Gen (Ker)
B8.1.2.
Genesis (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 201): (Ker in) Crawford 1922 (1969), 444-56.



 37.1. Her cydde god ælmihtig his mildheortnisse þe he abrahame
behet &amp; iosepe &amp; abrahames ofsprincge.
 37.2. Þa þa iosep wæs <foreign>XVI</foreign> wintra þa heolde his fæder
heorde mid his gebroðrum &amp; he wæs mid belan sunum &amp; zeluan his
fæder wiua ac hine gewregdon his gebroðra to heora fæder þære
mæstan wrohtæ.
 37.3. Soðlice israhel luuode iosep ouer ealle his sunu &amp;
forþan þe he hine gestrinde on his ylde &amp; het him weorcan ringfage
tunecan.
 37.4. Ða his gebroðra þæt gesawon þæt his fæder
hine swiðor luuode þonne his oðre suna þa onscunedon hi hine &amp; ne
mihte nane freondrædene wið hine habban.
 37.5. Witodlice hit gelamp þæt him gemætte an sweuen &amp;
he rehte þæt his gebroðrum þuruh þæt hig hine hatedon þe
swiðor.
 37.6. &amp; he cwæð to heom gehyrað min sweuen þe me
gemætte.
 37.7. Me þuhte þæt we bundon sceauas on æcere &amp; min
sceaf arise &amp; stode uprihte eowrum sceauum on middan &amp; eowre gilmas
stodon abuton &amp; abugon to minum sceaue.
 37.8. Ða cwædon his gebroðra cwyst þu byst ðu ure kininc
oððe beo we þine hyrmen; Witodlice þurh þis sweuen &amp; þurh þas
spræce hi hine hatedon &amp; hæfdon andan to him.
 37.9. Oþer sweuen him gemætte &amp; rehte þæt his
gebroðrum &amp; cwæð ic geseah on swefne swilce sunna &amp; mona &amp;
endleouan steorran &amp; ealle hig onbugon ongean me.
 37.10. Þa he þæt his fæder &amp; his gebroðrum rehte
þa ðreatode his fæder hine &amp; cwæð Hwæt sceal þis beon þe
þu gesawe sculon we abugan ðe ic &amp; þin modor &amp; þine
gebroðra.
 37.11. Witodlice his gebroðra yrsodon swiðe wið hine &amp; se
fæder hit mænde stillice.
 37.12. Þa þa his gebroðra wæron to lange on sichem mid
heora uæder heordum on læswum.
 37.13. Ða ewæð israhel to iosepe þine gebroðra healdað
sceap on sihhima.
 37.14. Far to heom &amp; loca hwæðer hit si wel mid heom &amp;
mid heora heordum &amp; cum to me &amp; cyð me hu hit si; He com þa to
sichem fram ebrom dene.
 37.15. &amp; hine gemette þar an man þa eode he on gedwolan
þa axode he hine hwæt he sohte.
 37.16. He andswarode iosep &amp; cwæð Ic sece mine gebroðra
hwar hi hyre heorde healdan.
 37.17. Ða cwæð se man to him hi uerdon of ðissere stowe ic
gehyrde þæt hi cwædon þæt hig woldon to dothaim; Iosep ferde þa
to dothaim æfter his gebroðrum.
 37.18. Ða hi hine feorran gesawon ærþan þe he to heom come
hig þohton hine to ofsleanne.
 37.19. &amp; cwædon him betweonan her gæð se swefnigend.
 37.20. Uton hine ofslean &amp; don hine on ðone ealdan pytt &amp;
secgan urum uæder þæt wilde deor hine fræton; þonne byð gesene
hwæt him his sweuen fremige.
 37.21. Soðlice þa ruben þis gehyrde he þohte hine to
genergienne of heora handum &amp; cwæð.
 37.22. Ne ofslea ge hine Ne we his blod ne ageoton ac wyrpað hine
on þone pytt &amp; healdað eowre handa unbesmitene þæt he sæde
forþon þe he wolde hine generian of heora handum &amp; his fæder
agiuan.
 37.23. Sona swa he to his gebroðrum com þa bereauodon hig hine
his tunecan.
 37.24. &amp; dydon hine on þone ealdan pytt.
 37.25. &amp; þa hig woldan etan hi gesawon <foreign>II</foreign> ismaelitisce
weguerende men comon of galaad &amp; læddon wyrt gemang on heora oluendum
&amp; tyrwan &amp; stacten on egipta land.
 37.26. Ða cwæð iudas to his gebroðrum hwæt fremað us
þeah we urne broðor ofslean.
 37.27. Selre is þæt we hine syllon to ceape ismaelitum &amp;
þæt ure handa beon unbesmitene; he his ure broðor &amp; ure flæsc
þa cwædon his gebroðra þæt hit swa mihte beon.
 37.28. &amp; þa þar uoran madianisce cypmen þa tugon hi hine
up of ðam pytte.
 37.29. &amp; sealdan hine ismaelitum wið <foreign>XXX</foreign> penegan &amp; hig
hine læddan to egypta lande.
 37.29. Ða com ruben eft to þam pytte &amp; þone cnapan ðar
ne uunde þa totær he his claðas.
 37.30. &amp; cwæð to his gebroðrum nis se cnapa na her
hwider ga ic nu.
 37.31. Þa namon hig an ticcen &amp; ofsniðon hit &amp; bedipton
his tunecan on þam blode.
 37.32. &amp; brohton to heora uæder &amp; cwædon þas
tunecan we uundon sceawa nu hwæðer hit si þines suna þe hyt ne sy.
 37.33. Þa cwæð se uæder þa þa he hig gecneow hit is
mines suna tunece; Hig cwædon þa wilde deor fræton iosep þinne suna.
 37.34. He tær ða his reaf &amp; scridde hine mid hæran
&amp; weop hyne lange tide.
 37.35. Soðlice his bearn hi gesamnode to ðam þæt hi heora
fæder gefrefrodon ac he nolde nane frefrunge underfon Ac cwæð wepende
ic fare to minum sunu to helle.
 37.36. Þa madianiscan sealdan iosep to egipta lande putiphare
þam afyredan faraones kempena ealdre.
 38.1. On þare ylcan tyde for iudas fram his gebroðrum to anum
odolamitiscum men.
 38.2. &amp; nam þar an chanaeisc wif seo wæs genemned sue.
 38.3. Be þære he gestrynde ðry suna her &amp; onam &amp;
sela.
 38.6. Soðlice iudas sealde here his sunu wif seo wæs genemned
thamar here forðferde buton bearnum.
 38.11. Ða cwæð iudas to thamare his snoru beo þu wuduwe
oþ þæt sela min sunu geweaxe þa for heo wuduwe on hire fæder huse.
 38.12. Þa æfter manegum gearum forðferde iudas wif; ða
sume dæge for iudas to his sceapscære &amp; hyras his sceaphyrda &amp; se
idolamitisce for to thamnatha.
 38.13. Þa cydde man thamare þæt hyre swegre for to
ðamnatha his sceapscære.
 38.14. Þa dyde heo of hyre wuduwan reaf &amp; nam hyre walcan
&amp; scrydde hi mid oðrum reaue &amp; eode &amp; sæt on þam wege þe
læg to þamnatha; forðam þe sela for his geoguðe hi genam sic to
gemæccan.
 38.15. Ða geseah iudas hig þa wende he þæt hit wære
myltresse ac heo helede hyre neb þæt he hig ne mihte gecnawan.
 38.16. Ða cwæð he to hyre læt me habban ðe &amp; he
nyste þæt hit wæs his snoru; þa cwæð heo hwæt sylst þu me
wið þam þe þu mine gemacan bruce.
 38.17. Þa cwæð he ic ðe sænde an ticcen of minre heorde
&amp; heo cwæð eft ic ðolie loca hwæt þu wille; Gif þu me sylst
underwed oþ þæt þu me sænde þæt þu me behætst.
 38.18. Ða cwæð iudas hwæt wilt þu to underwedde niman;
þa cwæð heo þinne ringc &amp; ðinne beah &amp; þinne stæf ðe
þu on handa hauast; Witodlice æt þam ilcan cyrre heo wearð mid cilde.
 38.19. &amp; heo eode þanon.
 38.20. &amp; iudas hyre sænde an ticcen wið his odolamitiscan
hyrde.
 38.21. &amp; he scolde feccan þæt underwed þe he ðam wiue
sealde.
 38.21. Þa ne mihte he hig findan nahwar þa axode he þa
landesmen hwar þæt wif wære þe æt þare wega gelæte sæte
þa cwædon hig þæt þar nan myltresse on lande nære.
 38.22. Ða cyrde he to iudan &amp; cwæð to him þæt he
hig ne mihte nahwar findan &amp; eac þa landesmen me sædon þæt þar
nan myltresse ne sæte.
 38.23. Ða cwæð iudas habbe hyre þæt þæt heo
hauað ne mæg heo us lease tellan; ic hyre sænde þæt ic hyre behet
&amp; þu hig ne mihtest findan.
 38.24. Þa æfter <foreign>III</foreign> monþum hi cwædon to iudan Thamar
þin snoru is forlegen &amp; hyre innoð is weaxende; þa cwæð iudas
lædað hig forð &amp; forbærnað hig.
 38.25. Þa heo wæs to þam witum gelæd þa sænde heo to
hyre swegre &amp; cwæð be þam men ic eom mid cilde þe þisne ryngc ah
&amp; þisne beah &amp; þisne stæf sceawa nu hwa þis age.
 38.26. Ða he þæt eal gecneow þa cwæð he Heo is
rihtwisra þonne ic þæt is forðan þe ic hig ne sealde selan minum
sunu &amp; þeahhwæðere næfde he hig syððan.
 38.27. On þare kennigctide ætywdon twegen getwisan on hyre
innoþe &amp; on cylda forðcyme; Se oðer ræhte forð his hand &amp;
seo byðerþinenu wrað wyrmreadne þræd þar on &amp; cwæð.
 38.28. Þes cymð raðor.
 38.29. &amp; he teah eft þa hand ongean &amp; se oðer com þa
cwæð þæt wif wig is weal todæled for þi &amp; for þan heo
namde his naman fares.
 38.30. Siððan com se oðer on þæs handa wæs se
wyrmreada þræd þone heo nemde zara.
 39.1. Witodlice man lædde iosep to egypta lande &amp; hine þar
gebohte putifar se afyreda faraones heres ealdor egyptisc man æt þam
ismaelitiscum mannum þe hine þyder læddon.
 39.2. &amp; drihten wæs mid him; Se man wæs wel donde on
eallum þinge &amp; wunode on his hlafordes huse.
 39.3. He wiste ful georne þæt god hine lufode &amp; ealle þa
þingc þe he dide he dyde be his dihte.
 39.4. Iosep hæfde mycele gyuu to his hlaforde &amp; þenode him
&amp; betæhte him eall þæt he ahte to bewitanne.
 39.5. &amp; drihten bletsode þæs egyptiscan æhta for
iosepes þingum &amp; gemænigfylde his speda ægðer ge on tunum ge on
landum.
 39.6. Iosep wæs fæger &amp; wlitig on ansyne.
 39.7. Witodlice his hlæfdige hine luuode &amp; cwæð to him
slap mid me.
 39.8. Ac he nolde nateshwon hyre þæs tiðian &amp; he
cwæð min hlauord me hæfð betæht ealle his þingc &amp; he nat
ealles hwæt he ah.
 39.9. Nafað he nan ðingc þæt ne si on minum anwealde buton
þe þe his wif eart hu mæg ic swa yfele don wið hine &amp; wið god
syngian.
 39.10. Þillicum wordum hy hine befealh ælce dæg þa
wearð þæt wif wrað þan geongan cnapan forðan þe he ascunode
unrihthæmed.
 39.11. Hit gelampt sic þa sume dæge þæt iosep wæs ana
on his hlafordes huse.
 39.12. Þa teah hy hine be his claðum &amp; cwæð to him
slap mid me þa ætarn he ut &amp; forlet his wæuels on hyra handa.
 39.14. Þa rymde heo to hyre hiwum &amp; cwæð Nu com þes
ebreisca cnapa in to me þæt he me gebismrode he eode in to me forðan
þæt he me ofername.
 39.15. Ac þa he gehyrde þæt ic rymde þa forlet he his
wæuels &amp; fleah ut.
 39.16. Þisne wrenc heo beþohte hyre sylf &amp; þa hyre
hlaford ham com þa cwæð heo.
 39.17. Se ebreisce weal þe þu me hider brohtest eode in to me
þæt he me gebysmrode.
 39.18. Ac sona swa ic hrymde he forlet me &amp; his wæuels &amp;
arn ut.
 39.19. Þa se hlauord þæt gehyrde þa wearð he swiðe
yrre &amp; gelyfde wel heora wordum.
 39.20. &amp; wearp ða iosep on cwearterne þær mon þæs
kyninges ræplinges heold &amp; he wæs þær belocen.
 39.21. &amp; drihten wæs mid him &amp; gemiltsode him &amp;
gedyde þæt þæs cwearternes ealdor him wearð swiðe hold.
 39.22. Se him betæhte ealle þa gebundenen men þe þar
gehæfte wæron.
 39.23. &amp; he ne cuðe nan þingc þar on þa þa hi him
betæhte wæron Ac drihten wæs mid him &amp; dihte him hwæt he don
scolde.
 40.1. Ða þis wæs ðus gedon þa gelamp hit þæt <foreign>II</foreign>
men agylten of hirede wið heora hlauord þæt wæs egypta kyninges byrle
&amp; his bæcestre.
 40.2. &amp; faraon wæs swiðe yrre wið hi; Se oðer bewiste
hys byrlas &amp; se oðer his bæcestran.
 40.3. Þa dyde man hig on cwearterne On þam wæs eac iosep
gebunden.
 40.4. &amp; ðæs cwearternes hyrde hig betæhte iosepe &amp;
he þenode heom.
 40.5. Þa binnan þam fyrste hig beggen gesawon sweuen on anre
nihte.
 40.6. Þa wæron hig swiðe unrote on mergen.
 40.8. &amp; cwædon to iosepe wyt gesawon sweuen ac wit nyton hwa
hit unc atelle hwæt hit behealde; ða cwæð iosep seccað me hwæt
gyt gesawon.
 40.9. Þa rehte ðare byrla ealdor him his sweuen &amp; cwæð
ic geseah wingeard.
 40.10. On þam waeron <foreign>III</foreign> clystru &amp; ic geseah þæron
weaxende blosman litlum &amp; litlum &amp; æfter þam blosman winbergan.
 40.11. &amp; faraones drenceuætt on minra handa &amp; ic nam
þa winbergan &amp; wrang on þæt fætt &amp; sealde faraone.
 40.12. Ða cwæð iosep þis his þin sweuen þa <foreign>III</foreign>
clystru þæt sind <foreign>III</foreign> dagas nugit &amp; æfter þam faraon
geðencgð þine þenunga &amp; he set þe to þare ylcan note þe þu
ær hæfdest &amp; þu sylst him his drenceuætt eal swa ðu ær
dydest.
 40.14. &amp; Geðenc me þonne þe þin wise wel licie &amp;
lær faraon þæt he me ut alæde of ðisum cwearterne.
 40.15. Forðon þe ic wæs dearnunga forstolen on ebrea lande
&amp; her unscyldig on pytt beworpen.
 40.16. &amp; þa ðara bæcestra ealdor gehyrde hu gleawlice he
þæt sweuen rehte þa cwæð he la leof ic geseh sweuen me þuhte
þæt ic hæfde <foreign>III</foreign> windlas mid meluwe ouer min heafod.
 40.17. &amp; þæt on þam uuemestan windle wære manega
cynna gebæc &amp; fugelos sic æton of ðam.
 40.18. Ða andwyrde iosep &amp; cwæð þis is þin sweuen;
þa <foreign>III</foreign> windlas þæt sind <foreign>III</foreign> dagas nu git.
 40.19. &amp; æfter þam hæt faraon þe ahon on rode &amp;
fugelas fretað þin flæsc.
 40.20. Siððan wæs se <foreign>III</foreign> dæg faraones gebyrtyd þa
worhte he mycelne gebyrscipe his cnihtum þa amang þam þa geþohte he
þara byrla ealdor; &amp; ðæra bæcestra.
 40.21. &amp; he gesette þæra byrla ealdor to ðære ilcan
note þe he ær hæfde.
 40.22. &amp; þone oðerne he het hon on gealgan; ða wæs
iosepes soðfæstnys auandod.
 40.23. &amp; ðeahhwæðere þæra byrla ealdor forgeat
iosepes ærende.
 41.1. Æfter twam gearum faraone mætte þæt he stode be
anre ea.
 41.2. &amp; him þuhte þæt he gesawe gan up of ðam flode
<foreign>VII</foreign> fægere oxan &amp; swiðe uætte.
 42.20. Hider to me hi didon swa swa he heom bebead.
 42.21. &amp; cwædon heom betweonan be gewirhtum we þoliað
þas þingc we syngedon on urum broðer &amp; we sawon his angsumnesse &amp;
he us georne friðes bæd ac we him nanes ne tiþodon forþam com þis
geswinc ouer us.
 42.22. Þa cwæð ruben cweþe ge ne sæde ic ær þæt
ge syngodon on þam cnapan &amp; ge me ne gelyfdon; Ac nu man hine wrecð.
 42.23. Hi nyston þæt iosep hi gecneow.
 42.24. &amp; he wænde hine þa lytwon fram heom &amp; weop
&amp; wænde eft to heom &amp; nam symeon &amp; band hine beuoran heom.
 42.25. &amp; bead his ðegnum þæt hi gefyldon heora saccas
mid hwæte &amp; legdon dearnunga heora ælces seoluor on heora saccan
&amp; formete to eacan &amp; hi dydon swa.
 42.26. Hi uoron þa &amp; læddon heora hwæte on heora
assum.
 42.27. Þa hi be wege wæron þa undyde heora an his sacc &amp;
wolde syllan his assan fodder.
 42.28. Þa cwæð he to his gebroðrum þa he þæt feoh
geseah on þæs sacces muðe þis feoh is eal her on urum saccum þe we
mid ceapodon; he wurdon þa ealle afyrhte &amp; cwædon heom betweonan
hwæt is he þe þis god us gedyde.
 42.29. Ða comon hig to iacobe heora fæder on chanaan lande
&amp; rehton him ealle þa þingc þe heom on siðe gelumpon.
 42.30. &amp; hu stiðe se landhlauord spræc wið hi &amp;
cwædon se landhlauord wende þæt we sceaweras wæron.
 42.31. &amp; we cwædon we synd ful getriwe ne þence we nanes
yueles.
 42.32. We <foreign>XII</foreign> gebroðra wæron anes esnes suna &amp; we him
sædon se an is dead &amp; se gingesta is mid urum uæder.
 42.33. Ða cwæð he to us ic wille geuandian hwæðer ge
getrywe synd lætað eowerne ænne broðor mid me &amp; nimaþ þa
þinc þe eowre hiwon beðurfon &amp; farað.
 42.34. &amp; lædað eowerne gingestan broðor to me þæt
ic wite þæt ge sceaweras ne beon &amp; þæt ge þisne eowerne
broðor geueccan þe her on bendum sitt &amp; þæt ge siððan leafe
habban to bigcanne loca hwæt ge willan.
 42.35. Ða hig þus spræcon þa tugon hi heora hwæte of
heora saccum &amp; fundon þar eall heora feoh &amp; hi wurdon þa ealle
aferede.
 42.36. Ða cwæð iacob heora uæder bearnlease ge habbað
me gedon; Næbbe ic nu iosep &amp; simeon is gebunden &amp; nu ge willað
niman beniamin æt me; þa andswerode ruben &amp; cwæð ic hæbbe <foreign>II</foreign>
suna ofsleah þa beggen gif ic hine þe ongean ne bringe; Syle hine me on
hand &amp; ic hine giue ðe on þinre handa; þa cwæð iacob ne cymð
beniamin mid eow forðon iosep his broðor is dead &amp; he is ana to laue
&amp; hu þonne gif him hwilc yfel on þam lande gelimpð æfre ic wurðe
syððan geomriende.
 43.1. Ða amang ðam hungre þa se mete ateorode þe hi of
egypta lande brohton.
 43.2. Þa cwæð iacob to his sunum farað to egipta lande
&amp; bicgað us sumne dæl metes.
 43.3. Þa cwæð iudas þæs landes ealdor swor aðas
beuoran us þæt we ne moston cumon beuoran him buton we brohton urne
gingestan broðor mid us.
 43.4. Nu witodlice gyf þu hine wilt mid us sændon we uarað
ætgædere &amp; bicgað þa þingc þe we beþuruon.
 43.5. Gyf þu þonne nelt ne durre we þar cumon.
 43.6. Ða cwæð israhel to heom earmlice dydon ge wið me
þa ge him sædon þæt ge a ma gebroðra hæfdon.
 43.7. Ða cwædon hi Se man us axode eal be endebyrdnesse ymbon
ure cyn &amp; hwæðer ure uæder leouode &amp; hwæðer we gebroðra
hæfdon &amp; we him andwerdon þæs þe he us axode &amp; we nyston
þæt he þæs gyrnan wolde þæt we urne broðor þyder lædan
scolde.
 43.8. Iudas cwæð eft to his fæder send þone cnapan mid me
þæt we magon bicgan þa þinc þe we beþurfon þæt we ne
forwyrðon.
 43.9. Ic underuo þone cnapan &amp; bide his eft æt me &amp;
buton ic hine bringe eft ham &amp; hine þe betæce beo ic deaðes
scyldig.
 43.10. Gyf þys yldingc nære nu we wæron cumene oðre
syðan.
 43.11. Ða cwæð israhel gyf ge þonne nyde don sculon doð
þonne swa ge willan; Nimað eac of eowrum selestum wæstmum &amp; on uatum
&amp; brincgað þam men to lake &amp; sumne dæl tyrwan &amp; hunig &amp;
stor &amp; recels &amp; æcerenu &amp; hnyte.
 43.12. &amp; twa swa mycel seolfres swa ge ær hæfdon þi
læs þe ge beon gedwealde.
 43.13. &amp; nimað eowerne broðor &amp; farað to þam men.
 43.14. Min drihten hine do glædne wið eow &amp; þæt he
gyue eow eowerne broðor þe he þær mid him hafað &amp; eac min cyld
beniamin; Ic eom nu bereauod minra bearna.
 43.15. Ða naman hig þa lac &amp; twiueald feoh &amp; beniamin
&amp; foron to egypta lande to iosepe.
 43.16. Þa he hig geseah &amp; beniamin mid heom þa cwæð he
to þan gereuan læd in þas men &amp; gearwa ure þenunga þæt þas
men magon etan mid me to middæges.
 43.17. &amp; he dyde swe he him beboden hæfde þa hi þer inne
wæron.
 43.18. Þa wyrdon hi swiðe afyrhte &amp; cwædon heom
betweonan for þam feohe þe we on urum sacce fundon we synd hider inn
gelædde þæt he wile us æt urum assum bereauian &amp; urum þingum
&amp; us sylfe ðeowige.
 43.19. Þa cwædon hig to þam wicnere.
 43.20. We biddað þe leof þæt þu hlyste ure spræce
Whilon ær we wæron her &amp; bohton us hwæte.
 43.21. &amp; þa we geceapod hæfdon &amp; we hamwerd wæron
þa undydan we ure saccas; þa fundon we þæt feoh þær on þe we
ær sealdon; Nu habbe we hit gebroht ongean be þam ylcan gewihte.
 43.22. &amp; eac oðer seoluor mid to ceapienne nyton we hwa hit
on urum saccas dyde.
 43.23. Þa cwæð se reua Sy sib mid eow; Ne ondræde ge
eowerne god forðon eower god eow sealde goldhord on eower saccas; Witodlice
þæt feoh þe ge me sealdon ic habbe auandod &amp; he lædde þa ut
symeon to him.
 43.24. &amp; hi þwogon heora fet &amp; he sealde heora assan
foddor.
 43.25. Soðlice hi legdon forð heora lac ongean þæt iosep
in eode.
 43.26. &amp; feollon ealle to his fotum.
 43.27. Iosep hi oncneow arwyrðlice &amp; axode hi hwaðer heora
fæder hal wære þe hi him foresædon oððe he leofode.
 43.28. Ða cwædon hig gesund he is þin þeow ure fæder
gyt he leofað.
 43.29. Ða iosep geseh his gemedredan broðor beniamin; þa
cwæð he is þis se cnapa þe ge me foresædon &amp; eft he cwæð
God miltsige þe sunu min.
 43.30. &amp; he wearð þa swa swiðe astyred þæt him
feollon tearas of his eagan for his broðor þingum &amp; he eode into his
beorclyfan &amp; weop swiðe sare.
 43.31. &amp; þa he ðæs wopes geswican hæfde þa eode he
into heom &amp; hi æton ætsomne.
 43.32. On sundron þa egyptiscan &amp; sundron þa ebreiscan; Hit
næs na alyued þæt hi ætgædere æton.
 43.34. &amp; hi man oferdrencte.
 44.1. Þa bead iosep his gereuan &amp; cwæð Fyllað heora
saccas mid hwæte &amp; lege heora ælces feoh on his agenne sacc.
 44.2. &amp; nim minne seolfrena læuel &amp; þæs hwætes
weorð þe he sealde &amp; do on þæs gingestan sacc &amp; he dyde þa
swa.
 44.3. On mergen þa hi uerdon.
 44.4. &amp; hig wæron butan þara byrig &amp; hæfdon eac
sumne dæl weges geuaran ða cwæð iosep to his gerefan aris &amp; far
æfter þisum mannum &amp; þonne ðu hig gefangen hæbbe þonne axa
þu hi hwi hi woldon god mid yfele forgildan.
 44.5. &amp; sege heom þæt se læuel þe hi forstolen
habbað wæs minum hlauorde swyðe dyre yuele habbe ge gedon.
 44.6. He dyde þa swa him beboden wæs &amp; þa hig gefangene
wæron hi cwædon.
 44.7. Hwi tihð ure hlauord us swa myceles falses.
 44.8. Þæt feoh þe we uundon on urum saccum þæt we
læddon to ðe of chanaan lande; Wenst þu þæt we stælon þines
hlauordes gold oððe his seolfor.
 44.9. Sec hit &amp; sy he ofslagan se ðe þu hine mid finde.
 44.10. Ða cwæð he sy hit swa ge cwædon Mid swa hwan swa
ic hit mid fynde beo he mines hlauordes þeow &amp; beon þa oðre
clæne.
 44.11. &amp; hi efston þa &amp; dydon heora saccas nyðer.
 44.12. &amp; he sohte fram þam yldestan oð ðone gingestan
oþ þæt he funde þone læuel on beniamines sacce.
 44.13. &amp; hi ealle wyrdon swiðe dreorige &amp; semdon heora
assan &amp; cyrdon eft to ðære byrig.
 44.14. Þa eode iudas fyrmest in mid his gebroðrum to iosepe
&amp; hi feollon ealle ætgædere beuoran iosepe.
 44.15. &amp; Iosep cwæð; hwi woldon ge swa don wendon ge
þæt ge mihton me bedydryan minne gelican.
 44.16. Þa cwæð iudas to him hwæt magon we cweðan ongean
þe hlauord; Nabbe we nane tala ongean þe; god hafað arasod ure
unrihtwisnesse; Nu we synd ealle þine þeowas ægðer ge we ge se þe se
læuel mid funden is.
 44.17. Þa cwæð iosep Nelle god þæt ic swa do Ac si he
min þeowa þe þone læuel forstæl &amp; fare ge to eowrum fæder.
 44.18. Þa eode iudas him near &amp; spræc þristelicor wið
hine; Ic bidde ðe hlauord þæt ic mote buton yrre wið ðe sprece þu
eart min hlauord under faraone.
 44.19. Þu axodest us ær hwæðer we hæfdon fæder
oððe modor.
 44.20. &amp; we cwædon we habbað ealdne uæder &amp; he
hæfð mid him urne gingestan broðor þone he gestrynde on his ylde &amp;
his gemeddredan broðor wæs dead &amp; he luuað hine ænne ouer us
ealle.
 44.21. &amp; þu bude us þæt we hine læddon to þe
þæt þu hine gesawe &amp; woldest witan be þam þæt we næran
sceaweras; Nu we habbað hine earfoðlice begitan æt urum uæder &amp;
hine hyder gebroht.
 44.32. Ic swor aðas minum fæder þæt ic hine ham ongean to
him brohte &amp; ic hine nam on minne truwan &amp; cwæð to him buton ic
hine ongean bringe eft to ðe ic beo æfre scyldig wið ðe.
 44.33. Hlauord min læt faran þone cnapan ham mid his broðrum
&amp; ic beo þin þeowa for him.
 44.34. Ne dear ic faran butan þam cnapan þi læs þe ic
geseo mines fæder sarnysse.
 45.1. Ða ne mihte iosep hine na lengc bedyrnan Ac he draf ealle
þa egyptiscan ut þæt nan fremde man nære betweox him.
 45.2. &amp; he weop ða &amp; clypode hluddre stemne þæt þa
egyptiscan hit gehyrdon &amp; eall faraones hired.
 45.3. &amp; he cwæð to his gebroðrum ic eom iosep leofað
ure fæder nu git þa ne mihton his gebroðra him for ege geandwerdan.
 45.4. Þa grette he hi arwurðlice &amp; cwæð ic eom iosep
eower broþor ðe ge sealdon to egypta lande.
 45.5. Ne ondræde ge eow nan þinc ne eow ne ofþince þæt
ge me sealdon on þis rice; Soðlice for eowre þearue me sænde god to
egipta lande.
 45.6. Nu <foreign>II</foreign> twa gear wæs hungor ofer ealle eorðan &amp; git
sculon <foreign>V</foreign>; On þam man ne mæg naðer ne erian ne ripan.
 45.7. Ac god me sænde to þam þæt ge beon gehealdene &amp;
þæt ge habban þæt ge magon big libban.
 45.8. Þæt næs na eowres þances ac wæs þurh god
þæt ic þurh his willan hider asænd wæs &amp; se dyde me swilce ic
wære faraones fæder &amp; his hiredes hlauord &amp; he gesette me to
hiredes ealdre ofer egypta lande.
 45.9. Farað hrædlice to minum fæder &amp; secgað him
þæt god me sette to hlauorde eallum egiptum; Beodað him þæt he fare
to me.
 45.10. &amp; wunige on gessen lande &amp; beo me gehænde he
&amp; his suna &amp; his bearna bearn &amp; eowre sceaphyrdas &amp; eowre
hryðerhyrdas &amp; eal þæt ge agon.
 45.11. &amp; ic eow fede; gyt synd <foreign>V</foreign> hungor gear bæfton; doð
þus þæt ge ne forwyrðon.
 45.12. Nu ge geseoþ hu hit mid me is &amp; ge gehyrað hwæt
ic eow to sprece.
 45.13. Kyðað minum fæder eal min wuldor &amp; ealle þa
þinc ðe ge gesawon on egypta lande; Efstað nu &amp; lædað hine to
me.
 45.15. &amp; he clypte heora ælcne &amp; cyste hi &amp; weop
þa; æfter þisum hi dorston sprecan wið hine.
 45.16. Þa spræc man ofer eal &amp; widmærsode þæt
iosepes gebroðra comon to faraone &amp; farao wæs glæd &amp; eal his
hired.
 45.17. &amp; he bead iosepe þæt he bude his gebroðrum &amp;
þus cwæð Semað eowre assan &amp; farað to chanaan lande.
 45.18. &amp; nimað eowera fæder &amp; eower mægðe &amp;
cumað to me &amp; ic eow sylle ealle egipta god.
 45.19. Beod heom eac þæt hi niman heora fæder &amp; efston
hider swa hi raþost magon.
 45.20. &amp; ne forlæton ge eowres ydysces nan ðinc forðam
ealle egypta speda beoð eowre.
 45.21. Israheles suna dydon swa heom beboden wæs &amp; iosep him
sænde wænas eal swa farao him bebead &amp; formete.
 45.22. &amp; sealde heora ælcum twa scrud &amp; <foreign>CCC</foreign>
sylfringa.
 45.23. &amp; he sænde his fæder <foreign>X</foreign> assan þa wæron
gesemede mid feo &amp; mid rægle &amp; mid egyptum welum &amp; <foreign>X</foreign> þa
bæron hlaf &amp; hwæte.
 45.24. Witodlice he let his gebroðra þa faran &amp; cwæð
to heom ne forlæte ge nan þingc be wege &amp; beoð swiðe gesome.
 45.25. Hi foron þa of egypta lande &amp; comon þa to chanaan
lande to iacobe heora fæder.
 45.26. &amp; cwædon to him la leof fæder iosep leofað þin
suna &amp; wealt ealles egypta landes; þa iacob þæt gehyrde þa þuhte
him swylce he of heuegum slæpe awacnode &amp; þeahhwæðere him ne
gelyfde.
 45.27. Hi rehton þa eall of heora færelde eall be
endebyrdnesse &amp; þa þa he geseah þa wænas &amp; ealle þa þing
þe him gesænd wæren his gast wearð þa geedcucod.
 45.28. &amp; he cwæð genoh ic hæbbe gyf iosep min suna gyt
leofað; Ic fare nu &amp; geseo hine ærðam þe ic swylte.
 46.1. Israhel ferde þa mid eallum þam þe he hæfde oð
þæt he com to aðswara pytte &amp; þar offrode lac isaaces gode his
fæder.
 46.2. &amp; god hine gehyrde &amp; cleopode to him &amp; cwæð
Iacob iacob; &amp; he him andswarode &amp; cwæð; Her ic eom hlaford.
 46.3. &amp; god cwæð to him ic eom se stranga god þines
fæder; Ne ondræd þu þe Ac far to egypta lande forðam þe ic gedo
þe weligne.
 46.4. Ic fare nu ðyder mid þe &amp; þanon ic þe læde.
 46.5. Iacob aras þa fram þam pytte &amp; his suna hine naman
mid litlingum &amp; mid heora wifum &amp; mid þam wænum þe farao þyder
sænde þonne ealda man on to ferienne.
 46.6. &amp; ealle þa þing þe he ahte on chanaan lande &amp;
he com þa to egypta lande mid eallum his kynne.
 46.8. Soðlice þis synd israhela naman þe uoran in to egypta
lande he mid his sunum Se frumcenneda ruben.
 46.9. &amp; rubenes sunu Enoh &amp; fallu &amp; charm.
 46.10. Simeones suna Gamuel &amp; Diamin &amp; achod &amp; iachim
&amp; Saher &amp; Sauw, Chana Nytedes suna.
 46.11. &amp; Leuies suna ierson &amp; caað &amp; merari.
 46.12. Iudas suna Her &amp; onham &amp; Sela &amp; fares &amp;
saram her &amp; onham forðferdon on chanaan lande; &amp; Fares suna wæron
akennede esrom &amp; amuel.
 46.13. Þis wæron isachares suna, Thola &amp; phua &amp; iob
&amp; semron.
 46.14. &amp; ðis wæron zabules suna, Sared &amp; elon &amp;
iaelel.
 46.15. Ðys synd lian suna þe heo akende on mesopotamia sirie
myd dian hire dehter þæt wæron ealra <foreign>III</foreign> &amp; <foreign>XXX</foreign> mid sunum &amp;
mid dohtrum.
 46.16. Ðis wæron gaades suna, sephio &amp; Thagis Suni &amp;
essebon her &amp; arodi &amp; areli.
 46.17. Ðis wæron asseras suna, Gamme &amp; iessui &amp; iesua
&amp; bæria &amp; sara heora sweostor.
 46.19. Ðis wæron racheles suna Iacobes wiues, Iosep &amp;
beniamin.
 46.20. &amp; Iosep gestrynde suna on Egypta lande be Asenehte
Putiphares dohter þæs sacerdes of Eliopoleus &amp; hi hatton Manases &amp;
Effraim.
 46.21. Ðis wæron Beniamines suna, Bela &amp; Bethor &amp;
Arbel Iera &amp; Naam, Rehi &amp; Rosmoim &amp; Opfam &amp; Ared.
 46.22. Rachel akende be Iacobe <foreign>XIII</foreign> suna.
 46.23. Þus hatte Danis suna, Vsim.
 46.24. Þis wæron Naptalimes suna, Hasiel &amp; Gum &amp;
Iesser &amp; Salem.
 46.27. Witodlice Iacob ferde <foreign>LXX</foreign> sum to Egypta lande.
 46.28. Þa sænde he Iudas beuoran him to Iosepe þæt he
sceolde cyðan him þæt he come ongean hine to Iessen lande.
 46.29. Þonne he ðyder come Iosep þa gearwode his carm &amp;
for ongean his fæder &amp; þa he hine geseah he cleopodo hine &amp; weop.
 46.30. &amp; Iacob cwæð, nu ic mæg swyltan blyðelice nu
ic þe geseo &amp; þe mine æhta betæce.
 46.31. &amp; Iosep cwæð þa to his gebroðrum &amp; to ealle
his hiwrædene, Ic fara nu &amp; cyðe faraone þæt ge comon to me.
 46.32. &amp; ic secge him þæt ge synd hyrdas &amp; habbað
gebroht mid eow eal þæt ge ahton.
 46.33. &amp; þonne he eow clypað &amp; axað eow hwæt ge
don cunnon.
 46.34. Þonne secge ge him þæt ge synd sceaphyrdas fram
cildhade ge we ge eowre fæderas oþ þisne andwerdan dæg; Secgað
þus þæt ge magon eardian on Iessen lande forþan þe ealle Egyptiscan
onscunian sceaphyrdas.
 47.1. Ða eode Iosep in to faraone &amp; cwæð to him, Min
fæder &amp; mine gebroðra &amp; hyra sceaphirdas &amp; hyra hryðerhyrdas
&amp; ealle þa þingc þe hi agon comon of Chanaan.
 47.2. Witodlice þa his <foreign>V</foreign> gingestan gebroðra beuoran þam
kyninge.
 47.3. Ða axode he hi hwæt hi wyrcan cuðe hi andswerodon him
&amp; cwædon we synd sceaphyrdas þine þeowas we &amp; ure fæderas.
 47.4. We comon to þam hider þæt we wunedon on þinum lande
forðam þe we nabbað nan gærs urum heordum &amp; hungor is on Chanaan
lande &amp; we biddað þe nu þæt we þine þeowas beon moton on
gessen lande.
 47.5. Ða cwæð se cyningc to Iosepe, ðin fæder &amp;
þine gebroðra syndon cumene hyder.
 47.6. Þu canst Egypta land geloga hig on þam selestan healf
&amp; syle heom gessen land gyf þu wite þæt hig gleawe synd &amp; sete
hi to ealdrum ofer minre heorde.
 47.7. Æfter þisum lædde Iosep his fæder in to þam
kyninge &amp; sette hine beuoran him; þa bletsode se kining hine &amp; axode
hine hu eald he wære.
 47.9. Ða andswerode he him &amp; cwæð an hund wintra.
 47.10. &amp; se cyningc hine bletsode &amp; he eode ut.
 47.11. Iosep sealde his gebroðrum tun on Egypta lande on þam
selestan ende Ramases eal swa farao him bebead.
 47.12. &amp; fedde hi &amp; ealle his fæder hiwrædene.
 47.13. Soðlice hlaues wæs wana on eallum ymbhwyrftum &amp;
hungor fornam swyðost Egypte &amp; Chanaan land.
 47.14. &amp; Iosep hæfde gegaderod eal þæt feoh þe hi
ahton &amp; gebroht on þæs kynges madmhuse.
 47.15. Þa þa heora feoh ateorade þa com eall Egipta folc to
Iosepe &amp; cwædon to him, Syle us mete hlauord elles we sculon swyltan
beforan ðe nu we feoh nabbað.
 47.16. He andswerade heom þa &amp; cwæð, driuað hider
eower orf gif ge feoh nabban &amp; ic eow sylle mete þar wið.
 47.17. &amp; hi dydon swa &amp; he sealde heom mete wið horsum
&amp; wið hryðerum &amp; wið sceapum &amp; wið assum &amp; he uedde hi
wið heora orfe.
 47.18. Þa comon hi eft to him on þam æftran geare &amp;
cwædon, Ne hele we þe hlauord þæt we nabbað naðer ne feoh ne orf
&amp; þu sylf wast.

Gen
B8.1.4.1.
Genesis (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Claudius B.IV): Crawford 1922, 81-211.



 1.1. ON angynne gesceop God heofonan &amp; eorðan.
 1.2. Se eorðe soðlice wæs idel &amp; æmti, &amp;
þeostra wæron ofer ðære nywelnysse bradnysse; &amp; Godes gast wæs
geferod ofer wæteru.
 1.3. God cwæð ða: Gewurðe leoht, &amp; leoht wæarð
geworht.
 1.4. God geseah ða ðæt hit got wæs, &amp; he todælde
þæt/ leoht fram ðam ðystrum.
 1.5. &amp; het ðæt leoht dæg &amp; þa ðystru niht: ða
wæs geworden æfen &amp; merigen an dæg.
 1.6. God cwæð ða eft: Gewurðe nu fæstnys tomiddes ðam
wæterum &amp; totwæme ða wæteru fram ðam wæterum.
 1.7. &amp; God geworhte ða fæstnysse, &amp; totwæmde ða
wæteru, ða wæron under ðære fæstnysse, fram ðam ðe wæron
bufan ðære fæstnysse: hit wæs ða swa gedon.
 1.8. &amp; God het ða fæstnysse heofonan, &amp; wæs ða
geworden æfen &amp; mergen oðer dæg.
 1.9. God ða soðlice cwæð: Beon gegaderode ða wæteru
ðe synd under ðære heofonan &amp; æteowige drignys; Hit wæs ða
swa gedon.
 1.10. &amp; God gecygde ða drignysse eorðan &amp; ðæra
wætera gegaderunga he het sæ God geseah ða ðæt hit god wæs.
 1.11. &amp; he cwæð: Sprytte seo eorðe growende gærs
&amp; sæd wyrcende &amp; æppelbære treow wæstm wyrcende æfter
his cynne, ðæs sæd sy on him syluum ofer eorðan; Hit wæs ða swa
gedon.
 1.12. &amp; seo eorðe forðteah growende wyrta &amp; sæd
berende be hyre cynne &amp; treow wæstm wyrcende &amp; gehwilc sæd
hæbbende æfter his hiwe; God geseah ða ðæt hit god wæs.
 1.13. &amp; wæs geworden æfen &amp; mergen se ðridda
dæg.
 1.14. God cwæð ða soðlice: Beo nu leoht on ðære
heofenan fæstnysse, &amp; todælan dæg &amp; nihte, &amp; beon to
tacnum &amp; to tidum &amp; to dagum &amp; to gearum.
 1.15. &amp; hi scinon on ðære heofenan fæstnysse &amp;
alihton ða eorðan; Hit wæs ða swa geworden.
 1.16. &amp; God geworhte twa micele leoht, þæt mare leoht to
ðæs dæges lihtinge, &amp; ðæt læsse leoht to ðære nihte
lihtinge, &amp; steorran he geworhte.
 1.17. &amp; gesette hi on ðære heofenan, ðæt hi scinon
ofer eorðan.
 1.18. &amp; gymdon ðæs dæges &amp; ðære nihte &amp; to
dældon leoht &amp; ðystro; God geseah ða þæt hit god wæs.
 1.19. &amp; wæs geworden æfen &amp; mergen se feorða
dæg.
 1.20. God cwæð eac swylce: Teon nu ða wæteru forð
swymmende cynn cucu on life &amp; fleogende cynn ofer eorðan under þære
heofonan fæstnysse.
 1.21. &amp; God gesceop ða ða miclan hwalas &amp; eal lybbende
fisccyn &amp; styrigendlice, ðe ða wæteru tugon forð on heora hiwum,
&amp; eall fleogende cyn æfter heora cynne; God geseah ða ðæt hit god
wæs.
 1.22. &amp; bletsode hi, ðus cweðende: Weaxað &amp; beoð
gemænifylde, &amp; gefyllað ðære sæ wæteru, &amp; ða fugelas
beon gemænifylde ofer eorðan.
 1.23. &amp; ða wæs geworden æfen &amp; merigen se fifta
dæg.
 1.24. God cwæð eac swilce: Læde seo eorðe forð cuce
nytena on heora cynne &amp; creopende cyn &amp; deor æfter heora hiwum; Hit
wæs ða swa gedon.
 1.25. &amp; God ða geworhte ðære eorðan deor æfter
heora hiwum &amp; ða nytenu &amp; eall creopende cynn on heora cynne; God
geseah ða ðæt hit god wæs.
 1.26. &amp; cwæð: Vton wyrcan man to anlicnysse &amp; to ure
gelicnysse, &amp; he sy ofer ða fixas &amp; ofer ða fugelas &amp; ofer ða
deor &amp; ofer ealle gesceafta &amp; ofer ealle creopende, ðe styriað on
eorðan.
 1.27. God gesceop ða man to his anlicnysse, to Godes anlicnysse
he gesceop hine; werhades &amp; wifhades he gesceop hi.
 1.28. &amp; God hi bletsode, &amp; cwæð: Weaxað &amp; beoð
gemenifylde &amp; gefyllað ða eorðan &amp; gewyldað hi, &amp; habbað
on eowrum gewealde ðære sæ fixas &amp; ðære lyfte fugelas &amp;
ealle nytenu, ðe styriað ofer eorðan.
 1.29. God cwæð ða: Efne ic forgyfe eow eall gærs &amp;
wyrta sæd berende ofer eorðan &amp; ealle treowa, ða ðe habbað
sæd on him sylfum heora agenes cynnes, ðæt hi beon eow to mete.
 1.30. &amp; eallum nytenum &amp; eallum fugelcynne &amp; eallum
ðam ðe styriað on eorðan, on ðam ðe is libbende lif, ðæt hi
habbon him to gereordigenne; Hit wæs ða swa gedon.
 1.31. &amp; God geseah ealle ða ðingc ðe he geworhte &amp; hi
wæron swyðe gode; Wæs ða geworden æfen &amp; merien se sixta
dæg.
 2.1. EORNOSTLICE ða wæron fulfremode heofonas &amp; eorðe
&amp; eall heora frætewung.
 2.2. &amp; God ða gefylde on ðone seofoðan dæg his weorc
ðe he worhte.
 2.3. &amp; he gereste hine on ðone seofoðan dæg fram eallum
ðam weorcum ðe he gefremode.
 2.3. &amp; God gebletsode ðone seofoðan dæg &amp; hine
gehalgode, for ðan ðe he on ðone dæg geswac his weorces, ðe he
gesceop to wyrcenne.
 2.4. Ðas synd ðæra heofenan &amp; ðæra eorðan
cneornysse, ða ða hi gesceapene wæron on ðam dæge ðe God geworhte
heofonan &amp; eorðan.
 2.5. &amp; ælcne telgor on eorðan, ær ðan ðe he up
asprunge on eorðan, &amp; eall gærs &amp; wyrta ealles eardes, ær ðan
ðe hi up asprytton; God soðlice ne sende nænne ren ofer eorðan ða
gyt: &amp; mann næs, ðe ða eorðan worhte.
 2.6. Ac an wyl asprang of ðære eorðan wæterigende ealle
ðære eorðan bradnysse.
 2.7. God gesceop eornostlice man of ðære eorðan lame, &amp;
onableow on his ansyne lifes orðunge, &amp; se man wæs geworht on
libbendre sawle.
 2.8. God ða aplantode wynsumne orcerd fram frymðe, on ðam he
gelogode þone man ðe he geworhte.
 2.9. God ða forð ateah of ðære moldan ælces cynnes
treow, fæger on gesyhðe &amp; to brucenne wynsum, eac swylce lifes treow
on middan neorxnawange and treow ingehydes godes &amp; yfeles.
 2.10. &amp; ðæt flod eode of stowe to stowe ðære
wynsumnysse to wæterigenne neorxnawang; ðæt flod is ðanon todæled
on feower ean.
 2.11. An ea of ðam hatte Fison; seo gæð onbutan ðæt
land ðe is gehaten Euilað, ðær ðær gold wyxð.
 2.12. &amp; ðæs landes gold is golda selost; ðær beoð
eac gemette ða gimstanas dellium &amp; honynchinus.
 2.13. Ðære oðre ea nama is Gion; seo is eac gehaten Nilus:
seo ymbgæð eall ðæra Silhearwena land.
 2.14. Þære ðriddan ea nama is Tygris; seo gæð ongean
ða Assyriscan; Seo feorðe ea is gehaten Eufrates.
 2.15. God genam ða ðone man &amp; gelogode hine on
neorxnawange, ðæt he ðær wyrcean sceolde &amp; ðæs begyman.
 2.16. &amp; bebead him, ðus cweðende: Of ælcum treowe
ðises orcerdes ðu most etan.
 2.17. Soðlice of ðam treowe ingehydes godes &amp; yfeles ne et
ðu; on swa hwylcum dæge swa ðu etst of ðam treowe, ðu scealt deaðe
sweltan.
 2.18. God cwæð eac swylce: Nis na god ðisum men ana to
wunigenne; uton wyrcean him sumne fultum to his gelicnysse.
 2.19. God soðlice gelædde ða nytenu, ðe he of eorðan
gesceop, &amp; ðære lyfte fugelas to Adame, ðæt he foresceawode hu he
hi gecygde; Soðlice ælc libbende nyten, swa swa Adam hit gecygde, swa is
his nama.
 2.20. &amp; Adam ða genamode ealle nytenu heora naman, &amp;
ealle fugelas &amp; ealle wildeor; Adam soðlice ne gemette ða gyt nanne
fultume his gelican.
 2.21. Ða sende God slæp on Adam, &amp; ða ða he slep, ða
genam he an rib of his sidan, &amp; gefylde mid flæsce ðær ðæt rib
wæs.
 2.22. &amp; geworhte ðæt rib, ðe he genam of Adame, to anum
wifmen &amp; gelædde hi to Adame.
 2.23. Adam ða cwæð: ðis is nu ban of minum banum &amp;
flæsc of minum flæsce; beo heo geciged fæmne, for ðan ðe heo is of
hyre were genumen.
 2.24. For ðan forlæt se man fæder &amp; modor, &amp;
geðeot hine to his wife, &amp; hi beoð buta on anum flæsce.
 2.25. Hi wæron ða buta, Adam &amp; his wif, nacode &amp; him
ðæs ne sceamode.
 3.1. EAC swylce seo næddre wæs geapre ðonne ealle ða
oðre nytenu ðe God geworhte ofer eorðan; &amp; seo næddre cwæð to
ðam wife: Hwi forbead God eow ðæt ge ne æton of ælcon treowe
binnan Paradisum?
 3.2. Þæt wif andwyrde: Of ðæra treowa wæstme ðe synd
on Paradisum we etað.
 3.3. &amp; of ðæs treowes wæstme þe is on middan
neorxnawange, God bebead us, ðæt we ne æton, ne we ðæt treow ne
hrepodon/ ði læs ðe we swelton.
 3.4. Ða cwæð seo nædre eft to ðam wife: Ne beo ge
nateshwon deade, ðeah ðe ge of ðam treowe eton.
 3.5. Ac God wat soðlice ðæt eowre eagan beoð geopenode on
swa hwylcum dæge swa ge etað of ðam treowe, &amp; ge beoð ðonne
englum gelice, witende ægðer ge god ge yfel.
 3.6. Ða geseah ðæt wif ðæt ðæt treow wæs god to
etenne, be ðam ðe hyre ðuhte, &amp; wlitig on eagum &amp; lustbære on
gesyhðe, &amp; genam ða of ðæs treowes wæstme &amp; geæt &amp;
sealde hyre were: he æt ða.
 3.7. &amp; heora begra eagan wurdon geopenode; hi oncneowon ða
ðæt hi nacode wæron, &amp; sywodon him ficleaf, &amp; worhton him
wædbrec.
 3.8. Eft ða ða God com, &amp; hi gehyrdon his stemne ðær
he eode on neorxnawange ofer midne dæg, ða behydde Adam hine, &amp; his
wif eac swa dyde, fram Godes gesihðe on middan ðam treowe neorxnanwonges.
 3.9. God clypode ða Adam, &amp; cwæð: Adam, hwær eart
ðu.
 3.10. He cwæð: ðine stemne ic gehire, leof, on neorxnawange,
&amp; ic ondræde me, for ðam ðe ic eom nacod, &amp; ic behyde me.
 3.11. God cwæð: Hwa sæde ðe ðæt ðu nacod wære,
gyf ðu ne æte of ðam treowe ðe ic ðe bebead ðæt ðu ne
æte.
 3.12. Adam cwæð: ðæt wif ðe ðu me forgeafe to
geferan, sealde me of ðam treowe, &amp; ic ætt.
 3.13. God cwæð to ðam wife: Hwi dydestu ðæt; heo
cwæð: Seo nædre bepæhte me &amp; ic ætt.
 3.14. God cwæð to ðære næddran: For ðan ðe ðu
ðis dydest, ðu bist awyrged betweox eallum nytenum &amp; wildeorum: ðu
gæst on ðinum breoste &amp; etst ða eorðan eallum dagum ðines
lifes.
 3.15. Ic sette feondrædene betwux ðe &amp; ðam wife &amp;
ðinum ofspringe &amp; hire ofspringe; heo tobrytt ðin heafod &amp; ðu
syrwst ongean hire ho.
 3.16. To ðam wife cwæð God eac swylce: Ic gemænifylde
ðine yrmða &amp; ðine geeacnunga; on sarnysse ðu acenst cild, &amp;
ðu bist under weres anwealde &amp; he gewylt ðe.
 3.17. To Adame he cwæð: For ðan ðe ðu gehyrdes ðines
wifes stemne, &amp; ðu æte of ðam treowe ðe ic ðe bebead ðæt
ðu ne æte, is seo eorðe awyrged on ðinum weorce: on geswyncum ðu
etst of ðære eorðan eallum dagum ðines lifes.
 3.18. Ðornas &amp; bremelas heo aspryt ðe, &amp; ðu ytst
ðære eorðan wyrta.
 3.19. On swate ðines andwlitan ðu brycst ðines hlafes, oð
ðæt ðu gewende to eorðan of ðære ðe ðu genumen wære, for
ðan ðe ðu eart dust &amp; to duste gewyrst.
 3.20. Ða gesceop Adam naman his wife, Eua, ðæt is lif, for
ðan ðe heo is ealra libbendra modor.
 3.21. God worhte eac Adame &amp; his wife fellene reaf &amp;
gescrydde hi.
 3.22. &amp; cwæð: Nu Adam can yfel &amp; god, swa swa ure sum,
ðe læs he astrecce his hand &amp; nime eac swylce of lifes treowe &amp;
ete &amp; libbe on ecnysse.
 3.23. Adræfde hine ða of neorxnawange, ðæt he ða
eorðan worhte &amp; him ðæron tilode, of ðære ðe he genumen
wæs.
 3.24. Ða ða he adræfed wæs of neorxnawanges myrhðe,
ða gesette God æt ðam infære engla hyrdrædene &amp; fyren swurd to
gehealdenne ðone weg to ðam lifes treowe.
 4.1. SOðLICE Adam gestrynde Cain be Euan his gemæccan, &amp;
ðus cwæð: ðisne man me sealde Drihten.
 4.2. Eft he gestrynde Abel; Abel wæs sceaphyrde, &amp; Cain
eorðtilia.
 4.3. Ða wæs hit geworden æfter manegum dagum ðæt Cain
brohte Drihtne lac of eorðan tilingum.
 4.4. Abel brohte to lace ða frumcennedan of his heorde; ða
beseah Drihten to Abele &amp; to his lacum.
 4.5. &amp; ne beseah to Caine ne to his lacum; ða wearð Cain
ungemetlice yrre.
 4.6. &amp; Drihten cwæð to him: Hwi eart ðu yrre?
 4.7. Gyf ðu god dest, hit ðe bið mid gode forgolden; gyf ðu
ðonne yfel dest, sona hit byð ðe mid yfele forgolden.
 4.8. Ða cwæð Cain to Abele his breðer: Vton gan ut; ða
hi ut agane wæron, ða yrsode Cain wið his broðor Abel, &amp; ofsloh
hine.
 4.9. Ða cwæð Drihten to Caine: Hwær is Abel ðin
broðor; ða andswarode he &amp; cwæð: Ic nat; segst ðu, sceolde ic
minne broðor healdon?
 4.10. Ða cwæð Drihten to Caine: Hwæt dydest ðu; þines
broðor blod clypað up to me of eorðan.
 4.11. Witodlice ðu byst awyrged ofer eorðan, for ðan ðe seo
eorðe onfeng þines broðor blodes, ðe ðu mid ðinum handum agute.
 4.12. Þonne ðu tilast ðin on eorðan, ne sylð heo ðe
nane wæstmas; ðu færst worigende &amp; bist flyma geond ealle
eorðan.
 4.13. Witodlice Cain cwæð to Drihtne: Min unrihtwisnys is mare
ðonne ic forgyfenysse wyrðe sy.
 4.14. Nu todæg ðu me aflymst &amp; ic me behyde fram ðinre
ansyne, &amp; ic worige &amp; beo aflymed geond ealle eorðan: ælc
ðæra ðe me gemett me ofslyhð.
 4.15. Ða cwæð Drihten to Caine: Ne bið hit na swa, ac
ælc ðæra ðe ofslihð Cain, onfehð seofonfeald wite; &amp; God him
sealde tacn ðæt nan ðæra ðe hine gemette hine ne ofsloge.
 4.16. Cain eode fram Drihtnes ansyne, &amp; he wunode flyma on
ðam eastdæle ðæs landes, ðe is genemned Eden.
 4.17. Witodlice Cain nam wif be ðære he gestrynde Enoch &amp;
he getimbrode ceastre &amp; nemde hi be his suna naman Enoch.
 4.18. Soðlice Enoch gestrynde Irad, &amp; Irad gestrynde
Mauiahel, Mauiael gestrynde Matusael, &amp; Matusael gestrynde Lamech.
 4.19. Witodlice Lamech nam twa wif; oðer wæs genemned Ada
&amp; oðer Sella.
 4.20. Be Adan he gestrynde Iabaal &amp; Iubal.
 4.21. Iubal wæs hyrda fæder &amp; þara manna ðe on
geteldum wunedon, &amp; sangera fæder &amp; hearpera &amp; organystra.
 4.22. Be Sellan he gestrynde Tubalcain, se wæs ægðer ge
goldsmið ge irensmið, &amp; ane dohtor, seo hatte Noema.
 4.25. Eft Adam gestrynde sunu ðone he nemde Seth, &amp; ðus
cwæð: Drihten me sealde ðisne sunu for Abel, ðe Cain ofsloh.
 4.26. Seth gestrynde sunu &amp; nemde hine Enos; Se Enos ongan
ærest clypian Drihtnes NamaN.
 5.5. Soðlice Adam leofode nigon hund wintra &amp; ðritig
wintra; &amp; he forðferde on godre ylde.
 5.6. Seth wæs hundwintre &amp; <foreign>v</foreign> ða he gestrynde Enos.
 5.7. Ymb seofan &amp; hundeahtatigwintre æfter ðam he
gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.8. &amp; he forðferde þa he wæs nigonhundwintre &amp;
twelfwintre; ðis is Adames cneores.
 5.9. Enos gestrynde Cainan, ða he wæs hundnigontigwintre.
 5.10. Æfter ðam he gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.11. &amp; Enos forðferde ða he wæs nygonhundwintre &amp;
fifwintre.
 5.12. Cainan gestrynde Malaleel, ða he wæs
hundseofontigwintre.
 5.13. &amp; æfter ðam he gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.14. &amp; he forðferde, ða he wæs nygonhundwintre &amp;
tynwintre.
 5.15. Witodlice Malaleel gestrynde Iared, ða he wæs fif &amp;
sixtigwintre.
 5.16. &amp; syððan he gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.17. &amp; he forðferde, ða he wæs eahtahundwintre &amp;
fif &amp; hundnygontigwintre.
 5.18. Iared gestrynde Enoch, ða he wæs hundwintre twa and
syxtig.
 5.19. &amp; æfter ðam he gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.20. &amp; he forðferde, ða he wæs nigonhundwintre &amp;
fif &amp; sixtigwintre.
 5.21. Enoch gestrynde Mathusalam, ða he wæs fif &amp;
sixtigwintre.
 5.22. &amp; syððan he gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.23. &amp; he wæs on ðison life ðreohundwintre &amp; fif
&amp; sixtiwintre.
 5.24. &amp; he ferde mid Gode, &amp; hine nan man syððan ne
geseah, for ðam ðe Drihten genam hine mid sawle &amp; mid lichaman.
 5.25. Witodlice Matusalem gestrynde Lamech, ða he wæs <foreign>c</foreign>
&amp; seofan &amp; hundeahtatigwintre.
 5.26. &amp; æfter ðam he gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.27. &amp; he forðferde, ða he wæs nygonhundwintre &amp;
nygon &amp; sixtigwintre.
 5.28. Lamech gestrynde sunu, ða he wæs anhundwintre &amp; twa
&amp; hundeahtatigwintre.
 5.29. &amp; nemde hine Noe, &amp; ðus cwæð be him: ðes man
us afrefrað fram urum weorcum &amp; fram urum geswyncum on ðam lande, ðe
Drihten wyrigde.
 5.30. Æfter ðam he gestrynde suna &amp; dohtra.
 5.31. &amp; he forðferde, þa he wæs seofonhundwintre &amp;
seofan &amp; hundseofantiwintre.
 5.32. Noe soðlice wæs fifhund geara; ða gestrynde he ðry
suna, SEM &amp; CHAM &amp; IAPHET.
 6.1. MEN wurdon ða gemenigfylde ofer eorðan &amp; dohtra
gestryndon.
 6.2. Ða gesawon Godes bearn, ðæt wæron gode men, manna
dohtra ðæt hi wæron wlitige, &amp; namon him wif of eallum ðam ðe
hi gecuron.
 6.3. &amp; God cwæð ða: Ne ðurhwunað na min gast on men
on ecnysse, for ðan ðe he is flæsc.
 6.4. Entas wæron eac swylce ofer eorðan on ðam dagum,
æfter ðan ðe Godes bearn tymdon wið manna dohtra &amp; hi cendon: ða
synd mihtige fram worulde &amp; hlisfulle weras.
 6.5. Ða geseah God ðæt micel yfelnys manna wæs ofer
eorðan, &amp; eal geðanc manna heortena wæs awend on yfel on eallum
timan.
 6.6. Gode ofðuhte ða ðæt he mann geworhte ofer eorðan:
he wolde ða warnian on ær &amp; wæs gehrepod mid heortan sarnysse
wiðinnan.
 6.7. &amp; cwæð: Ic adylgie ðone man, ðe ic gesceop, fram
ðære eorðan ansyne, fram ðam men oð ða nytenu, fram ðam
slincendum oð ða fugelas: me ofðingð soðlice ðæt ic hi worhte.
 6.8. Noe soðlice wæs Gode gecweme, &amp; gyfe ætforan him
gemette.
 6.9. Ðas synd Noes cneornyssa: Noe wæs rihtwis wer &amp;
fulfremed on his mægðum; mid Gode he ferde.
 6.10. &amp; gestrynde ðry suna Sem &amp; Cham &amp; Iaphet.
 6.11. Ða wæs eall seo eorðe gewemmed ætforan Gode &amp;
afylled mid unrihtwisnysse.
 6.12. Ða geseah God ðæt seo eorðe wæs gewemmed, for
ðan ðe ælc flæsc gewemde his weg ofer eorðan.
 6.13. &amp; God cwæð ða to Noe: Geendung ealles flæsces
com ætforan me; seo eorðe is afylled mid unrihtwisnysse fram heora ansyne,
&amp; ic fordo hi mid ðære eorðan samod.
 6.14. Wyrc ðe nu ane arc of aheawenum bordum &amp; ðu wyrcst
wununga binnan ðam arce &amp; clæmst wiðinnan &amp; wiðutan mid
tyrwan.
 6.15. &amp; ðu wyrcst hine ðus: ðreohund fæðma bið se
arc on lenge, &amp; fiftig fæðma on bræde, &amp; ðritig on
heahnysse.
 6.16. Ðu wyrcst ðæron egðyrl &amp; ðu tihst his
heahnysse togædere on ufeweardum to anre fæðme; duru ðu setst be
ðære sidan wiðneoðan, &amp; ðu macast ðreo fleringa binnan ðam
arce.
 6.17. Efne ic gebringe flodes wæteru ofer eorðan, ðæt ic
ofslea eal flæsc on ðam ðe is lifes gast under heofonum: ealle ða
ðing ðe on eorðan synd beoð fornumene.
 6.18. Ic sette min wedd to ðe, &amp; ðu gæst in to ðam
arce, &amp; ðine suna, &amp; ðin wif &amp; ðinra suna wif mid ðe.
 6.19. &amp; of eallum nytenum ealles flæsces twegen gemacan ðu
lætst in to ðam arce mid ðe, ðæt hi libban magon.
 6.20. Eac of fugelum be heora cynne, &amp; of eallum orfcynne,
&amp; of eallum creopendum cynne twam &amp; twam faran in mid ðe, ðæt hi
magon libban.
 6.21. Ðu nimst witodlice of eallum mettum, ðe to mete magon, in
to ðe, ðæt hi beon ægðer ge ðe ge him to bigleofan.
 6.22. Noe soðlice dyde ealle ða ðing, ðe him God bebead.
 7.1. AND God cwæð to him: Gang in to ðam arce &amp; eal
ðin hiwræden, ðe ic geseah soðlice rihtwisne ætforan me on þisre
mægðe.
 7.2. Nim in to ðe of eallum clænum nytenum seofan &amp; seofan
ægðres gecyndes &amp; of unclænum twam &amp; twam.
 7.3. &amp; of fugelcynne seofan &amp; seofan ægðres gecyndes,
&amp; sæd si gehealden ofer ealre eorðan bradnysse.
 7.4. Ic soðlice sende ren nu embe seofan niht ofer eorðan
feowertig daga &amp; feowertig nihta togædere &amp; ic adylegie ealle ða
edwiste, ðe ic worhte ofer eorðan bradnysse.
 7.5. Noe ða dyde ealle ða ðingc ðe him God bebead.
 7.6. &amp; he wæs ða sixhund geara on ylde, ða ða ðæs
flodes wæteru yðedon ofer eorðan.
 7.7. Hwæt ða Noe eode in to ðam arce, &amp; his ðry suna
&amp; his wif &amp; hus suna wif, for ðæs flodes wæterum.
 7.8. Eac swylce ða nytenu of eallum cynne &amp; eallum
fugolcynne.
 7.9. Comon to Noe in to ðam arce, swa swa God bebead.
 7.10. Þa on ðam eahtoðan dæge, ða ða hi inne wæron
&amp; God hi belocen hæfde wiðutan, ða yðode ðæt flod ofer
eorðan.
 7.11. On ðam oðrum monðe, on ðone seofonteoðan dæg
ðæs monðes, ða asprungon ealle wyllspringas ðære miclan
nywelnysse &amp; þære heofenan wæterðeotan wæron geopenode.
 7.12. &amp; hit rinde ða ofer eorðan feowertig daga &amp;
feowertig nihta on an.
 7.17. Wæs ða geworden micel flod &amp; ða wæteru wæron
gemenifylde &amp; ahefdon up ðone arc.
 7.18. &amp; yðodon swyðe &amp; gefyldon ðære eorðan
bradnysse: witodlice se arc wæs geferod ofer ða wæteru.
 7.19. &amp; ðæt wæter swyðrode swylce ofer eorðan;
wurdon ða behelede ealle ða heahstan duna under ealre heofenan.
 7.20. &amp; ðæt wæter wæs fyftyne fæðma deop ofer
ða heahstan duna.
 7.21. Wearð ða fornumen eal flæsc ðe ofer eorðan
styrode, manna &amp; fugela, nytena &amp; creopendra.
 7.22. &amp; ælc ðingc ðe lif hæfde wearð adyd on ðam
deopan flode.
 7.23. Buton ðam anum ðe binnan ðam arce wæron.
 7.24. Ðæt flod stod ða swa anhund daga &amp; fiftig daga.
 8.1. &amp; GOD ða gemunde Noes fare &amp; ðæra nytena ðe
him mid wæron, &amp; asende wind ofer eorðan, &amp; ða wæteru wurdon
gewanode.
 8.2. &amp; ða wylspringas ðære miclan nywelnysse wurdon
fordytte &amp; ðære heofonan wæterðeotan, &amp; se ren wearð
forboden.
 8.3. Ða wæteru ða gecyrdon of ðære eorðan ongean
farende &amp; begunnon to wanigenne æfter oðer healfhund daga.
 8.4. Ða ætstod se arc on ðam seofoðan monðe ofer ða
muntas Armenisces landes.
 8.5. &amp; ða wæteru toeodan &amp; wanodon of ðone teoðan
monð, &amp; on ðam teoðan monðe æteowedon ðæra munta cnollas.
 8.6. Ða æfter feowertigum dagum undyde Noe his eahðyrl, ðe
he on ðam arce gemacode.
 8.7. &amp; asende ut ænne hremn: se hrem fleah ða ut &amp;
nolde eft ongean cyrran, ær ðan ðe ða wæteru adruwodon ofer
eorðan.
 8.8. He asende ða eft ut ane culfran, ðæt heo sceawode gyf
ða wætera ðagyt geswicon ofer ðære eorðan bradnysse.
 8.9. Heo ða fleah ut &amp; ne mihte findan hwær heo hire fot
asette, for ðan ðe ða wætera wæron ofer ealle eorðan; &amp; heo
gecyrde ongean to Noe, &amp; he genam hi in to ðam arce.
 8.10. He abad ða gyt oðre seofan dagas &amp; asende ut eft
culfran.
 8.11. Heo com ða on æfnunge eft to Noe, &amp; brohte an twig
of anum elebeame mid grenum leafum on hyre muðe.
 8.11. Ða undergeat Noe ðæt ða wætera wæron adruwode
ofer eorðan.
 8.12. &amp; abad swa ðeah seofan dagas &amp; asende ut culfran;
swa heo ne gecyrde ongean to him.
 8.13. Ða geopenode Noe ðæs arces hrof, &amp; beheold ut
&amp; geseah ðæt ðære eorðan bradnis wæs adruwod.
 8.15. God ða spræc to Noe, ðus cweðende.
 8.16. Gang ut of ðam arce, ðu &amp; þin wif &amp; ðine suna
&amp; heora wif.
 8.17. &amp; eal ðæt ðær inne is mid ðe, læd ut mid
ðe ofer eorðan, &amp; weaxe ge &amp; beoð gemænifylde ofer eorðan.
 8.18. Noe ða ut eode of ðam arce, &amp; hi ealle ofer
eorðan.
 8.20. &amp; he arærde an weofod Gode, &amp; genam of eallum
ðam clænum nytenum &amp; clænum fugelum, &amp; geoffrode Gode lac on
ðam weofode.
 8.21. God ða underfeng his lac &amp; ðære winsumnysse
bræð, &amp; cwæð him to: Nelle ic nateshwon awyrgean ða eorðan
heononforð for mannum; andgyt &amp; geþoht menniscre heortan syndon
forðhealde to yfele fram iugoðe; Eornostlice ne ofslea ic heononforð mid
wætere ælc ðingc cuces, swa swa ic dyde.
 8.22. Eallum dagum ðære eorðan, sæd &amp; gerip, cyle
&amp; hæte, sumor &amp; winter, dæg &amp; niht ne geswicað.
 9.1. GOD bletsode ða Noe &amp; his suna, &amp; cwæð him to:
Weaxað &amp; beoð gemenifylde &amp; afyllað ða eorðan.
 9.2. &amp; beo eower ege &amp; oga ofer ealle nytenu &amp; fugelas
&amp; ofer ealle ða ðingc ðe on eorðan styriað; Ealle sæfixas
syndon eowrum handum betæhte.
 9.3. &amp; eal ðæt ðe styrað &amp; leofað beo eow to
mete, swa swa growende wyrta ic hi betæce ealle eow.
 9.4. Butan ðam anum ðæt ge flæsc mid blode ne eton.
 9.5. Eower blod ic ofgange æt eallum wildeorum &amp; eac æt
ðam men; of ðæs weres handa &amp; his broðor handa ic ofgange ðæs
mannes lif.
 9.6. Swa hwa swa agyt ðæs mannes blod, his blod byð agoten;
witodlice to Godes anlicnysse is se man geworht.
 9.7. Weaxe ge nu &amp; beoð gemænifylde &amp; gað ofer
eorðan &amp; gefyllað hi.
 9.8. God cwæð eft to Noe &amp; to his sunum.
 9.9. Efne nu ic sette min wed to eow &amp; to eowrum ofspringe.
 9.10. &amp; to eallum libbendum nytenum ðe of ðam arce eodon.
 9.11. Ðæt ic nateshwon nelle heononforð eal flæsc adydon
mid flodes wæterum; ne heononforð ne bið flod tosencende ða eorðan.
 9.12. Ðis bið ðæt tacn mines weddes ðæt ic do betwux
me &amp; eow &amp; eallum libbendum nytenum on ecum mægðum.
 9.13. Ðæt is, ðæt ic sette minne renbogan on wolcnum,
&amp; he byð tacn mines weddes betwux me &amp; ðære eorðan.
 9.14. Þonne ic oferteo heofonan mid wolcnum, ðonne æteowað
min boga on ðam wolcnum.
 9.15. &amp; ic beo gemyndig mines weddes wið eow, ðæt
heononforð ne byð flod to adylgienne eall flæsc.
 9.16. Bið ðonne se min renboga on ðam wolcnum &amp; ic hine
geseo &amp; beo gemyndig ðæs ecean weddes, ðe geset is betwux Gode &amp;
eallum libbendum flæsce, ðe ofer eorðan is.
 9.17. Ðis byð ðæt tacn mines weddes ðæt ic gesette
betwux me &amp; eallum flæsce ofer eorðan.
 9.18. Wæron ða Noes suna ðe of ðam arce eodan: Sem &amp;
Cham &amp; Iaphet; &amp; Cham witodlice is fæder ðære Chananeiscre
ðeode.
 9.19. &amp; of ðisum ðrym Noes sunum is tosawen eall mancyn
ofer eorðan.
 9.20. Noe ða yrðlingc began to wyrcenne ðæt land &amp;
gesette him wingeard.
 9.21. &amp; ða ða he dranc of ðam wine, ða wearð he
druncen &amp; læg on his getelde unbehelod.
 9.22. His sunu ða, Cham, geseah his gesceapu unbeheled, &amp;
cydde hit his twam gebroðrum ut on felda.
 9.23. Hwæt, ða Sem &amp; Iapheth dydon anne hwitel on heora
sculdrum, &amp; eodon underbæc &amp; beheledon heora fæderes gecynd, swa
ðæt hi ne gesawon his næcednysse.
 9.24. Noe soðlice ða ða he awoc of ðam slæpe, &amp; he
ofaxode hwæt his suna him dydon.
 9.25. Ða cwæð he: Awyrged is Chanaan, &amp; he byð
ðeowena ðeowa his gebroðrum.
 9.26. &amp; he cwæð: Gebletsod is Drihten, Semes God; beo
Chanaan his ðeowa.
 9.27. Gemænifylde God Iapheð, &amp; he wunie on Semes
geteldum, &amp; beo Chanaan his ðeowa.
 9.28. Noe ða leofode ðreohund geara &amp; fiftig geara æfter
ðam flode.
 9.29. &amp; wæron ða gefyllede ealle his dagas nygonhund geara
&amp; fiftig geara, &amp; he forðferde.
 10.1. Þis synd Noes suna naman: Sem &amp; Cham &amp; Iapheth.
 10.2. Iafeðes suna Gomer &amp; Magog &amp; Madai; Iuan &amp;
Tubal &amp; Mosoh &amp; ðiras.
 10.32. Ðis wæs Noes hiwræden &amp; his mægða: ðurh
ðas wæron ðeoda todælede on eorðan æfter ðam.
 11.1. Soðlice ealle menn spræcon ða ane spræce.
 11.2. Ða ða hi ferdon fram eastdæle, hi fundon ænne feld
on Senaarlande, &amp; wunodon ðæron.
 11.3. Ða cwædon hi him betwynan: Vton wyrcean us tigelan &amp;
ælan hi on fyre.
 11.3. Witodlice hi hæfdon tigelan for stan &amp; tyrwan for
wealllim.
 11.4. &amp; cwædon: Vton timbrian us ceastre &amp; stypel oð
heofon heahne, &amp; uton wyrðian urne naman.
 11.4. Ær ðam ðe we synd todælede geond ealle eorðan.
 11.5. Witodlice Drihten astah nyðer to ðam ðæt he gesawe
ða burh &amp; ðone stypel ðe Adames bearn getimbrodon.
 11.6. &amp; he cwæð: ðis is an folc, &amp; ealle hi
sprecað an leden &amp; hi begunnon ðis to wyrcenne; ne geswycað hi ær
ðan ðe hit geara sy.
 11.7. Soðlice uton cuman &amp; todælan ðær heora
spæce.
 11.8. Swa Drihten hi todælde of ðære stowe geond ealle
eorðan.
 11.9. &amp; for ðam man nemde ða stowe Babel, for ðam ðar
wæron todælede ealle spæce.
 11.27. Ðis is Thares cynryn.
 11.28. Ðare gestrynde Abram &amp; Nachor &amp; Aran; Witodlice
Aran gestrynde Loth.
 11.28. Aran forðferde ær ðan ðe Thare his fæder on Vr
Chaldea.
 11.29. Soðlice Abram &amp; Nachor wifodon; Abrames wif hatte
Sarai &amp; Nachores wif Melcha.
 11.30. Sarai wæs untymende, næfde heo nan bearn.
 11.31. Witodlice Thare nam Abram, his sunu, &amp; Loth, his suna
sunu, &amp; gelædde hi of Vr Chaldea, ðæt hi ferdon to Chanaan lande;
Hi foron oð hi comon to Aran, &amp; hi wunodan ðær.
 11.32. Thare leofode twa hund geara &amp; fif gear, &amp;
forðferde on Aran.
 12.0. HER swutelað þæs ælmihtigan Godes mildheortnyss
&amp; hys wundra, hu he Abraham geceas &amp; hys bletsunga him sealde &amp; hys
ofspringe.
 12.1. God cwæð þa to Abrame: Far of þinum lande &amp; of
ðinre mægðe &amp; of ðines fæder huse, &amp; cum to þam lande
þe ic ðe geswutelige.
 12.2. &amp; ic macige ðe mycelre mægðe &amp; þe gebletsige
&amp; ðinne naman ic gemærsige, &amp; ðu byst gebletsod.
 12.3. Ic gebletsige ða þe ðe bletsiað, &amp; ic awyrwige
ða þe ðe wyriað, &amp; on þe beoð gebletsode ealre eorðan
mægða.
 12.4. Abram ða ferde of Aran, swa swa God him bead, &amp; Loth
ferde mid him.
 12.5. Mid ealre fare &amp; mid eallum æhtum, oð þæt hi
comon to þam lande Chanaan.
 12.6. &amp; Abram sceawode ðæt land, &amp; ða gemæru:
Chananeus wæs þa on lande.
 12.7. God þa geswutelode hyne sylfne Abrame, &amp; cwæð him
to: þinum ofspringe ic forgyfe ðis land; Hwæt, þa Abram arærde
ðær an weofod Gode, þe him æteowde.
 12.8. &amp; ferde syððan to þam munte be eastan Bethel, be
westan Hai, &amp; þær gesloh hys geteld &amp; arærde þær an weofod
Gode, &amp; hys naman ðær clypode.
 12.9. Þanon he ferde eft to ðam suðdæle þæs landes.
 12.10. &amp; hyt wearð þa mycel hungorgear on þam lande;
Abram ða ferde to Egypta lande, wolde þær on ælþeodinysse anbidian,
for ðan ðe se hunger ðearle swyðrode.
 12.11. Mid ðam ðe hi wæron gehende Egypta lande, þa
cwæð Abram to hys wife: Ic wat ðæt þu eart wlitig on hiwe.
 12.12. &amp; þonne ða Egyptiscean ðe geseoð, þonne
cweðaþ hi ðæt þu min wif sy, &amp; hi ofsleað me &amp; ðe
healdað.
 12.13. Sege nu, ic ðe bidde, þæt ðu min swuster sy,
þæt me wel sy for ðe, &amp; min sawel lybbe for þinum intingan.
 12.14. Hi comon ða to Egypta lande, &amp; ða Egyptiscean
gesawon ðæt þæt wif wæs swyðe wlitig.
 12.15. &amp; ðæs cyninges ealdormen spæcon be hyre wlite to
þam cyninge Farao, &amp; heredon hi beforan him; þæt wif wearð þa
gelæht &amp; gelædd to þam cyninge.
 12.16. &amp; Abram underfeng fela sceatta for hyre: he hæfde
ða on orfe &amp; on ðeowum, on oluendum &amp; on assum mycele æhta.
 12.17. God soðlice beswang Farao þone cyning mid þam
mæstum witum &amp; ealne hys hired for Sarai, Abrames wife.
 12.18. Farao ða het clypian Abram, &amp; cwæð him to:
Hwæt la, hwi dydest ðu swa wið me; hwi noldest ðu secgan þæt heo
þin wif ys.
 12.19. For hwylcon intingan sædest ðu þæt heo ðin
swustor wære; efne nu her ys ðin wif: nim hig and far ðe aweg.
 12.20. Abram þa ferde of Egypta lande mid ealre hys fare, &amp;
Farao se cyning him funde ladmen.
 13.1. &amp; LOTH ferde forð mid him, oð ðæt hi comon to
suðdæle betwux Bethel &amp; Hai.
 13.4. To ðære stowe þe he ðæt weofod ær arærde,
&amp; gebæd hyne ðær to Gode.
 13.5. &amp; Loth samod mid him.
 13.5. Abram soðlice wæs swyðe welig on golde &amp; on
seolfre &amp; on orfe &amp; on geteldum.
 13.6. Swa þæt þæt land ne mihte aberan þæt hi begen,
he &amp; Loth, ætgædere wunedon: heora æhta wæron menigfealde &amp;
ne mihton wunian ætgædere.
 13.7. Wearð eac ðurh þone intingan sacu betwux Abrames
hyrdemannum &amp; Lothes; On ðære tide wunedon Chananeus &amp; Ferezeus on
ðam lande.
 13.8. Abram þa cwæð to Lothe: Ic bidde þæt nan sacu ne
sy betwux me &amp; ðe, ne betwux minum hyrdum &amp; ðinum hyrdum; wyt synd
gebroðru.
 13.9. Efne nu eall seo eorðe lið ætforan ðe: ic bidde, far
fram me: gyf ðu færst to þære wynstran healfe, ic healde þa
swyðran healfe; gyf þu ðonne þa swyðran healfe gecyst, ic fare to
þære wynstran healfe.
 13.10. Loth ða beheold geond eall, &amp; geseah þæt eall se
eard wið ða ea Iordanen wæs myrge mid wætere gemenged, swa swa Godes
neorxnawang, &amp; swa swa Egypta land becumendum to Segor, ær þan þe
God towende ða burga Sodomam &amp; gomorran.
 13.11. Loth ða geceas him þone eard wið Iordanen &amp; ferde
fram eastdæle, &amp; hi wurdon totwæmede heora ægðer fram hys
breðer.
 13.12. Abram eardode ða on þam lande Chanaan: Loth soðlice
wunode on þam fæstenum ðe wæron embe Iordanen, &amp; he eardode on
þære byrig Sodoma.
 13.13. Þa Sodomitiscan men wæron forcuðostan &amp; swyðe
synfulle ætforan Gode.
 13.14. God cwæð ða to Abrame, æfter ðan þe Loth
wæs totwæmed him fram: Ahefe upp þine eagan &amp; beheald fram
ðære stowe þe ðu on stenst to norðdæle &amp; to suðdæle
&amp; to eastdæle &amp; to westdæle.
 13.15. Eal ðis land þe ðu gesyxt, ic forgyfe ðe &amp;
þinum ofsprincge on ecnysse.
 13.16. &amp; ic do þinne ofsprincg swa menigfealdne swa swa
ðære eorðan dust: gyf ænig man mæg geriman ðære eorðan
dust, þonne mæg he eac swylce geriman þinne ofspring.
 13.17. Aris nu &amp; far geond þis land on lencge &amp; bræde,
for ðan ðe ic hyt þe forgyfe.
 13.18. Abram þa eornostlice astyrode hys geteld, &amp; com &amp;
eardode wið þone dene Mambre, þæt ðe ys on Ebron, &amp; þær
arærde weofod Gode.

 14.10. Þa feollon ða cyningas on ðam gefeohte ofslagene, of
Sodomam &amp; Gomorran, þæra manfulra ðeoda, &amp; heora geferan flugon
afyrhte to muntum.
 14.11. Þa namon þa sigefæstan cyningas sona on þam burgum
Sodoma &amp; Gomorra ða god þe hi ðær fundon.
 14.12. &amp; eac læddon aweg Loth mid hys æhtum, Abrames
broðor sunu, ðe on þam burgum eardode.
 14.13. Ða ætbærst him sum man, &amp; se hyt sæde Abrame,
hu man hys broðor sunu on bendum aweg lædde.
 14.14. Abram ða genam ardlice ðreohund manna &amp; eahtatyne
men of hys inbyrdlingum, &amp; efste wið ðæs heres, oð ðæt he hi
