þe.
 44.33. Hlaford min, læt þone cnapan faran ham mid his
gebroþrum, &amp; ic beo þin þeowa for hine.
 44.34. Ne dear ic ham faran butan þam cnapan, þe læs þe ic
geseo mines fæder sarnysse.
 45.1. ÐA ne mihte Iosep hine leng dyrnan, ac he draf ealle þa
Egyptiscan ut, þæt nan fremde man betwuh him nære.
 45.2. &amp; he weop &amp; clypode hluddre stemne, þæt ða
Egyptiscan gehyrdon, &amp; eal Pharaones hyred.
 45.3. &amp; he cwæð to hys gebroþrum: Ic eom Iosep; leofaþ
ure fæder nu gyt; ða ne mihton his gebroðru him for ege geandwyrdan.
 45.4. Ða grette he hig arwurþlice, &amp; cwæþ: Ic eom
Iosep eower broðor, þe ge sealdon on Egipta land.
 45.5. Ne ondræde ge eow nan þing, ne eow ne ofþince þæt
ge me sealdon on þis rice; Soþlice for eowre þearfe me sende God on
Egypta land.
 45.6. Nu twa gear wæs hunger ofer ealle eorðan, &amp; gyt
sceolon fyfe on þam man ne mæg ne erian ne rypan.
 45.7. &amp; God me sende to þam þæt ge beon gehealdene,
&amp; þæt ge habbon þæt ge magon big libban.
 45.8. Ðæt næs na eowres þances ac þurh God, þe ic
þurh hys willan hider asend wæs: se dide me swylce ic Pharaones fæder
wære &amp; hys hyredes hlaford, &amp; he sette me to ealdre ofer Egypta
land.
 45.9. Farað hrædlice to minum fæder, &amp; secgaþ hym
þæt God me sette to hlaforde eallum Egyptum: beodaþ him þæt he fare
to me.
 45.10. &amp; wunige on Gessen lande &amp; beo me gehende, he &amp;
hys suna &amp; hys bearna bearn, &amp; eower scep &amp; eower hryþerheorda,
&amp; eal þæt ge agon.
 45.11. &amp; ic eow fede: gyt synd fif hungergear bæfton; doþ
ðus, þæt ge ne forwurðon.
 45.12. Nu ge geseoþ hu hit mid me is, &amp; ge gehyrað hwæt
ic eow sprece.
 45.13. Cyþað mynum fæder eal min wuldor &amp; ealle þa
þingc þe ge gesawon on Egypta lande: efstaþ &amp; lædaþ hine to me.
 45.14. &amp; he clypte heora ælcne &amp; cyste hig &amp; weop;
æfter þison hi dorston sprecan wiþ hine.
 45.16. Ða spræc man ofer eal &amp; widmærsode þæt
Iosepes broðru comon to Pharaone, &amp; Pharao wæs glæd, &amp; eal hys
hyred.
 45.17. &amp; he bead Iosepe þæt he bude hys broþrum, &amp;
þus cwæþ: Symað eowre assan &amp; farað to Chanaan lande.
 45.18. &amp; nimað þær eowerne fæder &amp; eowre
mægþe &amp; cumað to me, &amp; ic eow sille ealle Egypta god.
 45.19. Beod him eac þæt hi nimon wænas to heora cyld
fære &amp; to heora gemæccena, &amp; beod heom eac þæt hy niman
heora fæder, &amp; efston hider swa hyg raþost magon.
 45.20. &amp; ne forlæte ge nan þingc of eowrum iddisce, for
þam ealle Egypta speda beoþ eowre.
 45.21. Israheles suna dydon swa heom beboden wæs, &amp; Iosep
him sealde wænas, eal swa Pharao hym bead, &amp; formete.
 45.22. &amp; sealde heora ælcum twa scrud, &amp; he sealde
Beniamine fif scrud &amp; þreohundryd sylfrynga.
 45.23. &amp; he sende hys fæder tyn assan þa wæron gesymed
mid feo &amp; mid hrægle &amp; mid Egypta welum, &amp; tyn ðe bæron
hwæte &amp; hlaf.
 45.24. Witodlice he let þa hys gebroðru faran &amp; cwæð
to hym: Ne forlæte ge nan þing be wege, ac beoð swyðe gesome.
 45.25. Hy foron of Egypta lande &amp; comon to Chanaan lande to
Iacobe heora fæder.
 45.26. &amp; cwædon to hym: Iosep leofaþ, þin sunu, &amp;
wealt ealles Egypta landes; ða Iacob þæt gehyrde, þa þuhte hym
swylce he of hefegum slæpe awæcnode, &amp; þeah hym ne gelyfde.
 45.27. Hy rehton hym heora færeld be endebyrdnysse, &amp; þa
he geseah þa wænas &amp; ealle þa ðyngc, þe hym gesende wæron,
hys gast wearþ geedcwicod.
 45.28. &amp; he cwæð: Genoh ic hæbbe, gyf Iosep myn sunu
gyt leofaþ; ic fare &amp; geseo hyne, ær þam ic swelte.
 46.1. ISRAHEL ferde þa mid eallum þam þe he hæfde, oþ
þæt he com to aþsware pytte, &amp; þær offrode lac Isaaces Gode hys
fæder.
 46.2. &amp; God hyne gehirde &amp; clypode hyne, &amp; cwæþ to
hym: Iacob, Iacob; &amp; he hym andswarode &amp; cwæþ: Her ic eom.
 46.3. &amp; God cwæð to him: Ic eom se strensta God þines
fæder; ne ondræd þu þe, ac far on Egypta land, for þam ðe ic do
þe þær weligne.
 46.4. Ic fare ðider mid þe, &amp; ðanon ic ðe læde.
 46.5. Iacob aras þa fram þam pytte, &amp; his suna hine namon
mid lytlingum &amp; mid heora wyfum &amp; mid þam wænum, þe Farao
þider sende þone ealdan man on to ferianne.
 46.6. &amp; ealle þa þingc þe he ahte on Chanaan lande; &amp;
he com on Egypta land mid eallum hys cynne.
 46.8. Soðlice þys synd Ysrahela bearna naman, þe in foron on
Egypta land, he mid hys sunum: se phrumcenneda Ruben.
 46.9. Rubenes suna: Enoh &amp; Phallu &amp; Charm.
 46.10. Simeones suna: Gamuel &amp; Diamin &amp; Achod &amp; Iachim
&amp; Saher &amp; Saul, Chananides suna.
 46.11. &amp; Leuies Sues suna: Ierson &amp; Chaath &amp; Merari.
 46.12. Iudas suna: Her &amp; Onam &amp; Sela &amp; Phares &amp;
Zaram; Her &amp; Onam forðferdon on Chanaan lande, &amp; Farase wæron
suna acennede Esrom &amp; Amul.
 46.13. Isachares suna: Thola &amp; Fua &amp; Iob &amp; Semrom.
 46.14. Zabulones suna: Sared &amp; Elon &amp; Iaelel.
 46.15. Ðys sind Lian suna, þe heo cende on Mesopotamie Sirie,
mid Dina hire dehter; þæt wæron ealra þreo &amp; <foreign>xxx</foreign> mid sunum
&amp; mid dohtrum.
 46.16. Gades suna: Sephio &amp; Thagis, Suni &amp; Essebon, Her
&amp; Arodi &amp; Areli.
 46.17. Asseres suna: Gamne &amp; Gessui &amp; Gessua &amp; Beria,
&amp; Sara heora swustor; Berian suna: Hebel &amp; Melchiel.
 46.19. Rachele suna Iacobes wifes: Iosep &amp; Beniamin.
 46.20. &amp; Iosep gestrynde suna on Egypta lande be Aseneth,
Putiphares dehter þæs sacerdes of Elipoleus, Manases &amp; Efraim.
 46.21. Beniamines suna; Bela &amp; Bechor &amp; Asbel &amp; Gera
&amp; Naam; Hehi &amp; Ros, Moym &amp; Oppham &amp; Ared.
 46.22. Rachel acende Iacobe feowertyne suna.
 46.23. Danis suna: Husim.
 46.24. Neptalines suna: Hasiel &amp; Guni &amp; Iesser &amp;
Salem.
 46.27. Witodlice Iacob ferde hundseofontigra sum on Egypta land.
 46.28. He sende Iudas beforan him to Iosepe, &amp; he cydde hym
þæt he come ongean hine to Iessen.
 46.29. Ða he ðyder com, Iosep gegearwode hys cræt &amp; for
ongean his fæder, &amp; þa he hine geseah he clypte hyne &amp; weop.
 46.30. &amp; Iacob cwæð: Nu ic mæg sweltan blyðelice nu
ic þe geseo &amp; þe mine æhta betæcean.
 46.31. &amp; Iosep cwæþ to his broðrum &amp; to ealre hys
ræddene: Ic fare &amp; ciðe Faraone þæt ge comon to me.
 46.32. &amp; ic secge him þæt ge synd hyrdas &amp; habbaþ
broht hider mid eow eal þæt ge ahton.
 46.33. &amp; þonne he eow clypað &amp; axaþ hwæt ge don
cunnon.
 46.34. Þonne secge hym þæt ge synd scephyrdas fram cyldhade,
ge we ge ure fæderas, oþ ðisne andweardan dæg; Secgaþ ðus,
þæt ge magon eardian on Gessen lande, for þam þe ealle Egyptisce
onscuniað scephyrdas.
 47.1. ÞA eode Iosep in to Pharaone, &amp; cwæð to him: Min
fæder &amp; mine gebroþu &amp; heora scepheorda &amp; heora hryþerheorda
&amp; ealle þa þing þe hig agon comon of Chanaan lande, &amp; nu hi synd
on Gessen lande.
 47.2. Witodlice he lædde his fif gingstan broðru beforan
þone cyngc.
 47.3. Þa he axode hwæt hy wyrcean cuþon: hi andswarodon
&amp; cwædon: We synd scephyrdas, ðine þeowas, we &amp; ure fæderas.
 47.4. We comon to þam þæt we wunodon on þinum lande, for
þam þe we nabbaþ nan gærs urum heordum, &amp; hungor wyxt on Chanaan;
&amp; we biddaþ þæt we þine þeowas beon moton on Iessen lande.
 47.5. Þa cwæð se cining to Iosepe: þin fæder &amp;
þine gebroþru comon.
 47.6. Þu canst Egypta land; geloga hi on þære selestan
stowe, &amp; sile him Iessen land, &amp; gyf þu wite þæt hig gleawe
synd, sete hi to ealdrum ofer mine heorda.
 47.7. Æfter þisum lædde Iosep hys fæder in to þam
cyninge, &amp; sette hine beforan; þa bletsode he hine &amp; axode hine, hu
eald he wære.
 47.9. Þa andswarode he him &amp; cwæð: Anhundwintre &amp;
<foreign>xxx</foreign> wintre.
 47.10. &amp; se cining hine bletsode, &amp; he eode ut.
 47.11. Iosep sealde his gebroþrum tun on Egypta lande, on þam
selistan ende, Ramases, eal swa Farao him bead, &amp; fedde hi &amp; ealle his
fæder hiwrædene.
 47.13. Soþlice hlaf wæs wana on eallum ymbhwyrftum, &amp;
hungor fornam swyþost Egypte &amp; Chanaan land.
 47.14. &amp; Iosep hæfde gegaderod eal þæt feoh þe hi
ahton, &amp; gebroht on þæs cyninges maðmhuse.
 47.15. Þa heora feoh geteorode, þa com eall Egypta folc to
Iosepe, &amp; cwædon to him: Sile us mete; hwi swelte we beforan þe, nu we
feoh nabbaþ?
 47.16. He andswarode him &amp; cwæþ: Drifaþ hider eowre orf,
gyf ge feoh nabbaþ, &amp; ic eow sille þærwiþ mete.
 47.17. &amp; hi didon swa, &amp; he sealde him andlifene wiþ
horsum &amp; wiþ hriðerum &amp; wið sceapum &amp; wið assan, &amp;
fedde hi þæt gear wið heora orfe.
 47.18. Ða comon hi eft to him on þam æftran geare, &amp;
cwædon: Ne hele we þe, hlaford, þæt we nabbað naþor ne feoh ne
orf; &amp; þu silf wast þæt we nan þing nabbaþ buton land &amp;
lichaman.
 47.19. Hwi swelte we beforan ðe; We &amp; ure land beoþ ðine;
bige us to þæs cyncges þeowote &amp; sile us sæd, þæt þæt
land ne licge weste &amp; we forwurþon.
 47.20. Witodlice Iosep bohte eal Egypta land, þa hy cypton ealle
heora hamas for þæs hungres micelnysse; &amp; he betæhte hi Pharaone.
 47.21. &amp; eal heora folc fram ende oþ oþerne Egypta landes,
buton þæra sacerda land, ðe se cyning him sealde: þa man fedde of
þæs cyninges berene, for þam hi ne sealdon heora land.
 47.23. Ða cwæþ Iosep to þam folce: Nu ge silfe witon
þæt Farao ah ægþer ge eow ge eowwer land; nimaþ sæd &amp;
sawaþ þæt land.
 47.24. Þæt ge habbon wæstmas, &amp; sillaþ þam cyninge
þone fiftan dæl: þa feower ic eow lyfe to sæde &amp; to mete eow
&amp; eowrum hiwum &amp; eowrum bearnum.
 47.25. Hi andswaredon, &amp; cwædon: æt þe is ure lyf
gelang; beseoh to us, &amp; we þeowiaþ bliðelice þam cyninge.
 47.26. Of þam dæge oþ þisne andweardan man gilt þam
cynincge þone fiftan dæl ofer eal Egypta land to gesetnysse, buton þam
sacerdlande, þe wæs æfre frig.
 47.27. Witodlice Israhel wunode on Egipta, þæt is on Gessen
lande, &amp; ahte þæt &amp; wæs gemænifyld swiðe.
 47.28. &amp; leofode þæron seofentyne gear; ealle hys lifes
dagas wæron hundteontig wintra &amp; seofon &amp; <foreign>xl</foreign> wintra.
 47.29. &amp; þa he geseah ðæt is endedæg him
genealæhte, he clypode Iosep hys suna, &amp; cwæþ to him: Sete þine
hand under min þeoh, &amp; cyð me þine soþfæstnysse &amp; swera me
þæt þu me næfre ne bebirige on Egypta lande.
 47.30. Ac do þæt ic reste myd minum fæderum: læde me of
þisum lande, &amp; bebirig me mid minum yldrum.
 47.31. &amp; Iosep swor þæt he swa don wolde.
 48.1. ÐA þis wæs ðus gedon, ða cydde man Iosepe þæt
his fæder wære gesycled, &amp; he nam hys twegen suna, Mannases &amp;
Efraim, &amp; com þyder.
 48.2. Ða cydde man Ysrahele þæt Iosep his suna wær cumen;
þa elnode he hine &amp; sæt up.
 48.3. &amp; cwæð, þa he in eode: ælmihtig God me
ætywde on Luza, þæt is on Chanaan lande, &amp; bletsode.
 48.4. &amp; cwæþ: Ic þe gemænigfylde &amp; ic sille þe
þis land &amp; þinum cynne æfter þe to ecre æhte.
 48.5. Witodlice þine twegen suna, ða þe acennede wæron on
Egypta lande ær þam ic hyder come, hi beoþ mine, Ephraim &amp; Mannases
swa Ruben &amp; Symeon beoþ mid me getealde, &amp; farað mid me.
 48.6. Staþala þu ða oþre on heora hamon.
 48.7. Me wæs Rachel dead be wege þa ic for of Mesopotamie on
Chanaan lande: hit wæs lenctentid, &amp; ic for to Eufrata &amp; bebirigde
hy wið þone weg þe is on Eufrata: seo ys on oþre naman genemned
Bethleem.
 48.8. Ða he hys suna geseah, þa cwæð he: Hwæt sind
þas?
 48.9. He andwyrde, &amp; cwæð: Mine suna, ðe me God sealde
on þysre stowe; ða cwæþ he: Læde hi to me, &amp; ic hi bletsige.
 48.10. Israeles eagon þistrodon for þære miclan ilde,
þæt he ne mihte beorhte geseon; ða fette hi man to hym, &amp; he cyste
hi.
 48.11. &amp; cwæþ to his suna: Gode þanc þæt ic þe
hæbbe &amp; þæt ic þine suna geseah.
 48.12. &amp; Iosep hi nam of þæs fæder bearme, &amp; he
abeah to þære eorþan &amp; geeaðmedde hine.
 48.13. &amp; sette Efraim on his swyþran hand, þæt wæs on
Israheles wynstran hand, &amp; Mannases on his winstran hand, þæt wæs
on Israheles swiþran healfe, &amp; dide begen to him.
 48.14. He hefde þa his swyþran hand ofer Efraimes heafod,
þæs gyngran broðor, &amp; hys winstran ofer Mannases heafod, þe yldra
wæs.
 48.15. &amp; he bletsode Iosep hys sunu, &amp; cwæþ: Drihten,
þu þe mine fæderas on þinre sihðe eodon, Abraham &amp; Isaac; God,
ðu þe me feddest fram cyldhade oþ ðysne dæg: Se encgel þe me
nerede of eallum yfelum bletsige þas cnapan, &amp; si min nama genemned ofer
hi, &amp; minra fædera Abrahames &amp; Isaaces, &amp; weaxen hi
manifealdlice on eorþan.
 48.17. Ða Iosep geseah þæt his fæder sette his swiþran
hand ofer Efraimes heafod, he wearþ swiðe sarig, &amp; nam þæs
fæder hand &amp; ðohte hi to ahebbenne of Efraimes heafde &amp; gesettan
ofer Mannases heafod.
 48.18. &amp; cwæþ to his fæder: Ne gebireþ hit swa,
fæder, for þam þe he is frumcenned: sete þine swiþran hand ofer his
heafod.
 48.19. Ða onscunode he þæt, &amp; cwæþ: Ic wat, sunu,
ic wat; þes biþ gemænigfild on folce &amp; his gingra broþor bið his
ealdor &amp; his cyn wyxt on þeoda.
 48.20. &amp; he bletsode hi, &amp; cwæþ: On þe biþ
gebletsod Ysrahela God, &amp; be eow man cwyþ ðus: Si God mid þe swa he
wæs myd Efraime &amp; Mannases.
 48.21. &amp; cwæþ to Iosepe hys suna: Nu ic swelte &amp; God
biþ mid eow &amp; eow eft gelæt to eowra fædera lande.
 48.22. Ic sille þe anne dæl toforan þinum broþrum, þone
ic nam of Amoreus handum mid gefeohte.
 49.1. SOþLICE Iacob clypode his suna, &amp; cwæþ to him:
Beoþ ætgædere þæt ic eow cyþe þa þing þe eow towearde
sind, &amp; hu eower ælcon gebireþ ær his ende.
 49.4. He him sæde þa swa hit on þære Ledenbec awriten is,
ræde þær se þe wille.
 49.28. Ða he hit him eal asæd hæfde, ða bletsode he
ælcne on sundron.
 49.29. &amp; cwæþ to him: Bebyriaþ me mid minum fæderum
on þam twifealdan scræfe þe is on Ephrones lande, þæs Etheiscan.
 49.30. Þæt Abraham bohte æt Ephrone þam Etheiscean him to
byrgenne.
 49.31. Ðær hine man birigde &amp; Sarran his wif; ðær
wæs Isaac bebiriged mid Rebeccan; &amp; þær lið Lia bebyriged.
 49.32. &amp; þa he þus gesprecen hæfde, he feold his fet
uppan his bed &amp; geendode, &amp; wæs to his folce gelæd.
 50.1. ÐA Iosep þæt geseah, þa feol he uppan hine &amp;
weop.
 50.2. &amp; bead his þeowan læcean, þæt hi mid
wyrtgemangum hine behwurfon: hi didon swa.
 50.3. Feowertig daga hit wæs þeaw þæt man sceolde wepan
ælcne deadne mannan, &amp; eal þæt folc hine weop hundseofontig daga.
 50.4. Ða þæs wopes dagas agane wæron, Iosep cwæþ to
Pharaones hirede: Secgaþ Faraone.
 50.5. Þæt min fæder me bæd þæt ic hine bebyrigde on
þære byrgene þe he silf dealf on Chanaan lande: biddað hine þæt
he me sille leafe.
 50.6. &amp; Pharao cwæþ: Far &amp; bebirge þinne fæder
swa he þe bæd.
 50.7. He for þa, &amp; Pharaones ildstan hiredmen foron mid him,
&amp; ealle þa betstborenan on Egypta lande mid him foron.
 50.8. &amp; eac his gebroþru mid &amp; eal heora hiwræden,
buton geongum litlingum &amp; hyrdum ða hi forleton on Gessen lande.
 50.9. He hæfde on his geferræddene cratu &amp; ridende men,
&amp; þær wæs micel folc.
 50.10. Ða foron hi oþ hi comon to þære þirsceflore þe
is begeondan Iordanen; þar hi wæron seofon dagas fulle, &amp; þær
mærlice þæt lic behwurfon mid miclum wope.
 50.11. Ða þæt gesawon þa Chananeiscean, þa cwædon hi:
þis is micel wop þissa Egiptiscra manna; &amp; for þam hi nemdon þa
stowe Egypta Wopstow.
 50.12. Witodlice Iacobes suna didon eal swa he him bebead.
 50.13. &amp; feredon hine to Chanaan lande &amp; hine þær
bebyrigdon on þam twifealdan scræfe þe Abraham bohte mid lande mid ealle
to licreste æt Ephrone ðam Etheiscan ongean Mambre.
 50.14. &amp; Iosep gewende to Egypta lande mid his gebroþrum
&amp; eallum his geferum, siþþan his fæder bebyriged wæs.
 50.15. Æfter þisum his gebroþru him ondredon &amp; spæcon
hym betweonan: Wenan we magon þæt he geþence þone teonan þe we him
ær didon, &amp; þæt he us mid yfele leanige.
 50.16. &amp; hi cwædon to him: Vre fæder bead us, ær þam
þe he forðferde, þæt we sædon þe þas word: Ic bidde þe, sunu
min, þæt ðu forgife þone gilt &amp; þa unrihtwisnesse þe hi wiþ
ðe worhton; We biddaþ þe eac þæt þu hit us þæs Godes
þances, þines fæder, forgife; ða Iosep þæt gehirde, þa weop
he.
 50.18. &amp; his gebroþru bugon to him, &amp; cwædon: We
sindon þine þeowas.
 50.19. Ða andswarode he him &amp; cwæþ: Ne ondræde ge
eow: cweþe ge, magon we Godes willan onscunian?
 50.20. Ge þohton yfele be me &amp; God gewende þæt yfel to
gode, þæt he me up ahofe, swa ge nu geseoþ &amp; he gehælde manega
folc.
 50.21. Ne ondrædaþ eow; ic eow fede &amp; eowwer litlingas;
&amp; he frefrode hi &amp; spræc glædlice.
 50.22. &amp; wunode on Egypta lande mid ealre his fæder
hiwrædene, &amp; he leofode anhund wintra &amp; tyn gear; &amp; he geseah
Efraimes suna oþ þa ðriddan cneorissae.
 50.22. Macharies suna, Manases suna, wæron acennede on Iosepes
anwealde.
 50.23. Ða þis wæs ðus gedon, he cwæþ to his
gebroþrum: æfter minum deaðe God cymþ to eow &amp; deþ ðæt ge
faraþ of þison lande to þam lande þe ic swor Abrahame &amp; Isaace
&amp; Iacobe.
 50.24. &amp; he cwæþ: Lædaþ mine ban of þisum lande.
 50.25. Iosep forþferde þa he wæs anhund wintra &amp;
tinwintre, &amp; hine man bebyrigde mid wyrtgemange: he wæs gelæd of his
stowe of Egypta lande.

Exod
B8.1.4.2.
Exodus (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Claudius B.IV): Crawford 1922, 212-85.



 1.1. ÐIS sind Israhela bearna naman þe mid Iacobe foron on
Egypta land; hi foron ealle mid heora hiwum.
 1.2. Ruben, Simeon, Leui &amp; Iuda.
 1.3. Isachar &amp; Zabulon, Beniamin.
 1.4. Dan &amp; Neptalim, Gad &amp; Aser.
 1.5. Witodlice ealra þara manna þe foron on Egypta land &amp;
of Iacobes ofspringe wæron fif &amp; hundseofonti; Soþlice Iosep wæs on
Egypta lande.
 1.6. &amp; þa he dead wæs &amp; ealle his gebroþru &amp; his
neamagas, Israhela folc weox swilce hi of eorþan sprittende wæron
gemenigfilde, &amp; swiþe gestrangode þæt land gefildon.
 1.8. Gemang þam aras niwe cyning ofer Egypta land, þe niste
hwæt Iosep wæs.
 1.9. &amp; cwæþ to his folce: Nu is Israhela folc micel &amp;
strengre þonne we.
 1.10. Gegaderiaþ eow wislice, &amp; uton gehynan hit ðæt hit
to menigfeald ne wurðe; &amp; gyf ure fynd us mid gefeohte gesecað &amp; us
oferwinnað, þonne faraþ hi of lande.
 1.11. Witodlice he sette him weorca mægstras, þæt hy
gehyndon hi mid hefigum byrþenum, &amp; hi getymbrodon Pharaones
eardungburga, Phiton &amp; Rameses.
 1.12. Swa hi swiðor wæron geswencte, swa wæron hi swiðor
gemenifylde &amp; weoxon.
 1.13. &amp; ða Egyptiscan hatedon þa Ysrahelyscan &amp;
swencton hi.
 1.14. &amp; to yrmþe heora lyf gelæddon mid heardum weorcum
clames &amp; tigelan &amp; mid ælcon þeowdome, þe hi on eorþweorcum
gehynede wæron.
 1.15. Soðlice Egypta cyningc cwæþ to þam þinenum þe
þam Ebreiscum wifum þenodon þonne hig bearn cendon, þæra oþer
wæs genemned Sephora &amp; oþer Phua, &amp; bead him þus: þonne gyt
þeniað þam Ebreiscum wifum &amp; heora cenningtyd cymþ, gyf hit
hisecyld biþ, ofsleaþ þæt, gyf hit mædencyld sy, healdað
þæt.
 1.17. Soþlice þa þinena him ondredon God &amp; ne dydon swa
se Egyptisca cync him bebead, ac heoldon þa wæpnedcyld.
 1.18. Þa clypode se cyng hi to him, &amp; cwæþ to him: Hwi
woldon gyt þæt don, þæt gyt þa wæpnedcyld heoldon?
 1.19. Þa andswarodon hi &amp; cwædon: Ne synd þa Ebreiscan
wif swilce þa Egyptiscan: hi synd wære &amp; cunnon þenunga, &amp; hi
cennaþ ær þam þe wit cumaþ to him.
 1.20. Witodlice God dide wel þam þinenum, &amp; þæt folc
weox &amp; wæs swiðe gestrangod.
 1.21. &amp; for þam þe þa ðinena him God ondredon, he
getimbrode him hus.
 1.22. Soþlice Pharao bebead eallum his folce, &amp; cwæþ:
Swa hwæt swa wæpnedhades beo acenned, wurpaþ hit ut on þæt
wæter &amp; healdaþ þa mædencyld.
 2.1. ÆFTER þyson for an esne of Leuies hiwrædene &amp; nam
wif on his agenum cynne.
 2.2. Seo geeacnode &amp; cende sunu, &amp; þa heo geseah þæt
he fæger wæs þa hydde heo hine þry monþas.
 2.3. Þa heo þa hine bediglian ne mihte, þa nam heo ænne
risscenne windel on scypwisan gesceapene &amp; smyrode hine mid tyrwan &amp;
mid pice, &amp; lede þæt cyld þæron, &amp; asette hine on anum
hreodbedde be þæs flodes ofre.
 2.4. &amp; hys swustor stod feorran &amp; beheold hu þæt
þingc gewurde.
 2.5. Þa eode Pharaones dohtor &amp; wolde hi þwean æt þam
wætere, &amp; hire mædene eodon be þæs wæteres ofre; þa heo
geseah þone windel on þam rixum, þa sende heo ane hire þinene þider
&amp; het hine feccan.
 2.6. Þa heo þone windel undide &amp; þæt cild þæron
geseah wepende, þa gemiltsode heo him, &amp; cwæþ: þis is of þæra
Ebrea cildum.
 2.7. Þa cwæþ ðæs cildes swustor: Wilt ðu þæt ic
ga &amp; clipie þe an Ebreisc wif þæt þis cild fedan mæge?
 2.8. Þa andswarode heo, &amp; cwæþ: Ga.
 2.8. Þa eode þæt mæden &amp; clypode þæs cildes
modor.
 2.9. &amp; Faraones dohtor cwæþ to hyre: Vnderfoh þis cyld
&amp; fed hit me, &amp; ic þe sylle þine mede.
 2.10. Þæt wif underfeng þone cnapan &amp; hine fedde &amp;
sealde Pharaones dehter.
 2.10. &amp; heo hine lufode &amp; hæfde hire for suna, &amp;
nemde his naman Moisi, &amp; cwæþ: For þam þe ic hine of wætere
genam.
 2.11. On þam dagum siððan Moyses geweox, þa for he to his
broþrum &amp; geseah heora geswencednyssa, &amp; hu sum Egyptisc man sloh
sumne Ebreiscne of his broðrum.
 2.12. Ða beseah he hine ymbutan hider &amp; ðyder, &amp; geseah
þæt þær nan man gehende næs; þa ofsloh he þone Egyptiscan
&amp; gehydde hine on þam sande.
 2.13. &amp; eft oþre dæg, þa he ut eode, he geseah twegen
Ebreisce him betwynan sacan; ða cwæþ he to þam oþrum: Hwig flitsðu
wið þinne nehstan?
 2.14. Ða andswarode he, &amp; cwæð: Hwa gesette þe to
ealdre &amp; to deman ofer us; Wilt ðu ofslean me, swa þu gyrsandæg
þone Egyptiscean ofsloge; ða ondred Moyses hym, &amp; cwæþ: Hwanon ys
þys word open geworden?
 2.15. Ða Farao gehyrde þas spræce &amp; sohte Moyses to
ofsleane, þa fleah he of his gesyhðe &amp; wunode on Madian lande, &amp;
sæt wið ænne pytt.
 2.16. Ða hæfde se sacerd on Madian seofan dohtra; ða comon
hig wæter to hladene, &amp; þa heora wæterfatu fulle wæron, þa
woldon hig heora fæder orf wæterian.
 2.17. Þa comon þa hyrdas þarto &amp; adryfon hig aweg.
 2.17. Ða aras Moyses &amp; bewerede þa mædenu &amp;
gewæterode heora sceap.
 2.18. Ða hi ham comon to Raguele heora fæder, ða cwæþ
he to him: Hwi comon ge hraþor þonne eower gewuna wæs?
 2.19. Ða andswarodon hi &amp; cwædon: An Egyptisc esne us
generede of þæra hyrda handum, &amp; eac hlod ure wæter mid us &amp;
sealde þam sceapum drincan.
 2.20. Ða cwæþ he: Hwær is he; Hwi forlete ge þone man;
Clypiaþ hine þæt he mid us ete.
 2.21. Soþlice Moyses swor þæt he wolde mid hym eardian,
&amp; nam Sephoram his dohtor to wife.
 2.22. Seo cende him sunu, þone he genemde Gerson, &amp; þus
cwæð: Ic wæs utacymen on elðeodig land.
 2.23. Æfter langre tyde Egipta cining forþferde, &amp;
Israhela bearn clypedon geomriende for þam weorcum, &amp; heora clypung com
to Gode fram þam weorcum.
 2.24. &amp; he gehyrde heora geomrunge &amp; gemunde þa
getreowþa þe he behet Abrahame &amp; Isaace &amp; Iacobe.
 2.25. &amp; beseah to Israela bearnum, &amp; alysde hi.
 3.1. SOÐLICE Moyses heold hys mæges sceap, þæs sacerdes,
on Madian; þæs nama wæs Iethro; &amp; ða he draf his heorde to
inneweardum þam westene, he com to Godes dune þe man Oreph nemneþ.
 3.2. &amp; Drihten him æteowde on fires lige on middan anre
bremelþyrnan, &amp; he geseah þæt seo ðyrne barn &amp; næs
forburnan.
 3.3. Ða cwæð Moyses: Ic ga &amp; geseo þa miclan
gesihðe, hwi þeos þyrne ne sy forbærned.
 3.4. Soðlice Drihten geseah þæt he ferde to geseonne; he
clypode of middre þære bremelþyrnan, &amp; cwæþ: Moyses, Moyses;
&amp; he andwyrde, &amp; cwæþ: Her ic eom.
 3.5. &amp; he cwæþ: Ne genealæce ðu hyder; do þin gescy
of ðinum fotum: soþlice seo stow þe ðu on stentst ys halig eorðe.
 3.6. &amp; cwæð: Ic eom þines fæder God &amp; Iacobes
God; Moyses hydde hys nebb; he ne dorste beseon ongean God.
 3.7. Ða cwæð God to hym: Ic geseah mines folces
geswencednysse on Egypta lande, &amp; ic gehyrde heora cleopunge, for þære
heardnysse þe ða weorc bewitan; &amp; ic wiste heora sar &amp; ic astah
nyðer, þæt ic hy alysde of Egypta handum, &amp; þæt ic hy ut
alædde of ðam lande to godum lande &amp; widgyllum, on þæt land þe
þe flewð meolce &amp; hunie, to þam stowum þær Chananeus is &amp;
Etheus, Amoreus &amp; Pherezeus, Eueus &amp; Iebuseus.
 3.9. Witodlice Ysrahela bearna clypung com to Gode, &amp; ic geseah
heora geswencednysse, þe hy fram Egypton þoledon.
 3.10. Ac cum; ic sende þe to Faraone, þæt ðu ut alæde
min folc, Israhela bearn, of Egypta lande.
 3.11. &amp; þa cwæð Moyses to Gode: Hwæt eom ic þæt
ic ga to Pharaone &amp; ut alædende Israhela bearn of Egypta lande?
 3.12. Ða cwæþ he to hym: Ic beo mid þe, þæt ðu
hæfst to tacne þæt ic þe sende; þonne þu ut alætst min folc of
Egypta lande, ðu offrast Gode uppan þisse dune.
 3.13. Ða cwæð Moyses to hym: Nu ic ga to Israhela bearnum
&amp; ic secge him, Eowera fædera God me sende to eow, gyf hi cweþaþ to
me, Hwæt is hys nama; hwæt secge ic him?
 3.14. Ða cwæð God to Moyse: IC EOM SE þE EOM, cwæð
he; Sege þus Israhela bearnum: SE þE IS, me sende to eow.
 3.15. &amp; eft cwæð God to Moyse: Sege þas ðing Israhela
bearnum: Drihten ure fædera God, Abrahames God &amp; Isaaces God &amp;
Iacobes God, me sende to eow; þæt is myn nama on ecnysse; þæt is min
gemynd on cneoresse &amp; on cneresse Ga &amp; gegadera Israela bearna ealdros,
&amp; cweþ to hym: Drihten eowre fædera God me æteowde, Abrahames God,
&amp; Isaaces God, &amp; Iacobes God, þus cweðende: Cumende ic eom to eow,
&amp; ic geseah ealle þa þingc þe eow belumpon on Egypta lande.
 3.17. &amp; ic cwæð þæt ic eow ut alæde of Egypta
geswencednysse on þæt land þe Chananeus on is, &amp; Etheus, Amoreus
&amp; Pherezeus, Eueus &amp; Iebuseus; on þam lande flewð meolc &amp;
hunig.
 3.18. &amp; hi gehyrað þine stemne; þu gæst inn &amp; þa
yldestan of Israhela folce to Egypta cyninge, &amp; cwyst to hym: Ebrea God us
clypode &amp; het us faran ðreora daga færeld þurh ðæt westen,
þæt we offrian urum Drihtne Gode.
 3.19. Ac ic wat þæt Egypta cyngc eow ne forlæt þæt ge
faron, buton þurh strange hand.
 3.20. Soþlice ic astrecce myne hand &amp; slea Egypta land on
eallum mynum wundrum þe ic wyrce on heora lande; æfter þysum he eow
forlæt.
 3.21. &amp; ic sylle ðyson folce gyfe beforan ðam Egyptyscan
folce, &amp; þonne gyt ut farað, ne fare ge ydelhynde.
 3.22. Ac þa Israhelyscan wif biddaþ æt þam Egyptyscan
wifum, æt heora neahgeburum &amp; æt heora husbondum, sylfrene fatu &amp;
gyldene &amp; reaf, &amp; gedoþ þa on eowre suna &amp; on eowræ dohtra,
&amp; reafiaþ Egypte.
 4.1. ÞA andswarode Moyses &amp; cwæð: Hi ne gelyfað me ne
mine stemne ne gehyraþ, ac hi secgaþ: Ne æteowde ðe God.
 4.2. Witodlice he cwæþ to hym: Hwæt is ðæt þu
hæfst on þinre handa; þa andswarode he &amp; cwæð: Hyt is gyrd.
 4.3. &amp; Drihten cwæð: Wurp hy on þa eorðan.
 4.3. &amp; he wearp, &amp; heo wæs gewend to næddran, swa
þæt Moyses fleah.
 4.4. &amp; Drihten cwæð: Astrece þine hand &amp; nim hire
steort.
 4.4. &amp; he astrehte hys hand &amp; nam hig, &amp; heo wæs
gewend eft to gyrde, þæt hy gelyfon þæt Drihten þinra fædera God
þe ætywde, Abrahames God &amp; Isaaces God &amp; Iacobes God.
 4.6. &amp; Drihten cwæð: Do þine hand on þinne bosum; þa
he hi dide on his bosum, þa brohte he hi forð hreofle, swa hwit swa snaw.
 4.7. Þa cwæð he: Teoh eft þine hand on þinne bosm.
 4.7. Þa teah he hig ongean &amp; brohte hi eft ut, &amp; heo
wæs gelic þam oþrum flæsce.
 4.8. &amp; he cwæð: Gyf hy ne gelyfað ðe, ne ne gehyrað
þæs ærran tacnes spræce, hi gelyfað þam worde þæs
æfterfyligendan tacnes.
 4.9. Witodlice gyf hy þyson twam tacnum ne gelyfað, ne ne
gehyraþ ðine stemne, nim þæt wæter on þam flode &amp; geot hit
uppan drige eorþan; &amp; swa hwæt swa ðu hlætst of þam flode, hyt
byð geworden to blode.
 4.10. Ða cwæð Moyses: Drihten, þu wast næs ic næfre
gespræce, &amp; siþþan þu spræce to þynum þeowe ic hæfde
þe lætran tungan.
 4.11. Ða cwæð Drihten to him: Hwa geworhte mannes muþ
oþþe hwa geworhte dumbne oððe deafne &amp; blindne oþþe geseonde?
Hu næs ic hyt?
 4.12. Far nu, &amp; ic beo on þinum muþe &amp; lære þe
hwæt ðu sprecan scealt.
 4.13. &amp; he cwæð: Ic bidde þe, Drihten, sende þone þe
ðu to sendene eart.
 4.14. Þa wæs Drihten yrre wið Moyses, &amp; cwæð: Aaron
þin broþor, diacon, he hæfð gode spræce; nu he cymþ ongean þe,
&amp; he geblissaþ on his heortan þonne he þe gesyhð.
 4.15. Spec to him &amp; sete min word on hys muð; &amp; ic beo on
þinum muðe &amp; on his muþe, þæt ic ætywe ync hwæt gyt don
scylon.
 4.16. He spricþ for ðe to þam folce &amp; bið þin muþ;
þu gewissast him þa þing þe Gode belimpaþ.
 4.17. Nim witodlice þas gyrde on þine hand, mid þære þu
scealt wundru &amp; tacna wircan.
 4.18. Ða for Moyses &amp; gecyrde to his mæge, þam wæs
Iethro nama, &amp; cwæþ to him: Ic wille faran to minum magum on Egypta
land, þæt ic geseo hwæþer hi gyt libbon; &amp; Iethro cwæþ: Ga
on sibbe.
 4.19. Witodlice Drihten cwæð to Moyse on Madian: Far on Egypta
land: soþlice ealle þa synd deade þe ðe ofslean woldon.
 4.20. Moyses nam his wif &amp; hys cild &amp; sette hi uppan assan,
&amp; for on Egypta land, &amp; bær Godes gyrde on his handa.
 4.21. &amp; Drihten cwæð to him þa he for on Egypta land:
Wite ðu georne þæt ðu do ealle þa tacn, þe ic ðe bebead, beforan
Faraone: ic ahyrde Pharaones heortan þæt he nele þin word gehyran ne min
folc forlætan.
 4.22. Þonne cweð ðu to him: Drihten het þe secgan þas
þing, Israhel is min frumcenneda sunu.
 4.23. Ic cweðe: Forlæt minne sunu þæt he ðeowige me;
&amp; ðu noldest hine forlætan; witodlice ic ofslea þinne frumcennedan
sunu.
 4.27. Drihten cwæð to Aarone: Ga ongean Moyses on þæt
westen; &amp; he for ongean hine to Godes dune &amp; ciste hine.
 4.28. &amp; Moyses rehte Aarone ealle Drihtnes word þe he hine
fore sende, &amp; þa tacn þe he hym bebead.
 4.29. &amp; hi foron ætgædere &amp; gegaderodon ealle þa
yldestan of Israhela mægþe.
 4.30. &amp; Aaron spæc ealle þa word þe God spræc to
Moyse, &amp; worhte tacn beforan eallum þam folce.
 4.31. &amp; þæt folc gelyfde &amp; hi gehyrdon þæt
Drihten gemiltsode Israhela mægðe &amp; þæt he geseah heora
geswencednysse; &amp; hi gebædon hi to Gode nywel astrehte on eorðan.
 5.1. ÆFTER þison Moyses &amp; Aaron eodon in &amp; cwædon
to Pharaone: Ebrea God het secgan þe þas þing, Forlæt min folc,
þæt hit mæge offrian me on þam westene.
 5.2. &amp; he andwyrde, &amp; cwæð: Hwæt is se Drihten,
þæt ic him hyran scule &amp; Israhela folc forlætan; ne can ic Drihten,
ne ic nelle forlætan Israhela folc.
 5.3. Ða cwædon hi: Ebrea God us bebead þæt we foron
þreora daga færeld on þæt westen, þæt we offrian urum Drihtne
Gode þæt us cwealm on ne becume ne swurdes ecg.
 5.4. Ða cwæð Farao, Egypta cyng, to Moyse &amp; to Aarone:
Hwi myrrað gyt þis folc fram heora weorcum; Gaþ to eowrum weorcum.
 5.5. &amp; Farao cwæð to his folce: Ge geseoþ þæt þis
Ebreisce folc is micel &amp; wyxt swyðe &amp; swyþor wile, gyf we heom
reste sillað fram heora weorcum.
 5.6. Witodlice Pharao bebead on ðam dæge þam weorcgerefum
&amp; þæs folces þenum, þus cweþende: Ne sille ge leng nan ceaf
þis Ebreiscan folce to tigolgeweorce, swa ge ær didon, ac gan &amp;
gaderian him sylf healm.
 5.8. &amp; asettaþ him þæt illce tigolgeweorc þe hi ær
worhton, ne ge nan þing ne gewanion; soþlice hy synd æmtige, &amp; for
þam hi hrymað &amp; cweðaþ: Uton faran &amp; offrian urum Gode.
 5.9. Beon hi gehynede &amp; gefillon þa weorc, þæt hi ne
hliston leasum wordum.
 5.10. Witodlice þa weorcgerefan &amp; þa þenas eodon ut &amp;
cwædon to þam folce: Pharao byt þæt man eow ne sylle leng nan ceaf:
Ac gaþ &amp; gaderiaþ swa hwar swa ge hyt findan magon, &amp; nan þyng ne
byð gewanod of eowrum geweorce.
 5.12. &amp; þæt folc wæs todrifen ofer eall Egypta land
ceaf to gaderienne.
 5.13. Wytodlice þa weorcgerefan stodon myd heom, &amp; cwædon:
Gefyllaþ eowwer weorc dæghwamlice, swa ge ær dydon þa man eow ceaf
sealde.
 5.14. &amp; Faraones þenas swungon þa þe bewiston Israhela
folces weorc, &amp; þus cwædon: Hwi ne gefylle ge þæra tigelena
gemet, swa ge ær dydon, ne gyrsandæg ne todæg?
 5.15. Þa comon Israhela folces prafastas &amp; clypodon to
Pharaone, &amp; ðus cwædon: Hwi destu þus wiþ ðine þeowas?
 5.16. Vs man ne sylleð nan ceaf, &amp; byt us þæt ilce
tygelgeweorc; nu we þine ðeowas synd beswungene &amp; unrihtlice hyt ys
gedon wiþ ðin folc.
 5.17. Ða cwæþ he: Ge synd æmtige &amp; idele, &amp; for
þam ge biddaþ, Lætaþ us faran &amp; offrian urum Gode.
 5.18. Gaþ witodlice &amp; wyrceað: ne sylð eow man nan ceaf,
&amp; ge sceolon agyfan þæt ilce tigelgetæl þe ge ær gewuna
wæron.
 5.19. &amp; Israhela folces prafastas gesawon þæt hy wæron
geswencte, for þam ðe him wæs gesæd þæt hym nære nan þing
þæs tigolgeweorces forgyfen, buton on þam ilcan gemete þe hi ær
gewuna wæron.
 5.20. Þa urnon þa Israheliscan ongean Moyses &amp; Aaron, þa
hig ut eodon fram Faraone.
 5.21. &amp; cwædon to him: Geseoh Drihten &amp; deme hwæt gyt
us gelæred habbað; ge habbað us gedon laþe Pharaone &amp; eallum hys
folce &amp; gemacod þæt hy willað us mid heora swurdum ofslean.
 5.22. Ða cwæð Moyses to Drihtne: Hwi swincð þis folc;
Hwi sentst ðu me to Pharaone þæt ic sprece on þinum naman?
 5.23. He swencð þin folc, &amp; þu hit nelt alysan.
 6.1. ÐA cwæð Drihten to Moyse: þu scealt geseon þa
þingc þe ic don wille Pharaone; soþlice þurþ strange miht he hi sceal
forlætan, &amp; þurh menige hand he hi ut forlæt of hys lande.
 6.2. Ða cwæð Drihten to Moyse: Ic eom Drihten, þe
æteowde Abrahame &amp; Isaace &amp; Iacobe, ælmihtig God; Min nama is
<foreign>ADONAI</foreign> þæt is Wundorlic on ure geþeode, &amp; ic behet minne truwan
þæt ic sealde him Chanaan land, þe hi on wracnodon &amp; utoncymene
wæron.
 6.5. Ic gehyrde Israhela bearna geomrunga &amp; þa yrmþa þe
ða Egyptiscean him didon, &amp; ic gemunde minra treowða þe ic Abrame
behet.
 6.6. Sege for þam Israela bearnum: Ic eom Drihten, ðe eow ut
alæde/ of Egypta cwearterne &amp; of heora ðeowete &amp; alyse on hean
hearme &amp; on mihtigum dome, &amp; genime eow to folce &amp; beo eowwer God
&amp; ge witon ðæt ic com eower Godd, þe eow ut alæde of Egypta
cwearterne, &amp; in gelæde on þæt land ðe ic Abrahame &amp; Isaace
&amp; Iacobe behet; þæt ic sille eow to agenne, ic Drihten eower God.
 6.9. Moyses sæde ealle þas þing Israhela bearnum; ða ne
gelyfdon hi him for heora yrmðum &amp; for ðam heardan weorcum þe him on
sæt.
 6.10. Ða cwæþ Drihten to Moyse: Ga in to Pharaone, Egypta
cynge, &amp; sege him þæt he læte faran Israhela bearn of Egypta
lande.
 6.12. Moyses andswarode beforan Drihtne &amp; cwæð: Nu
Israhela bearn me ne gelifað ne ne gehyrað, hwanon wile Pharaon me gelyfan,
&amp; ic eom ungetynge on spræce?
 6.16. Her telð embe Moyses cynryn &amp; Aarones: hy wæron
geboren of Leuies mægðe; Amram hatte heora fæder; he nam wif, seo hatte
Iochabeth; heo wæs hys fæderan dohtor; &amp; heo gebær twegen suna:
Moyses &amp; Aaron; &amp; Amram leofode hundteonti wintra &amp; seofon &amp;
ðritig wintra.
 6.26. Ðis is se Moyses &amp; Aaron þe God bebead þæt hi ut
alæddon Israhela folc of Egypta lande.
 6.27. Hi spæcon to Pharaone, Egypta cyninge, þæt he lete
faran Israhela folc of Egypta lande.
 6.28. On dæg þa God spræc to Moyse on Egypta lande, he
cwæð to him: Ic eom Drihten: spec to Pharaone, Egypta cyninge, ealle ða
þing þe ic to þe spece.
 6.30. &amp; Moyses cwæð to Drihtne: Ic eom unhrædspæce;
hu gelyfð Farao me?
 7.1. &amp; DRIHTEN cwæð to Moyse: Nu ic gesette þe Pharaone
to Gode, &amp; Aaron þin broðor byð ðin witega.
 7.2. Þu sprecst ealle þa þing þe ic ðe bebeode, &amp; he
sprycð to Pharaone, þæt he forlæte Israhela folc of hys lande.
 7.3. &amp; ic ahyrde his heortan þæt he hy nele forlætan
&amp; ic gemænifealde mine tacnu &amp; mine forebeacnu on Egypta lande.
 7.4. &amp; he eow ne gehyrð, &amp; ic asende mine hand ofer
Egypta land &amp; ut alæde minne here &amp; min folc, Israhela bearn, of
Egypta lande þurh þa mæstan wundru.
 7.5. &amp; þa Egyptyscan witan þæt ic eom Drihten, þe ic
strecce mine hand ofer Egypta land &amp; ut alæde Israhela bearn of heora
midlene.
 7.6. Witodlice Moyses &amp; Aaron dydon eal swa Drihten him
bebead.
 7.7. Soðlice Moises wæs hundeahtatigwintre, &amp; Aaron þreo
&amp; hundeahtatigwintre þa hy spæcon to Pharaone.
 7.8. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse &amp; to Aarone: þonne
Pharao inc gesyhð, þonne cweð he to inc: Wyrceað sum tacn beforan me
þæt ic mæge eow gelyfan; ðonne cweð ðu to Aarone, þinum
breðer; Nym ðine gyrde &amp; wurp hi beforan Pharaone; &amp; heo wyrð to
næddran.
 7.10. Witodlice þa Moyse &amp; Aaron eodon to Faraone, þa didon
hy swa Drihten hym bebead; &amp; Aaron nam hys gyrde &amp; wearp beforan
Pharaone &amp; hys ðegnum, &amp; heo wearð to næddran.
 7.11. Soðlice Pharao gegadorode ealle þa drycræftegustan
men, &amp; hy worhton oþer swilc ðyng þurh heora drycræft &amp; þurh
Egyptyscan galdru.
 7.12. &amp; hy wurpon ealle heora gyrda nyðer, &amp; hy wurdon to
næddrum, ac Aarones gyrd forswealh ealle heora gyrda.
 7.13. Þa gebealh Pharao hine, &amp; ne let hi faran na swa
Drihten hym bebead.
 7.14. Soðlice Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Pharaones heorte ys
gehefegod; nele he myn folc forlætan.
 7.15. Ga to him to morgen þone he ut gæþ to þam wætere,
&amp; stand ongean hine uppan þæs wæteres ofre, &amp; nim þe on hand
ða gyrde ða to næddran gewearð, &amp; cweð to hym: Ebrea God me
sende to þe, &amp; cwæð: Forlæt min folc þæt hit offrige me on
þam westene; &amp; þu hit noldest gyt forlætan.
 7.17. Witodlice Drihten cwyð þas þing: Be þison þu wast
þæt ic eom Drihten nu ic slea mid þyssere gyrde, þe is on minre handa,
þises flodes wæter, &amp; hit byð geworden to blode.
 7.18. &amp; þa fixas, þe synd on þam flode, acwelað &amp;
þa wæteru forrotiað, &amp; þa Egyptiscan beoð geswencede, þe
ðæs flodes wæter drincað.
 7.19. Witodlice Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Sege Aarone: Aþene
þine hand ofer ealle Egypta wæteru &amp; flodas, ge ofer burnan ge ofer
meras &amp; ofer ealle wæterpittas, þæt hi synd gewend to blode, &amp;
sy blod ofer eal Egypta land, ge on trywenum fatum ge on stænenum.
 7.20. Soðlice Moyses &amp; Aaron dydon swa him Drihten bebead,
&amp; he hof up his gyrde &amp; sloh þæt wæter beforan Pharaone &amp;
his ðegnum, &amp; hit wearð to blode.
 7.21. &amp; þa fixas ðe wæron on þam wætere, wurdon
deade, &amp; ðæt wæter forrotede &amp; ða Egyptiscan ne mihton
drincan þæt wæter, for þam heora wætera wæron geworden to
blode.
 7.22. &amp; Pharaones heorte wæs ahyrd, &amp; nolde hy gehyran
swa Drihten hym bebead.
 7.23. Ac awende hine fram him &amp; eode in to his botle, &amp;
nolde nan þing Godes word underfon on his heortan.
 7.24. &amp; witodlice ealle þa Egyptyscean dulfon wæterpittas
neah ðam flode, &amp; woldon drincan.
 7.25. Ac hi ne mihton drincan seofon dagum of ðam wætere,
siððan God het þæt wæter to blode gewurðan.
 8.1. &amp; DRIHTEN cwæð to Moyse: Ga in to Pharaone &amp;
cweð to him: Drihten þe het secgan þas þing, Forlæt min folc,
þæt hit offrie me.
 8.2. Soþlice, gyf ðu hit nelt forlætan, ic sende froxas ofer
ealle þine landgemæru &amp; þæt flod awylð eall froxum, &amp; hi
astygað &amp; gað in to þinum husum &amp; to þinum bedde &amp; to
þinum hordclifan &amp; to þinra þegna husum, &amp; on þin folc &amp; on
þine ofnas &amp; on þine metelafa; &amp; to þe &amp; to ðinum folce
&amp; in to eallum þinum ðeowum gað þas froxas.
 8.5. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Cweð to Aarone: Hefe up
þine hand ofer eal þæt flod &amp; ofer burna &amp; ofer moras, &amp;
alæd up þa froxas ofer eall Egypta land.
 8.6. &amp; Aaron ahof up his hand ofer eal Egypta wæteru, &amp;
þa froxas astigon up ofer eal Egypta land.
 8.8. Witodlice Pharao clypode Moyse &amp; Aaron, &amp; cwæð to
him: Biddaþ eowerne Drihten þæt he adrife ealle ðas froxas fram me
&amp; fram minum folce, &amp; ic forlæte þæt Israhelisce folc, þæt
hit offrige Gode.
 8.9. Þa cwæð Moyses to Pharaone: Gesete me andagan,
hwænne ðu wille þæt ic for þe gebidde &amp; for þin folc,
þæt þas froxas beon adrifene fram þe &amp; fram þinum folce,
þæt hi faran on wæteru.
 8.10. Ða andswarode Pharao &amp; cwæð: Nu to morgen; ða
cwæð Moyses: Ic do neah ðam þe ðu cwæde, þæt ðu wite
þæt nis nan oþer swilc God swilce ure God.
 8.11. &amp; þa froxas faraþ fram þe &amp; fram þinum
þegnum.
 8.12. Ða eode Moyses &amp; Aaron ut fram Pharaone, &amp; Moyses
clypode to Drihtne for ðam wordum þe he spræc beforan Pharaone be ðam
froxum.
 8.13. &amp; Drihten dide eal swa Moyses bæd, &amp; þa froxas
wurdon deade on heora husum &amp; on heora æcerum.
 8.15. Þa Farao geseah þæt he reste hæfde, he ahyrde hys
heortan, &amp; ne let hi faran swa Drihten hym bebead.
 8.16. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Cweð to Aarone: Ahef
þine gyrde &amp; sleah on eorðan, þæt gnættas gewurðon ofer eal
Egypta land.
 8.17. &amp; Aaron ahefde up hys hand, &amp; sloh mid þære
gyrde on þa eorðan, &amp; gnættas wæron gewordene on mannum &amp; on
orfe, &amp; eal þæræ eorðan dust wæs geworden to gnættum ofer
eall Egypta land.
 8.19. Ða cwædon þa dryas to Pharaone: þis is Godes miht;
&amp; his heorte wearð ahyrd, &amp; he hi ne gehyrde swa Drihten him bebead.
 8.20. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Aris on dægred &amp;
stand beforan Pharaone: soþlice he gæð ut to þam wæterum; þonne
cwest ðu to him: Drihten cwyð ðas þing: Forlæt min folc, þæt
hyt offrige me.
 8.21. &amp; gyf ðu hit ne forlætst, witodlice is sende on ðe
&amp; on þin folc &amp; on þine hus ealle fleogena cynn, &amp; eall Egypta
land byð gefilled mid mistlicum fleogena cynne.
 8.22. &amp; ic wyrce ðonne on dæg micele wundra on Gessen
lande, þær min folc is, þæt ðar ne beoð nane fleogan, þæt
ðu wite þæt ic eom Drihten.
 8.23. &amp; ic sette dal betwyx þin folc &amp; min folc; to
merigen bið þæt tacn.
 8.24. &amp; Drihten dyde swa, &amp; ðæt mæste fleogena cyn
comon on Faraones hofon &amp; on eall Egypta land, &amp; eorðe wæs amyrred
þurh ða fleogan.
 8.25. Pharao cleopode Moyses &amp; Aaron, &amp; cwæð to him:
Gaþ &amp; offriað eowrum Gode on þison lande.
 8.26. &amp; Moyses cwæð: Hit ne mæg swa beon; sceolon we
ofrian urum Drihtne þa þing ðe Egypta onscuniað to offriane; Gyf we
cwellaþ beforan Egyptum þa þing þe hi wurðiað, hi us oftorfiað
mid stanum.
 8.27. Ðreora daga færeld we sceolon faran on þæt westen
&amp; ofrian urum Drihtne, swa he us bebead.
 8.28. Ða cwæð Farao: Ic eow forlæte þæt ge ofrian
Drihtne, eowrum Gode on westene; &amp; þeahhwæðere ne fare ge to feor:
gebyddað for me.
 8.29. &amp; Moyses cwæð, þa he ut eode: For ðe ic gebidde,
&amp; þeos fleoge færð fram ðe &amp; fram ðinum folce nu to mergen;
&amp; þeahhwæðere ne leoh ðu leng, þæt þu ne forlæte
þæt folc, þæt hit offrige Gode.
 8.30. Ða Moyses ut eode fram Faraone, he hine gebæd to
Drihtne.
 8.31. &amp; Drihten dide swa he hine bæd, &amp; adraf ða
fleogan fram Faraone &amp; fram hys folce, þæt ðær ne wearð nan to
lafe.
 8.32. Þa wearð Faraones heorte gehefegod, swa þæt he
witodlice æt ðam cyrre nolde þæt folc forlætan.
 9.1. SOþLICE Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Ga in to Pharaone, &amp;
cweð to him: Drihten, Ebrea God, segð þas þing: Forlæt min folc,
þæt hit ofrie me on westene.
 9.2. Gyf ðu ðæt onscunast &amp; þæt folc of hæfst,
Witodlice min hand bið ofer ðine æceras &amp; ofslihð þine hors
&amp; þine assan &amp; olfendas &amp; oxan &amp; sceap mid hefegum cwealme.
 9.4. &amp; Drihten wyrcð wundor betwux Israhela æhtum &amp;
Egypta æhtum, þæt nan þing ne forwyrð on þam ðingum þe
belympð to Israhela bearnum.
 9.5. &amp; Drihten gesette andagan, &amp; cwæð: Nu to merigen
deð Drihten þas þing on eorðan.
 9.6. Witodlice Drihten dyde þas þing; on oþrum dæge wurdon
ealle Egypta nytenu deade; soþlice Israhela bearna nytena ne forwearð nan
þyng.
 9.7. &amp; Farao sende &amp; het hit sceawian; ða næs þar
nan þyng dead of ðam ðe Israhela folc ahton: þa wearð Pharaones
heorte gehefegod, þæt he ne forlæt þæt folc.
 9.8. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse &amp; to Aarone: Nimað
handfulle axan of þam ofne, &amp; wurpe Moyses þa axan up beforan Faraone.
 9.9. Þæt dust gewyrð ofer eal Egypta land: soðlice on
mannum &amp; on nytenum beoð wunda &amp; swellende blæddran ofer eal
Egypta land.
 9.10. &amp; hi namon þa axan beforan Faraone, &amp; Moyses wearp
hy upp, &amp; swellendae blædran &amp; wunda wurdon on ðam mannum &amp; on
þam nytenum.
 9.11. Swa þæt ða dryas ne mihton standan beforan Moyse for
ðam wundum þe him on wæron &amp; on eallum Egypta lande.
 9.12. &amp; Dryhten ahyrde Pharaones heortan, þæt he hig ne
gehyrde, swa Dryhten bebead Moyse.
 9.13. Wytodlice Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Aris to merigen &amp;
stand beforan Pharaone, &amp; cweð to hym: Drihten, Ebrea God, cwyð ðas
þyng: Forlæt myn folc, þæt hyt offrige me, For ðam æt þysum
cyrre ic sende eal myn wito ofer ðe &amp; ofer eal ðin folc, ðæt ðu
wite þæt ne sy myn gelica on ealre eorðan.
 9.15. Nu ic ahebbe up mine hand &amp; ic ofslea ðe &amp; þin
folc mid cwealme, &amp; ðu forwyrst.
 9.16. For ðam ic þe gesette, ðæt ic mine strengðo on
ðe gecyðe, &amp; þæt min nama si gecyðed ofer ealle eorðan.
 9.17. Gyt ðu hæfst min folc, &amp; nelt hit forlætan,
Witodlice nu to morgen on þysse ylcan tide ic sende micelne hagol, swylce on
Egypta lande næs fram ðam dæge þe hit gestaþolod wæs oð ðas
dagas.
 9.19. Soðlice send nu rihte &amp; gegadera ealle þine nytenu
&amp; ealle þine þing ðe ðu on æcere hæfst: witodlice menn &amp;
nytenu sweltað, &amp; ealle þa ðing ðe ute beoð, &amp; se hagol hym
onufan fealð.
 9.20. Se ðe Drihtnes wordes ondred of Faraones folce, se fleah
mid hys mannum &amp; nytenum in to husum.
 9.21. &amp; se ðe Drihtnes word forgymde, he forlet his menn
&amp; hys nytenu ute.
 9.22. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Ahefe upp þine hand,
þæt hagol gewurðe ofer eall Egypta land &amp; ofer menn &amp; ofer
nytenu &amp; ofer eall Egypta land.
 9.23. &amp; Moyses aðenode his gyrde upp, &amp; Drihten sende
þunorrada &amp; hagol &amp; byrnende ligeta ofer eal Egypta land.
 9.24. &amp; Drihten let rinan hagol wið fyr gemenged &amp; hi
ferdon ætgædere, &amp; swa micel he wæs swa næfre ær ne
ætywde on eallum Egypta lande syþðan seo ðeod gesceapen wæs.
 9.25. &amp; se hagol sloh on eallum Egypta lande ealle ða ðing
þe ute wæron, ægðer ge menn ge nytenu, &amp; eal Egypta gærs se
hagol fordyde, &amp; ælc treow ðe wæs on ðam rice he tobræc.
 9.26. &amp; on Gessen lande, þær Israhela bearn wæron, ne
com nan dæl ðæs hagoles.
 9.27. Ða sende Pharao to Moyse &amp; to Aarone, &amp; cwæð
to him: Ic winne ongean Drihten; ic wat þæt ic &amp; min folc synd
arlease.
 9.28. Biddað Drihten þæt hys þunorrada &amp; ðes hagol
geswicon, &amp; ic wille eow forlætan &amp; ge ne þurfon her leng wunian.
 9.29. Moyses cwæð: þonne ic ut ga of ðissere byrig, ic
ahebbe up mine hand to Drihtne &amp; þa ðunorrada &amp; se hagol
geswicað, ðæt ðu wite þæt eorðe is Drihtnes.
 9.30. Ic wat soðlice ðæt ðu &amp; ðin folc nu gyt eow
Drihten ne ondrædað.
 9.31. Witodlice eal heora fleax &amp; heora beras wæron fordone,
for þam þe hi wæron on ða tid grene.
 9.33. Ða Moyses eode ut of ðære byrig fram Pharaone, he ahof
up his hand to Drihtne, &amp; se hagol &amp; ða ðunorrada geswicon &amp;
hit wearð eall smylte ofer ða ðeode.
 9.34. Soðlice þa Pharao geseah þæt se hagol &amp; ða
ðunorrada geswicon, þa ihte he eft his synna.
 9.35. &amp; his heorte &amp; his folces wæs ahyrd, &amp; he
nolde forlætan þæt Israhelisce folc, swa God him bebead þurh Moysen.
 10.1. &amp; DRIHTEN cwæð to Moyse: Ga in to Pharaone &amp; ic
ahyrde his heortan &amp; his folces, þæt hi nellað ðe gehyran.
 10.2. &amp; telle þinum suna &amp; ðinum magum, hu oft ic
hæbbe fordon þa Egyptiscan &amp; worhte mine wundru on him.
 10.3. Moyses &amp; Aaron eodon in to Pharaone, &amp; cwædon to
him: Forlæt Godes folc, ðæt hit offrige him ðas ðingc ðe Ebrea
God byt: hu lange wilt ðu beon me ungehyrsum?
 10.4. Soðlice gyf ðu min folc forlætan nelt, nu to morgen ic
sende gærstapan ofer eall ðin rice, &amp; ofer ealle ðine eorðan,
&amp; hi fretað eall ðæt growende is, þæt ðam hagole to lafe
wæs, ge on treowum ge on æcerum ge on eallum growendum ðingum, hi
forgnagað.
 10.6. &amp; hi gefyllað þine hus &amp; þinra ðegna &amp;
ealles ðines folces ofer eall Egypta land, &amp; swa fela heora bið swa ge
ne eower yldran ne gesawon syððan hi geborene wæron; &amp; Moyses eode
ut fram Pharaone.
 10.7. Witodlice Pharaones ðegnas cwædon to him: Hu lange
sceolon we ðolian ðas yrmðu; Forlæt ðas men, þæt hi offrian
heora Gode: hu ne gesihstu ðæt eall Egypta land mot forwurðan?
 10.8. &amp; hi clypodon ongean Moyses &amp; Aaron, &amp; cwædon:
Hu fela manna wille ge on eowrum cynne, þæt faran &amp; eowrum Gode
offrian?
 10.9. Moyses him andwyrde &amp; cwæð: We willað faran mid
wifum &amp; mid cildum, mid ealdum &amp; mid geongum, &amp; mid eallum urum
cynne &amp; mid eallum urum yrfe, &amp; offrian wurðlice urum Drihtne, for
ðam þe hit is halig tid.
 10.10. Ða andswarode Farao &amp; cwæð: Hu mage ge ðæs
frymdige beon, ge ðe mine ðeowas syndon, ðæt ge sceolan faran fram me
mid eallum eowrum cynne &amp; eowrum Gode offrian?
 10.11. Hig ne mæg na swa beon, ac ceosað swa fela manna of
eowrum cynne swa ge willon, þæt eowrum Gode offrian, swa ge sylfe ær
bædon; &amp; hig wurdon þær rihte ut adrifene fram Pharaone.
 10.12. Witodlice Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Ahefe þine hand ofer
Egypta land, þæt gærstapan cumon &amp; freton eal ðæt gærs ðe
ðam hagole to lafe wæs.
 10.13. &amp; Moyses ahof up hys gyrde ofer Egypta land, &amp;
Drihten dyde ðæt ðær bleow byrnende wynd ealne þone dæg &amp;
ealle ða niht, &amp; on mergen se byrnende wind brohte gærstapan.
 10.14. Þa foron ofer eall Egypta land, swilce næfre ær
ðære tide næron, ne æfter towearde ne synd.
 10.15. Witodlice hi fræton eal ðæt se hagol ær læfde,
þæt nan ðing næs grenes læfed, ne on gærse ne on treowum, on
eallum Egypta lande.
 10.16. For ðam ðingon clypode Pharao hrædlice Moyses &amp;
Aaron, &amp; cwæð to him: Ic agylte wið eowerne Drihten &amp; wið
eow.
 10.17. Ac forgyfað me minne gylt nu æt ðisum cyrre, &amp;
biddað eowerne God þæt he adrife þysne deað fram me.
 10.18. &amp; he eode ut fram Faraone &amp; gebæd hine to
Drihtne.
 10.19. Þa asende God wind fram westdæle &amp; awearp ða
gærstapan on ða Readan Sæ, þæt ðær ne wearð furðon an to
lafe on eallum Egypta lande.
 10.20. &amp; Drihten ahyrde Faraones heortan, &amp; he ne forlet
Israhela bearn.
 10.21. Soðlice Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Ahefe up þine hand
þæt ðystru cuman ofer eal Egypta land swa ðicce ðæt hi grapian.
 10.22. &amp; Moyses ahof up hys hand &amp; egeslice ðystru
wæron gewordene on eallum Egypta lande.
 10.23. Þæt nan man ne geseah oþerne ðrym dagum, ne he hyne
ne astyrode of ðære stowe ðe he on wæs; Soðlice swa hwar swa
Israhela bearn wæron, þar wæs leoht.
 10.24. Ða clypode Pharao Moyses &amp; Aaron, &amp; cwæð to
him: Gað &amp; offriað eowrum Gode: foran eowre yrfe sceal beon her.
 10.25. Ða cwæð Moyses: Wilt ðu us syllan ofrunge, þæt
we bringon urum Gode?
 10.26. Eall ure yrfe færð mid us; ne wyrð her nan to lafe,
for ðam ðe we heora beþurfon to Drihtnes ofrunge, ures Godes, &amp; we
nyton furðon gyt hwæt seo ofrung beon sceal, ær we to ðære stowe
cumon.
 10.27. Soðlice Drihten ahyrde Faraones heortan, &amp; he nolde hy
forlætan.
 10.28. Ða cwæð Farao to Moyse: Far fram me &amp; warna
ðæt ic ðe leng ne geseo: swa hwilce dæg swa ic ðe geseo þu scealt
sweltan.
 10.29. Moyses him andwyrde &amp; cwæð: Sy hit swa ðu
cwæde; ne geseo ic ðe næfre leng.
 11.1. &amp; DRIHTEN cwæð to Moyse: Nu gyt ic reppe Pharao mid
anum wite, &amp; Egypta land, &amp; æfter ðison he eow forlæt &amp; nyt
eow þæt ge faran ut.
 11.2. Witodlice ðu scealt beodan Israhela folce, þæt esne
bidde æt his frynd &amp; wif æt hyre neahgeburan gyldene fatu &amp;
sylfrene; Soðlice Drihten sylð gyfe his folce beforan þam Egyptiscum;
&amp; Moyses wæs swyðe mære man on Egypta lande beforan eallum Faraones
folce.
 11.4. &amp; he cwæð: Drihten cwyð ðas ðing: To midre
nihte ic gange ut on Egypta land, &amp; ofslea ælc frumcenned cyld on Egypta
land, fram Pharaones frumcennedan suna þe sit on his cynesetle, oð
þære wylne frumcennedan sunu þe sit æt ðære cweornan, &amp;
ealre ðære nytena frumcennedan.
 11.6. &amp; micel hream bið ofer eal Egypta land, swilce ær
nes ne æfter ne cymð.
 11.7. Soðlice of Israhela folce ne forwyrð ne man ne nyten,
þæt ge witon hu wundorlice Drihten todælde þæt Egyptisce folc
&amp; ðæt Israhelisce folc.
 11.8. &amp; eal þis ðin folc færð to me &amp; me
geeaðmet, &amp; cwyð: Far ut, &amp; eal ðæt folc ðe ðe hyran
sceal; æfter þison we farað ut; &amp; he eode fram Faraone &amp; wæs
swyðe yrre.
 11.9. Soðlice Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Ne gehyrð Farao inc,
þeah ðe fela tacna synd gewordene on Egypta lande.
 11.10. Witodlice Moyses &amp; Aaron worhton ealle ða wundru &amp;
þa forebeacnu, þe her awritene synd, beforan Pharaone; &amp; Drihten ahyrde
Pharaones heortan, þæt he ne forlet Israhela folc of his lande.
 12.1. WITODLICE Drihten cwæð to Moyse &amp; to Aarone on
Egypta lande: þes monð bið eower æresta monð on geare.
 12.3. Sprecað to eallum Ysrahela folce, &amp; secgað him: On
ðam teoðan dæge þyses monðes nime ælc man an lamb to his
hywrædene.
 12.4. &amp; gyf þær læs manna beon þonne þæt lamb
etan mæge, nime his neahgebur, ðe him nyxt bið, swa fela swa þæt
lamb etan magon.
 12.5. Witodlice ðæt lamb sceal beon anwintre purlamb, clæne
&amp; unwemme: on ða ylcan wisan nimað ticcenu.
 12.6. &amp; healdað þæt oð ðone feowerteoðan dæg
þæs monðes, &amp; ofrian eall Israhela folc ðæt on æfen.
 12.7. &amp; nimon of his blode &amp; smiton on ægðer gedyrne
on þam husum, þær hi hit inne etað.
 12.8. &amp; eton eal ðæt flæsc on fyre gebræd on
ðære nihte, &amp; ðeorfe hlafas mid ðære lactucan þe on felda
wyxt.
 12.9. Ne ne eton ge of ðam nan ðing hreawes ne mid wætere
gesoden, ac si hit eall on fyre gebræd: etað his heafod &amp; his fet
&amp; his innewearde, ne ðær ne beo nan ðing to lafe on morgen; gyf
ðær hwæt to lafe beo, forbærnað hit eall on fyre.
 12.11. Begyrdað eowre lendenu, &amp; habbað gescy on eowrum
fotum &amp; stafas on handum, &amp; etað hrædlice; witodlice hit ys Godes
faru.
 12.12. &amp; ic fare on ðære nihte ofer eall Egypta land &amp;
ofslea ælc frumcenned, ge on mannum ge on nytenum, on Egypta lande, &amp; ic
Drihten wyrce wundra on Egypta godum.
 12.13. Soðlice þæt blod eow bið to tacne on ðam husum
ðe ge on beoð: þonne ic ðæt blod geseo, þonne forbuge ic eow &amp;
eower nan ne bið forspilled, þonne ic slea Egypta land.
 12.14. Gemunað þisne dæg &amp; wurðiað hine Drihtne to
lofe on eowrum cynryne.
 12.15. &amp; etað ðeorf seofon dagas, &amp; ne beo nan beorma
on ðam forman dæge on eowrum husum; swa hwylc man swa et gebyrmed on ðam
forman dæge oððe on þone seofoðan, se man forwyrð of Ysrahela
folce.
 12.16. Se forma dæg bið halig &amp; se seofoða bið eal
swa; ne wyrce ge nan ðing on ðam dagum, buton ða ðing þe ge etan
sceolan.
 12.17. &amp; healdað ðeorfe mettas; soðlice on ðam forman
dæge ic alæde ut eowwerne here of Egypta lande; &amp; wurðiað þisne
dæg on ecnysse on eowrum cynryne.
 12.18. On ðam forman monþe, þæs monðes feowerteoðan
dæges, ge sceolon etan on æfen ðeorf oð ðone an &amp; twentigan
dæg þæs ylcan monðes on æfen.
 12.19. Ne beo nan gebyrmed mete seofon dagum on eowrum husum; se
ðe ytt gebyrmed, se man forwyrð of Ysrahela folce; ne ete ge nan þing
onhafenes, ne utancymene ne in lande geborene, on eallum eowrum eardungstowum.
 12.21. Soðlice Moyses clypode ealle Ysraheles folces ealdras,
&amp; cwæð to him: Gað &amp; nimað nyten ðurh eower hiwrædene
&amp; offriað Pase, þæt is færeld.
 12.22. &amp; dyppað isopan sceaf on ðam blode ðe is on ðam
ðrexwolde, &amp; sprengaþ on ðæt oferslege &amp; on ægðer gedyre;
ne ga eower nan ut of his huse ær on mergen.
 12.23. Soðlice Drihten færð &amp; ofslyhþ ða Egyptiscan,
&amp; þonne he gesyhð þæt blod on ðam oferslege &amp; on ægðrum
gedyre, he forgæð þæs huses duru &amp; ne læt slean nanne man on
eowrum husum.
 12.24. Gehealdað þis gebod on ecnysse.
 12.25. &amp; þonne ge in gað on ðæt land þe Drihten eow
syllan wile, swa he eow behet, begymað ðissa gesetnyssa.
 12.26. &amp; þonne þæt folc cwyð: Hwæt is ðeos
gesetnys?
 12.27. Hit is Godes færeldes ofrung, þa he for ofer Israhela
bearna hus &amp; sloh ða Egyptiscan &amp; eower cyn aredde; &amp; þæt
folc hit eadmodlice to Gode gebæd, &amp; foron ut of ðam lande, swa
Drihten bebead Moyse &amp; Aarone.
 12.29. Wytodlice hit gewearð to midre nihte, ðæt Drihten
acwealde ælc frumcenned cyld on Egypta lande fram Faraones yldestan sunu,
ðe sit on his cinesetle, oð ðære gehæftan wilne frumcennedan cild,
þe sæt on ðæm cwearterne, &amp; eal heora nytena frumcenned.
 12.30. &amp; Farao aras on niht &amp; his ðegnas &amp; eal Egypta
folc, &amp; micel hream wearð up asprungen on Egypta lande, &amp; næs nan
hus on eallum Egypta lande þæt lic inne ne læge.
 12.31. Þa het Farao clipian Moyses &amp; Aaron to him, Arisað
&amp; farað ut of minum lande mid eallum Israhela cynne, &amp; offriað
eowrum Gode, swa ge frymdige wæron.
 12.32. &amp; nimað eower hriðerhyrda &amp; eower sceaphyrda
&amp; eal eower orf, &amp; farað of minum lande: gebiddað for me &amp; for
min folc.
 12.33. &amp; ða Egyptiscan nyddon þæt Israhelisce folc ut of
heora lande, &amp; ðus cwædan: Ealle we moton sweltan.
 12.34. Witodlice þæt Israhelisce folc nam gesyft melu, ær
ðam þe hit gebyrmed wære, &amp; bundon on heora claðum.
 12.35. &amp; Israhela bearn didon eal swa Drihten him bebead, &amp;
abædon æt ðam Egyptiscan heora gyldene fatu &amp; heora sylfrenan &amp;
ealle heora betstan reaf.
 12.36. &amp; Drihten his folc wurðode Israhela bearn, mid þara
Egyptiscan gestreone.
 12.37. &amp; Israhela bearn foron of Rammessæ to Sochoð nean
sixhundred þusend wæpmanna, butan wifum &amp; cildum.
 12.38. Mid eallum heora yrfe sceapa &amp; hriðera &amp; ælces
cynnes orfe þe hi ahton.
 12.39. &amp; hi bocon þæt melu þe hi of Egypta lande
bæron, &amp; worhton þeorfe heorðbacene hlafas, &amp; hi ne moston rum
habban þæt hi hit on riht bocon, for ðam Egyptiscan þe hi ut nyddon of
heora lande.
 12.40. Witodlice Israhela bearn wæron on Egypta lande feower
hund wintra &amp; ðritig wintra.
 12.41. &amp; siððan foron Israhela bearn of Egypta lande.
 12.42. Þas niht sceolon ealle Israhela bearn begyman, ðe God hi
ut alædde of Egypta lande.
 13.19. WITODLICE Moyses nam Iosepes ban mid him, for ðam þe he
halsode Israhela bearn, &amp; cwæð: Drihten wile eow gyt gemiltsian;
alædað mine ban forð mid eow.
 13.20. &amp; hi foron fram Socho &amp; wicodon æt Etham on þam
ytemestan ende þæs westenes.
 13.21. &amp; Drihten for beforan heom, &amp; swutelode him þone
weg, on dæg þurh sweart tacn on sweres gelicnesse &amp; on niht swilce an
byrnende swer him for beforan.
 13.22. &amp; symle him gelæste þæt swearte tacn on dæg
&amp; þæt fyrene on niht.
 14.1. DRIHTEN spræc to Moyse, &amp; cwæð: Sege Israhela
bearnum þæt hi gecyrron ongean Phiaroth; Seo stow is betweonan Magdalem
&amp; þære Readan Sæ ongean Behelsephon, &amp; ceosað eow wicstowe be
ðære sæ on minre gesihðe.
 14.4. &amp; Farao hæfð gegaderod ealne his here &amp; wile eow
ofslean, &amp; ic cyðe on Pharone &amp; on eallum his here þæt ic eom
eower God.
 14.5. Ða cydde man Pharaone, hwær þæt Israhelisce folc
gewicod hæfde wið ða Readan Sæ; þa wearð Faraones heorte awend
&amp; ealles his folces fram ðam ðe hi ær Drihtne beheton; ða het
Farao gegaderian eall his folc togædere; ða hi gegaderode wæron, ða
cwæð he to him: Hu wille we don ymbe þis Israhelisce folc, þe ure
wealas syndon, &amp; ure unðances of þis lande willað; ða cwæð
Farao &amp; eall ðæt folc: Vton him faran on &amp; ofslean hi, &amp; ne
lætan nænne libban on eallum heora cynne.
 14.6. Ða gegaderode Farao ealle his ealdormenn &amp; ealne his
here.
 14.7. &amp; gegaderode six hundred godra crata, ðe man of feohtan
mihte on ðam lande, &amp; ealle ða cratu butan ðam ðe on Egypta lande
wæron, &amp; ealne þone fultum ðe he on Egypta lande begytan mihte,
&amp; beferde ðæt Israhelisce folc ðær hi gewicode wæron be
ðære Readan Sæ.
 14.10. Ða ðæt Israhelisce folc beseah on Pharaones here,
ða clypodon hi to Moyse, &amp; cwædon: Earme hæfst ðu us forlæred:
hwi ne moston we ðeowian Faraone, urum hlaforde, on Egypta lande; Hwi woldest
ðu us ut alædan?
 14.12. Nu we moton beon ofslagene on þis westene; betere us
wære ðæt we hyrdon Pharaone, urum hlaforde, þonne we sceoldon beon on
þis westene ofslagene.
 14.13. Ða cwæð Moyses to ðam folce: Ne ondrædað eow;
standað &amp; geseoþ Drihtnes mærða, ðe he to dæg wyrcean wile;
Soðlice ða Egyptiscan ðe ge nu geseoð &amp; eow fore ondrædað, ne
geseo ge hi næfre ma.
 14.14. Beoð eow stille, &amp; Drihten fiht for eow.
 14.15. Ða cwæð Drihten to Moyse: Sege Israhela folce
þæt hi faran to ðære Readan Sæ.
 14.16. &amp; aðene ðine gyrde ofer ða sæ &amp; todæl
hi, ðæt Israhela folc ga drium fotum innan ða sæ.
 14.17. &amp; ic ahyrde Pharaones heortan &amp; his folces, ðæt
hi farað æfter eow innan ða sæ, þæt ic beo gemærsod on
Pharaone &amp; on eallum his here &amp; on eallum his crætum, &amp; ða
Egyptiscean witon ðæt ic eom Drihten, eowwer God.
 14.21. Ða Moyses aðenode his hand ofer ða sæ: ða sende
Drihten micelne wind ealle ða niht &amp; gewende ða sæ to drium; &amp;
þæt wæter wearð on twa todæled, &amp; læg an drige stræt
ðurh ða sæ.
 14.22. &amp; ðæt wæter stod on twa healfa ðære
stræte swylce twegen heage weallas; ða for eall Ysrahela folc ðurh ða
sæ on þone weg ðe Drihten him geworhte, &amp; ða comon hale &amp;
gesunde þurh ða sæ, swa Drihten him behet.
 14.23. Ða Pharao com to ðære sæ, &amp; eal his here, ða
for he on þone ylcan weg æfter Israhela folce on dægred mid eallum his
folce &amp; mid eallum his wæpnum.
 14.26. Ða cwæð Drihten to Moyse: Aðene ðine hand ofer
ða sæ &amp; ofer Faraon &amp; ofer ealne his here.
 14.27. &amp; he ahefde up his hand, &amp; seo sæ sloh
togædere &amp; ahwylfde Pharaones cratu, &amp; adrencte hine sylfne &amp;
eal his folc, þæt ðær ne wearð furðon an to lafe þe lif
gebyrede.
 14.29. Soðlice Moyses &amp; Israhela folc foron ðurh ða sæ
drium fotum.
 14.30. &amp; Drihten alysde on ðam dæge Israhela folc of
ðæra Egyptiscra handum.
 14.31. &amp; hi gesawon þa Egyptiscan deade up to lande aworpene,
þe heora ær ehton on ðam lande þe hi ða to cumene wæron: &amp;
ðæt Israhelisce folc ondredon him Drihten &amp; hyrdon Gode &amp; Moyses
his ðeowe.
 15.1. ÞA Moyses hæfde gefaren ofer ða Readan Sæ, þa
gegaderode he eal Israhela folc togædere &amp; sang Gode lofsang mid eallum
þam folce, &amp; þancode Gode ealra ðæra miltsa &amp; ðæra
mærða &amp; ealra þæra wundra ðe God on him gedon hæfde &amp; on
his cynne.
 15.20. Maria wæs gehaten Moyses swustor; heo gesamnode ealle
þa wifmen togædere on Israhela cynne; &amp; namon heora hearpan him on
hand, &amp; heredon God &amp; wuldrodon ægðer ge mid hearpan ge mid
lofsange.
 15.22. Witodlice Moyses lædde Israhela folc fram ðære
Readan Sæ, &amp; hi foron on an westen, ðe is Sur genemned; &amp; hi foron
ðry dagas ðurh ðæt westen, ðæt hi nan wæter ne gemytton, oð
þæt hi comon to ðære stowe, þe is Mara genemned þæt is on ure
leden biternys; ða ne mihton hi drincan ðæt wæter, for þam ðe hit
wæs biter: þa heton hi ealle his naman Mara, þæt is on ure leden
biternys.
 15.24. Ða gegaderode eall ðæt Israhelisce folc ongean Moyses
&amp; Aaron, &amp; cwædon: Hwæt sceolon we drincan; We ne magon drincan
þis wæter for his biternysse.
 15.25. Ða clypode Moyses to Drihtne, &amp; sæde him ðæs
folces neode: ða æteowde Drihten Moyse an treowcyn, &amp; het don þæt
treow on ðæt wæter, &amp; hit wearð syððan wered to drincenne.
 15.27. Ða comon hi to Helim, &amp; ðær wæron twelf wyllas
&amp; hundseofonti palmtreowa, &amp; wicodon ðær be ðam wæterum.
 16.1. ÞA ferdon hi ðanon on ðam fiftigoðan dæge þæs
æftran monðes ðæs ðe hi ut ferdon of Egypta lande.
 16.2. Ða gegaderode eft eall ðæt Israhelisce folc
togædere ongean Moyses &amp; Aaron, &amp; cwædon: We hæfdon hlaf &amp;
flæsc genoh on Egypta lande; hwi woldon gyt lædan us ut of Egypta lande
innan ðis westen, ðæt we her hungre acwelon?
 16.11. Ða gehyrde Drihten Israheles folces murcnunge, ða
cwæð Drihten to Moyse: To æfen ic sende þison folce flæsc to
etene, &amp; to merigen ic gedo ðæt hi beoð mid hlafe gefylled, ðæt
ge witon ðæt ic eom Drihten eower God.
 16.13. Hit gewearð ða on æfen ðæt Drihten gesende swa
micel fugelcyn on heora wicstowe swilce edischenna, ðæt is on Leden
<foreign>cuturnix</foreign>; &amp; hi namon on ðam fugelcynne, &amp; slogon swa fela swa hi
woldon, þæt hi genoh hæfdon &amp; æton; Witodlice on merigen wæs
ðæt deaw abutan ða fyrdwic Swilce hit hagoles eorðhele wære &amp;
swilce hit on pilan gepilod wære.
 16.15. Ða hi ðæt gesawon, ða cwædon hi betwynan him,
Manhu; ðæt is, Hwæt is ðis; for ðam hi nyston hwæt hit wæs;
ða cwæð Moyses: ðis is se hlaf ðe Drihten eow sealde to etenne.
 16.16. &amp; bebead ðæt ælc man gaderie swa micel, ðæt
he genoh hæbbe to etenne, þæt is an gemetfæt ful, þe hi gomor
heton.
 16.17. &amp; Israhela bearn didon swa, &amp; gadrodon, sum mare sum
læsse.
 16.18. Se ðe mare gegaderode næfde na mare, ne se ðe
læsse gaderode næfre na læsse, ac ælc ðæt genoh hæfde.
 16.19. Ða bead Moyses him þæt hi his nan þing ne læfdon
ofer niht.
 16.20. Þa læfdon hi hit sume oð hit morgen wæs, &amp; hit
wearð wyrmum acreowyd, &amp; hit forrotode; ða wæs Moyses yrre.
 16.21. &amp; hi gaderodon on morgen þæt hi genoh hæfdon,
&amp; þa seo sunne scean ða formeolt hit.
 16.22. On ðam sixtan dæge hi gegæderodon twyfealdlice; þa
comon ða ealdras &amp; rehton hit Moyse.
 16.23. Ða cwæð he to him: Sæternesdæges rest is
Drihtne gehalgod; gearwiað to mergen þæt ge to gearwiænne habbon,
&amp; healdað oð merigen, ðæt ðar to lafe beo.
 16.24. Ða dydon hi swa, &amp; hit ne rotode, ne hi ne fundon nan
ðingc fules ðæron.
 16.25. &amp; Moyses cwæð: Etað hit to dæg; for ðan ðe
hit is Drihtnes restedæg, for ðam ge hit ne findað to dæg on
eorðan.
 16.26. Gaderiað hit syx dagas; ne finde ge hit on ðam
seofoðan.
 16.27. Hi eodon ut on ðam seofoðan dæge &amp; ne fundon nan
ðingc.
 16.28. Ða cwæð Drihten to Moyse: Hu lange nelle ge healdan
mine beboda?
 16.29. On ðam sixtan dæge he him sylð twyfealdne mete; beo
ælc æt ham &amp; ne ga nan ut on ðam seofoðan dæge.
 16.30. &amp; reste ðæt folc hit on ðam seofoðan dæge.
 16.31. &amp; nemdon ðone mete, Man; ðæs swæc wæs
swylce smedma mid hunige.
 16.33. &amp; Moyses het niman þæt gemetfæt ful &amp; settan
beforan Drihtne on ðam getelde to healdene.
 16.35. Israhela bearn æton hefonlice mete feowertig wintra, oð
hi comon to Chanaan lande.
 17.1. HI foron of Sin, ðam westene, &amp; wicodon on Rapfidim;
ðær næs nan wæter.
 17.2. Ða murcnodon hi ongean Moyses, &amp; cwædon: Hwi
læddesðu us ut of Egypta lande, ðæt ðu woldest us ofslean &amp; ure
bearn mid ðurste?
 17.4. Ða clypode Moyses to Drihtne, &amp; ðus cwæð: Hu
sceal ic don ymbe ðis folc; Nu binnan lytlan fyrste hi wyllað me
oftorfian.
 17.5. Ða cwæð Drihten to Moyse: Clypa to ðe þa yldestan
on Israhela folce, &amp; nim ða gyrde on ðine hand, þe ðu ðæt
wæter mid sloge.
 17.6. &amp; ic stande beforan ðe uppon Oreb stane; &amp; sleah
ðone stan, &amp; ðæt wæter gæð ut of him, ðæt ðæt folc
hæfð genoh to drincenne; ða dide Moyses swa.
 17.7. &amp; genemde ða stowe, Costnung, for Israhela bearna sace,
for ðan þe hi cwædon: Is Drihten mid us ðe nis?
 17.8. Wytodlice Amaleh com &amp; feaht ongean Israhela folc on
Raphidim.
 17.9. Ða cwæð Moyses to Iosue: Ceos ðe geferan, &amp;
feoht ongean Amalech: ic stande to morgen uppon ðis beorge &amp; hæbbe
Drihtnes gyrde on handa.
 17.10. &amp; Iosue dyde eal swa Moyses him bebead, &amp; feaht
ongean Amalech; witodlice Moyses &amp; Aaron &amp; Vr stigon uppon ðone
beorh.
 17.11. Ðonne Moyses his handa up ahof, ðonne hæfde Israhela
folc sige; gyf he þonne lytwhon slacode, þonne hæfde Amalech sige.
 17.12. Ða Moyses handa wæron werige, ða namon hi ænne
stan &amp; ledon undor hine; &amp; he sæt uppon ðam stane; witodlice Aaron
&amp; Vr underwriðedon Moyses handa on ægðre healfe &amp; hi ne slacodon
nan ðing syððan, ær sunne to setle eode.
 17.13. &amp; Iosue aflymde Amalech &amp; his folc mid swurdes
ecge.
 17.14. Þa cwæð Drihten to Moyse: Writ ðys on bec to
gemynde &amp; sile Iosue: Witodlice ic adylgye Amaleches gemynd under heofone.
 17.15. Ða worhte Moyses an weofod, &amp; genemde his naman,
Drihten is min upahafennys.
 17.16. For ðam ðe Drihtnes cynesetles mægen &amp; Godes
gefeoht byð ongean Amaleh of cneorysse.
 18.1. IETHRO, se sacerd on Madian, gehyrde hu Drihten alædde
Israhela folc of Egypta lande.
 18.2. Ða lædde he mid him Sefforam, Moyses wif, ongean hine,
&amp; his twegen suna; oðer hatte Gerson, Oðer Eliezer.
 18.7. He eode ut ongean Iethro &amp; cyste hine, &amp; hi gegretton
hi gesibsumum wordum: ða Moyses in eode to his getelde, þa rehte he Iehtro,
his mæge, ealle ða ðingc ðe God dyde Faraone &amp; Egypta folce &amp;
hu he alysde Israhela folc of Egypta lande.
 18.9. Ða wæs Gethro bliðe for eallum ðam godum ðe
Drihten dyde Israhela folce, for ði ðe he hi generode on Egypta lande.
 18.10. &amp; cwæð: Sy Drihten gebletsod, ðe eow alysde of
Egypta lande &amp; of Pharaones handa.
 18.11. Nu ic wat ðæt Drihten is mære ofer ealle godas, for
ðam ðe hi wæron ofermede ongean hi.
 18.12. Iethro brohte gode offrunga, &amp; Aaron &amp; ealle ða
yldestan comon &amp; æton mid him beforan Drihtne.
 18.13. Ða on oðrum dæge sæt Moyses, &amp; he wolde deman
ðam folce þe him beforan stod.
 18.14. Ða Iethro ðæt geseah, ða cwæð he: Hwæt dest
ðu on ðis folce; Hwi swincst ðu ana &amp; eal folc anbidað fram
merigene oð æfen?
 18.15. Ða Moyses him andwyrde &amp; cwæð: ðæt folc
cymð to me, &amp; bit me ðæt ic him deme &amp; cyðe him Godes beboda
&amp; his æ.
 18.17. &amp; he cwæð: Ne dest ðu na wel.
 18.18. Ðu eart mid dysegum geswince geswenced, ægðer ge ðu
ge þin folc ðe mid ðe is; ne miht ðu hit ana acuman.
 18.19. Ac gehyr min word &amp; minne ræd, &amp; Drihten byð
mid ðe; beo ðis folc on ðam ðingon ðe to Gode belimpað, þæt
ðu recce him ða ðing ðe God bebytt.
 18.20. &amp; ætywe him his æ, &amp; hu hine man wurðian
sceole, &amp; ðone weg þe hi on faran sceolon, &amp; ðæt weorc þe hi
weorcan sceolan.
 18.21. Geceos of eallum ðysum folce wise men &amp; soðfæste,
&amp; ða ðe him God ondrædan &amp; gytsunge hation, &amp; gesete of him
ðusendmen &amp; hundredmen &amp; fiftigesmen &amp; teoðingmen, ðe deman
ðam folce on eallum tidum: ðæt ðær mæst sy, reccon hi hit ðe,
&amp; demon hi ða læsse ðyng; &amp; hyt bið ðe þe leohtre, gyf
ðu ða byrðene todælst.
 18.23. Gyf ðu ðæt dest, ðu gefylst Godes hæse &amp; his
bebodu; &amp; cyrre eall ðis folc ham on sibbe.
 18.24. Moyses dyde ealle ða ðingc ðe he lærde, ða he
þis gehyrde.
 18.25. &amp; geceas arode weras of eallum Israhela folce, &amp;
gesette hi ðam folc to ealdron, þusendmen, &amp; hundredmen &amp;
fiftigesmen &amp; teoðingcmen, ðe demdon ðam folce on eallum tidum;
ðæt ðær hefegost wæs, hi rehton him, &amp; demdon þa leohtran
ðingc.
 18.27. &amp; ða forlet he Iethro; &amp; for ham to his lande.
 19.1. ON ðam ðriddan monðe þe Israhela folc ferde of Egypta
lande, hi ferdon to Sinai westene.
 19.2. Þa hi foron of Raphidim, hi wicodon on ðære sylfan
stowe, &amp; Israhela folc slogon heora geteld feor fram ðam munte.
 19.3. Moyses astah to Gode, &amp; Drihten hine clypode of ðam
munte, &amp; cwæð: Sege ðas ðing Iacobes cynne, &amp; cyð Israhela
folce, &amp; ðus cweð: Ge sylfe gesawon ða ðingc ðe ic dyde þam
Egyptyscum, &amp; hu ic gefyrðrode eow.
 19.5. Gyf ge min word gehyrað &amp; mine treowða gehealdað,
ge beoð me gecorene of eallum folcum; eal eorðe is min.
 19.6. &amp; ge beoð mine sacerdas &amp; halig ðeod; ðis synd
ða word ðe ðu scealt specan to Israhela folce.
 19.7. Ða com Moyses, &amp; rehte ðæs folces ealdrum ealle
ða spæca ðe Drihten bebead.
 19.8. &amp; ðæt folc cwæð ðæt hi woldon ðæt
don; ða brohte Moyses ðæs folces word to Drihtne.
 19.9. &amp; Drihten cwæð to him: Nu ic cume to ðe on
sweartum wolcne, ðæt ðis folc gehyre ðæt ic sprece to ðe, &amp;
gelife þe on ecnysse; Witodlice Moyses cydde Drihtne þæs folces word.
 19.10. &amp; he cwæð to him: Gehalga hi to dæg, &amp; waxan
hi to merigen heora hreaf, &amp; beon gearuwe to ðam ðriddan dæge: on
ðam dæge Drihten cymð beforan eallum folce uppan Sinai munte.
 19.12. &amp; ðu tæcst Israhela folce gemæro abutan ðone
munt &amp; cwyst: Warniað þæt ge ne cumon to neah ðisum munte; ælc
ðara þe his æthrinð swelte se deaðe.
 19.13. &amp; ne ofslea hine nan man mid his handa, ac si he mid
stanum oftorfod oððe mid flanum ofscotod, sy hit man sy hit niten, ne mot
hit libban; þonne ge gehyran mid þam byman blawan þonne fare ge on ðone
munt.
 19.14. &amp; Moyses eode nyðer of ðam munte to ðam folce,
&amp; gehalgode hit; &amp; ða hi heora reaf woxon, ða cwæð he to him:
Beoð gearuwe to ðam ðriddan dæge, &amp; ne cume eowwer nan neah his
wife.
 19.16. Ða com se ðridda dæg, &amp; ligeta &amp; ðunor
&amp; ðicce genip oferwreah ðone munut, &amp; byman sweg wæs gehyred,
&amp; eal ðæt folc him ondred, ðe wæs on ðam fyrdwicon.
 19.17. Ða Moyses hi ut lædde ongean Drihten, hi stodon on
nyðeweardon ðam munte.
 19.18. &amp; eal Sinai munt smeac, for ðam ðe Drihten wæs
uppan him on fyre, &amp; se smic aras of him &amp; eal se munt wæs egeslic.
 19.19. &amp; ðære byman sweg weox, swa leng swa swyðor;
Moyses spræc &amp; Drihten him andwyrde.
 19.20. &amp; Drihten eode uppon ðæs muntes cnæp, &amp;
clypode Moyses to him, &amp; cwæð to him: Ga nyðer &amp; cyð ðis
folce, ðæt hi ne gan ofer ða gemæro, ðe læs hi swylton.
 19.22. Syn ða sæcerdas gehalgode, þe beforan Drihtne gað,
ðæt ic hi ne slea.
 19.23. &amp; Moyses cwæð to Drihtne: Ne mæg þis folc
astigan on Sinai munt; ðu hete settan gemæro abutan &amp; hine gehalgian.
 19.24. Drihten cwæð to him: Ga nyðer to ðis folce &amp;
Aaron mid ðe; ne cumon ða sacerdas neah Drihtne, ðe læs hi swelton.
 19.25. Moyses eode nyðer to ðam folce, &amp; rehte hit eall
him.
 20.1. &amp; GOD spræc ðus: Ic eom Drihten ðin God.
 20.4. Ne wyrc ðu ðe agrafene godas, Ne ne wurða: ic wrece
fædera unrihtwisnesse on bearnum.
 20.6. &amp; ic do mildheortnesse ðam ðe me lufiað &amp; mine
bebodu healdað.
 20.7. Ne nemne ðu Drihtnes naman on idel; ne bið he unscyldig,
se ðe his naman on idel nemð.
 20.8. Gehalga þone restedæg.
 20.9. Wyrc six dagas ealle ðine weorc.
 20.10. Se seofoða is Drihtnes restedæg, ðines Godes; ne wyrc
ðu nan weorc on ðam dæge, ne nan ðæra ðe mid ðe beo.
 20.11. On six dagon God geworhte heofonan &amp; eorðan &amp;
sæ &amp; ealle ða ðinc þe on him synd, &amp; reste ði seofoðan
dæge &amp; he halgode hine.
 20.12. Arwurða fæder &amp; modor.
 20.13. Ne sleh ðu.
 20.14. Ne synga ðu.
 20.15. Ne stel ðu.
 20.16. Ne beo ðu on leasre gewitnesse ne ongean ðinne nextan.
 20.17. Ne wilna ðu ðines nextan huses, ne ðu his wifes, ne
his weales, ne his wylne, ne his oxan, ne his assan, ne nan ðæra ðinga
þe his synd.
 20.18. Witodlice eal folc gehyrdon stefna &amp; byman sweg, &amp;
gesawon leohtfatu &amp; þone munt smeocan; þa wæron hig afærede,
&amp; cwædon to Moyse: Sprec to us &amp; we hlystað; ne spece Drihten to
us, ðe læs ðe we swelton.
 20.20. Moyses cwæð to him: Ne ondrædað eow; God com
þæt he wolde fandian eowwer.
 20.21. Ðæt folc wæs afæred, &amp; Moyses eode to ðam
genipe ðe God on wæs.
 20.22. Gemang ðam Drihten spræc to Moyse, &amp; cwæð: Ge
gesawon ðæt ic spræc of heofone: Ne wyrce ge sylfrene godas ne
gyldene.
 20.24. Ac weorcað weofod of eorðan, &amp; offriað uppan ðam
onsægednyssa, scep &amp; oxan, on ælcere stowe ðe mines naman gemynd on
sy: ic cume to ðe &amp; gebletsige ðe.
 20.25. Gyf ðu stænen weofod me wyrce, ne getimbra ðu
ðæt of gesnidenum stanum; gyf ðu ðin tol ahefst ofer hit, hit byð
besmiten.
 20.26. Ne ga ðu on stapum to minum weofode, þe læs man geseo
ðine sceama.
 21.1. ÐIS synd ða domas ðe ðu him tæcan scealt.
 21.2. Gyf ðu Ebreiscne ðeow bigst, þeowige ðe syx gear,
&amp; beo him freoh on ðam seofoðan.
 21.3. Ga he ut mid swylcum reafe swylce he in com; gyf he wif
hæbbe, ga heo ut mid him.
 21.4. Gif he næbbe, his hlaford him wif sylle, &amp; hi suna
habbon &amp; dohtra, þæt wif &amp; hyre wenclo beo ðæs hlafordes: ga
he ut mid his hæteron swilcon he in com.
 21.5. Gyf se weal cwyð: Me is min hlaford leof &amp; min wif
&amp; mine wenclo; nelle ic gan ut ne beon frig.
 21.6. Bringe his hlaford hine to ðæs halidomes dura &amp;
ðyrlige his eare mid anum æle, &amp; beo his ðeow a woruld.
 21.7. Gyf hwa becypð his dohtor on ðeowene, ne gæð heo ut
swa ðeowyna gewuna is.
 21.8. Gyf heo mislicað þam hlaforde, &amp; forlæte hi: ne
mot he hi fremdum folce syllan, þeah he hi forhogie.
 21.9. Gyf heo is beweddað, do hire æfter dohtra gewunan.
 21.10. Gyf he oðre him nimð, forgyfe he ðæt mæden &amp;
sylle hyre reaf &amp; hyre mægþhades wurð, ðæt synd twelf
scyllingas be twelf pænegon.
 21.11. Gyf he ðas þreo þingc ne deð, ga hyre ut to gyfe
butan feo.
 21.12. Se ðe man wundað &amp; wile hine ofslean, swelte he
deaðe.
 21.13. Se ðe nan ðyng ne syrwde ac hine God sealde on his hand,
ic gesette him hwider he bugan sceall.
 21.14. Gyf hwa ofslyhð his nextan, do hine fram minum weofode,
þæt he swelte.
 21.15. Se ðe slea his fæder oððe his modor, swelte he
deaðe.
 21.16. Se ðe man forstele &amp; hine gesylle, swylte he deaðe.
 21.17. Se ðe his fæder wyrige oððe his modor, swelte he
deaðe.
 21.18. Gyf men cydaþ, &amp; heora oðer oþerne mid stane
wyrpð oððe mid fyste slyhð, &amp; he dead ne byð ac lið on bedde
seoc; Gyf he arist &amp; ut gæð mid his stafe, he bið unscyldig þe
hine sloh; gylde swa þeah his weorc &amp; þæt hine man hæle.
 21.20. Se ðe his wealh slicð mid gyrde, oððe his wylne,
&amp; hi deade beoð þurh his handa.
 21.21. Gyf he ænne dæg oþþe twegen leofað ofer
ðæt, he bið unscyldig, for ðam hit is his feoh.
 21.22. Gyf men sacað, &amp; hwylc slyhð eacniende wif &amp; hi
bearnlease gedeð &amp; heo aleofað, bete swa micel swa ðæs wifes wer
gyrnð &amp; deman tæcon.
 21.23. Gyf hit swa ne bið, &amp; heo æfter ðam dead byð,
sylle lyf wið life: Eage wið eagan, toþ wiþ teð, hand wiþ handa,
fot wiþ fet: Bærninge wið bærninge, wunde wið wunde, læll wið
lælle.
 21.26. Gyf hwa slea his weales eage ut, oððe his wylne, &amp;
hi anege gedo, læte hi frige for ðam eagan þe he ut adyde.
 21.27. Gyf he toð of aslea, læte hig frige.
 21.28. Gyf oxa hnite wer oððe wif ðæt hi deade beoð, sy
he mid stanum oftorforod; ne ete man his flæsc; his hlaford bið
unscyldig.
 21.29. Gyf se oxa hnitol wære for dæge oððe for twam,
&amp; hi hit his hlaforde cyddon &amp; he hine belucan nolde, &amp; he wer
oððe wif ofhnit, oftorfie man ðone oxan mid stanum &amp; ofslea ðone
hlaford.
 21.30. Gif he betan mote, sylle wið his life swa hwæt swa man
him scrife.
 21.31. Be gelican dome, gyf he ofhnit sunu oððe dohtor.
 21.32. Gyf he weal oððe wylnan amyrð, sylle ðam hlaforde
þritig scillinga seolfres, &amp; si se oxa mid stanum oftorfod.
 21.33. Gyf hwa pyt adelfe &amp; hine ne oferhelie, &amp; þær
afealle on oxa oððe assa, Gilde þæs pyttes hlaford þara nytena
wurð, &amp; ðæt þær dead bið biþ his.
 21.35. Gyf utacymene oxa oðres oxsan gewundaþ, gesyllon þone
oxan, &amp; todælon þæt wurð &amp; þæs deadan hold him
betweonan.
 21.36. Gyf se oxa hnitol wæs &amp; se hlaford hine ne heold,
gilde oxan mid oxan &amp; hæbbe him ðone deadan.
 22.1. GYF hwa stylð oxan oþþe sceap &amp; ofslihð, sylle
fif oxan for ænne &amp; feower sceap for anum.
 22.2. Gyf man ðeof gemete &amp; he hus brece &amp; hine man
þær gewundie, se slaga bið unscyldig.
 22.3. Gyf he sunnan scinendre ðæt deð, he bið scyldig
&amp; swelte he: gyf he næbbe hwæt he wið þære stale sylle, sylle
man hine wið feo.
 22.4. Gyf man cucu finde þæt he stæl, oxan oþþe assan
oþþe scep, gylde be twifealdon.
 22.5. Gyf hwa ett æceras oððe wingeard, gylde of his agenum
be ðæs demmes ehte.
 22.6. Gyf fyr bærne mugan oððe standende æceras, gylde
þone byrst þe ðæt fyr ontende.
 22.7. Gyf hwa befæste his feoh to hyrdnesse &amp; hit man
forstylð þam þe hit underfehð, gyf man þone þeof finde, gylde be
twifealdon.
 22.8. Gyf se hushlaford hit nat, ladie hine.
 22.9. &amp; gyf him man gedeme, gilde be twyfealdan.
