Deut
B8.1.4.5.
Deuteronomy (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Claudius B.IV): Crawford 1922, 333-76.



 0.1. Her ongynð seo boc ðe is genemned on Ebreisc <foreign>Helle
Adabarim</foreign>, and on Grecisc <foreign>Deuteronomium</foreign>, &amp; on Leden <foreign>Secunda Lex</foreign>, &amp;
on Englisc Seo æftre æ.
 1.1. ÐIS synd ða word ðe Moyses spræc to eallum Israhela
folce begeondan Iordane on ðam feldwestene wið ða Readan Sæ, betwux
Pharan &amp; Thophel &amp; Laban &amp; Aseroh, ðær micel gold is,
endleofan daga færeld on Choreb, ðurh Seir dune weg oð Cadesbarne.
 1.3. On ðam feowerteoþan geare on ðam endlyftan monðe on
ðam forman dæge ðæs monðes, he spræc to him ealle ða ðingc
ðe Drihten him bebead, syððan he sloh Seon, Amorrea cyningc, se wunode on
Esebon, &amp; Og, cyningc on Basan, se wunode on Aseroth &amp; on Edrai
begeondan Iordane on Moab lande; Moyses geswutelode ða æ, &amp; cwæð:
Drihten ure God sprecð to us on Oreb, &amp; cweð: Genoh lange ge wunedon on
ðisse dune.
 1.7. Cyrrað &amp; farað to Amorrea dune &amp; to oðrum
feldlandum &amp; dunlandum &amp; to unhehrum landum on suðhealfe wið ða
sæ Chanaan landes &amp; Libani, oð ðæt micele flod Eufraten.
 1.8. Be ðam lande Drihten cwæð: Nu ic hit sealde eow,
farað inn &amp; habbað þæt, ðæt Drihten foreswor eowrum
fæderum, Abrahame &amp; Isaace &amp; Iacobe, ðæt he hit sealde him
&amp; hira ofsprincge æfter him.
 1.9. &amp; ic cwæð to eow on ðære tide: Ne mæg ic ana
eow acuman, for ðan ðe Drihten eow gemænifylde, &amp; eower is to dæg
swa fela swa steorrena.
 1.11. Drihten, eower fædera God, geice fela ðusenda to þison
getele, &amp; bletsige eow swa he eow behet: Næ mæg ic ana eower gemang
acuman &amp; eower swarnyssa &amp; eowre saca.
 1.13. &amp; ic cwæð to eow: Ceosað eow wise men of eowrum
cynne &amp; gleawe &amp; ða ðe heora drohtnung si afandod; &amp; ic gesette
hig eow to ealdrum.
 1.14. Ða andswarodon ge me, &amp; cwædon: Wel ðu sprecst.
 1.15. &amp; ic nam wise men &amp; welborene, &amp; sette hi to
ealdrum &amp; to hundredmannum &amp; to fiftigesmannum &amp; to
teoþingmannum, þe eow lærdon ælc ðingc.
 1.16. &amp; ic bebead him, &amp; cwæð: Demað ælcon men
riht, sy hit burga mann, sy hit utacymene.
 1.17. Demað ðam rican swa ðam heanan, &amp; ðam lytlan swa
ðam miclan, for ðam ðe hit is Godes dom; Gyf eow ænig ðingc ðince
earfoðlic, secgað hit me &amp; ic hit bete.
 1.20. Ic cwæð to eow: Farað to ðam lande þe God behet
eowrum fæderum, &amp; habbað hit: ne ondræde ge eow, ne nan ðingc ne
forhtiað.
 1.22. &amp; ge andswaredon me, &amp; cwædon: Vton sendan
sceaweras, ðæt sceawion ðæt land &amp; cyðan us on hwylcne weg we
faran sceolon &amp; to hwylcum burgum.
 1.23. &amp; ic sende twelf men of eow.
 1.24. &amp; hi foron &amp; ðæt land sceawodon &amp; us
ðæs landes wæstmas brohton, &amp; cwædon: God is ðæt land ðe
God us syllan wile.
 1.26. Ða noldon ge faran for eowre geleaflyste, &amp; ne gelyfdon
Drihtnes spræce.
 1.27. &amp; ge murcnodon, &amp; cwædon: Drihten us hatað,
&amp; for ðam he alædde us ut of Egypta lande, to ðam ðæt he us
sealde on Amoreiscra hand to ofsleanne.
 1.28. Hwyder fare we?
 1.28. Ða bodan us færdon, &amp; cwædon: ðær is micel
folc &amp; maran men ðonne we, &amp; micla burga &amp; oð heofun fæste;
ðær we gesawon Enachis suna.
 1.29. And ic cwæð to eow: Ne forhtiað &amp; ne ondrædað
hi.
 1.30. Drihten eower God, ðe eower lateow is, he fyht for eow, swa
he dyde on Egypta lande beforan eallum folce.
 1.31. &amp; ge sylfe on westene gesawon: Drihten, eower God, eow
bær on eallum ðam wegum ðe ge foron, swa man byrð lytle cyld, oð
ðæt ge comon to ðisse stowe.
 1.32. &amp; ge furðon ne gelyfdon Drihtne, eowrum Gode.
 1.33. Se eode beforan eow on wege &amp; mearcode ða stowa ðe ge
eowre geteld on slean sceoldon; on niht he tæhte eow ðurh fyr &amp; on
dæg ðurh genip.
 1.34. &amp; ða Drihten eowre spræca gehyrde, he wæs swyðe
yrre, &amp; swor, &amp; cwæð: Ne syhð nan man of ðisse wyrrestan
cneoresse ðæt gode land, ðe ic mid aðe behet eowrum fæderum buton
Caleb, Iepones sunu; he hit gesyhð &amp; ic hit sylle him &amp; his bearnum,
for ðam ðe he fyligde me.
 1.37. Næs ðæt nan wundor ðæt Drihten wæs ðam
folce gram, þonne he wæs me yrre for eowre scylde, &amp; cwæð to me:
Ne færst ðu ðider; Ac Iosue Nunes sunu, þin þen, he færð
ðyder in for ðe; mynga hine &amp; gestranga hine; &amp; he todælð
ðæt land Israhela folce.
 1.39. Eowre lytlingas &amp; ða cild ðe nyton nanes ðinges nan
gescead ne godes ne yfeles, hi farað inn, &amp; ic him sylle ðæt land.
 1.40. Ge cyrrað &amp; farað on ðæt westen ður ða
Readan Sæ, &amp; ðoliað ðæs ðe eow God behet for eowre
ungehyrsumnysse &amp; eowre geleafleaste.
 3.23. IC bæd Drihten on ða tid, &amp; ðus cwæð: Drihten
God, ðu ðe ongunne ætywan ðinum ðeowe ðine mærðe &amp; ðine
strengstan hand, nis soðlice nan oðer Godd ne on heofone ne on eorðan,
ðe mæge weorcean ða weorc ðe ðu wyrcst, &amp; beon wiðmeten
ðinre strengðe.
 3.25. Alyfe me to farenne &amp; to geseonne ðæt seloste land
begeondan Iordane, &amp; ða gecorenustan dune &amp; Libanum.
 3.26. &amp; Drihten me wæs yrre for eowre scylde, &amp;
cwæð to me: Genoh hyt is nu; ne sprec ðu nateshwon lengc to me ymbe
ðis ðingc.
 3.27. Astih on Fasgan muntes cnæpp, &amp; beseoh to westdæle
&amp; to norðdæle &amp; to suðdæle &amp; to eastdæle: ne
oferfærst ðu soðlice Iordane.
 3.28. Beod Iosue &amp; gestranga hine, for ðam ðe he stæpð
beforan þison folc &amp; todælð him ðæt land, ðæt he geseon
sceall.
 3.29. &amp; we wunedon on ðære dene wið Phogores templ.
 4.1. LA Israhel; gehyr nu bebodu &amp; domas ðe ic lære, &amp;
do ða, ðæt ðu sy langlife &amp; fare inn &amp; hæbbe ðæt land,
ðæt Drihten, eower fædera God, eow syllan wile.
 4.2. Ne ice ge nan ðingc to ðam worde ðe ic eow to sprece, ne
ge ne wanion of ðam; Gehealdað Drihtnes bebodu, eowres Godes, ðe ic eow
bebeode.
 4.3. Ge gesawon ealle ða ðingc ðe Drihten dyde ongen
Belphegor, hu he forbrytte ealle his biggengan beforan eow.
 4.5. Ge witon ðæt ic lærde bebodu &amp; rihtwisnyssa, swa
Drihten God me bebead.
 4.8. Hwylc oðer ðeod is swa mære, ðe hæbbe laga &amp;
rihte domas &amp; ealle æ ðe ic to dæg foresette beforan eow?
 4.9. Gehealdað eow sylfe &amp; eowre sawle geornlice; ne cuman
eow ðas word of gemynde swa lange swa ge libbon; lærað eowre suna &amp;
eowre magas, þæt hi healdon ða bebodu ðe ic eow bead.
 4.15. Ne gesawe ge nane anlicnesse on ðam dæge ðe Drihten
spræc to eow on Oreb on fyres midlene.
 4.16. Ne wyrce ge eow ðe ma nane anlicnyssa ne wæpmannes, ne
wifmannes, ne nanes nytenes, ne fugeles ne wyrmes, ne fisces.
 4.19. Ne behealdon ge heofonan, ne sunnan, ne monan, ne steorran,
ðe læs ðe ge ðurh gedwyld on hi gelyfon; God hi gesceop eallum mannum
to bryce.
 4.20. Soðlice Drihten eow alædde of Egypta lande to ðam
ðæt he hæfde eow to agenum folce.
 4.21. Eft he cwæð: Drihten wæs me yrre for eowrum
spræcum, &amp; swor ðæt ic ne oferfore Iordane ne ne come on ðam
selustan lande, ðe Drihten eow syllan wile.
 4.22. Nu swelte ic her on lande: ne fare ic ofer Iordane, ac ge
farað &amp; agað ðæt gecorene land.
 4.23. Warniað eow ðæt ge næfre ne forgyton Drihtnes wedd,
eowres Godes, ðe he eow behet.
 4.25. Gyf ge þonne minum worde ne gelyfað &amp; Drihtnes beboda
forhogiað, ic hæbbe to dæg gewitnysse heofon &amp; eorðan ðæt ge
forwurðað raðe on ðam lande, ðe Drihten eow to gelet; ne beo ge
ðæron nane hwile.
 4.27. Ac Drihten eow todrifð geond ealle ðeoda, ðæt eower
byð feawa on ðam lande to lafe.
 4.28. &amp; ge ðeowiað fremdum godum, manna handgeweorc,
treowene &amp; stænene; ða ne geseoð, ne ne gehyrað, ne hi ne etað,
ne hi ne drincað.
 4.29. &amp; ðonne ge gemunað Drihten, eowerne God, &amp; hine
secað, ðonne gemete ge hine, gyf ge hine mid inweardre heortan secað,
&amp; mid ealle mihte.
 4.30. On ðære ytemestan tide ge beoð gecyrrede to Drihtne,
eowrum Gode, &amp; ge gehyrað his stemne, for ðam ðe he is mildheort God;
ne forlæt he eow, ne he eallunga ne adylgað eow, ne he ne forgyt his wedd,
on ðam he swor eowrum fæderum.
 4.32. Axiað be ealdon dagon ðe wæron ær þonne ge, of
ðam dæge ðe Drihten man gesceop ofer eorðan, fram ufeweardum heofone
&amp; oð his ende, hwæðer æfre gewurde ðus gerad ðingc, oððe
hwæðer ænig man gehyrde Godes stefne &amp; his word, swa swa ge
gehyrdon &amp; gesawon.
 4.39. Ongytað eornostlice to dæg on eower heortan ðæt
Drihten sylf is God &amp; nis nan oðer ne uppe on heofonum ne nyðer on
eorðan.
 4.40. Gehaldað his beboda &amp; domas ðe ic eow beode, þæt
eow sy well &amp; eowrum bearnum æfter eow, &amp; ðæt ge ðurhwunian
lange on ðam lande ðe Drihten, eower God, eow syllan wile.
 4.44. Ðis is seo æ ðe Moyses foresette beforan Israhela
folce, &amp; laga &amp; domas, ðus cweðende.
 5.1. LA Israhel, gehyr nu godcunde domas &amp; leorniað ða
&amp; eac wyrceað.
 5.2. Drihten God behet us wedd on Oreb.
 5.3. Ne sealde he wedd urum fæderum, ac us ðe nu gyt
lybbað.
 5.4. Ansyne to ansyne he spræc to us on ðam munte of ðæs
fyres midlene.
 5.5. Ic wæs dælre betwux Gode &amp; eow on ða tide ðæt
ic cuðe eow his word, &amp; he cwæð: Ic eom Drihten, eower God, ðe eow
ut alædde of Egypta lande of ðeowte.
 5.7. Nafa ðu fremde godas beforan me.
 5.8. Ne wyrce ðu græftgeweorc, ne nanes cynnes anlicnyssa, ne
ða ne wurða; Ic eom Drihten, eower God, ðe wrece fædera unrihtwisnyssa
on hyra bearnum, &amp; miltsige ðam ðe me lufiað &amp; mine bebodu
healdað.
 5.11. Ne nemne ge Drihtnes naman on idel, for ðam ðe ne byð
he unscyldig, se ðe for idelum ðincge his naman nemð.
 5.12. Healdað ðone restendæg, ðæt ðu hine halgie, swa
Drihten ðe bebead, &amp; ðus cwæð: Wyrc syx dagas &amp; freolsa ðone
seofoðan.
 5.15. Gemunað ðæt ge sylfe wæron ðeowe on Egypta lande
&amp; ic eow alysde.
 5.16. Arwurða ðinne fæder &amp; ðine modor, ðæt ðu
sy langlife &amp; ðæt ðu sy welig on ðam lande ðe God ðe syllan
wile.
 5.17. Ne beo ðu manslaga.
 5.18. Ne unrihthæme ðu.
 5.19. Ne stel ðu.
 5.20. Ne sege ðu lease gewitnessa.
 5.21. Ne gyrn ðu ðines nextan wifes, ne his huses, ne his
landes, ne nan ðæra ðinga þe his beo.
 5.22. Ðis synd ða word ðe Drihten spræc to eallum Israhela
folce on ðam munte on ðæs fyres midlene &amp; ðæs genipes, micelre
stefne, &amp; wrat ða on twam stænenum tabulum &amp; sealde me.
 5.23. Æfter ðam ðe ge gehyrdon his word &amp; gesawon ðone
munt byrnan, ða cwædon to me ða ealdras &amp; ða betstborenan men: Nu
we gesawon Godes mægenðrym &amp; his micelnyssæ; we gehyrdon his stefne
on fyres midlene, &amp; we ongeaton to dæg ðæt Godd spræc wið
men, &amp; se leofað.
 5.25. Hwi swelte we &amp; forwurðað on ðisum mæstan fyre;
Witodlice gyf we lengc gehyrað Drihtnes stefne, ures Godes, we
forwurðað.
 5.26. Hu mæg ænig man lyfiende Godes stefne gehyran &amp; eac
libban?
 5.27. Ga ðu &amp; gehyr ða ðingc ðe Drihten, ure God, þe
secge &amp; sege us; &amp; we gehyrað ðe &amp; doð ða.
 5.28. Ða Drihten ðæt gehyrde, ða cwæð he to me: Ic
gehyrde ðises folces word, ðe hi spæcon well.
 5.29. Hwanon cymð him swylc geðanc, ðæt hi ondredon me
&amp; healdon mine bebodu, ðæt him sy wel on ecnysse &amp; heora bearnum?
 5.30. Sege him ðæt hi faron to heora geteldum.
 5.31. Stand ðu her mid me, &amp; ic secge ðe ealle bebodu &amp;
godcunde æ &amp; domas; lære hi, ðæt hi don ða on þam lande ðe
ic him to æhte sylle.
 5.32. Healdað ða ðingc ðe Drihten, eowwer God, eow bebead;
ne ahylde ge naðer ne on ða wynstran healfe ne on ða swyðran.
 5.33. Ac gað rihte on ðone weg ðe Drihten eow bebead,
ðæt ge libbon &amp; eow sy well &amp; eowre dagas syn gelencgede on ðam
lande, ðe ge agon sceolon.
 6.4. GEHYRE, Israhel; Dryhten, ure God, is an God.
 6.5. Lufa ðinne Drihten mid ealre ðinre heortan &amp; mid
eallum mode &amp; mid eallum mægne.
 6.6. &amp; healdað ða word ðe ic ðe bebeode &amp; lære
ða ðinum bearnum, ðonne ðu sitte on ðinum huse, &amp; writ ða on
ðinum þærscwolde &amp; on ðines huses durum.
 6.10. &amp; ðonne Drihten, eower Godd, eow in gelæt on
ðæt land, ðe he foreswor eowrum fæderum, Abrahame &amp; Isaace &amp;
Iacobe, &amp; he eow sylð miccle burga &amp; ða selustan gebytlu &amp;
fulle hus ælces welan ða ðe ge ne worhton, &amp; wæterpyttas ðe ge
ne dulfon, wingeardas &amp; elebeamas ðe ge ne plantodon, &amp; ge etað
&amp; beoð gefyllede.
 6.13. Warniað geornlice ðæt ge ne forgyton Drihten, ðe eow
ut alædde of Egypta lande of ðeowetes huse; Geeaðmede Drihten, ðinne
God, &amp; ðeowa him anum &amp; swera on his naman.
 6.14. Ne far ðu æfter fremdum godum, ði læs ðe God
yrsie ongean ðe.
 6.16. Ne fanda ðu ðines Godes, swa ðu dydest on ðære
costnungstowe.
 7.11. GEHEALDAÐ eornostlice ða bebodu &amp; ða godcundan æ
&amp; domas, ðe eow to dæg bebeode ðæt ge don.
 7.12. Gyf ðu hi gehyltst, Drihten ðin God gehealt ðæt wedd
&amp; ða mildheortnysse ðe he swor eowrum fæderum.
 7.13. &amp; he lufað &amp; gemænifylt and he bletsað eow
&amp; eowre wæstmas on ðam lande ðe he foreswor eowrum fæderum.
 7.14. Ge beoð gebletsod toforan eallum oðrum mannum; ne bið
mid eow nan ðingc unberendes, ne on mannum ne on nytenum.
 7.15. Drihten adrifð fram eow ælc yfel &amp; wyrpð ongean
eowre fynd.
 8.19. GYF ge ðonne forgymeleasiað Drihtnes bebod, eowres Godes,
&amp; fyliað fremdum godum, ic secge eow to soðan ðæt ge forwurðað
mid ealle, gyf ge beoð ungehyrsume Drihtnes beboda.
 9.4. NE wene ge na ðæt Drihten, eower God, fordyde eowre fynd
&amp; sealde eow ðæt seluste land for eowre rihtwisnyssae, ac he hi
fordyde for heora arleasnysse.
 9.5. &amp; ðæt ðæt word wære gefylled, ðe he mid
aðe behet eowrum fæderum, Abrahame &amp; Isaace &amp; Iacobe.
 9.6. Wite ge to soðum ðingum ðæt God ne sealde eow for
eowre godnysse ðæt seluste land to æhte, for ðam ðe ge synd ealra
folca ungeleaffulluste &amp; heardheorteste.
 9.7. Gemunat &amp; ne forgytað, hu swyðe ge gremedon Drihten on
ðam westene; Of ðam dæge ðe he eow ut alædde of Egypta lande oð
ðisne andweardan dæg, æfre ge fliton &amp; wunnon ongean Drihten.
 9.8. On Oreb ge hine gremedon &amp; he wæs yrre &amp; wolde eow
fordon.
 9.9. Ða astah ic on ðone munt &amp; bær ða stænenan
bredu, on ðam wæs ðæt wedd ðe Drihten wið eow gecwæð, &amp;
ic ðurhwunode on ðam munte feowertig daga &amp; feowertig nihta, swa
ðæt ic ne æt ne ne dranc.
 9.10. &amp; Drihten me sealde twa stænene tabulan mid Godes
fingre awritene.
 9.11. &amp; ða feowertig daga &amp; efenfela nihta agane
wæron, Drihten me sealde ða bredu.
 9.12. And cwæð to me: Aris &amp; gang nyðer, for ðam ðe
ðin folc, ðe ðu ut alæddest of Egypta lande, forleton raðe mine
bebodu &amp; ðone weg ðe ðu him geswutelodest, &amp; hi guton him
hæðenne god.
 9.13. &amp; Drihten cwæð eft to me: Ic geseo ðæt ðis
folc is heardheort &amp; ungeleaffull; Læt me, ðæt ic hi fordo &amp;
adylgie heora naman under heofone, &amp; ic gesette ðe ofer ða ðeode ðe
is mare ðonne ðeos &amp; strengre.
 9.15. Ða ic nyðer eode of ðam byrnendan munte &amp; hæfde
ða twa bredu on twam handum, &amp; ic geseah ðæt ge syngodon beforan
Gode, &amp; worhton eow gegoten cealf, &amp; wurðodon hit for God, &amp;
forleton raðe ðone weg ðe Drihten eow æteowde.
 9.17. Ic wearp ða bredu of minum handum &amp; tobræc hi
beforan eow.
 9.18. &amp; ic feoll beforan Drihtne, swa ic ær dyde; feoworti
daga &amp; feoworti nihta ne æt ic ne ne dranc, for eallum eowrum synnum
ðe ge dydon ongean God &amp; hine gremedon.
 9.19. Ic ondred soðlice his graman &amp; his yrre, for ðam ðe
he wæs astyrod ongean eow &amp; wolde eow fordon; &amp; Drihten me gehyrde
&amp; tiðode me.
 9.20. He wæs yrre wið Aaron &amp; wolde hine fordon, &amp; ic
gebæd for hine.
 9.21. Eowerne gylt ðe ge worhton, ðæt wæs þæt cealf,
ic nam &amp; forbærnde &amp; brytte to duste, &amp; wearp on ða burnan
ðe of ðam munte scyt.
 9.22. On bryne &amp; on costnunge &amp; on gewilnunge byrgenum ge
gremedon Drihten.
 9.23. Ða he sende eow of Cadesbarne, &amp; ðus cwæð:
Farað &amp; habbað ðæt land ðe ic eow sealde: &amp; ge forhogodon
Drihtnes gebod, &amp; ge noldon him gelyfan, ac wæron æfre wiðerwearde
on ðam dæge ðe ic eow cuðe.
 9.25. Ic læg beforan Drihtne feowortig daga &amp; feowortig
nihta, on ðam ic hine bæd eaðmodlice ðæt he eow ne fordyde, swa he
cwæð ðæt he don wolde.
 9.26. &amp; ic cwæð: Drihten God, ne forspil ðu ðin folc
&amp; ðine yrfeweardnisse, ðe ðu alysdest, ða ðu hi ut alæddest of
Egypta lande.
 9.27. Gemun ðinra ðeowa, Abrahames &amp; Isaaces &amp; Iacobes;
ne beheald ðu þises folces heardheortnysse &amp; arleasnysse, ðæt
ðæs landes menn, ðe ðu hi of alæddost, ne secgon: Drihten hi ne
mihte gelædan on ðæt land ðe he him behet, ac he hi hatode &amp; for
ðam he hi lædde ut, ðæt he hi ofsloge on ðam westene.
 10.1. ON ðære tide Drihten cwæð to me: Wyrce ðe twa
stænene tabulan, swylce ða ærran wæron, &amp; astih to me on ðone
munt, &amp; wyrc treowene earce.
 10.2. &amp; ic write on ðam bredum ða word ðe wæron on
ðam ðe ðu ær bræce: &amp; lege ða on ða earce.
 10.3. Ic worhte earce of sethimtreowum &amp; stænene tabulan,
swylce ða ærran wæron, &amp; ic astah on ðone munt &amp; hæfde hi
on minum handum.
 10.4. &amp; he wrat on ðam bredum ða tyn word ðe on ðam
oðrum awritene wæron, &amp; sealde hi me.
 10.5. &amp; ic eode nyðer of ðam munte &amp; lede ða bredu on
þa earce, ðe ic worhte, ðær hi synd of ðisne dæg, swa Drihten me
bead.
 10.8. On ða tide he bead ðæt Leuies mægð bære ða
earce, &amp; stode beforan him on ðenunge, &amp; bletsode Godes naman oð
ðysne andweardan dæg.
 10.10. Ic stod on ðam munte, swa ic ær dyde, feowertig daga
&amp; feowortig nihta, &amp; Drihten me gehyrde &amp; nolde eow fordon.
 10.11. &amp; he cwæð to me: Ga beforan ðison folce to ðam
lande ðe ic behet heora fæderum to syllenne.
 10.12. La Israhel, ne bit God ðe nanes ðinges, buton ðæt
ðu ondræde Drihten ðinne Godd &amp; lufie hine &amp; ðeowige him mid
eallum mægne &amp; mid eallum mode.
 10.13. &amp; gehealde Drihtnes bebodu &amp; his æ, ðe ic ðe
to dæg bebeode.
 10.14. Heofon &amp; heofona heofon &amp; eorðe &amp; ealle ða
ðingc ðe synd on him synd Drihtnes, eowres Godes.
 10.17. Drihten sylf is goda God, mære God &amp; mihtig egesful;
ne wandað he for ricum ne for heanum.
 10.18. He demð steopcildum &amp; wudewum; he lufað fordrifene
&amp; sylð him andlyfene &amp; scrud.
 10.19. Lufiað fordrifene, for ðam ðe ge sylfe wæron
fordrifene &amp; utancymene of Egypta lande.
 10.22. Hundseofontigra sum eowre fæderas wæron on Egypta
lande, &amp; Drihten, eower God, eow gemænigfylde swa heofonas tungla.
 11.1. LUFIAÐ Drihten eowerne God, &amp; wyrceað his bebodu
&amp; his æ &amp; his domas on ælcne timan.
 11.2. Oncnawað to dæg ða þingc ðe eowre bearn nyton,
ða ðe ne gehyrdon Drihtnes lare, eowres Godes, &amp; his mærða &amp;
his strengða, &amp; ða tacnea, ðe he worhte on Pharaone cinincge onmiddan
Egypta lande, &amp; on eallum Egypta here &amp; on horsum &amp; on cratum, hu
ðære Readan Sæ wæteru hi adrencton, ða hi eow drifon, &amp;
Drihten hi adylgode oð ðisne andweardan dæg.
 11.5. &amp; gemunað hwæt he eow dyde on ðam westene, oð ge
comon to ðisse stowe, &amp; hu seo eorðe forswealh Dathan &amp; Abiron mid
husum, &amp; geteldum, &amp; mid eallum hyra spedum þe hi hæfdon, onmiddan
Israhela folce.
 11.7. Ge gesawen ealle ða mæran Drihtnes weorc, þe he
worhte, &amp; gehyrdon his word ðus cweðende; Nu to dæg ic sette beforan
eow bletsunga &amp; wyrignysse: bletsunge, gyf ge hyrsumiað Drihtnes bebodum,
eowres Godes, ðe ic eow to dæg bebeode, wyrignyssa, gyf ge ne hyrað
Drihtnes bebodum, ðe he eow bebead, &amp; gað æfter fremdum godum ðe
ge ne cunnon.
 11.25. Ðonne Drihten eow gelæt on ðæt land ðe ge to
farað on to eardigenne, þonne set he bletsunga uppan Garizim dune &amp;
awyrignysse uppan Hebald dune, ða synd begeondan Iordane be ðam wege ðe
lið to sunnan setlgange on Chananeus lande, se eardað on feldlandum wið
Galgalam &amp; wið ða langan dene.
 12.32. WYRCEAð ealle ða ðingc ðe Drihten eow bebead, &amp;
ne ice ge nan ðingc ðærto, ne ne waniað.
 13.1. GYF ænig witega arise betwynan eow, &amp; secge ðæt
hine mæte swefen, &amp; secge tacnu &amp; forebeacnu, &amp; hit agæð
eall swa he sprycð, &amp; he cwyð to eow: Vton gan &amp; fylian fremdum
godum ðe ge ne cunnon &amp; uton ðeowian him.
 13.3. Ne hlyste ðu his worda , for ðan ðe Drihten fandað
eower, hwæðer ge hine lufian mid eallum mode.
 13.4. Fyliað Drihtne, eowrum Gode, &amp; ondrædað hine &amp;
healdað his bebodu &amp; gehyrað hine &amp; ðeowiað him.
 13.5. Slea man ðone leasan witegan, for ðam ðe he awende eow
fram Drihtne, eowrum Gode, ðe eow ut alædde of Egypta lande, &amp; for
ðam ðe he dyde ðæt ge dweledon of ðam wege ðe Drihten eow bebead,
ðæt ge adrifon yfel fram eow.
 13.6. Gyf ðin broðor ðe lære dearninga, oððe ðin
suna, oððe ðin dohtor, oððe ðin wif, oððe ðin freond, &amp;
ðus cweðe: Vton gan &amp; ðeowian fremdum godum.
 13.8. Ne hyre ðu him, ne ðu him ne ara, ðæt ðu him
gemiltsige &amp; hine bedyhlige, ac ofsleah hine ðærrihte.
 13.10. &amp; oftorfa ðu &amp; eall ðæt folc hine mid stanum
for ðam ðe he wolde ateon ðe fram Drihtne, þinum Gode, ðe ðe ut
alædde of Egypta lande of ðeowettes huse, ðæt eal Israhela folc
ondræde, ðonne hi ðæt gehyrað, &amp; nateshwon nan ðingc ne don
eft swylces.
 14.1. BEOÐ Drihtnes bearn, eowres Godes: ne efesiað eow, ne
eowre hær ne scerað, for ðam ðe Drihten eow geceas him to syndrigum
folce ofer ealle oðre folc.
 14.22. Syle ðone teoðan dæl ealra ðinra wæstma ælce
geare Drihtne, ðinum Gode, on ðære stowe þe he gecyst ðæt man his
naman on nemne, &amp; leorna ðæt ðu ondræde Drihten on ælce tid.
 14.24. Gyf se weg swa lang beo, ðæt þu ðine þingc
ðyder bringan ne mæge, ðonne syle ðu hi wið wurðe &amp; bring
ðæt wurð to ðære stowe; &amp; bige ðær mid ðam ylcan feo swa
hwæt swa ðe licie, hryðera &amp; sceap &amp; win &amp; beor &amp; eal
ðæt ðe licie, &amp; et ðær beforan Drihtne; ðu &amp; ðin
hiwræden, &amp; se sacerd ðe binnan þinre byrig beo.
 15.1. &amp; GYF ðinra freonda ænig beo binnan ðinre byrig on
ðam lande ðe Drihten, ðin God, ðe syllan wile, &amp; him gelimpe
ðæt he ðearfa beo, ne beo ðu swa heardheort ðæt ðu him ðines
godes wyrne.
 15.8. Ac syle him to læne swa hwæt swa he beðurfe &amp; he
ðe bidde, þæ læs he wrege ðe to Drihtne &amp; hit wurðe ðe to
hearme.
 15.10. Ne wanda ðu ðæt ðu ðinum frynd ne helpe ðær
he beðurfe, &amp; Drihten, eower Godd, eow bletsie on æclne timan.
 15.11. Ne beo ge butan ðearfan on ðam lande ðær ðu on
wunie, for ðam ðe ic bebead ðæt ðu dohtest ðinum breðer &amp;
wædlan &amp; ðearfan.
 15.12. Gyf ðu gebicge ænne mann, ðeowige he ðe six gear,
&amp; freo hine on ðam seofoðan.
 15.13. &amp; þonne þu hine freoge, ne læt ðu hine gan
idelhende fram ðe.
 15.14. Ac syle him formete on hlafe &amp; on sufle &amp; on wine,
ðæt Drihten, ðin God, ðe bletsie.
 15.15. Gemun ðæt ðu wære ðeow on Egypta lande &amp;
Drihten ðe alysde.
 15.16. Gyf se ðeowa þonne cweðe ðæt he nelle fram ðe
faran, for ðam ðe he lufað ðe &amp; þine hiwrædene, nim ðonne
anne æll &amp; þurhsting his eare æt ðines huses ðura &amp; beo he
ðe syððan ðeow on ecnysse.
 16.18. SETE deman &amp; lareowas, ðæt hi demon rihtne dom,
&amp; ne wendon ne hider ne ðyder; Ne wanda ðu for rican ne for heanum ne
for nanum sceatte, for ðam medsceattas ablendað wisra manna geðancas
&amp; awendaþ rihtwisnessa word.
 16.20. Fylige rihtlice ðam rihte, ðæt ðu libbe lange on
ðam lande ðe Drihten, ðin God, ðe sylð.
 17.2. GYF ænig mann ðeowige fremdum godum, &amp; geeaðmede
hine to sunnan &amp; to monan, &amp; hit man to soðan ongyte, oftorfie hine
mann mid stanum.
 17.15. Ne ceos ðu ðe cyningc of nanre oðre ðeode mannum
buton of ðinum agenum cynne.
 18.10. &amp; WARNA ðe ðæt ðu ne gyme drycræfta ne
swefna ne hwatena, ne idelra galdra, ne ne axa nane wiccean rædes, ne sece
ðu riht æt deadum.
 18.12. Soðlice Drihten onscunað ealle ðas ðingc &amp; for
ðylcon gylte he eow fordeð.
 18.17. Drihten cwæð: Gyf ge nellað ða word gehyran, ðe
eow bebodene synd on minum naman, ic hit wrece on eow.
 19.16. GYF ænig man oðerne wrege &amp; him hwylcne gylt
onsecge; smeage man geornlice hwæðer hit soð sy, &amp; gyf hit ðonne
leas bið, beo se leasa gewita ðæs ylcan wyrðe, ðe he wolde ðæt
se oðer wære.
 20.10. GYF ðu wille ænige buruh oferwinnan, beod him ærest
sibbe.
 20.11. Gyf hi ðonne on hand gað &amp; ða gatu ondoð,
þonne beon hi ealle gesunde &amp; ðeowion ðe &amp; beon ðine
gafolgyldan.
 20.12. Gyf hi ðonne ðæt nellað &amp; willað ongen ðe
feohtan, ofsleah ælcne wæpnedman, butan wifum &amp; cildum.
 21.18. GYF ænig man hæbbe modigne sunu &amp; rancne, ðe
nelle hyran his fæder &amp; his meder, ðonne nimon hi hine &amp; lædon
to ðære burge deman, &amp; cweðon to him: ðis is uncer ungehyrsuma
sunu; he forhogað ðæt he hyre uncer lare; he begæð unætas &amp;
oferdrynceas &amp; galscype.
 21.21. Oftorfie eall seo burhwaru hine mid stanum to deaðe.
 21.22. Ðonne man bið deaðes scyldig &amp; hine man on gealgan
ahehð, byrge hine man ðæs ylcan dæges, ði læs ðe ðæt land
sy besmiten ðurh hine.
 22.5. NE scryde nan wif hi mid wæpmannes reafe, ne wæpman mid
wifmannes reafe.
 22.22. Gyf ænig man hæme mid oðres wife, swelton hi buta.
 22.28. Gyf ænig man ofernime unbeweddod mæden &amp; hit
wurð cuð, sylle hire fæder fiftig yntsena seolfres &amp; hæbbe hi
æfre syððan to wife swa lange swa he libbe.
 23.19. NE læne ðinum breðer nan ðingc to hyre, ac fremdum
men.
 23.21. Ðonne ðu behat behætst Drihtne, ðinum Gode, ne
wanda ðu ðæt ðu hit ne gelæste, for ðam ðe he hit wile habban,
&amp; gyf ðu dead bist, ðu byst scyldig.
 23.22. &amp; gyf ðu nan ðingc ne behætst, ðu byst
clæne.
 23.24. Gyf ðu gange binnan ðines freondes wingeard, et
ðæra bergena, swa fela swa ðu wille, &amp; ne ber ðu na ma ut mid
ðe.
 23.25. &amp; gyf ðu gange ofer his æcer, brec ða ear &amp;
gnid, &amp; ne rip ðu na mid sicele.
 24.5. ÐONNE man niwan wif nimð, ne fare he ut to gefeohte, ne
him nan man utfæreld ne beode, ac beo him æt ham butan gylte on his huse,
ðæt he geblissige an gear mid his wife.
 24.7. Gyf ænig man sylle his broðor wiþ wurðe, si he
ofslagen.
 24.12. Nafa ðu nanes ðearfan wedd mid ðe nihtlangne fyrst, ac
agyf hit him sona ær sunnan setlgange, ðæt he bletsie ðe, þonne he
gerest on his reafe, &amp; ðæt ðu hæbbe rihtwisnysse.
 24.16. Ne slea man fæderas for suna gylton, ne suna for
fædera gylton, ac swelte anra gehwylc for his agenum gylte.
 25.5. GYF twegen gebroðra eardiað ætsamne, &amp; hyra oðer
bið dead butan bearnum, ne nime ðæs forðfarenan laf nanne oþerne man
buton his broðor, ðæt he awecce his broðor sæd; &amp; nemne man
ðone frumcennedan sunu be ðæs deadan naman, þæt his nama ne beo
adylegod of Israhela folce.
 25.7. Gyf he ðonne nelle niman his broðor lafe, þe him seo
æ bebyt to hæbbenne, fare ðæt wif to ðam portgate &amp; cyðe hit
ðam yldestan mannum.
 25.8. Clypie hine man ðyder &amp; axie hine be ðam ðingum;
gyf he ðonne cwyð: Nelle ic hi habban to wife; &amp; ga ðæt wif to him
&amp; nime his gescy of his fotum beforan ðam ealdrum &amp; spæte on his
nebb; &amp; nemne hine ælc man on Israhela folce unsceoda.
 25.13. Hæbbe ælc man rihtne anmittan, &amp; rihte wæga,
&amp; rihte gemetu on ælcum þincge, ðæt hi naðer ne syn ne
læssan ne maran ðonne hit riht sy, For ðan ðe Drihten ascunað
ælce unrihtwisnyssae.
 27.9. MOYSES &amp; ða sacerdas of Leuies cynne cwædon to
eallum Israhela folce: La Israhel, ongyt ðæt ðu eart Drihtnes folc,
ðines Godes.
 27.10. Gehyr his word &amp; his beboda &amp; his rihtwisnyssa, ðe
ic eow bebeode.
 27.11. And Moyses cwæð to ðam folce: ðis synd ða ðe
sculon standan &amp; bletsian Drihten uppan Gazarim dune, ðonne hi habbað
Iordane oferfarene: Simeon &amp; Leui, Iudas &amp; Isachar, Ioseph &amp;
Beniamin.
 27.13. &amp; ðas sceolon standan on Hebal dune to wyrgenne: Ruben
&amp; Gad, Aser &amp; Zabulon, Dan &amp; Neptalim.
 27.14. &amp; ða sacerdas of Leuies cynne cweðað to Israhela
folce hludre stefne: Beo se man awyrged ðe wyrce agrafene godas oððe
gegotene &amp; on diglum sette; &amp; eal ðæt folc cweðe, Amen.
 27.16. Beo se man awyrged ðe ne arwurðað his fæder &amp;
his modor; &amp; eall folc cwyð, Amen.
 27.17. Sy se man awyrged ðe forhwyrfe his freondes landgemæru;
&amp; eall folc cwyð, Amen.
 27.19. Beo se man awryged ðe deme unrihte domas steopcildum &amp;
wydewum; &amp; cwyðe eal folc, Amen.
 27.20. Sy se awyrged se ðe hæme mid his fæder wife; &amp;
eal folc cweðe, Amen.
 27.21. Beo se man awyrged ðe hæme wið nyten; &amp; cweðe
eall ðæt folc, Amen.
 27.22. Sy ðe man awyrged se ðe hæme wið his swustor,
oððe wið his swegre; &amp; eal folc cwyð, Amen.
 27.24. Sy ælc morðslaga awyrged; &amp; eal folc cwyð, Amen.
 27.25. Sy se awyrged ðe unscyldigne mann belæwe wið
metsceatte; &amp; eal folc cwyð, Amen.
 27.26. Beo se awyrged ðe wunað on ðisse æ, &amp; hi mid
spæcon &amp; mid wordum gefylð &amp; nele mid weorcum; &amp; eal folc
cweð, Amen.
 28.1. GYF ðu ðonne Drihtne hyrsumast &amp; his beboda healtst,
ðe ic ðe bebeode, Drihten ðin God ðe gedeð heahst &amp; mærost
ealra ðæra ðeoda ðe on eorðan wuniað.
 28.2. Ealle ðas bletsunga cumað ofer ðe, gyf ðu gehealtst
his beboda.
 28.3. Beo ðu gebletsod on byrig; beo ðu gebletsod on lande.
 28.4. Beo ðines innoðes wæstm gebletsod, &amp; þines
landes wæstm, &amp; ðinre nytena wæstm.
 28.5. Beon ðine bernu gebletsode, &amp; eac ðine lafa.
 28.6. Beo ðu gebletsod ingangende &amp; utgangende.
 28.7. Drihten afylð ðine fynd beforan ðe; on anne weg hi
gað ongean ðe &amp; on seofon wegum hi fleoð fram ðe.
 28.8. Drihten sent bletsunga ofer ðine heddernu &amp; ofer ealle
ðine weorc ðe ðu wyrcst, &amp; he bletsað ðe on ðam lande ðe ðu
underfehst.
 28.9. Drihten ðe gecyst to halegum folce, swa swa he swor, gyf
ðu gehealtst Drihtnes bebodu, &amp; ealle men geseoð ðæt ðu Drihten
lufast; him stent ege of ðe.
 28.11. Drihten gedeð ðæt ðu hæfst ælces godes genoh,
swa swa he swor ðinum fæderum.
 28.12. He geopenað heofun, his selestan goldhord, &amp; sent
tidrenas on ðin land; he bletsað ealle ðine weorc, ðe biddað manega
ðeoda ðines ðincges to læne, &amp; ðu ne bitst nanne.
 28.13. Drihten ðe geset symle on foreweard &amp; na on
æfteweard, &amp; ðu bist æfre bufan &amp; na benyðan, gyf ðu
Drihtnes bebodum hyrsumast, swa ic ðe bebeode.
 28.15. Moyses cwæð eft to Israhela folce: Gyf ðu nelt
gehyran Drihtnes bebod, ðines Godes, ðe ic ðe to dæg bebeode, ealle
ðas wyrignyssa cumað ofer ðe &amp; ðe fordoð.
 28.16. Beo ðu awyriged binnan byrig &amp; butan.
 28.17. Sy ðin bearn awyrged &amp; ðine lafa.
 28.18. Sy þines innoðes wæstm awyrged &amp; ðines landes
wæstm &amp; þinra nytena.
 28.19. Beo ðu awyrged ingangende &amp; utgangende.
 28.20. Sende Drihten hungor &amp; yrmðe ofer ðe, oð he ðe
fordo, for ðam ðe ðu hine forlete.
 28.21. Sende Drihten cwealm on ðe.
 28.22. Slea ðe Drihten mid feforadle &amp; mid cyle &amp; mid
hætan &amp; mid swoleðan, oð ðu forwurðe.
 28.23. Sy ðe heofune swylce ar &amp; eorðe swylce ysen.
 28.24. Sende Drihten dust ofer ðin land for ren &amp; feallon
axan of heofone ofer ðe, ðæt ðu sy forbryt.
 28.25. Do Drihten ðæt ðu fealle beforan ðinum feondum,
&amp; ðonne ðu fare on anne weg ongean hi, ðæt ðu fleo on seofon
wegas fram him, &amp; ðu sy todrifen geond ealle eorðricu, &amp; ðæt
ðin lichama sy eallum fugelum to mete &amp; wilddeorum.
 28.27. Slea ðe Drihten mid ðam Egyptiscean witon, ðæt ðu
hal ne wurðe.
 28.28. Sende ðe Drihten on ungewit &amp; blindnysse, ðæt
ðu grapie on midne dæg, swa se blinda deð on ðystrum, &amp; ðæt
ðu ne mæge ðine wegas aredian, &amp; ðolie bysmor on ælcne timan,
&amp; næbbe ðone ðe ðe werige.
 28.30. &amp; þu nimst wif &amp; oðer man lið mid hyre; ðu
rærst hus &amp; ne eardast ðæron; ðu plantast wingeard &amp; ne
brycst his.
 28.31. Man slicð ðinne oxan beforan ðe, &amp; þu his ne
abitst; nime man ðinne assan beforan ðe &amp; hine na ne ongyfe; niman
ðine fynd ðin orf &amp; nafa ðu nanne fultum.
 28.32. Syn ðine suna &amp; ðine dohtra geseald oðrum folce,
ðær ðu on locige, &amp; ne sy nan strengð on ðinre handa.
 28.33. Ete elðeodig folc ðine tilunga &amp; ðe mid bysmore
ofsittan ealle ðine dagas, ðæt ðu gange wafigende for hyra ege.
 28.35. Slea ðe Drihten mid ðam wyrstan yfele on cneowum &amp;
on spearlirum, ðæt ðu næbbe nan ðincg hales fram ðam fotwolmun of
ðone hneccan.
 28.36. Drihten sent uncuðe ðeode ofer eow, ða ðe ge ne
cunnon, &amp; ge ðeowiað fremdum godum, stoccum &amp; stanum.
 28.37. &amp; ge forwurðað ðurh bygspel &amp; bigcwydas.
 28.38. Ge sawað micel sæd &amp; ripað litel, for ðam
gærstapan hit fretað eall.
 28.39. Ge plantiað wineardas &amp; delfað, &amp; ge ne
drincað ðærof, for ðam ðe wurmas hine fretað.
 28.40. Ealle eowre elebeamas forwurðað.
 28.41. Ge strynað suna &amp; dohtra, &amp; ne brucað heora, for
ðam ðe hi man læt to oðrum lande.
 28.42. Ragu &amp; meos fornymð ealle eowres landes wæstmas.
 28.43. Vtancymene eardiað on eowrum lande &amp; beoð wyldran
ðonne ge &amp; eow genyðeriað.
 28.44. Hi lænað eow &amp; ge ne lænað him; hi beoð on
foreweard &amp; ge on æfteweard.
 28.45. Ealle ðas wyrignyssa cumað ofer eow &amp; eow fordoð,
for ðam ðe ge forhogedon Drihtnes beboda, &amp; ða æ ðe he bebead.
 28.46. &amp; tacnu &amp; forebeacnu wurðað on eow &amp; on
eowrum ofspryngce.
 28.48. &amp; ge ðeowiað eowrum feondum, &amp; Drihten asent
hungor on eow &amp; ðurst &amp; næcede &amp; ælce wædle; Drihten
sett ysen geoc on eowerne swuran, of ge forwurðað.
 28.49. &amp; he asent ðeoda ofer eow of feorwegum, ðæra
spræca ge ne cunnon.
 28.53. Ge beoð swa lange inne besetene, oð ge etað eowre
agene suna &amp; dohtra, buton ge healdon ðisse æ word, ðe her on
ðisse bec awritene synd, &amp; ondrædan Drihtnes wurðfullan naman,
eowres Godes.
 28.59. Drihten geeacnoð eowre wito &amp; eowres cynrynes wito;
ða wyrstan untrumnyssa &amp; ðone mæstan ece he sent on eow.
 28.61. &amp; ðær to eacan ealle ða adla ðe synt awritene
on ðisse bec, he sent ofer eow, ðæt ge forwurðan.
 28.62. &amp; eower wurðað feawa to lafe, ðe ær wæron
swa fela swa heofones tungla, for ðam ðe ge ne gehyrdon Drihtnes word.
 28.63. &amp; swa Drihten eow ær gemiltsode &amp; eow
gemænifylde, swa he eow fordeð &amp; genyðerað &amp; forhwyrfð eow
of ðam lande ðe ge inn farað to agenne.
 28.64. Drihten eow adrifð geond ealle ðeoda oð eorðan
endas, &amp; ge ðeowiað ðam godum ðe ge ne cunnon, stoccon, &amp;
stanum.
 28.65. Witodlice ne gereste ge on nanum earde; he sent on eow
forhte heortan &amp; geteoriende eagan &amp; modes gnornunge.
 28.66. &amp; eow bið eower lyf æwene; ge ondrædað eow
deað dæges &amp; nihtes.
 28.67. On ærnemergen ge cweðað: Hwa hylpð us ðæt we
æfnes gebidan; &amp; on æfen ge cweðað: Hwa fylst us ðæt we
dæges gibidon; For eowre forhtnysse &amp; yrhðe, ðe eow eglað.
 28.68. Scyphere eow nimð &amp; sylð eow eowrum feondum to
ceape, &amp; eow ne alyst nan man.
 29.1. ÐIS synd ða word ðe Drihten bebead Moyse ðæt he
bude Israhela folce on Moab lande, butan ðam wedde ðe he him behet on
Oreb.
 29.2. &amp; Moyses clypode eall Israhela folc, &amp; cwæð to
him: Ge gesawon ealle ða ðingc ðe Drihten worhte beforan eow on Egypta
lande on Pharaone &amp; on eallum his ðeowum; &amp; micele costnunga on
eallum his lande ge gesawon, ða tacn &amp; ða forebeacn.
 29.4. Drihten eow ne sealde undergytende heortan, ne eagan to
geseonne, ne earan to gehyrenne oð ðisne andweardan dæg.
 29.5. He lædde eow feowertig wintra geond ðæt westen:
næron eowre reaf forwerode, ne eowre gescyg mid ylde fornumene.
 29.6. Ne æte ge hlaf, ne drunce ge win ne beor, ðæt ge
wiston ðæt he is Drihten, eower God.
 29.7. &amp; ge comon to ðisse stowe, &amp; Seon, cyng of Esebon,
for ut &amp; Og, cyng of Basan, for ongean us to gefeohte, &amp; we ofslogon
hi.
 29.8. &amp; namon hyra land, &amp; sealdon hit Rubene to æhte
&amp; Gade &amp; healfre Mannases mægðe.
 29.9. Healdað eornostlice ealle ðisse æ word &amp;
gefyllað hi, ðæt ge undergyton ealle ða ðingc ðe ge doð.
 29.10. Ge standað to dæg ealle beforan Drihtne, eowrum Gode,
eowra mægða ealdras &amp; ða betstborenan &amp; þa lareowas &amp;
eall Israhela folc, &amp; wif &amp; ealle utancymene ðe mid eow eardiað,
butan wuduheawerum &amp; ðam ðe wæter berað.
 29.12. &amp; gað on Drihtnes bebodum, eowres Godes, ðæt he
gelæste eow ðæt he mid aðe swor eowrum fæderum, Abrahame &amp;
Isaace &amp; Iacobe.
 29.14. Ne beode ic ðas bebodu eow anum, ac eallum mannum, ðam
ðe nu synd &amp; ðam ðe towearde synd.
 30.15. ONGYTAÐ ðæt God sette to dæg beforan eow lif &amp;
god, &amp; ðær ongean deað &amp; yfel, ðæt ge lufion Drihten,
eowerne God, &amp; healdon his bebodu, ðæt ge libbon &amp; syn
gemænifylde.
 30.17. Soðlice, gyf eower heorte bið fram awend &amp; nele
gehyran, &amp; ge beoð mid gedwolan beswicen &amp; lufiað fremde godas, ic
secge eow to soðe ðæt ge forwurðaþ &amp; sweltaþ on lytlere
hwile.
 30.19. Ic clypie me to dæg to gewitnysse heofon &amp; eorðan
þæt ic eow sette beforan lif &amp; god, bletsunga &amp; wyrignyssa:
geceosað lif, ðæt ge libbon &amp; eower ofspringc.
 30.20. Lufie Drihten: he is soþlice lif &amp; eower daga
langnyss, ðæt ge eardion on ðam lande þe Drihten foreswor eowrum
fæderum, Abrahame &amp; Isaace &amp; Iacobe, ðæt he hit sealde him.
 31.1. WITODLICE Moyses spræc ealle ðas word to eallum Israhela
folce.
 31.2. &amp; cwæð to him: Ic eom to dæg hundtwelftiwintrae;
ne mæg ic lengc faran ut &amp; inn, &amp; eac Drihten cwæð to me: Ne
oferfærsðu Iordane.
 31.3. Eornostlice Drihten, eower God, færð beforan eow &amp;
gewylt eow ealle ðeoda to handa, &amp; Iosue færð beforan eow, swa God
spræc.
 31.6. Ongynnað esnlice &amp; beoð staðolfæste: ne
ondrædað eow ne ge ne forhtion, for ðam Drihten, eower God, eow læt
&amp; eow ne forlæt.
 31.7. Moyses ða cwæð to Iosue beforan eallum Israhela folce:
Beo strang &amp; staðolfæst; Soðlice ðu lædst ðis folc on
ðæt land ðe Drihten swor ðæt he syllan wolde hyra fæderum, &amp;
ðu hit todælst mid hlyte.
 31.8. &amp; Drihten, ðe eowwer latteow is, bið mid ðe: ne
forlæt he ðe na; ne ondræd ðu ðe, ne ðu ne forhta.
 31.9. Witodlice Moyses wrat ðas æ &amp; sealde hi ðam
sacerdum, Leuies bearnum, &amp; eallum Israhela ealdrum, &amp; cwæð to
him: þonne eall Israhela folc togædere sy, ðonne ræde ge ðas word
ðisse æ beforan him, ðæt hi gehyron, &amp; leornion, &amp;
ondrædon Drihten eowerne God, &amp; healdon &amp; gefyllon ealle ðisse
æ word.
 31.14. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Nu synd ðines deaðes
dagas gehende; clypa Iosue &amp; standað on ðære halgan stowe, ðæt
ic spece wið hine; Moyses &amp; Iosue foron &amp; stodon on ðære halgan
stowe.
 31.15. &amp; Drihten him ætywde on genipe on ðære halgan
stowe ingange.
 31.16. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Moyse: Nu ðu scealt restan mid
þinum fæderum, &amp; þis folc arist &amp; syngað &amp; folgað
fremdum godum on ðam lande ðe hit to færð &amp; on eardað; ðær
hi forlætað me &amp; doð for naht ðæt wedd ðe ic him sealde.
 31.17. &amp; min yrre arist ongen hi on ðam dæge, &amp; ic
forlæte hi &amp; behyde me fram him, &amp; hi beoð fordone; him cumað to
ealle yfelu &amp; geswencednyssa, swa ðæt hi cweðað on ðam dæge:
ðas yfelu synd becumen on us for ðam ðe God nys mid us.
 31.18. Soðlice ic me behyde on ðam dæge fram him for eallum
ðe hi dydon, &amp; for ðam ðe hi fyligdon fremdum godum.
 31.19. Writað nu ðisne cantic &amp; lærað Israhela bearn,
ðæt hi hyne gemyndelice singon, &amp; sy me ðis leoð to tacne gemang
Israhela folce.
 31.20. Soðlice ic hi in gelæde on ðæt land ðe ic
foreswor hyra fæderum; ðæt is wæstmbære land ægðer ge on
meolce ge on hunige; &amp; ðonne hi etað &amp; fulle beoð &amp; fætte,
þonne forlætað hi me &amp; cyrrað to fremdum godum &amp; ðeowiað
him, &amp; tellað min wedd for naht.
 31.21. Syððan hi gemetað manega yfelu &amp; geswencednyssa,
ðis leoð him andswarað for gewitnysse &amp; ðæt leoð ne adylegað
nan man of ðines ofsprincges muðe; ic wat soðlice ðæs folces
geðanc, hwæt hi to dæg don willað, ær ðam ðe ic hi in
gelæde on ðæt land ðe ic him behet.
 31.22. Moyses wrat ðone cantic &amp; lærde Israhela folc,
&amp; bead Iosue, Nunys suna, &amp; cwæð: Beo strang &amp;
staðolfæst; ðu gelædst Israhela folc on ðæt land ðe ic him
behet, &amp; ic beo mid ðe.
 31.24. Æfter ðam ðe Moyses wrat ðisse æ bebodu, &amp;
ða gefylde, he bebead Leuies cynne, ðe bæron ða earce ðe Drihtnes
wedd on wæs, &amp; ðus cwæð: Nimað ðas boc &amp; lecgað hi be
ðære earce sidan, ðe Drihtnes wedd on is, ðæt heo sy ðær
ongean eow to gewitnysse.
 31.27. Ic can eower geflit &amp; eowre heardheortnysse; On minum
life, ða hwile ðe ic mid eow ferde, æfre ge fliton ongean Godd, &amp; ge
doð miccle swyðor syððan ic dead beo.
 31.28. Gegaderiað to me ealle ða betstborenan on eowrum cynne
&amp; lareowas, ðæt hi gehyron mine word, &amp; ic clypige heofun &amp;
eorðan to gewittnysse.
 31.29. Ic wat ðæt ge unrihtlice lybbað æfter minum
deaðe, &amp; ge sona forlætað ða ðincg ðe ic eow bebead, &amp;
becumað on miccle yfelu on ðære ytemestan tide, ðonne ge unriht
wyrceað beforan Drihtne &amp; hine gremiað mid eowrum handgeweorce.
 31.30. Moyses spæc ðas word beforan Israhela folce &amp; hi
fylde oð ende, &amp; ðus cwæð.
 32.1. GEHYRAð heofonas ða ðingc ðe ic spece, &amp; gehyre
eorðe mine word.
 32.2. Weaxe min lar swa ren; flowe min spæc swa deaw &amp; swa
smylte ren &amp; swa dropan ofer gærsa ciðas, for ðam ðe ic clypie
Drihtnes naman; Syllað mærðe urum Gode.
 32.4. Godes weorc synd fulfremede &amp; ealle his wegas synd domas;
Godd is getrywe, butan ælcere unrihtwisnysse rihtwise.
 32.5. Him syngodon on unrihtwisum &amp; na his gecorenan bearn; La
yfele cneores.
 32.6. Agylts ðu Drihtne ðas ðincg, stunt folc &amp; unwis;
Secge ge, nis he eower fæder, ðe eow ahte &amp; worhte &amp; gesceop?
 32.7. Gemunað ealdra daga; geðenceað ealle cneoressa; axiað
eowre fæderas &amp; hi cyðað eow, eowre yldestan &amp; hi secgað eow.
 32.8. Ða se hehsta todælde ðeoda; ða he ascyrede Adames
bearn, he geset folca gemæro æfter Israhela bearna getele.
 32.9. Drihtnes dæl wæs his folc &amp; Iacob his
yrfeweardnyss.
 32.10. He funde hit on westum lande, on egeslicre stowe &amp; on
widum westene; he lædde hit ymbutan &amp; lærde &amp; heold hi swa his
eagan seon.
 32.11. Swa earn his briddas spænð to flihte &amp; ofer hi
flicerað, swa he tobrædde his feðeru &amp; nam eower cynryn &amp; bær
on his eaxlum.
 32.12. Drihten sylf wæs eowwer latteow &amp; næs mid him nan
fremde god.
 32.13. He sette hi ofer heah land, ðæt hi æton ðæs
landes wæstmas &amp; ðæt hi sucon hunig of stane &amp; ele of ðam
heardustan stane, buteran of hryðera heorde &amp; meoluc of sceapun mid lamba
rysle &amp; ramma of Basanes cynrene &amp; buccan &amp; hwætes smedeman,
&amp; hi druncon hluttor win.
 32.15. Hi wæron gemæste &amp; wiðerodon for hyra
fætnysse; hi forleton God heora scyppend &amp; gewiton fram hyra halwendan
Gode.
 32.16. Hi gremedon hine mid fremdum godum.
 32.17. Hi offrodon deoflum &amp; na Gode, ðam godum ðe hi ne
cuðon; niwe comon, ðe hyra fæderas ne wurðodon.
 32.18. Ge forleton God ðe eow gestrynde, &amp; ge forgeaton
Drihten eowwerne scyppend.
 32.19. Ða Drihten ðæt geseah, ða wearð he yrre, for
ðam ðe his suna &amp; his dohtra hine gremedon.
 32.20. &amp; he cwæð: Ic behyde me fram him, &amp; ic
besceawige hyra endas; soðlice hit is ungeleafful cynryn &amp; ungetrywe
bearn.
 32.21. Hi me tyrigdon mid hyra idelgyldum, &amp; ic anyde hi ut on
fremde folc &amp; ic hi geswence mid dysgere ðeode.
 32.22. Fyr is onæled on minre hatheortnysse &amp; byrnð oð
helle endas &amp; fryt land mid his wæstme &amp; forbærnð duna
staðelas.
 32.23. Ic gegaderige yfelu ofer hi &amp; ic afæstnige mine flana
on him.
 32.24. Hi beoð mid hungre fornumene &amp; fugelas hi fretað mid
ðære biterustan slitincge; ic sende wildeora teð on hi mid wurmum &amp;
næddrum.
 32.25. Vte hi reafoð swurd &amp; inne ege, cniht &amp; mædenu,
sucende mid ealdum men.
 32.26. Ic cwæð: Hwær synd hi?
 32.26. Ic gedo ðæt hyra gemynd geswicð of eallum mannum.
 32.27. &amp; for hyra feonda yrre ic wandode, ðe læs ðe hyra
fynd ofermodegodon, &amp; cwædon: Vre hand is heah &amp; ne worhte Drihten
ðas ðingc.
 32.28. Ðeod is butan geðeahte &amp; butan gleawnysse.
 32.29. Ic wisce ðæt hi wiston &amp; undergeaton &amp;
foresceawodon hyra ende, Hu an man drifð ðusend &amp; twegen aflymeþ tyn
ðusendu? Hu nis hit for ðam ðe hyra God hi forlet &amp; Drihten hi
beleac?
 32.31. Soðlice nis ure God swylce hyra God is, &amp; ure fynd
synd deman.
 32.32. Hyra wingeard is of Sodomwara winearde &amp; of Gomorra
underburgum; hyra winberie is gealla &amp; ðæt biteroste clyster.
 32.33. Heora win is dracena gealla &amp; næddrena attor
unhalwendlic.
 32.34. Hu næron þas gesceapen mid me &amp; geinseglude on
minum goldhordum?
 32.35. Seo wracu is min &amp; ic hit agylde on tide, ðæt hyra
fot ætslide; hyra forwyrde dæg is gehende: &amp; þas ðingc eow synd
gegearwode.
 32.36. Drihten demð his folce &amp; gemiltsað his ðeowum; he
gesyhð hi geuntrumod &amp; ða belocenan geteorodun &amp; ða lafa synd
fornumene.
 32.37. &amp; cweðað: Hwær synd hyra godas on ðam hi truwan
hæfdon, Of ðæra offrunga ge æton ryslas &amp; druncon win on heora
ofrungum; Arison nu &amp; fylston eow æt nydðearfe.
 32.39. Geseoð ðæt ic ana eom &amp; nis nan oþer god butan
me; ic ofslea &amp; ic læte libban; ic ofslea &amp; ic hæle, &amp; ne
mæg nan man of minre handa ut alynian.
 32.40. Ic hebbe to heofone mine hand &amp; ic swerige ðurh mine
swyðran, &amp; ic cweðe: Ic libbe on ecnysse.
 32.41. Ic gescyrpe min swurd swa ligette &amp; min hand demð; ic
agylde wrace minum feondum &amp; ðam ðe me hatedon.
 32.42. Ic smyrige mine flan on blode, &amp; min swurd fryt
flæsc.
 32.43. Geblissiað heofonas mid him &amp; arwurðion hine ealle
Godes englas; ðeoda heriað his folc, for ðam ðe he wyrcð his ðeowas
&amp; agylt wrace hyra feondum, &amp; Drihten byð arfæst his folces
lande.
 32.44. Moyses &amp; Iosue, Nunes sunu, nu spræcon ealle ðas
word to eallum Israhela folce.
 32.46. &amp; cwædon: Healdaþ ealle ðas word ðe ic eow to
dæg bebeode, &amp; beodað ða eowrum bearnum to healdenne &amp; to
donne, For ðam ne synd hi eow on idel beboden, ac ðæt ge libbon ðurh
hine &amp; þurhwunion lange tid &amp; doð ða þingc on ðam lande ðe
ge in faraþ to agenne, þone ge ofer Iordane faraþ.
 32.48. Drihten wæs ða sprecende to Moyse, ðus cweðende:
Astih to me on ðisne munt Abarim, se is on Nebo dune, on ðam lande Moab
ongean Iericho, &amp; geseoh Chanaan land ðe ic forgyfe Israhela bearnum to
agenne, &amp; swelt on ðam munte.
 32.50. &amp; ðu byst geðeodd to ðinum folcum, swa swa Aaron,
ðin broðor, wæs dead on ðære dune Or, &amp; wæs gelogod to his
folcum.
 32.51. For ðam ðe gyt agylton ætforan me on Israhela bearna
middan æt ðæs wiðersæces wæterum on Chades on ðam westene
Sin, &amp; ge ne wurðodon me onmang Israhela bearnum.
 32.52. Ðu scealt geseon ðæt land &amp; ðu ne cymst
ðæron.
 33.1. MOYSES ða gebletsode ær his deaðe Israhela bearn, ða
twelf mægða, ælc mid syndrigre bletsunge.
 34.1. &amp; ASTAH syððan uppan ðone munt Nebo, on Fasgan
cnæp, ongean ða buruh Iericho; &amp; Drihten him æteowde eall Galaad
land oð Dan, &amp; eall Neptalim land, &amp; Effraim, &amp; Mannasen, &amp;
eall ðæt land oð ða ytemestan sæ, &amp; ðone suðdæl &amp;
ða rumnysse Iericho feldes &amp; palmtreowa byrig oð Segor.
 34.4. Drihten cwæð ða to him: ðis is ðæt land ðe ic
behet Abrahame &amp; Isaace &amp; Iacobe, ðus cweðende: ðinum ofsprincge
ic forgyfe ðis land; ðu hit gesawe nu ðinum eagum &amp; ðu ne færst
ðæron.
 34.5. Moyses ða, Godes ðeow, wæs ðær dead on Moab
lande, swa swa Drihten wolde.
 34.6. &amp; he bebyrigde hine on ðære dene Moablandes ongean
Phogor; &amp; nyste nan man his byrgenne oð ðisne andweardan dæg.
 34.7. Hundtwelftig geara wæs Moyses, ða ða he gewat, &amp;
his eagan ne mistodon ne his teð ne wagodon.
 34.8. &amp; Israhela bearn hine beweopon ðritig daga on Moabes
feldum, &amp; ða heofungdagas wæron ða gefyllede ðe hi Moysen
bemændon.
 34.9. Soðlice Iosue, Nunes sunu, wearð gefylled mid wisdomes
gaste, for ðan ðe Moyses sette his handa uppan hine, &amp; Israhela bearn
him gehyrsumodon, &amp; dydon swa swa Drihten bebead Moyse.
 34.10. Ne aras syððan nan witega on Israhela ðeode swylce
Moyses wæs, ðe Drihten cuðe of ansyne to ansyne, on eallum tacnum &amp;
forebeacnum ðe God sende ðurh hine, ðæt he worhte on Egypta lande
Pharaone &amp; eallum his folce, &amp; eallum his lande, &amp; ealle ða
strangan mihta &amp; ða miclan wundra, þe Moyses worhte ætforan Israhela
folce.

Josh
B8.1.4.6.
Joshua (London, British Library, MS. Cotton Claudius B.IV): Crawford 1922, 377-400.



 1.1. HIT wæs geworden æfter Moyses forðsiðe, Drihtnes
ðeowan, ðæt Drihten spræc to Iosue, Nunes suna, &amp; cwæð him
to: Moyses, min ðeowa, forðferde; aris nu &amp; far ofer ðas ea Iordanen,
ðu &amp; eal ðis folc mid ðe, to ðam lande ðe ic forgyfe Israhela
bearnum.
 1.3. Eal ðæt rymet ðe eower fotswaðu on bestæppað, ic
eow forgyfe; swa swa ic spræc to Moyse, Fram ðam westene &amp; fram Libano
oð ða miclan ea Eufraten, eall Eðea land oð ða miclan sæ ongean
sunnan setlgang beoð eowre gemæru.
 1.5. Ne mæg eow nan ðingc wiðstandan on eallum dagum ðines
lifes; swa swa ic wæs mid Moyse, swa ic beo eac mid ðe, &amp; ic ðe ne
forlæte.
 1.6. Beo ðu nu gestrangod &amp; ellenrof; soðlice ðu dælst
mid hlote ðisum folce ðæt land ðe ic behet ðinum fæderum.
 1.7. Beo ðu gestrangod &amp; swyðe ellenrof, ðæt ðu mid
weorcum gefylle ða æ ðe Moyses, min ðeowa, ðe bebead; ne ðu ne
gebuh fram ðære æ on ða swyðran healfe ne on ða wynstran,
ðæt ðu ongyte ealle ða ðingc ðe ðu dest.
 1.9. Ic ðe bebeode ðæt ðu beo gestrangod &amp; ellenrof;
ne ondræd ðu ðe, for ðan ðe ic, ðin Drihten &amp; ðin God, beo
mid ðe on eallum ðam ðe ðu to færst.
 1.10. Hwæt ða Iosue het ðæt folc hi gearcian to ðam
earde to farenne, swa swa se ælmihtiga wolde.
 1.16. &amp; ðæt folc him behet ðæt hi him gehyrsumian
woldon on eallum his hæsum, swa swa hig gehyrsumodon Moyse; hi bædon ða
georne: Beo huru Godd mid ðe, swa swa he wæs mid Moyse, &amp; se man ðe
wiðcwyð ðinum bebodum ahwar, beo he deaðes scyldig: beo ðu huru
gehyrt &amp; hicg ðegenlice.
 2.1. IOSUE ða sona asende twegen sceaweras digellice of Sathin,
&amp; het sceawian ðæt land &amp; ða buruh Iericho, hu heo geworht
wære; Hi ferdon ða &amp; comon to anre myltistran huse heo wæs Raab
gehaten &amp; gereston hi ðær.
 2.2. Ða wearð ðam cyninge gecydd ðæt ðær comon
sceaweras of Israhela bearnum, ðæt hi ða burh sceawodon, &amp; sende to
Raab &amp; het ða sceaweras agyfan.
 2.4. Ac heo hæfde hi behydd, ær hyre seo hæs to come, on
hyre upflora, &amp; geandwyrde ðus: Ic andytte ðæt hi comon to me, ac ic
ne cuðe heora fær, &amp; hi urnon on æfnunge ut of ðissere byrig, mid
ðam ðe ða burhgata belocene wurdon; efstaþ nu ardlice &amp; ge hi
ofridað.
 2.7. Hi ða sona æfter ridon idelum færelde.
 2.8. &amp; ðæt wif ða spræc to ðam behyddum werum: Ic
wat nu to soðan ðæt God eow sylð ðisne eard; witodlice eower ege is
on us becumen, &amp; ðis folc is geyrged &amp; ormod ongean eow.
 2.10. We gehyrdon ðæt Drihten adrigde ða Readan Sæ, ða
ða ge ferdon fram Egypta lande, &amp; hu ge ofslogon syððan twegen
cyningas, Seon &amp; Og, &amp; aswearc ure mod, &amp; ure gast forhtode to
eowrum infærelde; eower Drihten is soðlice soð God on heofonum &amp; on
eorðan, ðe ealle ðingc gewylt.
 2.12. Sweriað me nu ðurh Drihten ðæt ge don eft wið me
swylce mildheortnysse swa ic macode wið eow, &amp; syllað me sum tacn,
ðæt ic sylf beo gehealden, &amp; min fæder, &amp; modor &amp; mine
gebroðra &amp; ða ðe us to lociað, alysað fram deaðe.
 2.14. Ða cnihtas hyre andwyrdon &amp; mid aðe hyre beheton:
ðonne ure Drihten us forgyfð ðisne eard to gewealde, we cyðað
mildheortnysse on ðe.
 2.15. Witodlice hire hus wæs on ðam wealle fæst, &amp; heo
let hi ut mid anum langan rape ðurh ðæs huses eahðirl ofer ðone
weal.
 2.16. &amp; cwæð: Farað eow nu wærlice &amp; gewendað
to muntum &amp; lutiað ðær ðry dagas, ðe læs ðe eow gemeton,
ða ðe eow æfter ridon, &amp; efstað syððan aweg.
 2.17. Hi cwædon to ðam wife: We beoð unscyldige wið ðe,
ðonne we to ðisum lande becumað, gyf ðu lætst ðisne rap hangian on
ðam ehðyrle, ðær ðu us ut alete, &amp; gelangast to ðe ðine
leofostan frynd, fæder &amp; modor &amp; ðine magas, in to ðe.
 2.19. &amp; locehwa ut gange, licge he ofslagen, &amp; se ðe on
ðam huse beo, hæbbe frið mid ðe.
 2.20. &amp; gyf ðu abarast ure spræce, we ne beoð
forsworene.
 2.21. Ðæt wif him cwæð to: Eower cwyde stande.
 2.22. Hi efston ða aweg, swa ðæt wif hi lærde, &amp;
comon to Iosue &amp; cyddon him eal ðis.
 2.24. Hi sædon him: To soðan us sylð Drihten ðis land;
ealle synd geyrgede, ðe eardiað on ðisum lande.
 3.1. IOSUE ða aras hraðe on ðære nihte, &amp; astyrode his
fyrdwic forð to Iordanen, &amp; wicode ðreo niht wið ða ea on
anbidunge.
 3.2. &amp; sende ða bydelas, &amp; bead eallum ðam here:
ðonne man eowres Godes earce styrað mid ðam gangendum bærmannum of
Leuies cynne, &amp; ge ne cunnon ðone weg, folgiað eow feorran ðære
earce, &amp; nan man ne genealæce neah ðam arce.
 3.5. &amp; beoð gehalgode; betwux eow Drihten wyrcð wundra to
mergen.
 3.6. &amp; he cwæð to ðam sacerdum: Nimað ðis Godes
scrin &amp; gað ætforan ðam folce: &amp; ða sacerdas dydon swa swa
Iosue hi het.
 3.7. &amp; Drihten cwæð to Iosue: Nu to dæg ic ongynne ðe
to mærsigenne ætforan Israhela bearnum, ðæt hi magon witan ðæt
ic wille mid ðe beon, swa swa ic mid Moyse wæs.
 3.8. &amp; ðu gewissa ða sacerdas, ða þe ðæt scrin
berað, ðæt hi gebidon on ðære ea.
 3.9. Iosue ða clypode, &amp; cwæð to ðam folce: Be ðam
ge magon witan ðæt God wunað betwux eow, &amp; ða hæðenan
todræfð, ðe nu habbað ðisne eard on eowre gesyhðe, for ðan
Iordan, seo ea, ætstent on hyre ryne; swa ðæt scrin in bið geboren,
swa ofstynt se stream.
 3.14. Ðæt folc ferde ða forð to ðære ea, &amp; sona
swa ða bærmen gesetton heora fotlæst on ðære ea ofre, swa
ætstod se stream, &amp; ongan to ðindenne ongean, swilce hit wære an
heah dun, &amp; se æftra stream arn ut to ðære sæ.
 3.17. Hwæt ða sacerdas ða ætstodon on ðam grunde on
drigre moldan on middan ðære ea, &amp; eal ðæt folc ferde forð ofer
ða ea be drium grunde.
 4.1. &amp; DRIHTEN cwæð to Iosue: Hat nu twelf weras of ðam
twelf mægðum niman twelf stanas on middan ðære ea ðær ða
sacerdas stodon, &amp; habban forð mid eow to eowre wicstowe &amp; wurpan hi
ðær.
 4.4. Ða dide Iosue swa swa Drihten him bebead, &amp; cwæð to
ðam folce: Gyf eowre bearn eow befrinað eft on uferum dagum, Hwæt doð
ðas stanas her?
 4.7. Þonne secge ge to andsware, ðæt seo ea Iordane
adruwode, mid ðam ðe ure fæderas ferdon ofer hi mid ðam halgan scrine,
&amp; hi beoð her to gemynde Israhela bearnum a on ecnysse.
 4.8. Ða dydon ða twelf weras swa swa Drihten him bebead, &amp;
namon twelf stanas on ðæs streames ryne; hæfdon forð mid him to heora
fyrdwicum.
 4.9. Iosue het eac ahebban oðre twelf stanas tomiddes ðam
streame, þær hi stodon mid ðam scrine, &amp; hi ðær ðurhwuniað
oð ðisne andweardan dæg.
 4.10. &amp; ðæt folc ferde forð mid gebylde.
 4.14. On ðam dæge gemærsode se ælmihtiga Drihten Iosue
þone æþelan ætforan Israhela folce, ðæt hi hine ondredon, swa
swa hi ondredon Moysen.
 4.18. Mid ðam ðe hi ferdon fram ðære ea Iordanen, ða arn
se stream forð swa swa he ær dyde.
 4.19. &amp; hi wicodon on Galgala, on easthealfe Iericho, on ðam
teoðan dæge ðæs forman monðes.
 5.1. ÐA geaxodon ða cyningas ðe eardodon on ðam leodscypum
þæt Drihten ða ea Iordanen adrigde ætforan Israhela bearnum ða ða
hi ferdon ðær ofer, ða wearð heora heorte toslopen &amp; heora gast ne
belaf on him, for ðan ðe hi ondredon Israhela tocymes.
 5.2. Drihten cwæð to Iosue on ðære ylcan tide: Wyrc ðe
stænene sex, &amp; oðre siðe ymbsnyð Israhela bearn.
 5.3. Iosue ða dyde swa swa Drihten him bebead, &amp; Israhela
bearn ealle ymbsnað uppan ðam beorge ðe is gehaten <foreign>Preputiorum</foreign>.
 5.4. Heora fæderas wæron ær on Egypto ymbsnydene &amp; seo
iugoð næs, ðe be ðam wege wæs acenned on ðam langsumon færelde
feowerti geara, &amp; ðis is se intinga ðære æftran ymbsnydennysse.
 5.8. Hi gewunodan ðær swa on ðære ylcan wicstowe, oð
ðæt hi gehælede wurdon, &amp; heton ða stowe Galgala.
 5.9. Drihten cwæð to Iosue: Nu to dæg ic adyde þæra
Egyptiscra hosp fram eowrum cynne.
 5.10. Hi wurdon ða on Galgala, &amp; worhton Phase, ðæt is
færeldfreols, on ðam feowerteoðan dæge ðæs monðes on
æfnunge on Iericho feldum.
 5.11. &amp; æton of ðæs landes wæstmum on ðam oðrum
dæge, ðeorfe hlafas &amp; polentan ðæs ylcan geares.
 5.12. Æfter ðam ðe hi æton of ðæs eardes wæstmum,
him ateorode se heofonlica mete; ne hi syððan ne onbyrigdon ðæs
bigleofan ofer ðæt, ac of ðæs geares wæstmum Chanaan landes.
 5.13. Mid ðam ðe Iosue com on Iericho lande, he geseah ænne
wer wið ða fyrde standan mid atogenum swurde, &amp; he sona hine axode:
Eart ðu ures geferes ðe ure wiðerwinna?
 5.14. Se wer him andwyrde: Ic eom ealdor &amp; latteow Drihtnes
heres, &amp; ic hider nu com.
 5.15. Iosue ða feoll sona afyrht to eorðan, &amp; cwæð:
Hwæt sprycð min hlaford to his ðeowan ðus?
 5.16. Se engel him cwæð to: Vncnyte ðin gescy hraðe of
ðinum fotum, for ðam ðe se stede is halig, ðe ðu on styntst; &amp; he
swa dyde.
 6.1. HIERICHO seo burh wæs mid weallum ymbtrymed &amp; fæste
belocen for ðes folces tocyme, &amp; hi ne dorston ut faran ne in faran for
him.
 6.2. Drihten cwæð ða to Iosue: Ic do ðas buruh Hiericho on
ðinum gewealde &amp; ðone cyning samod &amp; ða strengstan weras ðe
wuniað on hyre.
 6.3. Farað nu six dagas symble ymb ða burh, ælce dæg
æne &amp; ealle suwigende; &amp; seofon sacerdas blawan mid byman eow
ætforan.
 6.12. Iosue ða swa dyde, &amp; ða sacerdas bæron ðæt
Godes scrin ymbe ða burh, ælce dæge æne.
 6.13. &amp; oðre seofon blewon mid sylfrenum byman.
 6.14. &amp; hi ealle to fyrdwicon ferdon æfter ðam.
 6.15. On ðam seofoðan dæge hi ferdon seofon siðon ymb ða
burh.
 6.16. &amp; on ðam seofoðan ymbfærelde, ða ða sacerdas
blewon, &amp; ðæt folc eall hrymde, swa swa Iosue him rædde, ða
burston ða weallas, ðe ða burh behæfdon, endemes to grunde, &amp; hi
ða in eodon, ælc man swa he stod on ðam ymbgange.
 6.17. Iosue ða clypode, &amp; cwæð to ðam folce: Sy ðeos
burh amansumod &amp; eall ðæt bið on hyre, buton Raab ana libbe &amp;
ða ðe lociað to hyre, for ðan ðe heo urum ærendracum
arfæstnysse cydde &amp; ge nan ðingc ne hreppon on reafe ne on feo,
ðæt ge ne beon scyldige sceamlicre forgægednysse, &amp; Israhela
fyrdwic for synne beo gedrefed.
 6.19. Swa hwæt swa her goldes byð, ðæt beo Gode gehalgod,
&amp; on seolfre oððe on are, eall in to his hordum.
 6.21. Hi ofslogon ða sona mid swurdes ecge weras &amp; wifmen
&amp; ða wepende cild, hryðera &amp; scep, assan &amp; ealle ðingc.
 6.22. Iosue cwæð ða syððan to ðam foresædum
ærendracum: Gað nu to ðam huse, ðær ge behydde wæron, &amp;
lædað ut ðæt wif, ðe eowrum life geheolp, &amp; ða ðe hyre to
lociað, lædað of ðisre byrig.
 6.23. Hy dydon ða swa swa him gedihte Iosue, &amp; læddon hi
of ðære byrig mid eallum hyre magum, &amp; hi syððan leofodon mid
sibbe betwux him.
 6.24. Hi forbærndon ða ða burh &amp; ðæt ðe binnan
hyre wæs.
 6.25. &amp; Iosue bæd ðus: Beo se awyrged, ðe æfre eft
geedstaðelie ðas buruh Hiericho.
 6.27. God wæs ða mid Iosue on eallum his weorcum, &amp; his
nama wearð gewidmærsod wide geond ðæt land.
 7.1. WITODLICE Achar, Charmies sunu, Zabdies suna, Zares suna, of
Iudan mægðe, behydde of ðam herereafe, ðe him forboden wæs, ðe
Iosue amansumode; &amp; se ælmihtiga God yrsode sona ongean Israhela bearn.
 7.2. Ða sende Iosue sceaweras to Hai, ðe ðær gehende
wæs, &amp; het besceawian ða burh; Hi ferdon ða &amp; comon, &amp;
cwædon to Iosue: Ne læd ðu eal ðis folc to ðære lytlan byrig, ac
twa ðusenda oððe ðreo læt faran ðærto; Hwæt sceal eall ðis
folc on idel beon geswenct?
 7.4. Ða ferdon ðreo ðusenda feohtendra wera to oferwinnenne
ða burh, ac hi wurdon on fleame &amp; sona ofslagene, six &amp; ðritig,
fram ðære buruhware, ðe him on bæc filigdon; ða wearð Iosue
swyðe sarig on his mode, &amp; eal Israhela folc wurdon afyrhte for ðære
dæde.
 7.6. &amp; Iosue feol astreht ætforan Godes scrine, &amp; ða
yldestan men ealle hi astrehton licgende swa oð æfen, &amp; dydon dust
uppan heora heafda.
 7.7. Iosue ða clypode, &amp; cwæð mid angsumnysse: Wella,
min Drihten God, hwi woldest ðu lædan ðis folc hider ofer ðas ea,
ðæt ðu us sealdest on Amorrea handum &amp; us fordydest?
 7.9. Ðis geaxiað Chananei &amp; cumað hider to us, &amp;
ealle ðas landleoda belicgað us mid fyrde &amp; urne naman adylegiað;
&amp; hwæt dest ðu, Drihten, ðinum mæran naman?
 7.10. &amp; Drihten him cwæð to: Aris nu, Iosue; hwi list ðu
neowel on eorðan?
 7.11. Israhel syngode &amp; ða gesetnysse gewemde; hi ætbrudon
of ðam herereafe, ðe him forboden wæs, &amp; on heora hordfatum
behyddon.
 7.12. Nu næfð Israhel nænne stede wið his fynd ac flyhð
underbæc, for ðan ðe he is besmiten mid ðære amansumunge; ne beo ic
lengc mid eow, buton ge þone fordon ðe ðises gyltes sy scyldig.
 7.13. &amp; ðus secge ðam folce: Beoð gearwe to mergen: seo
amansumung is on eow.
 7.14. Gegaderiað eow be mægðum &amp; gange ðæt gehlot
fram mægðe to mægðe &amp; be manna hiwrædenum &amp; be
ænlypegum mannum; &amp; beo se forbærned, se ðe befangen byð on ðam
fracodan gylte, mid eallum his æhtum, for ðam unrihtum weorce.
 7.16. Hi samnodon hi ða be syndrigum mægðum, &amp; eode
ðæt gehlot swa lange oð hit becom to ðam ylcan men, ðe ðæt man
gefremode, to ðam foresædan Achar, Charmies suna, of Iudan mægðe,
&amp; he wearð ameldod.
 7.20. He andette ða Iosue ætforan him eallum, &amp; cwæð:
Soðlice ic syngode; Ic geseah betwux ðam herereafum wyrmreadne basingc
&amp; twahund entsa hwites seolfres &amp; sumne gyldene dalc on fiftigum
entsum, &amp; ic atbræd ðæt &amp; behydde on eorðan ætforan minum
getelde.
 7.22. Iosue ða sende sona to his getelde, &amp; man funde ða
ðingc, swa swa he foresæde.
 7.24. &amp; hi læddon Achar to Achores dene, mid wife, &amp;
mid cildum, &amp; mid eallum æhtum, &amp; hine ðær stændon &amp; his
ðingc forbærndon.
 7.26. &amp; worhton mid stanum ænne steapne beorh him ofer;
&amp; Godes hatheortnys gecyrde sona fram ðam folce.
 8.1. DRIHTEN cwæð to Iosue: Ne ondræd ðu ðe nan
ðingc: nim ðæs folces mæniu &amp; far ðe to Hai: ða buruh ic ðe
sylle &amp; ða buruhware samod, þone cyningc, &amp; ðæt land, &amp;
ða ðe lociað to him.
 8.2. Do ymb ða burh, swa ðu dydest embe Hiericho; habbað eow
ða huðe &amp; ðæt orf eow gemæne; sete nu syrwa wiðæften ða
burh.
 8.3. Iosue sende ða sona on ðære nihte ðritig ðusend
wera to ðæra searwa stowe, &amp; het hi beon gearwe &amp; anbidan
ðær, &amp; cwæð: Ic fare mid ðisum folce foran ongean ða burh;
&amp; þonne hi ut farað to us, we fleoð endemes; þonne wenað hi
soðlice ðæt we syn geyrgede.
 8.7. Ðonne fare ge to, mid ðam ðe we fleonde beoð, &amp;
gegað ða burh &amp; forbærnað hi sona.
 8.8. Hi dydon ða swa swa him dihte Iosue.
 8.10. &amp; he sylf on ærnemerigen mid ðam oðrum flocce to
ðære byrig ferde beotlice mid wige.
 8.14. Hi geseah ða se cyningc ðe sæt on ðære byrig,
&amp; gewende of ðære byrig mid ealre ðare buruhware &amp; mid eallum
his folce to gefeohte gearu, &amp; nyston ða searwe ðe him sæton
bæfton.
 8.15. Iosue ða fleah, swylce he afyrht wære, mid eallum his
here andlang ðæs westenes.
 8.16. &amp; ða oðre hrymdon hridende him æfter.
 8.18. Drihten cwæð ða to Iosue: Ahefe ðinne scyld up
ongean ðas burh Hai; ic ðe forgyfe hi.
 8.19. He ahefde sona his scyld, &amp; ðæt gesawon ða oðre,
ðe lutedon on ðære dygelnysse, swa swa him dihte Iosue, &amp; arison
sona &amp; ridon to ðære byrig, &amp; hi ealle forbærndon buton
gefeohte.
 8.20. Seo buruhwaru ða beseah underbæc sona &amp; gesawon
ðone smic swyðe heage astigan, &amp; ne mihton ðanon fleon ne forð ne
underbæc.
 8.21. Iosue ða geseah ðæt seo burh wæs gegan &amp; feaht
him wið sona &amp; his geferan wiðhindon, &amp; ofslogon hi endemes,
ðæt ðær an ne belaf.
 8.23. Ðone cyningc hi brohton cucene to Iosue, ðone he het ahon
on heagum gealgum.
 8.25. Twelf ðusenda ðær feollon on ðam gefeohte ofslagene,
wera &amp; wifa.
 8.30. &amp; Iosue worhte ða an weofod Gode, of ungeworhtum
stanum, &amp; his lac ðær geofrode ðam lyfiendan Gode, &amp; Moyses æ
geedniwode ætforan Israhela bearnum.
 9.1. ÐES hlisa wearð ða cuð ðæra leoda cyningum ðe
begeondan Iordane eardiende wæron.
 9.2. &amp; gesamnodon hi ealle anmodlice to gefeohte togeanes Iosue
&amp; Israhela bearnum.
 9.3. Hwæt ða Gabanitiscean gamenlice ræddon, &amp; mid
geaplicre fare ferdon to Iosue.
 9.4. Namon him ealde gescy &amp; unornlic scrud &amp; fynige
hlafas, &amp; forwerede fætelsas &amp; geclutode bytta.
 9.6. &amp; cwædon to Iosue; We comon, leof, feorran of fyrlenum
lande, &amp; we gewilniað friðes &amp; freondræddene wið eow; Him
andwyrde Iosue &amp; Israhela folc ðus: We nyton ðeah ge wunion her on
neawyste hwær, &amp; we frið ne nimað ðus færinga wið eow; weald
ðeah eower eard us gesceote.
 9.9. Hi andwyrdon Iosue &amp; Israhela bearnum ðus: We gehyrdon
eowerne hlisan, hu se lyfigenda God eow sige forgeaf on Seone ðam cyninge
&amp; on Og eal swa on Astaroth.
 9.11. Ða cwædon ure frynd ðæt we comon to eow to eowre
manrædene.
 9.12. &amp; we mid us namon nigbacene hlafas, ðe for ðam langan
wege nu synd gefynegode, swa swa ge fandian magon.
 9.13. Vre reaf synd forwerede, syððan we gewendon hider, &amp;
ure gescy geclutode, swa swa ge geseon magon, for ðam langsuman færelde
syððan we ferdon ut.
 9.14. Hi undorfeng ða Iosue, &amp; ne befran his Drihten.
 9.15. &amp; hi ealle him sworon ðæt hi man slean nolde.
 9.16. Hwæt ða ymbe ðry dagas wearð heora dæd cuð,
ðæt hi on neawyste eardodon, &amp; eall heora geapscype wearð ameldod
Israhela bearnum.
 9.18. Hi ne mihton swa ðeah ða men acwellan for heora
aðsware, ac arodon heora life.
 9.27. &amp; Iosue him bebead ðæt hi bæron wæter to
ðæs folces neode &amp; to Godes weofode &amp; wudedon him symle on
gesettum timan; Hi bugon ða to ðam, &amp; him wæs geborgen; &amp;
wunedon on Israhela on ðam weorce fæste.
 10.3. HWÆT ða Adonisedech, cyningc on Ierusalem, sende to
ðam cyningum on Ebron &amp; on Hierimoth &amp; on Lachis &amp; on Eglon,
&amp; cwæð: Cumað to me, ic bidde, &amp; bringað me fultum, ðæt
we magon ða burh Gabaon oferwinnan, for ðan ðe hi gebugon to Iosue &amp;
Israhela bearnum.
 10.5. Ða comon ða fif cyningas mid fyrde to Gabaon &amp;
wicodon ðær onemn, woldon hi oferwinnan.
 10.6. Ða sende seo buruhwaru sona to Iosue biddende ðæt he
come &amp; ða burh geheolde.
 10.7. Iosue ða ferde mid his fyrde ðyderweard.
 10.8. &amp; Drihten him cwæð to: Ne ondræd ðu ðe nan
ðingc; on ðine handa ic hi betæce; ne mæg heora nan ðe
wiðstandan.
 10.9. Iosue him ða feng on mid gefeohte, &amp; Drihten hi aflymde
fram Israhela bearnum; hi feollon ða swyðe on ðam fleame ofslagene.
 10.11. &amp; God him sende ufan greate hagolstanas, &amp; wurdon ma
manna ofslagene mid ðam miclum hagolstanum ðonne hi mid swurde ofslogon
ðæs dæges.
 10.12. On ðam dæge bæd Iosue his Drihten, &amp; ðus
cwæð: Ne astyra ðu sunne of ðam stede furðor ongean Gabaon, &amp; ne
gang ðu mona ongean Achialon ænne stæpe furðor.
 10.13. Ða stod seo sunne on ðam stede fæste &amp; se mona
gelice, oð ðæt hi aledon heora fynd.
 10.14. Næs swa lang dæg ær ðam on ðisum life æfre,
ne syððan on ðisre worulde, for ðan ðe God wolde ða fylstan his
cempan &amp; feohtan for Israhel.
 10.16. Ða fif cyningas ætburston, &amp; flugon to Maceda &amp;
behyddon hig on anum scræfe, hopodon to life.
 10.17. Þa wearð Iosue gecydd ðæt ða cyningas ðær
lagon behydde on ðam scræfe.
 10.18. &amp; he het ða sona wylian to ðam scræfe micele
weorcstanas &amp; beclysan hi ðærinne, oð ðæt hi comon eft &amp;
setten/ him weardas ofer, &amp; gewende him forð.
 10.21. Ðæt folc ða hit gegaderode æfter ðam gefeohte to
Iosue to Maceda byrig, &amp; nan man ne dorste on eallum ðam ymbwhyrfte
acweðan ongean him.
 10.22. Ða cwæð Iosue: Teoð ða cyningas forð ut of
ðam scræfe &amp; gangon ða yldestan to &amp; ofstæppaþ heora
sweoran swyðe myð fotum; ða dydon ða ealdormen swa swa him dihte Iosue,
&amp; ðara cyninga swuran forcuðlice trædon.
 10.25. &amp; Iosue cwæð eft to Israhela folce: Ne ondræde
ge eow; ðus deð ure Drihten eallum eowrum feondum ðe feohtende beoð
wið eow.
 10.26. Iosue hi ofsloh ða &amp; syððan up aheng on fif wacum
bogum, &amp; het hi byrian on æfen on ðam ylcan scræfe, ðær hi
ær lutedon, &amp; lecgan him on uppan ormæte weorcstanas.
 10.28. On ðam dæge he gewan ða burh Maceda &amp; ðone
cyning ofsloh &amp; acwealde his folc &amp; on hyre ne belæfde nane lafe
cuce.
 10.29. Ða ðanon he gewende mid wige to Lebna &amp; oferwan ða
burh, &amp; mid wige acwealde ðone cyning &amp; ðæt folc, &amp; ðær
furðon ne belæfde naht to lafe cucu, ðe ne lage ofslagen.
 10.31. Fram Lebna he ferde mid his fyrde to Lachis.
 10.32. &amp; Drihten him sealde on ðone oðerne dæg ða
buruh on his handa &amp; ða buruhwara samod, &amp; he cwealde hi ealle &amp;
ðone oðerne cyningc, Hiram gehaten, ðe onette to ðære byrig him to
fultume; ac he feol him sylf, &amp; his folces nan ðingc ætfleon ne
mihte.
 10.34. He ferde ða to Eglon, &amp; ymbsæt ða buruh.
 10.35. &amp; on ðam ylcan dæge he geeode ða burh, &amp; mid
wæpnum acwealde ða ðe wunedon on hyre.
 10.36. Fram Eglon hi ferdon &amp; fuhton on Ebron, &amp; ða buruh
oferwunnon, &amp; mid wige acwealdon eal ðæt hi ðær fundon ðæs
earman folces.
 10.38. Fram Hebron he gecyrde to Dabira ðære byrig &amp; hi
aweste, &amp; oferwan ðone cyningc &amp; his folc ofsloh mid swurdes ecge,
&amp; ne let ðær to lafe nan ðing libbende.
 10.40. Iosue ofsloh ða mid ðam sigefæstan here eall ðæt
mennisc ðe on muntum wunode, &amp; ða ðe on ðam suðdæle syttende
wæron &amp; on feldlicum wunungum, ðe he findan mihte, &amp; Asedoch eac,
mid eallum heora cyningum, &amp; ælc ðingc ðe orðode, he acwealde mid
wæpnum, swa swa Drihten him bebead, Israhela God.
 10.41. On anre hergunge he aweste fram Chadesbarne, oð ðæt
he com to Gazan, eal Gessen land oð Gabaon ða burh, &amp; ealle ða
cyningas acwealde &amp; heora folc; Drihten soðlice feaht for hine &amp;
Israhel.
 10.43. &amp; hi ealle gecyrdon gesunde to Galgala.
 11.1. ÐIS wearð ða gecydd ðam cyninge Iabin, ðe rixode on
Asor, &amp; he hraðe sende to eallum ðam cyningum, ðe cuce ða wæron
on eallum ðam eardum ðe him ymbe lagon.
 11.4. &amp; hi anmodlice comon ealle mid heora folcum, swa
mænigfealde swa swa sandceosel on sæstrande byð, ðæt hi mid
ðære mæniu mihton oferwinnan Israhela bearn.
 11.6. Ac Drihten cwæð to Iosue: Ne ondræd ðu ðe ðas
mæniu; nu to mergen ic hi sylle on ðisre ylcan tide ealle to wundienne on
Israhela gesyhðe, &amp; ðu soðlice forcyrfst heora horsa hohsyna &amp;
heora cræta forbærnst.
 11.7. Iosue com ða mid gecampe to him mid eallum his here, &amp;
hi hetelice sloh, &amp; nan ðing ne belæfde libbende on him.
 11.9. He forcearf ða hohsina ealra ðæra horsa &amp;
forbærnde heora cræta, swa swa him bebead Drihten.
 11.10. He ferde ða to Asor mid fyrdlicum truman, &amp; ða burh
geeode, &amp; ðær binnan ofsloh ðone cyning &amp; ðæt folc ðe he
ðær funde; Seo burh Asor wæs swyðe trum gefyrn &amp; manegra burga
heafod.
 11.11. Ac hi forbærnde Iosue, &amp; ealle hyre fæstenu hi
fordylgodon mid fyre, swa swa Moyses him bebead, se mæra Godes man.
 11.14. Ðæra burga huðe hi hæfdon him gemæne, &amp; hi
dældon ðæt orf, swa him dihte Moyses: ne forlet Iosue nan ðingc his
beboda.
 11.16. Iosue ða gewylde eall ðæt widgylle land manegra
cyninga on muntum &amp; on feldum, &amp; ða cyningas ofsloh mid swurdes
ecge.
 11.18. Lange he wæs feohtende on fyrlynum burgum, &amp; ælc
buruhwaru wæs bugende to him, butan Eueum ana ðe eardodon on Gabaon.
 11.20. Drihten hi gehyrde ðæt hi gehæfton wið hine,
ðæt hi feollon on ðam gefeohte ætforan Israhela bearnum, &amp; nane
mildheortnysse ne begeaton, swa swa God bebead Moyse.
 11.21. On ðære tide com Iosue &amp; ofsloh Enachim on
muntlandum Hebron &amp; Dabir &amp; Anab &amp; of ælcum munte Iudan &amp;
Israhel, &amp; heora burga adylegode.
 11.23. Iosue ða gewann mid wige ðone eard, swa swa Drihten
cwæð to Moyse on ær, &amp; he dælde ðæt land Israhela bearnum,
eallum ðam twelf mægðum; &amp; ðæt gewin ða geswac.
 12.1. ÐIS synd ða cyningas ðe Iosue ofsloh, &amp; Israhela
bearn, begeondan Iordane: þis is se æresta, cyningc on Hiericho, &amp;
ða buruh gewann; cyning on Hai; Cyning on Ierusalem; cyning on Hebron; Cyning
on Hierimoth; cyning on Lachis; Cyning on Eglon; cyning on Gazer; Cyning on
Dabir; cyning on Gader; Cyning on Herma; cyning on Hered; Cyning on Lebna;
cyning on Odolla; Cyning on Maceda; cyning on Bethel; Cyning on Tapha; cyning
on Afer; Cyning on Afeht; cyning on Saron; Cyning on Madon; cyning on Asor;
Cyning on Someron; cyning on Achsaf; Cyning on Thenach; cyning on Mageddo;
Cyning on Cedes; cyning on Iachane; Cyning on Dor; cyning on Galgal; Cyning on
Thersa: ðæt is ealra cyninga an &amp; ðritig.
 21.41. DRIHTEN ða forgeaf Israhela bearnum eallne ðone eard,
swa swa he behet heora ealdfæderum, &amp; hi ahton hit syððan &amp; hi
ðæron eardedon &amp; heora ofspring syððan.
 21.42. God him forgeaf ða sibbe on eallum ymbhwyrfte &amp; nan
wiðerwinna ne dorste winnan wið ðæt folc, &amp; ealle hi bugon to
Israhelea manrædene.
 21.43. &amp; Drihten eall gefylde ðæt he him ær behet;
næs nan ðingc aidlod ac wæs eall gefylled.
 14.2. HI dældon ða ðæt land, swa swa him dihte Iosue,
æfre be gehlote on eallum ðam burgum &amp; on burhscyrum, ðe binnan
ðam earde wæron, on wudum &amp; on feldum, &amp; feng ælc to his
dæle.
 23.1. ÐA æfter langum fyrste, syððan hi on friðe wunodon
&amp; Iosue ealdode, ða het he cuman him to Israhela bearn &amp; ða yldstan
heafodmen, &amp; manode hi georne, ðæt hi Moyses æ on eallum ðingum
heoldon, swa swa se ælmihtiga God him on Sinai ðam munte gesette &amp;
gedihte.
 23.7. He bæd hi ða georne ðæt hi bugan ne sceoldon fram
Godes biggengum to ðam bysmorfullum hæðengilde on ðæs folces wisan,
ðe ðær wearð ofslagen.
 24.16. HI ða anmodlice cwædon ðæt hi ðam ælmihtigan
Gode æfre woldon ðeowian on eallum heora life, ðe swylce wundra
gefremode on heora fæderum &amp; on him.
 24.31. Hi dydon eac swa on Iosues dagum &amp; on ðæra ealdra
dagum ðe æfter him leofodan, ðe ða wundra cuðon ðe God worhte on
him.
 24.29. Iosue wæs on ylde tyn geara &amp; hundteontig, &amp; he
ða forðferde ætforan his magum.
 24.30. &amp; hi hine bebyrigdon on his gehlotlande, ðe lið to
Effraim dune fram norðdæle Gaas dune.
 24.32. Iosepes ban witodlice, ðe Israhela bearn brohton of
Egypta lande, hi bebyrigdon on Sichem, on ðæs landes dæle ðe Iacob
bohte æt Emores sunum, Sichemes fæder; &amp; hit wæs gehloten to
Iosepes bearna lande, for ðam ðe Iacob hit sealde Iosepe is sune æt is
forsyðe.

 1. Methodius cwað adam wæs gesceopa man on wlite of ðritig
wintra &amp; naþeles on ane dage &amp; geara &amp; æfter ðam an &amp;
twa wintra &amp; þri wintra &amp; ælla ða oðron.
 2. Josephus cwæð þæt wæs in syrie on ane felde abute
damasco of rædra yrþe þæt is mædenyrðe þæt is uniwemð
yrþe land hunireped þat is clane land.
 3. Me red on boc be paradisum in eden þæt is neorxnawanga eden
þæt is inne estnysse &amp; inne blisse eden is atanha ðam angynne on
hesdele þysre worlde se stede is swyþe on suote breðe &amp; swyðe suote
smelle &amp; wensæm wunyincge &amp; lang hidraan an hestdele anlænges
ðare sæ butan ure wuniaghe <foreign>ut usque ad lunarem globum attingat</foreign>; þæt
is to þas monas træenle hi taeh &amp; ðær þa wæteræ diluuii
ne ne come ðat is Noes floð.
 4. Me cwæð þæt hi wære inne neorxnawange <foreign>vii</foreign> tide.
 5. In syrie abute damasco on ane felde þanon he com þær cayn
abel ofsloh &amp; beside þan wæs adam &amp; eue bebyrigde on þan
twyfealde scræfe.
 6. Methodius cwæð adam slep be is wife &amp; hi gestrinde
sunes &amp; dohtra.
 7. Methodius cweð þa adam wæs ahund wintra &amp; <foreign>xxx</foreign> cayn
ofsloh abel þa wæs abel <foreign>c</foreign> wintra æfter þan adam &amp; eue hine
bewyppe hunð wintra.
 8. Se steðe is ycwæðen si denæ of tæran besyde hebron
þe adam &amp; eue wypen.
 9. Josephus cwæð fæle cenne landes ywilcon caym &amp;
calmanna is wyf forð hi comen to þæra steðe þe me cweðe naida.
 10. Agen þæt lænd of hestnysse þæt is eden
neorxnawange.
 11. Josephus Lamech &amp; his sunes hifunde fæle cenne
cræftæs eac he wes god scette &amp; mid his scete ofsloh caym &amp; mid
is bohe is agene man ofsloh him to mycele sorhe forþam caynes senne bið
acorede seofonfeald wyte is bið acorðe <foreign>septuagies septies</foreign> wyten þæt
byð syxti &amp; seofontene saulen of Lamech forfeden in diluuio.
 12. Methodius cwæð of abele næs nan baren &amp; al caynnes
ofspringe furwurðen in diluuio adam se forme man seth se oder.
 13. Þa hundseofontig wenðeres &amp; Methodius &amp; Josephus
gewriten þæt adam wæs twa hund wintra &amp; <foreign>xxx</foreign> þa he gestrinde
seth.
 14. Me reð on boce þæt adam hæfde <foreign>xxx</foreign> suna &amp; swa
fela dohtra butan cayn &amp; abel.
 15. Sethes sunes yherden adames wytegunge be twam domon &amp;

 17. Fæle cynne wenughe me telleð be matusalemes gearen þa
<foreign>lxx</foreign> cwæð þæt he lefede hundseofontig writen <foreign>xiiii</foreign> wintre hefter
þan flode hac me ne reð þæt he wera in þara arcæ ne he ne ferde
mid gode swa enoch deða sume cwæð þæt he forðferde <foreign>vi</foreign> wintre
hær þan flode; Ieronymus cweðe þan ylcan geare þe se floð wæs;

 27. Þæt wæs bathueles sune.

&amp; aræde weofod on godes name; lian docter dina for hut to hisyen þas

&amp; ælle is mægum to muculum hærme swa seo leden boc sprycð

bethel &amp; herde godes name; On þan time forðferde debbora rebecca
fostermoder &amp; heo bebyrigde on nyþewærðe bethel hunder ane ache
&amp; me cwæð þane steðe ache wop.
 29. Ða he com færm mesopotania æn wycnigeðe on salim
þæt is in chanaan lande.
