ÆGenPref
B8.1.7.1.
Preface to Genesis (Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Laud Misc. 509): Crawford 1922, 76-80.



 1. <foreign>Incipit prefatio Genesis Anglice</foreign>.
 1. ÆLFRIC MUNUC GRET ÆðELWÆRD EALDORMANN EADMOdlice.
 1. Þu bæde me, leof, þæt ic sceolde ðe awendan of
Lydene on Englisc þa boc Genesis: ða þuhte me hefigtime þe to
tiþienne þæs, &amp; þu cwæde þa þæt ic ne þorfte na mare
awendan þære bec buton to Isaace, Abrahames suna, for þam þe sum
oðer man þe hæfde awend fram Isaace þa boc oþ ende.
 6. Nu þincð me, leof, þæt þæt weorc is swiðe
pleolic me oððe ænigum men to underbeginnenne, for þan þe ic
ondræde, gif sum dysig man þas boc ræt oððe rædan gehyrþ,
þæt he wille wenan, þæt he mote lybban nu on þære niwan æ,
swa swa þa ealdan fæderas leofodon þa on þære tide, ær þan
þe seo ealde æ gesett wære, oþþe swa swa men leofodon under Moyses
æ.
 12. Hwilon ic wiste þæt sum mæssepreost, se þe min
magister wæs on þam timan, hæfde þa boc Genesis, &amp; he cuðe be
dæle Lyden understandan: þa cwæþ he be þam heahfædere Iacobe,
þæt he hæfde feower wif, twa geswustra &amp; heora twa þinena.
 15. Ful soð he sæde, ac he nyste, ne ic þa git, hu micel
todal ys betweohx þære ealdan æ &amp; þære niwan.
 17. On anginne þisere worulde nam se broþer hys swuster to wife
and hwilon eac se fæder tymde be his agenre dehter, &amp; manega hæfdon
ma wifa to folces eacan &amp; man ne mihte þa æt fruman wifian buton on
his siblingum.
 20. Gyf hwa wyle nu swa lybban æfter Cristes tocyme, swa swa men
leofodon ær Moises æ oþþe under Moises æ, ne byð se man na
cristen ne he furþon wyrðe ne byð þæt him ænig cristen man mid
ete.
 23. Ða ungelæredan preostas, gif hi hwæt litles
understandað of þam Lydenbocum, þonne þingð him sona þæt hi
magon mære lareowas beon, ac hi ne cunnon swa þeah þæt gastlice
andgit þærto, &amp; hu seo ealde æ wæs getacnung toweardra þinga
oþþe hu seo niwe gecyþnis æfter Cristes menniscnisse wæs
gefillednys ealra þæra þinga, þe seo ealde gecyðnis getacnode
towearde be Criste &amp; be hys gecorenum.
 29. Hi cweþaþ eac oft be Paul, hwi hi ne moton habban wif, swa
swa Petrus se apostol hæfde, &amp; hi nellað gehiran ne witan, þæt se
eadiga Petrus leofede æfter Moises æ, oþ þæt Crist, þe on þam
timan to mannum com &amp; began to bodienne his halige godspel &amp; geceas
Petrum ærest him to geferan: þa forlet Petrus þærrihte his wif, &amp;
ealle þa twelf apostolas, þa þe wif hæfdon, forleton ægþer ge wif
ge æhta, &amp; folgodon Cristes lare to þære niwan æ &amp;
clænnisse, þe he silf þa arærde.
 37. Preostas sindon gesette to lareowum þam læwedum folce: nu
gedafnode him þæt hig cuþon þa ealdan æ gastlice understandan,
&amp; hwæt Crist silf tæhte &amp; his apostolas on þære niwan
gecyðnisse, þæt hig mihton þam folce wel wissian to Godes geleafan,
&amp; wel bisnian to godum weorcum.
 41. We secgað eac foran to þæt seo boc is swiþe deop
gastlice to understandenne, &amp; we ne writaþ na mare buton þa nacedan
gerecednisse.
 43. Þonne þincþ þam ungelæredum þæt eall þæt
andgit beo belocen on þære anfealdan gerecednisse, ac hit ys swiþe feor
þam.
 45. Seo boc ys gehaten Genesis, þæt ys gecyndbod, for þam
þe heo ys firmest boca &amp; spricþ be ælcum gecinde, ac heo ne spricð
na be þæra engla gesceapenisse.
 47. Heo onginð þus: <foreign>In principio creauit Deus celum &amp;
terram</foreign>; þæt ys on Englisc, On annginne gesceop God heofenan &amp;
eorþan.
 49. Hit wæs soðlice swa gedon, þæt God ælmihtig
geworhte on anginne, þa þa he wolde, gesceafta.
 51. Ac swa þeah æfter gastlicum andgite þæt anginn ys
Crist, swa swa he sylf cwæþ to þam Iudeiscum: Ic eom angin, þe to eow
sprece.
 53. Þurh þis angin worhte God Fæder heofenan &amp; eorþan,
for þan þe he gesceop ealle gesceafta þurh þone Sunu, se þe was
æfre of him accenned, wisdom of þam wisan Fæder.
 55. Eft stynt on þære bec on þam forman ferse: <foreign>Et spiritus
Dei ferebatur super aquas</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc, &amp; Godes gast wæs
geferod ofer wæteru.
 58. Godes gast ys se Halga Gast, þurh þone geliffæste se
Fæder ealle þa gesceafta, þe he gesceop þurh þone Sunu, &amp; se
Halga Gast færþ geond manna heortan &amp; sylð us synna forgyfnysse
ærest ðurh wæter on ðam fulluhte &amp; syððan ðurh dædbote;
&amp; gyf hwa forsyhð ða forgyfnysse, ðe se Halga gast sylð, ðonne
bið his syn æfre unmiltsigendlic on ecnysse.
 64. Eft is seo halige ðrynnys geswutelod on ðisre bec, swa swa
is on ðam worde, ðe God cwæð: Uton wyrcean mannan to ure anlicnisse.
 66. Mid ðam ðe he cwæð: Uton wyrcean, is seo ðrynnys
gebicnod; mid ðam ðe he cwæð: to ure anlicnysse, is seo soðe annys
geswutelod.
 68. He ne cwæð na menigfealdlice: to urum anlicnyssum, ac
anfealdlice: to ure anlicnysse.
 69. Eft comon ðry englas to Abrahame, &amp; he spræc to him
eallum ðrym swa swa to anum.
 70. Hu clypode Abeles blod to Gode buton swa swa ælces mannes
misdæda wregað hine to Gode butan wordum?
 72. Be ðisum lytlan man mæg understandan, hu deop seo boc is
on gastlicum andgyte, ðeah ðe heo mid leohtum wordum awriten sy.
 74. Eft Iosep, ðe wæs geseald to Egypta lande &amp; he ahredde
ðæt folc wið ðone miclan hunger, hæfde Cristes getacnunge, ðe
wæs geseald for us to cwale &amp; us ahredde fram ðam ecan hungre helle
susle.
 77. Ðæt micele geteld, ðe Moyses worhte mid wundorlicum
cræfte on ðam westene, swa swa him God sylf gedihte, hæfde getacnunge
Godes gelaðunge, ðe he sylf astealde ðurh his apostolas mid menifealdum
frætewum &amp; fægerum ðeawum.
 80. To ðam weorce brohte ðæt folc gold &amp; seolfor &amp;
deorwurðe gimstanas &amp; mænifealde mærða; sume eac brohton
gatehær, swa swa seo æ bebead.
 83. Þæt gold getacnode urne geleafan &amp; ure gode ingehyd,
ðe we Gode offrian sceolon; ðæt seolfor getacnode Godes spræca &amp;
ða halgan lare, ðe we habban sceolon to Godes weorcum; ða gimstanas
getacnodon mislice fægernyssa on Godes mannum; ðæt gatehær getacnode
ða stiðan dædbote ðæra manna, ðe heora synna behreowsiað.
 88. Man offrode eac fela cynna orf Gode to lace binnan ðam
getelde; be ðam is swyðe mænifeald getacnung, &amp; wæs beboden
ðæt se tægl sceolde beon gehal æfre on ðam nytene æt ðære
offrungae, for ðære getacnunge ðæt God wile ðæt we symble well
don oð ende ures lifes; ðonne bið se tægl geoffrod on urum weorcum.
 93. Nu is seo foresæde boc on manegum stowum swyðe nearolice
gesett, &amp; ðeah swyðe deoplice on ðam gastlican andgyte; &amp; heo is
swa geendebyrd, swa swa God sylf hi gedihte ðam writere Moyse, &amp; we ne
durron na mare awritan on Englisc þonne ðæt Leden hæfð, ne ða
endebyrdnysse awendan, buton ðam anum, ðæt ðæt Leden &amp; ðæt
Englisc nabbað na ane wisan on ðære spræce fandunge: æfre se ðe
awent oððe se ðe tæcð of Ledene on Englisc, æfre he sceal
gefadian hit swa ðæt ðæt Englisc hæbbe his agene wisan, elles hit
bið swyðe gedwolsum to rædenne ðam ðe ðæs Ledenes wise ne can.
 101. Is eac to witene ðæt sume gedwolmen wæron ðe woldon
awurpan ða ealdan æ, &amp; sume woldon habban ða ealdan &amp; awurpan
ða niwan, swa ða Iudeiscean doð; ac Crist sylf &amp; his apostolas us
tæhton ægðer to healdenne, ða ealdan gastlice &amp; ða niwan
soðlice mid weorcum.
 105. God gesceop us twa eagan &amp; twa earan, twa nosðyrlu,
twegen weleras, twa handa &amp; twegen fet, &amp; he wolde eac habban twa
gecyðnyssa on ðisre worulde gesett, ða ealdan &amp; ða niwan; for ðan
ðe he deð swa swa hine sylfne gewyrð, &amp; he nænne rædboran
næfð, ne nan man ne ðearf him cweðan to, Hwi dest ðu swa?
 110. We sceolon awendan urne willan to his gesetnyssum, &amp; we ne
magon gebigean his gesetnyssa on urum lustum.
 113. Ic cweðe nu ðæt ic ne dearr ne ic nelle nane boc
æfter ðisre of Ledene on Englisc awendan; &amp; ic bidde ðe, leof
ealdormann, ðæt ðu me ðæs na leng ne bidde, ði læs ðe ic beo
ðe ungehyrsum, oððe leas gyf ic do.
 116. God ðe sy milde a on ecnysse.
 117. Ic bidde nu on Godes naman, gyf hwa ðas boc awritan wille,
ðæt he hi gerihte wel be ðære bysne, for ðan ðe ic nah geweald,
ðeah ðe hi hwa to woge gebringe ðurh lease writeras, &amp; hit bið
ðonne his pleoh na min: micel yfel deð se unwritere, gyf he nele his gewrit
gerihtan.

END_TEXT

Judg
B8.1.7.2.
Judges (Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Laud Misc. 509): Crawford 1922, 401-14.



 0.1. <foreign>De Libro Iudicum, Anglice</foreign>.
 0.1. Æfter ðam ðe Moyses, se mæra heretoga, þæt
Godes folc gelædde of Pharaones þeowette ofer ða Readan Sæ, &amp; God
him æ gesette, &amp; æfter þam þe Iosue be Godes sylfes gewissunge
þæt mankyn gebrohte mid swiðe micclum sige to þam behatenan earde
&amp; hi þæron wunedon, þa wurdon hig ealles to oft on yfel awende &amp;
mid yfelum weorce þone ælmihtigan God þearle gegremedon.
 0.6. &amp; God hi eac sona hæðenum leodum let to anwealde, swa
þæt þa hæðenan hæfdon heora geweald, swa oft swa hig abulgon
þam ælmihtigan Gode, oð þæt hig eft oncneowon heora yfelan dæda
&amp; gebugon to Gode biddende his miltse.
 0.10. Ða funde he him sona sumne fultum æfre, &amp; he hig
ahredde of þam reðan þeowte þæra hæðenra leoda þe heora
hæfdon geweald.
 0.12. Hig næfdon manne cyning him gecorenne þa git, for ðam
þe God sylf wæs heora wissiend þa &amp; gesette him deman þe demdon
þam folce to swiþe langum fyrste, oð þæt hi sylfe gecuron Saul him
to cyninge, swa swa us secgað bec, be Godes geþafunge on Samueles timan.
 3.5. WE willað nu secgan swutelicor be þisum, þæt þæt
Israhela folc æfter Iosuam forðsiþe, þæs æþelan heretogan,
þe hig þider gelædde, &amp; æfter geendunge þæra ealdra manna
þe Godes mihta cuðon &amp; his wundra gesawon, wunodon on þam lande
betwux hæþenum leodum, &amp; gewifodon him ongean Godes willan on þam
hæðenum mædenum þæs hæðenan mancynnes, &amp; fengon to
lufienne heora fulan þeawas, &amp; eaðelice forleton Godes gesetnysse &amp;
his halgan æ mid ealle forgeaton.
 3.8. God wearð him þa yrre for yfelum dædum, &amp;
betæhte hig Chusam, þam hæþenan cyninge, swa þæt hig þeowodon
swiðe yfelum þeowte þam hæþenan cyninge to eahta geara fyrste, &amp;
he hig ofsette &amp; geswencte forðearle.
 3.9. Hig þa eft clipodon to þam ælmihtigan Gode, &amp; he
him asende sona his fultum; gesette him anne deman, se hatte Othoniel.
 3.10. On him wæs Godes gast, &amp; he hig þa gewissode &amp;
feaht wið þone Chusan &amp; hine ofercom sona ðurh Godes sylfes fultum.
 3.11. &amp; hi syððan wunedon on fulre sybbe ealles feowertig
geara, &amp; Othoniel þa geendode his dagas.
 3.12. Eft þa Israhel æfter his forðsiþe geeacnodon heora
yfel &amp; þone ælmihtigan God mid weorcum gegremedon &amp; gewendon heora
mod fram his geleafan &amp; his æ forsawon; ða betæhte he hig eac
Eglone, þam cyninge Moabiscre ðeode.
 3.13. Se hig ofsloh swiðe &amp; heora burh gewann &amp; gewilde
hig ealle, swa þæt hig him þeowodon on micclum geswince eahtatyne gear
for heora unræde.
 3.15. Hig clipodon þa swiðe on heora geswencednisse to þam
heofonlican Gode, his helpes biddende, &amp; he him asende sona alysednisse
þurh heora agenne mæg, se hatte Aoth; him wæs gelice gewylde his
wynstre &amp; his swiðre; ða gesende þæt folc sume lac þam cyninge
þurh ðone Aoth.
 3.17. &amp; he him brohte þa lac.
 3.19. Æfter heora spræce cwæþ se Aoth him to: Eala þu
Engol cining.
 3.20. Ic hæbbe þe to secganne ures Godes ærende; uton gan
onsundron; &amp; hig sona eodon in to sumum diglan huse.
 3.21. Ða abræd Aoth bealdlice his swurd mid his wynstran handa
&amp; hine hetelice þidde, swa þæt þa hiltan eodon in to þam
innoðe, &amp; þæt smeru wand ut, for ðam þe he wæs swiðe
fætt; He forlet þa þæt swurd stician on him &amp; gewende him ut
æt sumere oþre duran, oð þæt he eft becom to his agenum geferon.
 3.25. Englon se cining læg þær swa dead.
 3.27. &amp; Aoth bleow bealdlice his horn &amp; ferde mid fultume
to gefeohte sona, &amp; ofsloh tyn ðusend Englones folces.
 3.30. &amp; he þa Moabiscan miclum geeadmette &amp; hi
underþeodde his agenum þeowte, &amp; heora land þa wæs wuniende on
sibbe æfter þisre dæde hundeahtatig geara.
 4.1. ÆFTER Aothes forðsiðe hi geeacnodon eft heora
unrihtwisnysse &amp; heora yfel ongean God.
 4.2. &amp; he hig þa betæhte sumum gramlican cininge, Iabin
gehaten.
 4.3. And he hæfde heora geweald ealles twentig geara, &amp; hig
yfele ofsette; &amp; hig þa clipodon on hira earfoðnisse to þam
mildheortan Gode, his mildsunge biddende.
 4.6. Ða asende him God sumne heretogan to, Barac gehaten, &amp;
he þa ferde mid tyn þusend mannum to þære burnan Cison, &amp; se
cining Iabin sende him togeanes anne ealdormann him swiðe getreowe, Sisarra
gehaten, mid nigonhund crætum &amp; mid ealre his fyrde to gefeohte
gearowe.
 4.14. Hwæt þa se Barac, gebyld swiðe þurh God, feaht him
togeanes mid his fyrde swiðe.
 4.15. &amp; God þa afærde þone forsædan ealdorman &amp;
ealle his meniu, ðæt hig mihtlease flugon, &amp; hig man ofsloh, þæt
hig sweltende feollon.
 4.17. &amp; Sesirra arn of his agenum cræte fram ealre þære
fyrde, geegsod þurh God, oð þæt he werig becom to anum wifmen æt
nehstan, þe him ær wæs cuð, Iahel gehaten.
 4.18. &amp; heo cwæþ to him: Gang in, la leof, to urum
getelde, ne ondræd þe nan þing; He eode þa inn earhlice swiðe, &amp;
seo wimman mid hire hwitle bewreah hine sona, let hine licgan swa ætlutian
his feondum.
 4.19. He wæs swiðe ofurnen &amp; he eðode swiðe; bæd
him drincan &amp; heo him bliþelice sealde: behelode hine eft.
 4.20. &amp; he hire cwæð to: Stand nu &amp; beheald: gif her
ænig man cume acsigende embe me, ðonne andswara þu sona þæt her nan
man ne come; &amp; he læg þær swa.
 4.21. Ða æfter litlum fyrste gelæhte seo wifman an
þæra teldsticcena &amp; stop inn digollice, gesloh ða mid anum bytle
bufan/ his þunwengan, þæt se sticca him eode ut þurh þæt heafod
in to þære eorðan, &amp; he ætforan hire spearnlode mid fotum, oð
þæt he forðferde swa mid bysmorlicum deaðe.
 4.22. &amp; Barac com sona, sohte þone Sisara; wolde hine
ofslean; ða clipode seo wimman cuðlice him to, het hine sceawian þone
þe he sohte; &amp; he geseah þa hwar Sisara læg, &amp; se teldsticca
sticode þurh his heafod.
 4.23. God þa geeadmette Iabin þone cining ætforan his folce;
&amp; hig fæstlice weoxon &amp; mid strangre mihte hine ofþrihton, oð
þæt hig mid ealle hine adilegodon.
 5.32. &amp; HI þa feowertig wintra wunedon on sibbe.
 5.32. We secgað nu eac þæt we singað be þisum on urum
sealmsange, swa swa hit sang Dauid þurh þone Halgan Gast, God heriende
þus: <foreign>Ecce inimici tui sonauerunt et qui oderunt te extollerunt capud. Fac
illis sicut Madian &amp; Sisare, sicut Iabin in torrente Cison</foreign>; ðæt ys on
urum gereorde: He cwæþ to his Drihtene, Efne nu Drihten þine fynd
hlydað &amp; þa þe þe hatiað ahebbað heord heafda; Do him swa swa
Madian &amp; swa swa Sisaran &amp; swa swa Iabin æt þam burnan Cyson.
 5.8. Hwæt sind Godes fynd buton þa fulan hæðenan &amp;
þa leasan Cristenan, þe hlydað ongean God &amp; mid unrihtwisnisse þa
earman ofsittað &amp; Godes lima dreccað, Gode to forsewennysse, ahebbende
heora heafda on healicre modignesse?
 5.11. Ac þes sealm us segð, hu him sceal getimian, swa swa
ðam eorgan Sisaran &amp; þam arleasan Iabine, þæt hi beon adilegode
fram Drihtenes halgum mannum þa þe hi huxlice her on life gedrehton.
 6.1. ÐEOS racu us segð, þe we nu ær ræddon, ðæt
þæt Israhela folc, þe we embe sprecað, siþþan gesyngodon swiðe
wið heora Drihten, &amp; he let hi to handa þam hæþenan leodscipe,
Madian gecweden.
 6.2. Ða hig miclum geswencton; &amp; heora orf genamon &amp;
heora æceras aweston &amp; ealle heora bigleofan endemes ætbrudon.
 6.2. Ða fleah þæt earme folc to fyrlenum muntum &amp;
behiddon hig on scræfum, mid hungre gewæhte; ðæt hi mihton geseon
þæt hig forsawon God, hi wurdon swa geeadmette yfele heora feondum sume
seofon gear on ðære miclan sorge; &amp; heora fynd ferdon freolice
gehwær, swa þicce swa gærstapan, on ðam godan earde &amp; þæs
eardes brucon him to bismore swa.
 6.7. Israhela folc þa earmlice clipode to þam heofonlican Gode,
his helpes biddende.
 6.14. &amp; he him foresceawode sumne heretogan, Gedeon gehaten,
heora agenes cynnes; ðam bebead God sylf þæt he sceolde faran &amp; his
folc ahreddan fram heora yrmðe, &amp; cwæð him wordum þus to: Wite
þu þæt ic ðe asende.
 7.1. GOD hine þa gestrangode, &amp; he gegaderode sona þæt
earme folc þær þær aflogene wæron, &amp; ferde ða mid fultume
þær heora fynd wicodon, swa swa him gewissode se welwillenda God.
 7.2. Ða cwæþ God sylf to him: Swiðe micel folc þu
hæfst on þinre firdinge to þam gefeohte; læt hi gecirran sume, ðe
læs þe hi secgon eft þæt hi mid hira folce hig sylfe alysdon &amp;
mid heora fultume him gefuhton sige.
 7.4. Ða geceas Gedeon, swa swa him gewissode God, þreohund wera
mid him of eallum þam werode.
 7.7. &amp; God him sæde þa: Ic sylf nu alyse eow on ðisum
þrim hundrydum, &amp; þe on hand betæhte ða Madianitiscean, þe eow
swa miclum gedrehton.
 7.16. Ðam folce wæs gewunelic þæt hi weredon byman on
ælcum gefeohte &amp; þa bleowon swiðe; ða het Gedeon his geferan
habban heora byman him mid to þære blawunge &amp; het heora ælcne
geniman anne æmtigne sester oððe anne wæterbuc to þam gewinne
forð.
 7.17. &amp; cwæþ him siþþan to: Swa swa ge geseoð
þæt ic do, doð ealle endemes æfter me sona.
 7.16. He todælde hi þa on þrim diglum floccum.
 7.19. &amp; ferde nihtes to þær heora fynd wicodon, begunnon
to blawenne mid heora byman swiðe &amp; slogon togædere ða æmtigan
sestras, &amp; tobræcon þa bucas mid micelre brastlunge.
 7.21. Wearð þa afæred eall seo hæðene fyrd þurch
heora blawunge &amp; ðæra buca sweg.
 7.22. &amp; God hi geegsode, þæt hi begunnon to sleanne ælc
heora oðerne mid hira agenum swurde on þære sweartan nihte mid
stiðlicum gefeohte.
 7.23. Hi flugon þa sume, ac him ferde æfter Gedeon swiðe
ofsleande æfre, oð þæt þær afeollon fif &amp; þrittig
ðusenda, sume þurh hi silfe, sume þurh Gedeon.
 7.25. &amp; twegen ealdormen eac, Horeb &amp; Zeb, ðær feollon
ofslagenne.
 8.12. &amp; HIM ætflugon twegen ciningas, Zebee &amp; Salmana,
ac he sohte hi georne, oð þæt he hi gelæhte; &amp; gelædde hi
ongean to his agenre fyrde; &amp; heora feorh him benam.
 8.28. Wæs þa wuniende on friðe feowertig wintra be Gedeones
wissunge.
 8.28. Be þisum we singað eac on þam foresædan sealme
ongean Godes wiðerwinnan, þe willað æfre þwyres, swa swa se Halga
Gast us sæde þurch Dauid: <foreign>Pone principes eorum sicut Oreb et Zeb et Zebee
et Psalmana</foreign>; ðæt ys on Engliscre spræce: Sete ðu ure Drihten heora
ealdormen swa swa Horeb &amp; Zeb &amp; swa swa Zebee &amp; Salmana; ðæt
is on angite þæt þa yfelan heafodmen, Godes wiðerwinnan, wurdon þa
gescinde.
 10.6. HWæT þa æfter fyrste þæt Israhela folc begunnon
to geeacnienne heora ealdan synna mid edniwum synnum on Godes gesihðe, &amp;
his æ forleton, þe he him ær gesette on þam munte Sinai.
 10.7. &amp; hine micclum gremedon, swa þæt he mid yrre hi on
hand betæhte þam hæðenan leodscipum, se hatte Amon.
 10.8. Hi wurdon ða gehergode &amp; gehynde forswiðe eahtatyne
gear under heora handa, oð þæt hig earmlice to ðam ælmihtigan
clipodon &amp; heora synna andetton mid sorhfullum mode.
 11.1. ÐA ofhearmode Gode heora yrmða sona, &amp; him
foresceawode sumne heafodman, Iepthae gehaten, &amp; him Godes gast on wæs.
 11.32. He ferde ða mid fultume &amp; heora fynd ofsloh, &amp; hi
God betæhte to his anwealde, swa þæt he þa gewann heora twenti burga,
&amp; he hi geeadmette heora unðances swa.
 12.7. &amp; HI wunodon on sibbe an &amp; ðritig geara.
 13.1. ÆFTER þisum fyrste hig fengon eft to gremienne þone
ælmihtigan God on heora ealdan wisan mid heora yfelum dædum, &amp; he hi
eac betæhte þam hæðenan folce þe hatton Philistei ealles feowertig
geara for heora misræde.
 13.2. An man wæs eardigende on Israhela þeode, Manue gehaten,
of ðære mægðe Dan: his wif wæs untymende &amp; hig wunedon butan
cilde.
 13.3. Him com þa gangende to Godes engel, &amp; cwæð
ðæt hi sceoldon habban sunu him gemæne; Se bið Gode halig fram his
cildhade &amp; man ne mot hine efsian oððe besciran; ne he ealu ne drince
næfre oþþe win, ne naht fules ne ðicge, for þam þe he onginð to
alysenne his folc, Israhela þeode, of Philistea þeowte.
 13.24. Heo acende þa sunu, swa swa hyre sæde se engel, &amp;
het hine Samson, &amp; he swiðe weoxs, &amp; God hine bletsode, &amp; Godes
gast wæs on him.
 14.5. &amp; HE wearð þa mihtig on micelre strengðe, swa
þæt he gelæhte ane leon be wege, þe hine abitan wolde, &amp;
tobræd hi to sticcum, swilce he totære sum eaðelic ticcen.
 15.8. HE begann þa to winnenne wið ða Philisteos &amp; heora
fela ofsloh &amp; to sceame tucode, þeah þe hig anweald hæfdon ofer his
leode.
 15.9. Ða ferdon þa Philistei forð æfter Samsone &amp;
heton his leode, þæt hi hine ageafon to hira anwealde, þæt hig wrecan
mihton heora teonræddenne mid tintregum on him.
 15.13. Hig ða hine gebundon mid twam bæstenum rapum &amp; hine
gelæddon to þam folce.
 15.14. &amp; ða Philisteiscan þæs fægnodon swiðe, urnon
him togeanes ealle hlydende, woldon hine tintregian for heora teonrædene;
ða tobræd Samson begen his earmas, ðæt þa rapas toburston, þe he
mid gebunden wæs.
 15.15. &amp; he gelæhte ða sona sumes assan cinban þe he
ðær funde, &amp; gefeaht wið hig &amp; ofsloh an þusend mid þæs
assan cinbane.
 15.16. &amp; cwæð to him sylfum: Ic ofsloh witodlice an
þusend wera mid þæs assan cinbane.
 15.18. He wearð þa swiðe ofþyrst for ðam wundorlican
slege &amp; bæd þone heofonlican God, þæt he him asende drincan: for
þam þe on ðære neawiste næs nan wæterscipe.
 15.19. Ða arn of þam cinbane, of anum teð, wæter, &amp;
Samson þa dranc &amp; his Drihtene þancode.
 15.21. Nu gif hwa wundrie, hu hit gewurðan mihte þæt Samson
se stranga swa ofslean mihte an þusend manna mid þæs assan cinbane,
þonne secge se mann, hu þæt gewurðan mihte, þæt God him sende
þa wæter of þæs assan teð.
 15.24. Nis þis nan gedwimor ne nan dwollic sagu, ac seo ealde
gesetniss ys eall swa trumlic, swa swa se Hælend sæde on his halgan
godspelle, þæt an stæf ne bið, ne an strica, awæged of ðære
ealdan gesetnisse, þæt hi ne beon gefyllede: gif hwa ðises ne gelyfð,
he ys ungeleafulic.
 16.1. ÆFTER þisum he ferde to Philistea lande in to anre birig
on heora anwealde, Gaza gehaten.
 16.2. &amp; hi þæs fægnodon, besetton þa þæt hus
þe he inne wunude, woldon hine geniman, mid þam þe he ut eode on
ærnemergen, &amp; hine ofslean.
 16.3. Hwæt ða Samson heora syrwunga undergeat, &amp; aras on
midre nihte tomiddes his feondum &amp; genam ða burhgatu &amp; gebær on
his hricge mid þam postum, swa swa hi belocene wæron, up to anre dune to
ufeweardum þam cnolle, &amp; eode him swa orsorh of heora gesihþum.
 16.4. Hine beswac swa þeah siððan an wif, Dalila gehaten, of
þam hæðenan folce, swa þæt he hire sæde, þurh hire swicdom
bepæht, on hwam his strengð wæs &amp; his wundorlice miht; ða
hæðenan Philistei beheton hire sceattas, wið þam þe heo beswice
Samson þone strangan.
 16.6. Ða ahsode heo hine georne mid hire olæcunge on hwam his
miht wære?
 16.7. And he hire andwirde: Gif ic beo gebunden mid seofon rapum of
sinum geworhte, sona ic beo gewyld.
 16.8. Ðæt swicole wif þa begeat þa seofon rapas, &amp; he
þurh syrwunge swa wearð gebunden.
 16.9. &amp; him mann cydde þæt þær comon his find; ða
tobræc he sona þa rapas swa swa hefelþrædas, &amp; þæt wif nyste
on hwam his miht wæs.
 16.11. He wearð eft gebunden mid eallniwum rapum &amp; he þa
tobræc swa swa þa oðre.
 16.16. Heo beswac hine swa þeah, þæt he hire sæde æt
nextan: Ic eom Gode gehalgod fram minum cildhade, &amp; ic næs næfre
geefsod ne næfre bescoren, &amp; gif ic beo bescoren, þonne beo ic
unmihtig oðrum mannum gelic.
 16.18. &amp; heo let þa swa.
 16.19. Heo þa on sumum dæge, þa þa he on slæpe læg,
forcearf his seofan loccan &amp; awrehte hine siðþan; ða wæs he swa
unmihtig swa swa oðre men.
 16.21. &amp; þa Philistei gefengon hine sona, swa swa heo hine
belæwde, &amp; gelæddon hine aweg; &amp; heo hæfde ðone sceatt, swa
swa him gewearð; Hi þa hine ablendon &amp; gebundenne læddon on heardum
raceteagum ham to heora birig, &amp; on cwearterne belucon to langre firste,
heton hine grindan æt hira handcwyrne.
 16.22. Ða weoxon his loccas &amp; his miht eft on him.
 16.23. &amp; þa Philistei full bliðe wæron, þancodon heora
gode, Dagon gehaten, swilce hig þurh his fultum heora feond gewildon.
 16.25. Ða Philistei þa micele fyrme geworhton &amp; gesamnodon
hi on sumre upflora, ealle þa heafodmen &amp; eac swilce wimmen, þreo
þusend manna, on micelre blisse: &amp; þa þa hig bliðust wæron, þa
bædon hig sume, þæt Samson moste him macian sum gamen, &amp; hine man
sona gefette mid swiðlicre wafunge &amp; heton hine standan betwux twam
stænenum swerum: On ðam twam swerum stod þæt hus eall geworht.
 16.27. &amp; Samson ða plegode swiðe him ætforan, &amp;
gelæhte þa sweras mid swiðlicre mihte, &amp; sloh hi togædere,
þæt hi sona toburston; &amp; þæt hus þa afeoll eall þæt folc
to deaðe &amp; Samson forð mid, swa þæt he miccle ma on his deaðe
acwealde, ðonne he ær cucu dyde.

ÆGenEp
B8.1.7.3.
Epilogue (Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Laud Misc. 509): Crawford 1922, 414-17.



 1. He hæfde getacnunge ures Hælendes Cristes, þe on his
agenum deaðe þone deofol gewylde &amp; his mihte oferswiðde &amp; hine
mankynnes benæmde.
 3. Ða Philistei, swa swa we her beforan sædon, besæton
þone Samson &amp; hine ofslean woldon on heora birig Gaza; ac he bær ða
gatu upp to anum beorge, to bysmore his feondum.
 5. Eall swa þa Iudeiscan, þe ofslogon urne Drihten, besetton
his birgene sona mid wearde, ac he tobræc hellegatu mid his heofonlican
mihte, &amp; of þam deofle genam þone dæl, þe he wolde, Adames
ofspringes, &amp; he eaðelice aras of ðam deaðe gesund on þam þriddan
dæge &amp; astah to heofenum to his halgan Fæder, gewunnenum sige, to
wuldre him sylfum &amp; his halgum þegnum, þam ðe he alysde.
 12. Nelle we secgan na swiðor be þisum, buton þæt se
Israhel, þe we embe spræcon, mislice ferde, oð þæt hi fengon to
ciningum, swa swa on Cininga Bocum ys full cuð be ðam.
 15. Ða Romaniscan leoda wæron eac lange eal swa buton cynegum,
ær þam ðe cristendom wære, &amp; hæfdon him <foreign>consulas</foreign>, þæt
we cweðað rædboran.
 17. Se consul sceolde him eallum wisian &amp; beon heora yldost to
anes geares fyrste; feng þonne oðer to, oðres geares firste, to þam
ylcan anwealde, &amp; eode swa abutan be heora gebyrdum &amp; be heora
geþingðum, oð þæt heora formanega oft fengon to anwealde &amp;
wunodon him on sibbe swiðe anrædlice, &amp; heold ælc oðerne on
arwurðnisse.
 23. Swa hi hæfdon ða siððan cesares ofer hig, þæt we
cweðað caseres, þa beoð cininga yldest, &amp; hi mid heora wisdome
gewyldon þa æt nehstan ealne middaneard to heora anwealde.
 25. Hi hæfdon ælce dæge heora witena gemot, &amp; wæron
gesette synderlice to ðam þa <foreign>senatores</foreign>, ðæt synd þeodwitan, þe
dæghwamlice smeadon on anum sindrian huse embe ealles folces þearfe heora
ræd kyddon siððan þam casere &amp; him gewearð anes.
 30. Gif ænig leodscipe wæs ungewylde þam casere, þonne
sende he him to swa fela eoroda, ðe mihton gebigan þæt mennisc him to,
oþþe mid egsunge þæt hig bugon to sibbe, oððe mid wige þæt hi
wurdon gewylde.
 34. Eft on þam cristendome wæs Constantinus se forma casere
ðe to Criste beah; &amp; us secgað bec þæt he sigefæst wæs
þurh þone Hælend Crist þe he gecoren hæfde.
 36. Eac his æftergengan þe on God gelyfdon wæron æfre
sigefæste þurh þone soðan God, &amp; se cristendom weox wel on heora
timan &amp; þæt ealde deofolgild wearð adwæsced þurh hi.
 40. Se yldra Theodosius swiðe oft hæfde sige on manegum
gewinne for his miclum geleafan, swa þæt on sumum gefeohte him sende God
swa micelne wind, þæt þa wæmna flugon mid swiftum gesceote swiðe on
heora find, &amp; his feonda wæmne wendon on hi sylfe &amp; fylston þam
casere, oð þæt him com to fotum his wiðerwinna gewilniende friðes.
 45. Ac þa þæs caseres cempan hine acwealdon, sona se gingra
Theodosius wæs swiðe gelyfed, &amp; he æfre his fyrde þam Hælende
betæhte, &amp; God feaht for hine &amp; his fyrde geheold, swa þæt on
sumne sæl sum his ealdormanna, þe him swiðe leof wæs, wearð
gelæht fram his feondum.
 49. Ða sende he sona to þæs ealdormannes sunu mid micclum
fultume, &amp; hi gemetton þærrihte Godes engel him togeanes gangende mid
him, se him tæhte þone weg, þe hi sylfe ne cuðon, ofer anum bradum
fenne, ðær nan fær ær næs, &amp; ofer þam wætere mid
wundorlicum færelde drium fotum ealle, swa swa Moyses dyde mid ðam ealdan
Israhel ofer þa Readan Sæ, oð þæt hi becomon þær ðær he
gehæft wæs, &amp; his fynd ofslogon mid swurdes ecge &amp; þone
ealdorman ahreddon fram heora reðnisse swa.
 56. Ðæra Perscisra cyning wæs ðam casere wiðerræde;
þa sende he his here him to &amp; he eac gegaderode of þam Saraceniscum
swiðe micele fyrde togeanes þam casere; ac Crist him sende to swa micelne
ogan, þæt hi hig sylfe adrengton an hund ðusend manna on ðære
miclan ea, Eufrates gehaten, &amp; he wolde þa frið; ða ne moste he
abugan for his manna unræde.
 62. He hæfde on his anwealde an ðusend cempena swa cene to
wige, þæt hi wæron gehatene ealle <foreign>inmortales</foreign>, þæt sindon
undeadlice; ða cwædon þæt hi woldon cunnian heora mihte on ðæs
caseres fyrde, ær þam þe hig fengon to sibbe.
 65. Hi þa ferdon to truwiende on hi silfe, &amp; ðæs caseres
fyrd feaht wið hig sona, sume foran ongean, sume ferdon hindan, oð þæt
þa undeadlican lagon ealle deade; &amp; heora cyning ða beah to þæs
caseres willan.
 69. On sumne sæl woldon þa wiðerrædan hæðenan mid
micelre fyrde faran on heregoð on þæs caseres anwealde on Romaniscre
þeode, &amp; ferdon ða to mid miclum gefilce.
 71. Ðis wearð þa gekydd ðam casere sona, &amp; he hine
gewende to his gewunelicum gebedum &amp; þæt gewinn betæhte þam
welwillendan Hælende, &amp; him raðe becom Cristes sylfes fultum, swa
þæt se heretoga þære hæðenra fyrde, Rugas gehaten, mid
heofonlicum ligette wearð sona ofslagen &amp; his geferan sume, &amp; eac
oðer fyr of heofenum þa becom &amp; forbærnde þa herelafe, ðæt
þær nan ne belaf, swilcne fultum hæfde Theodosius þurh God.
 78. On Engla lande eac oft wæron cyningas sigefæste þurh
God, swa swa we secgan gehyrdon, swa swa wæs ælfred cining, þe oft
gefeaht wið Denan, oþ þæt he sige gewann &amp; bewerode his leode; swa
gelice æðestan, þe wið Anlaf gefeaht &amp; his firde ofsloh &amp;
aflimde hine sylfne, &amp; he on sibbe wunude siþþan mid his leode.
 82. Eadgar, se æðela &amp; se anræda cining, arærde
Godes lof on his leode gehwær, ealra cininga swiðost ofer Engla ðeode,
&amp; him God gewilde his wiðerwinnan a, ciningas &amp; eorlas, þæt hi
comon him to buton ælcum gefeohte friðes wilniende, him underþeodde to
þam þe he wolde, &amp; he wæs gewurðod wide geond land.
 88. We endiað nu þisne cwide þus, þanciende ðam
ælmihtigan ealra his godnissa, se ðe æfre rixað on ecnisse, AMEN.

END_TEXT

B8.1.9.
Fragment of Exodus: (Ker in) Crawford 1922 (1969), 458-60.



 16.16. Fæt ful, þe hi gomor heton, &amp; israhela bearn dydon
swa &amp; gadrodon, sum mare sum læsse.
 16.18. Se ðe mare gaderode næfde na mare ne se þe lesse
gaderode næfre na læsse, ac ælc þæt genoh hæfde.
 16.19. Ða bead moyses him þæt hi his nan þingc ne
læfdon ofer niht.
 16.20. Þa læfdon hi hit sume oð hit morgen wæs, &amp; hit
wearð wyrmum creowyd &amp; hit forrotode; þa wæs moyses yrre &amp; hi
gaderodon on morgen þæt hi gehæfdon, &amp; þa seo sunne scean þa
formeolt hit.
 16.22. On þam syxtan dæge hi gegæderodon twyfealdlice, þa
comon þa ealdras &amp; rehton hit moyse.
 16.23. Þa cwæð he to him sæternes dæges rest is
drihtne gehalgod gearwiað to merigen þæt ge to gearwienne habbon, &amp;
healdað oþ merigen þæt þar to lafe beo.
 16.24. Þa dydon hi swa, &amp; hit ne rotode ne hi ne fundon nan
þingc fules þær on.
 16.25. And moyses cwæð etað hit to dæg forþan þe his
drihtnes risten dæg, forþam ge hit ne findaþ todæg on eorþan.
 16.26. Gaderiað hit <foreign>VI</foreign> dagas ne finde ge hit on þam
seofoþan.
 16.27. Hi eodon ut on þam seofoþon dæge &amp; ne fundon nan
þingc.
 16.28. Þa cwæð drihten to moyse hu lange nelle ge healdan
mine beboda.
 16.29. On þam <foreign>VItan</foreign> dæge he him sylð twifealdne mete; beo
ælc æt ham &amp; ne ga nan ut on þam seofoþan dæge.
 16.30. &amp; reste þæt folc hit on þam seofoðan dæge.
 16.31. &amp; nemdon þone mete man, þæs swæc wæs swylce
smedma mid hunige.
 16.33. &amp; moyses het niman þæt gemetfæt ful &amp; settan
beforan drihtne on þam getelde to healdene.
 16.35. Israhela bearn æton heofonlicne mete feowertig wintra
oþ hi comon to chanaan lande.
 17.1. Hi foron of sin þam westene &amp; wicodon on rafidim,
þær næs nan wæter.
 17.2. Þa murcnodon hi ongen moyses &amp; cwædon hwi læddest
þu us ut of egypta lande þæt ðu woldest us ofslean &amp; ure bearn mid
þurste.
 17.4. Ða clypode moyses to drihtne &amp; þus cwæð: hu
sceal ic don embe þis folc nu binnan lytlan fyrste hi wyllað me oftorfian.
 17.5. Þa cwæð drihten to moyse clypa to þe ða yltstan on
israhela folce &amp; nim þa gyrde on þine hand þe þu þæt wæter
mid sloge.
 17.6. &amp; ic stande beforan þe oppon oreb stane &amp; sleh
þone stan &amp; þæt wæter gæð ut of him þæt þæt folc
hæfð genoh to drincenne; þa dyde moyses swa.
 17.7. &amp; genemde þa stowe costnung for israhela bearna sace,
forþan þe hi cwædon is drihten mid us þe nis.
 17.8. Witodlice amalech com &amp; feaht on israhela folc on
raphidim.
 17.9. Þa cwæð moyses to Iosue ceos ðe geferan &amp; feoht
ongean amalech; Ic stande to morgen uppon þis beorge &amp; hæbbe drihtnes
gyrde on minre handa.
 17.10. &amp; Iosue dyde eall swa moyses him bebead &amp; feaht
ongean amalech; Witodlice moyses &amp; aaron &amp; ur stigon sti uppon þone
beorh.
 17.11. Þone moyses his handa up ahof, þone hæfde israhela
folc sige; gyf he þone lythwon slacode, þone hæfde amalech sige.
 17.12. Þa moyses handa wæron werige þa namon hi anne stan
&amp; ledon under himne &amp; he sæt uppon þam stane; Witodlice aaron
&amp; ur underwriþedon moyses handa on ægþre healfe &amp; hi ne slacodon
nan þing syþþan ær sunne to setle eode.
 17.13. &amp; Iosue aflimde amalech &amp; his folc mid swurdes
eccge.
 17.14. Ða cwæð drihten to moyse: Writ þis on bec to
gemynde &amp; syle iosue; Witodlice ic adilgige.
 23.8. Þu lac þa ablendað gleawne &amp; awendað rihtwisra
word.
 23.9. Ne beo þu elþeodigum gram, forþam ðe ge wæron
elþeodige on egypta lande.
 23.10. Saw <foreign>VI</foreign> gear þin land &amp; gadera his wæstmas &amp;

 23.12. Wyrc <foreign>VI</foreign> dagas &amp; geswic on þam <foreign>VIIfoðan</foreign> þæt
þin oxa &amp; þin assan hi gereston &amp; þæt þynre wylne sunu sy

 23.13. Healdað ealle þa ðingc þe ic eow sæde &amp; ne

 23.14. Ðriwa on geara gewurþiað minne freols; þu ytst

monþes tid inwra wæstma, þa þu ut fore of egypta lande; ne cymst þu
butan ælmyssan on mine gesihðe.
 23.16. Heald þa symbeltide þæs monðes frumsceatta þines
weorces, þe ðu on lande sæwst, &amp; on geres utgange þone þu
gegaderast þine wæstmas togædere.
 23.17. <foreign>III</foreign> on geare ælc wæpnedman ætywð beforan
drihtne.
 23.18. Ne offra þu þinre onsægednysse blod uppan beorman ne

 23.19. Bring þine frumsceattas to godas huse na ic sende minne
encgel þæt ðe læde into þære stowe þe ic gegearwode.
 23.21. Gym his &amp; gehyr his stemne, forþam þe he forgyfð
þone ge syngiað &amp; min nama is on him.
 23.22. Ic beo þinra feonda feond &amp; þe inn gelæde to
amareus lande.
 23.24. Ne geaðmed þu heora godas, ac tobrec hira anlicnyssa.
 23.25. Þeowiað drihtne ic blætsige eow &amp; do ælce
untrumnysse eow fram &amp; geice eower dagas &amp; aflyme þine fynd beforan
þe.
 23.28. &amp; ic asende hyrnetta þe aflymaþ efeum &amp;
chananeum twelmonþum ær þu in fare.
 23.31. Ic sette þine gemæro fram ðære readan sæ &amp;
fram þam westene oð flod.
 23.32. Nafa þu nane sibbe wið heora godas þy læs þe hi
ðe beswicon.
 26.1. He cwæð to moyse astih to drihtne þu &amp; aaron nadab
&amp; abiu &amp; hund seofontig ealde of israhela folce &amp; geeadmedað
feorr.
 26.2. Moyses ana astihþ to drihtne.
 26.3. Moyses com eft &amp; rehte þam folce ealle drihtnes word
&amp; hi cwædon anre stemne we doð ealle drihtnes word þe he spræc.
 26.4. Moyses wrat ealle drihtnes spræca &amp; aras on morgen
&amp; getimbrode an weofod æt þam munte nyþeweardan &amp; twelf meara on
twelf israhela mægþum.
 26.5. Moyses sende cnihtas þæt offrodon twelf cealfas.
 26.6. &amp; moyses nam healf þæt blod &amp; dyde on geryde
orcas &amp; get þæt oþær uppan þæt weofod &amp; rædde his boc
þam folce; &amp; hi cwædon we doð ealle þa þingc þe drihten bebead
&amp; beoð gehyrsume.
 26.8. &amp; he nam þæt blod &amp; sprengcde þæt folc
&amp; cwæð: þis is þære treowðe blod þe drihten eow behet be
allon þison spræcon.
 26.9. Moyses &amp; aaron nadab &amp; abiu &amp; hund seofontig
israhela folces ealdro astigon &amp; hi gesawon israhela god; under his foton
wæs swylce þæs stanes þe man saphiros on leden nemð &amp; swylce
seo heofone þone heo smylte byð.
 26.11. Israhela bearn gesawon drihten &amp; æton &amp; druncon.
 29.9. Syþþan þu gehalgast hira handa þu offrast an cealf;
aaron &amp; his suna settað heora handa uppan his heafod &amp; þu cwelst
hit on drihtnes gesihþe wyð ðære cyðnysse geteldes dura.
 29.12. &amp; þu smitst þæs cealfes blod mid þinum fringre
on þæs weofodes.

PPs (prose)
B8.2.1.
Psalms 1-50: Bright and Ramsay 1907, 1-122.
<catref target="PIS">


 1.1. Eadig byð se wer þe ne gæð on geþeaht unrihtwisra,
ne on þam wege ne stent synfulra, ne on heora wolbærendum setle ne sitt.
 1.2. Ac his willa byð on Godes æ, and ymb his æ he byð
smeagende dæges and nihtes.
 1.3. Him byð swa þam treowe, þe byð aplantod neah wætera
rynum.
 1.4. Þæt sylð his wæstmas to rihtre tide, and his leaf
and his blæda ne fealwiað, ne ne seariað; swa byð þam men þe we
ær ymbspræcon eall him cymð to gode þæt þæt he deð.
 1.5. Ac þa unrihtwisan ne beoð na swylce, ne him eac swa ne
limpð; ac hi beoð duste gelicran, þonne hit wind toblæwð.
 1.6. þy ne arisað þa unrihtwisan on domes dæg, ne þa
synfullan ne beoð on geþeahte þæra rihtwisena.
 1.7. For þam God wat hwylcne weg þa rihtwisan geearnedon, ac
þa unrihtwisan cumað to witum.
 2.1. Hwy ryð ælc folc, and hwi smeagað hi unnytt?
 2.2. And hwy arisað eorðcynincgas, and ealdormenn cumað
tosomne wið Gode, and wið þam þe he to hlaforde geceas, and gesmyrede;
Hi cweðað.
 2.3. Utan tobrecan heora bendas, and aweorpan heora geocu of us.
 2.4. Hwæt forstent heora spræc, cwæð se witega, þeah
hi swa cweðen; For þam se God, þe on heofonum ys, hig gehyspð, and
Drihten hyg gescent.
 2.5. And he clypað to him on his yrre, and gedrefð heora
geþeaht.
 2.6. And ic eam þeah cincg geset fram Gode ofer his ðone halgan
munt Syon, to þam þæt ic lære his willan and his æ.
 2.7. For þan cwæð Drihten to me, þu eart min sunu, nu
todæg ic ðe acende.
 2.8. Bide me, and ic þe sylle þeoda to agnum yrfe, and þinne
anwald ic gebræde ofer ðeoda gemæro.
 2.9. And ic gedo þæt þu heora wylst mid isernre gyrde, and
hi miht swa eaðe abrecan, swa se croccwyrhta mæg ænne croccan.
 2.10. Ongytað nu, kyningas, and leorniað, ge domeras, þe ofer
eorðan demað.
 2.11. þeowiað Drihtne, and ondrædað hine, blissiað on
Gode, and ðeah mid ege.
 2.12. Onfoð lare, þy læs eow God yrre weorðe, and þy
læs ge wendon of rihtum wege.
 2.13. For þæm þonne his yrre byð onæled, þonne beoð
eadige, þa þe nu on hine getrywað.
 3.1. Eala, Drihten, hwi synt swa manige minra feonda, þara þe
me swencað; for hwi arisað swa mænige wið me; Monige cweðað to
minum mode, þæt hit næbbe nane hæle æt his Gode.
 3.2. Ac hit nis na swa hy cweðað; ac þu eart, butan ælcum
tweon, min fultum, and min wuldor, and þu ahefst upp min heafod.
 3.3. Mid minre stemne ic cleopode to Drihtne, and he me gehyrde of
his þam halgan munte.
 3.4. þa ongan ic slapan and slep, and eft aras; for ðam þe
Drihten me awehte, and me upparærde.
 3.5. For ðam ic me nu na ondræde þusendu folces, þeah hi
me utan ymbþringen; ac ðu, Drihten, aris, and gedo me halne; forþam þu
eart min God.
 3.6. For ðam þu ofsloge ealle þa ðe me wiðerwearde
wæron butan gewyrhton, and þara synfulra mægen þu gebryttest.
 3.7. For þam on ðe ys eall ure hæl, and ure tohopa, and ofer
þin folc sy þin bletsuncg.
 4.1. þonne ic cleopode to þe, þonne gehyrdest þu me,
Drihten; for ðam þu eart se ðe me gerihtwisast, and on minum earfoðum
and nearonessum, þu me gerymdest.
 4.2. Gemiltsa me, Drihten, and gehyr min gebed.
 4.3. Eala manna bearn, hu lange wylle ge beon swa heardheorte wið
Gode; and hwi lufige ge idelnesse, and secað leasuncga?
 4.4. Wite ge þæt God gemyclade his ðone gehalgodan, and he
me gehyrð, þonne ic him to clypige.
 4.5. þeah hit gebyrige þæt ge on woh yrsien, ne scule ge hit
no þy hraþor þurhteon, þe læs ge syngien, and þæt unriht
þæt ge smeagað on eowerum mode forlætað, and hreowsiað
þæs.
 4.6. Offriað ge mid rihtwisnesse, and bringað þa Gode to
lacum, and hopiað to Drihtne.
 4.7. Manig man cwyð, Hwa tæcð us teala, and hwa sylð us
þa god þe us man gehæt; and is þeah geswutelod ofer us þin gifu,
þeah hi swa ne cweðen.
 4.8. þæt ys þæt þu sealdest blisse minre heortan, and
þin folc gemicladest, and him sealdest geniht hwætes, and wines, and eles,
and ealra goda, þeah hi his ðe ne ðancien.
 4.9. Ac gedo nu þæt ic mote on þam genihte, and on þære
sibbe slapan, and me gerestan; for ðam þu, Drihten, synderlice me gesettest
on blisse and on tohopan.
 5.1. Drihten, onfoh min word mid þinum earum, and ongyt mine
stemne and min gehrop, and ðenc þara worda minra gebeda.
 5.2. For ðam ic gebidde on dægred to ðe; ac gedo þæt
þu gehyre min gebed, Drihten.
 5.3. Ic stande on ærmergen beforan ðe æt gebede, and seo
þe; þæt is, þæt ic ongite þinne willan butan tweon, and eac
þone wyrce for ðam þu eart se ylca God þe nan unriht nelt.
 5.4. Ne mid þe ne wunað se yfelwillenda, ne þa unrihtwisan ne
wuniað beforan þinum eagum.
 5.5. þu hatast ealle þa þe unriht wyrcað, and þæt ne
forlætað, ne his ne hreowsiað; and þu fordest þa þe symle leasinga
specað.
 5.6. And þa manslagan, and þa swicolan þu forsyhst.
 5.7. Ic þonne hopiende to þinre þære myclan
mildheortnesse, ic gange to þinum huse, Drihten, and me gebidde to þinum
halgan altare, on ðinum ege.
 5.8. Drihten, læd me on þine rihtwisnesse fram minra feonda
willan; gerihte minne weg beforan þinre ansyne; se weg ys min weorc.
 5.9. For ðam on minra feonda muðe is leasuncg, and heora mod is
swiðe idel.
 5.10. Heora mod and heora wilnuncg ys swa deop swa grundleas pytt,
and heora tungan sprecað symle facn; ac dem him, Drihten.
 5.11. And gedo þæt hy ne mægen don þæt yfel þæt
hy þencað and sprecað; ac be þære andefne heora unrihtwisnesse
fordrif hi; for ðam hy ðe gremiað, and þine þeowas, Drihten.
 5.12. And blissian ealle, þa þe to ðe hopiað, and
fægnian on ecnesse: and þu wuna on him; and fægnian þin ealle, þa
þe lufiað þinne naman.
 5.13. For þam þu eart se Drihten þe gebletsast and geblissast
rihtwise; þu us gecoronadest and geweorðadest, and us gescyldst mid þam
scylde þinre welwilnesse.
 6.1. Drihten, ne þrea þu me on þinum yrre, ne on þinre
hatheortnesse ne swenc me.
 6.2. Ac miltsa me, Dryhten, forþam ic eom unhal, and gehæl me,
for þam eall min mægn, and eal min ban synt gebrytt and gedrefed, and min
sawl, and min mod ys swyðe gedrefed.
 6.3. Eala, Drihten, hu lange wylt þu þæt hit on ðam sy;
gehwyrf, la Drihten, to me, and alys mine sawle, and gedo me halne for þinre
mildheortnesse/.
 6.4. For ðam þa deadan, þe on helle beoð, þin ne gemunan,
ne ðe andettað, ne ne heriað, swa swa we doð.
 6.5. Ic swince on minre granunge, and ælce niht on minum bedde
ic sice and wepe, and hwilum min bedd wæte mid tearum.
 6.6. Mine eagan synt gedrefede for yrre, and ic eom forealdod
betweoh eallum minum feondum.
 6.7. Gewitað fram me ealle þa þe unriht wyrcað; forðam
þe Drihten hyrde mine wependan stefne, and God gehyrde mine healsunge, and
Drihten onfeng min gebed.
 6.8. Sceamian heora for ði, and syn gedrefede ealle mine fynd;
and gan hy on earsling, and sceamien heora swiðe hrædlice.
 7.1. Drihten, min God, to þe ic hopige; alys me fram eallum þam
þe min ehtað, and gefriða me.
 7.2. þæt næfre mine fynd ne gripen mine sawle swa swa leo;
for þam ic nat ealles hwa me ahredde and gehæle, butan þu wylle.
 7.3. Drihten, min God, gif ic to þisum, þe me nu swencað,
þæs geearnod hæbbe, þæt hi nu doð, oððe ænig unriht wið
hi gedon hæbbe.
 7.4. Oððe furðum him gulde yfel wið yfle, swa swa hi hit
geworhton; þonne ofslean me mine fynd orwigne, næs þas þe mine frynd
beon sceoldon.
 7.5. And secan mine fynd mine sawle, and þa gefon, and oftreden
on eorðan min lif, and minne weorðscipe to duste gewyrcen.
 7.6. Aris, Drihten, of þinum yrre, and rær on minra feonda
mearce, and geweorða þe sylfne þara.
 7.7. Aris, Drihten, to þinum gehate, and do swa swa þu gehete;
þæt wæs þæt þu woldest helpan unscyldegum gif þu swa dest,
þonne cymð swiðe mycel folc to þinum þeowdome.
 7.8. And þu uppastihst, and hi mid þe lætst to heofonum:
Drihten, dem folcum, and dem me.
 7.9. Drihten, dem me æfter minum gewyrhtan, and dem me æfter
minre unscæðfulnesse.
 7.10. Geenda nu þæt yfel þæra unrihtwisra, and gerece and
geræd þa rihtwisan; þu, Drihten, þe smeast heortan, and ædra, and
manna geþohtas.
 7.11. Mid rihte we secað fultum to þe, Drihten; for ðam þu
gehælst þa heortan rihtra geþohta.
 7.12. þe Drihten, þe is rihtwis dema, and strang and
geþyldig, hwæðer he yrsige ælce dæge; Bute ge to him gecyrren, se
deofol cwecð his sweord to eow.
 7.13. And he bende his bogan, se is nu gearo to sceotanne; he
teohað þæt he scyle sceotan þæt deaðes fæt, þæt synt þa
unrihtwisan he gedeð his flan fyrena, þæt he mæge mid sceotan and
bærnan þa þe her byrnað on wrænnesse, and on unðeawum.
 7.14. He cenð ælc unriht, and hit cymð him sare, and his
geferum.
 7.15. He adylfð þone pytt, and he hine ontynð, and on þone
ylcan befylð.
 7.16. Gehweorfe his sar on his heafod, and on his brægn astige
his unriht.
 7.17. Ic þonne andette Drihtne æfter his rihtwisnesse, and
herie his ðone hean naman, and lofige.
 8.1. He cwæð Eala, Drihten ure God, hu wundorlic þin nama ys
geond ealle eorðan.
 8.2. For þam ahefen ys þin myclung ofer heofonas; ge furðum,
of ðæra cilda muðe, þe meolc sucað, þu byst hered.
 8.3. þæt hi doð to bysmore þinum feondum; for ðam þu
towyrpest þine fynd, and ealle þa þe unrihtwisnesse ladiað and
scyldað.
 8.4. Ic ongite nu þæt weorc þinra fingra, þæt synd
heofonas, and mona, and steorran, þa þu astealdest.
 8.5. Drihten, hwæt is se mann, þe þu swa myclum amanst;
oþþe hwæt is se mannes sunu, þe þu oft rædlice neosast?
 8.6. þu hine gedest lytle læssan þonne englas, þu hine
gewuldrast and geweorðast, and him sylst heafodgold to mærðe, and þu
hine gesetest ofer þin handgeweorc.
 8.7. Ealle gesceafta þu legst under his fet, and under his
anwald; sceap and hryðera, and ealle eorðan nytenu.
 8.8. Fleogende fuglas, and sæfiscas, þa farað geond þa
sæwegas.
 8.9. Drihten, Drihten, ure God, hu wuldorlic þin nama ys geond
ealle eorðan.
 9.1. Ic andette Drihtne on ealre minre heortan, and ic bodige
ealle ðine wundra.
 9.2. And ic blissige, and fægnige, and herige þinne naman,
ðu hea God.
 9.3. For ðam ðu gehwyrfdest mine fynd under bæc, and hi
wæron geuntrumode, and forwurdon beforan ðinre ansyne.
 9.4. For ðam þu demst minne dom and mine spræce, and eall
for me dydest þæt ic don sceolde: ðu sitst on ðam hean setle, þu
ðe symle demst swiðe rihte.
 9.5. ðu ðreast and bregst þa ðeoda þe us ðreatigað,
and ða unrihtwisan forweorðað; and ðu adilgast heora naman on worulda
woruld.
 9.6. Seo redelse, and þæt geþeaht urra feonda geteorode,
ða hi hit endian sceoldan, and heora ceastra þu towurpe ealle.
 9.7. And heora gemynd onweg gewat mid þam myclan hlisan, and
Drihten þurhwunað on ecnesse.
 9.8. And he gearwað his domsetl, and he demð ealre eorþan
swyðe emne.
 9.9. He demð folcum mid rihte, he ys geworden friðstow
ðearfendra.
 9.10. And gefultumend þu eart, Drihten, æt ælcere ðearfe;
for ðy hopiað to þe, ealle þa ðe witan þinne naman.
 9.11. For ðam þu ne forlætst nanne þara þe ðe secð;
heriað forði Drihten, þone ðe eardað on Sion.
 9.12. And bodiað betweoh folcum his wundru; forðam he nis na
ofergeotol þara gebeda his þearfena, ac he is swyþe gemyndig heora blod
to wrecanne.
 9.13. Gemiltsa me, Drihten, and geseoh mine eaðmetto, hu earmne
me habbað gedon mine fynd; for ðam þu eart se ylca God, þe me uppahofe
fram deaðes geatum, to þam þæt ic bodade eall þin lof on ðam
geatum þære burge Hierusalem.
 9.14. Ic fægnie on þinre hælo, ðe þu me sylest; and
ða ðeoda þe min ehtað syn afæstnode on ðam ylcan earfoðum, þe
hi me geteohhod hæfdon, and heora fet synt gefangene mid þy ilcan gryne,
þe hi me gehyd and gehealden hæfdon.
 9.15. For þam byð Drihten on his rihtum domum, and on his
handgeweorce byð gefangen se synfulla.
 9.16. And þa unrihtwisan beoð gehwyrfede to helle, and ælc
folc þæra ðe God forgyt.
 9.17. For þam God ne forgyt his ðearfan oð heora ende, ne
heora geþyld ne forweorð oþ ende.
 9.18. Aris, Drihten, þy læs se yfelwillenda mæge don
þæt he wille; and gedo þæt eallum folcum sy gedemed beforan ðe.
 9.19. Gesete, Drihten, ofer hy sumne anwald, þæt hig gelære
þæt hy witon þæt hi men synt.
 9.20. Drihten, hwi gewitst þu swa feor fram us, and hwi noldest
þu cuman to us, to þære tide þe us nydþearf wæs?
 9.21. þonne se unrihtwisa ofermodegað, þonne byð se earma
ðearfa onæled and gedrefed, and eac geunrotsod; ac weorðon þa
unrihtwisan gefangene on þam geþohtum, þe hi geþoht habbað.
 9.22. For þam se synfulla byð hered þær he his yfelan
willan wyrcð, and hine bletsiað þa yfelan for his yfelan dædum.
 9.23. Se synfulla bysmrað Drihten, and for þære menigu his
unrihtes, he ne geðencð þæt God hit mæg gewrecan.
 9.24. For þam he ne deð god beforan his modes ansyne; for þam
beoð his wegas and his weorc eal neh unclæne.
 9.25. For þam he næfð nan gemynd Godes doma beforan his
ansyne, þæt he mæge rixian, and wealdan ealra his feonda, and don him
to yfele þæt þæt he wylle.
 9.26. And he cwyð on his mode, Ne wyrð þisses næfre nan
wending, butan mycelre frecennesse minra feonda.
 9.27. His muð byð symle full wyrignessa, and bitera worda, and
facnes, and searuwa.
 9.28. And under his tungan byð ealne weg oþera manna sar and
geswinc; he syt symle on geþeahte mid þam welegum dygollice, to þam
þæt he mæge fordon þa unsceðþendan.
 9.29. And þreatað þone earman mid his eagum, and sætað
his digollice, swa swa leo deð of his hole.
 9.30. He sætað þæt he bereafige þone earman, and
þæs wilnað; and þonne he hine gefangen hafað mid his gryne, þonne
genæt he hine, and þonne he hine hæfð gewyldne, þonne aginð he
sylf sigan, oððe afylð.
 9.31. He cwæð ær on his mode, Ne geþencð God
þyllices, ac ahwyrfð his eagan, þæt he hit næfre ne gesyhð.
 9.32. Aris, Drihten, min God, and ahefe upp þine hand ofer ða
unrihtwisan, and ne forgit þone þearfan on ende.
 9.33. For þam bysmrað se unrihtwisa Drihten; for ðam he
cwyð on his mode, Ne recþ God, þeah ic þus do.
 9.34. Gesyhst þu nu, cwæð se witega to Drihtne hwylc broc,
and hwylc sar we þoliað and þrowiað; Nu hit wære cyn þæt þu
hit him wræce mid þinre handa; Ic þearfa eom, nu to ðe forlæten;
þu eart fultumiend þara þe nabbað nawðer ne fæder ne modor.
 9.35. þu forbrycst þone earm, and þæt mægen þæs
synfullan; for þy, þeah hine hwa ahsode, for hwi he swa dyde; þonne ne
mihte he hit na gereccan, ne geþafa beon nolde, þæt he untela dyde.
 9.36. Drihten rixað on ecnesse, on þisse worulde ge on
þære toweardan; for þæm weorðað aworpene þa synfullan of
ægðrum his rica.
 9.37. Drihten gehyrð þa wilnunga his þearfena, and heora
modes gyrnesse gehyrað þine earan.
 9.38. Dem nu, Drihten, þearfe þæs earman, and þæs
eaðmodan, þæt se awyrgeda ne ece, þæt he hine leng myclie ofer
eorðan.
 10.1. Hwy lære me þæt ic fleo geond muntas and geond
westenu, swa spearwa; for þam ic getrywe Drihtne?
 10.2. Ic wat þeah, for þam þe þa synfullan bendað heora
bogan, and fyllaþ heora coceras mid flanum, to þam þæt hi magon
sceotan þa unscyldigan heortan dygollice, þonan hi læst wenað.
 10.3. For þam hi wilniað þæs þe hi magon, þæt hi
toweorpen þæt God geteohhad hæfð to wyrcanne: hwæt dyde ic
unscyldega wið hi, oþþe hwæt mæg ic nu don?
 10.4. Drihten ys on his halgan temple, se Drihten se þæs setl
ys on heofenum.
 10.5. His eagan lociað on his earman þearfan, his bræwas
þæt ys his rihta dom ahsað manna bearn.
 10.6. Se ylca Drihten ahsað rihtwise and unrihtwise; þæt
heora ægðer secge hwæt he dyde, þæt he him mæge gyldan be heora
gewyrhtum for ðam se þe lufað unriht, he hatað his agene sawle.
 10.7. Drihten onsent manegra cynna witu, swa swa ren, ofer ða
synfullan; and hi gewyrpð mid grine, and he onsent fyr ofer hig, and
ungemetlice hæto þære sunnan, and wolberende windas, mid þyllicum,
and mid manegum þyllicum beoð heora drincfatu gefyldu.
 10.8. For þam God ys swyðe rihtwis, and he lufað
rihtwisnesse, and heo byð symle swyðe emn beforan him.
 11.1. Gehæl me, Drihten, for þam haligdom is nu on þisum
tidum/ full neah asprungen, and soðfæstnes ys swyðe gelytlod.
 11.2. Idla spræca hi sprecað to heora nyhstum, facen hi
sprecað mid heora weolorum; for þam hi nabbað on heora mode, þæt hi
on heora muðe sprecað, ac þencað yfel, þeah hi hwilum tela cweðen.
 11.3. Ac Drihten towyrpð ealle þa facnesfullan weoloras, and
þa oferspræcan, and þa yfelspræcan tungan.
 11.4. þa þe teohhiað þæt hi scylen hi sylfe weorðian
mid idelre spræce; hy cweðað, Hwi ne synt we muðfreo, hu ne moton we
sprecan þæt we wyllað, hwæt ondræde we hwylc hlaford mæg us
forbeodan urne willan?
 11.5. Ac Drihten cwyð, For yrmðum þæra wædlena, and
for granunge þæra þearfena, ic arise.
 11.6. Ac hi sette on mine hælo, and ic do swyðe treowlice ymb
hy.
 11.7. Godes word cwæð Dauid beoð swiðe soð, and swiðe
clænu; hy beoð swa hluttur swa þæt seolfor, þe byþ seofon siðon
amered, syþþan se ora adolfen byð.
 11.8. þu, Drihten, gehælst us, and gefreoðast fram heora
yfle on ecnesse.
 11.9. ðeah þa unrihtwisan us utan began on ælce healfe, and
heora sy mycle ma þonne ure; þeah þu us tobrædst ongean hy, and wið
hi gefriðast.
 12.1. Hu lange wilt þu, Drihten, min forgitan, hwæðer þu
oð minne ende wylle; oððe hu lange wilt þu ahwyrfan þinne andwlitan
fram me?
 12.2. Hu lange sceal ic settan on mine sawle þis sorhfulle
geþeaht, and þis sar æt minre heortan; hwæþer ic ælce dæge
scyle?
 12.3. Hu lange sceal min feond beon uppahafen ofer me; Beseoh to
me, Drihten, min God, and gehyr me.
 12.4. Onliht mine eagan, þæt hi næfre ne slapan on swylcum
deaðe.
 12.5. þy læs æfre min feond cweðe, Ic eom strengra
þonne he; þa þe me swencað hy fægniað gif ic onstyred beo; ac ic
þeah on þine mildheortnesse gelyfe.
 12.6. Min heorte blissað on þinre hælo, and ic singe þam
Gode þe me eall god syleð, and lofie þinne naman, þu hehsta God.
 13.1. Se unrihtwisa cwyð on his mode, Nis nan God þe þis
wite, oððe wræce: þonne byð þæt folc for þam cwyde gewemmed,
and gescynded on heora wonwillan.
 13.2. Nis nan þe eallunga wel do, ne forðon anlepe.
 13.3. Drihten locað of heofenum ofer manna bearn, and hawað
hwæðer he geseo ænigne þæra, þe hine sece, oþþe hine
ongite.
 13.4. Ac hi hine fleoð ealle endemes, and secað and lufiað
þæt hy syn idle and unnytte: nis heora furðum an, þe eallunga wel do.
 13.5. Hi synt byrgenum gelice, seo byð utan fæger, and innan
ful; heora tungan wyrcaþ mycel facn: þeah hi fægere sprecon, heora
geþeaht, and heora willa, and heora weorc, byð swylce þære wyrrestan
nædran attor, þa mon aspis hæt.
 13.6. Dara muð byð symle full wyrignessa, and bitera worda,
heora fet beoð swiðe hraðe blod to ageotanne, unþearfes, for yflum
willan.
 13.7. And heora wegas beoþ symle gedrefede; hie wilniað ealle
mægne oþera manna unsælþa, and him cymð sylfum þæt ylce: ne
secað hi nane sibbe.
 13.8. Ne Godes ege ne byð beforan heora modes eagum; Hwi ne
ongitað ealle, þe unriht wyrcað.
 13.9. Þa þe wilniað fretan min folc swa ænne hlaf; þa ne
clypiað to Gode mid godum weorcum: hwi ne ongitað hi, þæt him cymð,
þonne hi læst wenað, ege and ungelimp?
 13.10. Hwy ne ongitað hi, þæt God byð mid þam rihtwisran
folce; Hwi gedrefe ge mines yrminges geþeaht; for þam God ys min
geþeaht.
 13.11. Hwa arist elles of Syon to þæm þæt he sylle
Israelum hælo, butan þu, Drihten, þe afyrst hæftnyd of þinum
folce?
 13.12. Blissie nu, Iacobes cyn, and fægnian Israele.
 14.1. Drihten, hwa eardað on þinum temple, oððe hwa mot
hine gerestan on þæm halgan munte?
 14.2. þa andswarode Drihten þæs witgan mode, þurh
onbryrdnesse þæs halgan gastes; and cwæð se witga, Ic wat, þeah ic
ahsige, Hwa þær eardað; Se þe ingæð butan wamme, and wyrcð
rihtwisnesse.
 14.3. And se þe sprycð rihtwisnesse mid his tungan, and
næfð nan facn on his mode.
 14.4. Ne his nyhstan nan yfel ne deð, ne nan edwit ne underfehð
wið his nyhstan.
 14.5. And se þe þone awrygdan for nawuht hæfð, and se þe
þone rihtwisan weorþað, þone þe Godes ege hæfð.
 14.6. Se þe his nyhstan swereð, and hine mid treowum ne
beswicð, and se þe his feoh to unrihtum wæstmsceatte ne syleð, ne
nanes feos ne wilnað æt þam unscyldigan onfon.
 14.7. Se þe þus deð, ne wyrð he næfre astyred, ne scynd,
on ecnesse.
 15.1. Gehealde me, Drihten, forþam ic hopige to ðe: hu ne
sæde ic þe, Drihten, þæt þu eart min God; for þam þu me eall
þa good sealdest þe ic hæbbe, and þe heora nan nydþearf nis eft on
me to nimenne.
 15.2. Drihten gefylde ealne minne willan, and me forgeaf, þæt
ic moste ofercuman þa þeoda, þe me ungeðwære wæron, and heora
hergas toweorpan, æfter minum agnum willan.
 15.3. Heora unmiht, and heora untrymð is swiðe gemanigfealdod;
nu swyðe hraðe hi forwurðað.
 15.4. Ne gaderie ic nan folc to unrihtum gewinne, swa swa hi doð;
ne ic ne clypige to heora godum, ne to heargum ne gebidde mid mine muðe.
 15.5. For þam þu, Drihten, eart se dæl mines yrfes, and se
calic minre blisse; and þu eart se þe me geedniwodest min rice.
 15.6. þu gedydest þæt we mætan ure land mid rapum, and
min hlyt gefeoll ofer þæt betste; for þam is min land nu foremære,
and me swyðe unbleo.
 15.7. Ic bletsige þone Drihten, þe me sealde andgit; ac þeah
he me þara uterrena gewinna gefreode, þeah winnað wið me þa inran
unrihtlustas, dæges and nihtes, þæt ic ne eom þeah eallunga orsorh.
 15.8. Ic ongit Drihten, and he byð symle beforan þære ansyne
mines modes; for þæm he bið simle on minum fultume, þæt ic ne beo
eallunga oferswiðed.
 15.9. For þæm þingum, min mod is gelustfullod, and ic cyðe
þa blisse on minre tungan, and on þæm tohopan ic me syððan gereste.
 15.10. For þæm þu ne forlætst mine sawle, ne min mod to
helle; ne þinne gehalgodan ne lætst forrotian, ne forweorðan.
 15.11. þu me gedydest lifes wegas cuðe, and gefylst me mid
gefean, beforan þinre ansyne; for ælc riht lustbærnes cymð þurh
þinne fultum, þæm þe heo cimð on ecnesse.
 16.1. Gehyr, Drihten, min gebed, and ongit mine rihtwisnesse.
 16.2. And onfoh mid þinum earum min gebed; for þon þu wast
þæt ic butan facne to þe cleopige: beforan þe sy se dom betwuh me and
him; geseon þine eagan þone rihtan dom betwuh us.
 16.3. þu hæfst afandod min mod, and þu come to me on niht,
and me gemettest unrotne, and me sude mid þam fyre monegra earfoða, swa swa
gold oþþe seolfor; and þu ne fundest on me nan unriht wiþ hi.
 16.4. Ne ic furðum nanum menn ne sæde eal þa earfoða, þe
hi me dydon; for þam wordum þinra weolora ic geþolode hearde wegas, and
manigfeald/ earfoðu.
 16.5. Geriht, Drihten, mine stæpas on þine wegas, þæt ic
ne aslide, þær þær ic stæppan scyle.
 16.6. For þam ic clypige symle to þe, forþam þu symle me
gehyrdest; onhyld nu þine earan to me, and gehyr min word.
 16.7. Gewundra nu, and geweorða þine mildheortnesse on me, þu
þe symle gehælst þa þe to ðe hopiað, and hi gehyldst wið þa
þe winnað wið þinne willan.
 16.8. Geheald me, Drihten, and beorh me, swa swa man byrhð þam
æplum on his eagum mid his bræwum; gehyd me under þinra fiðera
sceade, wið þara unrihtwisena ansyne, þe wilniað þæt hi me
fordon.
 16.9. Mine fynd me ymbhringdon utan on ælce healfe, and hi
habbað ealle heora fætnesse, and heora tohopan, and heora weolan, swiþe
orsorhlice utan bewunden, and sprecað nu for þi swiðe ofermodlice.
 16.10. Hy habbað me swyðe forsewenlice utan ymbstanden; þa
eagan heora modes habbað geteohhad, þæt hi me gebygen oð eorðan.
 16.11. Hy sætiað min, and sittað swa gearwe swa se leo
deð to þam þe he gefon wyle, and swa swa his hwelp byð gehyd æt
þære sæte.
 16.12. Aris, Drihten, and cum to me ær ær hie cumen, and
gehwyrfe hi fram me, and ahrede mine sawle æt þam unrihtan wisan, and of
þære wræce minra feonda alys me, mid þinre handa, and mid þine
mægene.
 16.13. Drihten, gedo þæt heora menigo sy læsse þonne ure
feawena nu is, and tostencte hi geond eorþan libbende of þis lande; gefyl
hie nu mid þære witnunga, þe þu lange gehyd hæfdest, and þeah him
geteohhod.
 16.14. Weorþen hi swa geðræste mid hungre, þæt hi eton
swynen flæsc þæt Iudeum unalyfedlic ys to etanne and þæt þæt
hi læfon healdan heora bearnum and heora bearna bearnum.
 16.15. Ic þonne rihtwis me oðywe beforan þinre ansyne, and
beo þonne gefylled ealles goodes, þonne me byð æteawed ðin wuldor.
 17.1. Ic þe lufige, Drihten, for þæm þu eart min mægen;
Drihten, þu eart min trymenes, and min friðstow.
 17.2. þu eart min alysend, and min God, and min gefultumend, to
þe ic hopige.
 17.3. þu eart min scyldere, and se horn minre hælo, þu eart
min fultumend; herigende ic clypige to þe, Drihten, and fram minum feondum
ic weorðe ahredd.
 17.4. Me ymbhringdon sar, and sorga, and granung, ful neah oð
deað; and geotende stream unrihtwisnessa minra wiðerweardra me gedrefdon.
 17.5. Me ymbhringdon sar and manigfeald witu, ful neah anlic helle
witum, and deaðes grynu me gefengon, and on eallum minum earfoðum ic
clypige to Drihtne, and to minum Gode ic cige.
 17.6. And he gehyrde of his þam halgan temple mine stemne, and
min gehrop com beforan his ansyne, and eac on his earan hit eode.
 17.7. And astyred wæs and acwacode seo eorðe minra feonda, and
se grundweall þara munta wæs tohrered; þæt is þæt mægen minra
ofermodena feonda hy wæron astyrede, for þam him wæs God yrre.
 17.8. For þam astah smec for his yrre, and fyr blysede beforan
his ansyne.
 17.9. Gleda wæron onælde fram him; he onælde heofonas, and
astah me on fultum; and seo eorðe wæs gesworcen and aðystrod under his
fotum.
 17.10. And he astah eft ofer cherubin, and he fleah; and he fleah
ofer winda fiðeru.
 17.11. And let þystru betwux him and minum feondum, þæt he
wæs/ næfre gesewen fram him, and he wæs þeah swiðe leoht on his
temple; þa hangode swiðe þystru wæter on þam wolcnum, and on
þære lyfte.
 17.12. And þa urnan swa swa ligetu beforan his ansyne, and he
gemengde hagol and fyres gleda.
 17.13. And worhte þunorrada on heofonum, and se hyhsta sealde his
stemne.
 17.14. He sende his strælas, and hi tostencte, and
gemanigfealdode his ligeta, and gedrefde hig mid þy.
 17.15. And eorðan wæter ut fleowan, and seo eorðe wæs
astyred, and on manegum stowum gehropen.
 17.16. For þinum þrean, and for þinum yrre.
 17.17. Drihten sende of his heanesse, and ahredde me æt þam
ofermætum wæterum.
 17.18. And of minum strengestum feondum, and for eallum þam þe
me hatedon; for þam hi wæron gestrangode ofer me.
 17.19. Hie me bregdon swiðe swiðlice on þam dagum, þe ic
geþræsted wæs, and Drihten wæs geworden min scyld, and he me
gelædde on rymet of minum nearonessum, and gedyde me halne, for þam he me
wolde.
 17.20. And he me geald æfter minre rihtwisnesse, and æfter
þære unscæðfulnesse minra handa he me geald.
 17.21. For þam ic heold Godes wegas, and his bebodu, and ic ne
dyde arleaslice, ne unhyrsumlice wið minne Drihten.
 17.22. For þam ealle his domas beoð symle beforan minre ansyne,
and his rihtwisnessa ic ne awearp fram me.
 17.23. For ði ic weorðe unwemme beforan him, and ic me behealde
wið min unriht.
 17.24. And me gylt Drihten æfter minre rihtwisnesse, and
æfter þære unscæðfulnesse minra handa beforan his eagum.
 17.25. Ac beo þu halig, Drihten, wið þa halgan, and
unsceðfull wið þa unsceðfullan, and gecoren wið þa gecorenan, and
hwyrf þe wið þa forhwyrfdan.
 17.26. For þam ic wat þæt þu symle eadmod folc gehælst,
and þa eagan þara ofermodena þu geeaðmetst.
 17.27. For þam þu onælest min leohtfæt; Drihten, min God,
onlyht mine þystru.
 17.28. For þam ic weorðe fram þe alysed æt costingum, and,
þurh mines Godes fultum, ic utgange ofer minre burge weall, þeah heo sy
utan behringed mid minum feondum.
 17.29. Drihten, min God, unwemme synt þine wegas: Godes word synt
amered on fyre; he is gefriþiend ælces þara, þe him tohopað.
 17.30. Hwylc ys God butan uran Gode; oððe hwylc Drihten butan
urum Drihtne?
 17.31. Se God me gegyrde mid mægnum, and mid cræftum, and
gesette mine wegas unwemme.
 17.32. He gedyde mine fet swa geræde swa swa heorotum, and me
gesette ofer heanesse.
 17.33. He gelærde mine handa to gefeohte, and he gedyde mine
earmas swa strange swa ærenne bogan.
 17.34. And þu, Drihten, sealdest me gescyldnesse þinre hælo,
and þin swiðre hand me underfeng, and þin lar me getyde.
 17.35. þu gebræddest mine stæpas under me, þæt mine
fet ne slideredon.
 17.36. Ic ehte minra feonda, and ic hie gefeng, and ic ne geswac,
ær hie forwurdon; ic hie gebigde þæt hie ne mihton gestandan ongean me,
ac feollon under mine fet.
 17.37. þu me begyrdest mid mægenum, and mid cræftum to
wige.
 17.38. þu gedydest me underþeodde þa þe wið me upp
arison, and minra feonda bæc þu onwendest to me, and me hine gesealdest,
and þu tostenctest þa þe me hatedon.
 17.39. Hy clypodon, and næs þara þe hig gehælde; hy
clypodon to heora godum, and hy noldon gehyran.
 17.40. For þam ic hi todælde swa smæle, and swa swa dust
beforan winde, and hi adilgode swa swa wind deð dust on herestrætum.
 17.41. Gefriða me, Drihten, wið þises folces unhyrsumnesse;
for þam þu me gesettest him to heafde, and eac oðrum ðeodum.
 17.42. And þæt folc me þeowode, þæt ic næfre ne
cuðe; hy onhyldan heora earan to minum wordum, and gehyrdon me.
 17.43. Ac þa ælðeodgan bearn me oft lugon, and, þeah hi
forealdedon on minum ðeowdome, hy healtodan on heora wegum, for þam hi hyra
willum ne heoldon Iudea æ.
 17.44. Min Drihten leofað symle, and he byð symle gebletsad,
and he is upahafen, Drihten min Hælend.
 17.45. Þu eart soð God, þu þe me sealdest þæt ic
meahte swylc wite don minum feondum, and me swylc folc underþydest.
 17.46. Þu eart min alysend fram þam þeodum þe wið me
yrsiað, and me upp ahefst ofer ða þe arison wið me, and fram þam
unrihtwisan were þu me alysdest.
 17.47. For þam ic ðe andette, Drihten, beforan folcum, and on
þinum naman ic singe sealmas.
 17.48. Gemycla nu, and gemonigfealda þa hælo þæs cynges,
ðe/ ðu gesettest ofer folcum; and do mildheortnesse þinum gesmyredan
Dauide, and his cynne on ecnesse.
 18.1. Heofonas bodiað Godes wuldor, and his handgeweorc bodiað
þone rodor.
 18.2. Se dæg segð þam oðrum dæge Godes wundru, and seo
niht þære nihte cyð Godes wisdom.
 18.3. Nis nan folc on eorðan, ne nan mennisc geþeode, þe ne
gyrre/ mistlica Godes gesceafta.
 18.4. Ofer ealle eorðan færð heora stemn, ofer ealle
eorðan endas heora word.
 18.5. Drihten timbrede his templ on þære sunnan: seo sunne
arist swiðe ær on morgen up, swa swa brydguma of his brydbure.
 18.6. And heo yrnð swa egeslice on hyre weg, swa swa gigant
yrnð on his weg; heo stihð oð þæs heofenes heanesse, and þanon
astihð; and swa yrnð ymbutan, oð heo eft þyder cymð; ne mæg hine
nan man behydan wið hire hæto.
 18.7. Godes æ is swiðe unleahtorwyrðe, for þæm heo
hwyrfð manna mod and heora sawla to Gode; Godes bebod is swiðe getrywe,
Godes rihtwisnessa synt swiðe rihta, for ðæm hy geblissiað manna
heortan; Godes bebod is swiðe leoht, hit onliht þa eagan; ægþer ge
modes ge lichaman.
 18.8. Godes ege is swiðe halig, he þurhwunað a worlda world;
Godes domas synt swiðe soðe, hi synt gerihtwisode on him sylfum.
 18.9. Hy synt ma to lufianne þonne gold oððe deorwurðe
gimmas, and hi synt swetran ðonne hunig oððe beobread.
 18.10. For þæm ðin ðeow hi hylt; on heora gehyldnesse is
mænig edlean.
 18.11. Hwa ongyt his uncysta; from þæm ðe me beholen synt,
geclænsa me, Drihten, and from ælðeodegum feondum spara me þinne
ðeow, Drihten.
 18.12. Gif mine fynd ne ricsiað ofer me, þonne beo ic unwemme,
and beo geclænsod from þæm mæstum scyldum; ac gif hi me abysgiað,
þonne ne mæg ic smeagan mine unscylda, ne eac ðinne willan ne mæg
smeagan to wyrcanne.
 18.13. Gif ðu me þonne fram him alyst, þonne sprece ic
þæt þe licað, and mines modes smeaung byð symle beforan ðinre
ansyne.
 18.14. Drihten, þu eart min fultum, and min alysend.
 19.1. Gehyre ðe Drihten on þæm dæge þinra earfoða,
gefriðie þe se nama Iacobes Godes.
 19.2. And onsende þe fultum of his þam halgan temple, and of
Sion gehæl ðe.
 19.3. Gemyndig sy Drihten ealra þinra offrunga, and þin
ælmesse sy andfengu.
 19.4. Gylde þe Drihten æfter ðinum willan, and eall ðin
geðeaht he getrymie.
 19.5. þæt we moton fægnian on ðinre hælo, and on
ðæm naman Drihtnes ures Godes we syn gemyclade.
 19.6. Gefylle, Drihten, eall þin gebedu: nu we ongitað þæt
Drihten wile gehælan his þone gesmyredan, and ðone gehalgodan, and he
hine gehyrð of his þam halgan heofone: swiðe mihtig is seo hælo his
ðære swyðran handa.
 19.7. On rynewænum, and on horsum, ure fynd fægniað, and
þæs gilpað; we þonne on þæm naman Drihtnes ures Godes us
micliað.
 19.8. Hy synd nu gebundne, and hi afeollon, and we soðlice
arison, and synt uppahafene.
 19.9. Drihten, gehæl urne kyning, and gehyr us on ðæm
dæge, þe we ðe to clypiað.
 20.1. Drihten, on ðinum mægene nu blissað ure kyning, and
for þinre hælo he fægnað swiðe swiðlice.
 20.2. For ðæm þu him sealdest his modes willan, and þæs
þe he mid his weolorum wilnade, þæs þu him ne forwyrndest.
 20.3. Mid þære swetnesse þinra bletsunga þu wære
hrædra to his fultume þonne he wende; þu sendest his heafod kynegold,
mid deorwyrþum gimmum astæned.
 20.4. He bæd langes lifes, and þu hit him sealdest a worlda
world.
 20.5. Swiðe micel is his wuldor.
 21.1. Drihten, Drihten, min God, beseoh to me; hwi forlete þu me
swa feor minre hælo?
 21.2. Ic clypige dæges and nihtes to ðe, and andette mine
scylda, and seofige min ungelimp, and þu hit ne gehyrst: ac ne understand
þu hit me to unrihtwisnesse, for ðæm ic þe nane oðwite, þæt
þu me ne gehyrst, ac minum agnum scyldum ic hit wite.
 21.3. ðu wunast on halgum stowum, Drihten, Israela lof: to þe
hopedon ure fæderas, hi hopedon to þe, and þu hi alysdest.
 21.4. Hy clypodon to ðe, and hi wurdon for ði gehælde; hi
hopedon, and hi þæs ne sceamode.
 21.5. Ic eam wyrme gelicra ðonne men; for þam ic eom worden
mannum to leahtrunge, and to forsewennesse, and ic eom utaworpen fram him of
heora gesomnunga, swa þes wyrm.
 21.6. ælc þæra þe me gesyhð, he me forsyhð mid
onscunað; hi sprecað mid heora welerum, and wecgað heora heafdu, and
cweðað.
 21.7. He hopode to Drihtne, alyse he hine; nu he gealp, þæt he
hine lufode.
 21.8. Drihten, þu eart se þe me gelæddest of minre modor
innoðe; þu wære min tohopa, syþþan ic fram minre modor breoston
gelæd wæs; þinre gymenne ic wæs beboden; syððan ic of hire
innoðe eode, þu wære min God.
 21.9. Ne gewit þu fram me; for þam me synt earfoðu swyðe
neh, and nis nan oþer þe wylle oððe mæge me gehelpan.
 21.10. Me ymbhringdon swiðe mænige calfru, þæt synt lytle
and niwe fynd and þa fættan fearas me ofsæton, þæt synd strengran
fynd.
 21.11. Hi todydon heora muð ongean me, swa swa leo, þonne he
geonað, and grymetað, and gefehð þæt þæt he wyle: eall min
mægen is tostenced, and to nauhte worden, swa swa þæt wæter,
þæt þe byð utagoten.
 21.12. Min heorte and min mod is gemolten, swa þæt weax, on
innan me.
 21.13. And min mægen ys forsearod, swa swa læmen crocca, and
min tunge ys gecleofod to minum gomum, and to deadum duste ful neah mine fynd
me geworhton.
 21.14. For ðan me ymbhringdon swiðe mænige hundas, and seo
gegaderung þara awyrgedra me ofsæton.
 21.15. Hy þurhdulfon mine handa and mine fet, and gerimde eall
min ban þæt ys min mægn, and mine getrywan frynd, þam ic getruwode,
swa wel swa minum agenum limum.
 21.16. Hy min hawodon and me beheoldon, and gedældan him min
hrægl, and þæt tohlutan.
 21.17. Ac, la Drihten, ne afyr þinne fultum fram me, ac loca to
minre generennesse.
 21.18. Ahrede mine sawle æt heora sweordum, and of þæs
hundes handa, min lif.
 21.19. Gefriða me of þæs leon muðe, and of þam hornum
þara anhyrna gefriða me yrming.
 21.20. Ic þonne bodie þinne naman minum broðrum; on midre
heora gesomnunge ic þe herie, and cweþe to him.
 21.21. Se þe Drihten ondræde herie hine, eall Iacobes cynn.
 21.22. Ondræde hine eall Israela cynn, for þam he na
forsyhð, ne ne awyrpð earmra manna gebeda, ne he his andwlitan ne awende
fram me; ac þonne ic clypode to him, þonne gehyrde he me.
 21.23. Beforan þe byð min lof on þære myclan cyrcan; ic
gylde min gehat Drihtne, beforan þam þe hine ondrædað.
 21.24. þonne etaþ þa þearfan, and hi beoð gefyllede, and
heriað þonne Drihten þa þe hine secað.
 21.25. And heora heortan onfoð mægene, and libbað a worlda
world: þonne gemunan þæt eall eorðgemæru, and gecyrrað ealle to
Drihtne.
 21.26. And gebiddað hy to him ealle þeoda, and ælc cynn; for
þam ðe Drihtnes synd þa ricu, and he wylt ealra þeoda.
 21.27. Hy etað, and hy gebiddað ealle þa welegan, geond þas
eorþan; beforan his ansyne cumað ealle þa þe on eorðan astigað.
 21.28. And min sawl him leofað, and min sæd him þeowað.
 21.29. And hy bodiað Drihten, ure cyn þæt æfter us
cymð; and heofonas bodiað his rihtwisnesse þam folcum þe þonne beoð
acende, þa worhte Drihten.
 22.1. Drihten me ræt, ne byð me nanes godes wan, and he me
geset on swyðe good feohland.
 22.2. And fedde me be wætera staðum, and min mod gehwyrfde of
unrotnesse on gefean.
 22.3. He me gelædde ofer þa wegas rihtwisnesse, for his
naman.
 22.4. þeah ic nu gange on midde þa sceade deaðes, ne
ondræde ic me nan yfel for þam þu byst mid me, Drihten.
 22.5. þin gyrd and þin stæf me afrefredon, þæt is þin
þreaung and eft þin frefrung.
 22.6. þu gearwodest beforan me swiðe bradne beod, wið þara
willan, þe me hatedon.
 22.7. þu gesmyredest me mid ele, min heafod: Drihten, hu mære
þin folc nu is, ælce dæge hit symblað.
 22.8. And folgie me nu þin mildheortnes, ealle dagas mines
lifes.
 22.9. Þæt ic mæge wunian on þinum huse, swiþe lange
tiid, oð lange ylde.
 23.1. Drihtnes ys eorðe and eall þæt heo mid gefyld is; and
eall mancynn, þe þæron eardað, is Drihtnes.
 23.2. He gesette þa eorþan ofer þære sæ, and ofer ðam
eam he hi gestaðelode.
 23.3. Hwa is þæs wyrðe, þæt he astige on Godes munt;
oþþe hwa mot standan on his halgan stowe?
 23.4. He byð þæs wyrðe, þe unscæðfull byð mid
his handum, and clæne on his heortan; se þe ne hwyrfð his mod æfter
idlum geþohtum, and him mid weorcum fulgæð, þeah hi him on mod cumen;
ne nænne að ne swerað, to beswice his nyhstan.
 23.5. Se þe swylc byð, he onfehð bletsunge fram Gode and
miltse æt Drihtne Hælende.
 23.6. þyllic byð þæt cyn þe God secð, and þa þe
secað þone andwlitan Iacobes Godes.
 23.7. Undoð nu eower geatu, ge ealdormen, and onhlidað þa
ecan geata; for þan þe ingæð se kyning, þe God gewuldrod hæfð,
and geweorðod; þa andswarode þæt folc, and cwæð.
 23.8. Hwæt is þes wuldorfæsta kyning; Hit is ure hlaford,
strang and mihtig, se þe hæfde anweald on gefeohte.
 23.9. Gedoð nu, ealdormen, eowru geatu, and onhlidað eowre
ecan geatu; for þam þær inngæð se kyning, þe God gewuldrod
hæfð, and geweorðod.
 23.10. Hwæt is se gewuldroda kyning; Hit is se wuldorfæsta,
se þe God fore wyrcð swylc wundru.
 24.1. To þe ic hæbbe, Drihten, min mod and mine sawle;
Drihten, min God, to þe ic hopige, and ic þæs næfre ne sceamige.
 24.2. Ne mine fynd me næfre forðy ne bysmrian; ne nan
þæra, þe to þe hopað, ne wyrð gescended.
 24.3. Scamien heora ealle þa unrihtwisan, þe idelnesse
wyrcað: Drihten, gedo me þine wegas cuðe, and lær me þine paðas.
 24.4. Geræd me, and gerece on þinre soðfæstnesse, and
lær me, for þam þu eart Drihten min Hælend; ælce dæge ic
anbidige þines fultumes.
 24.5. Gemun, Drihten, þinra miltsunga, and þinre
mildheortnesse, þe fram fruman worlde wæs.
 24.6. Þa scylda mines iugoðhades ne gemun þu, Drihten, ne
huru þa þe ic ungewisses geworhte; þæt synt, þa þe ic wende
þæt nan scyld nære ac for þinre myclan mildheortnesse, beo þu min
gemyndig, Drihten.
 24.7. For þam gesette God æ scyldiendum on heora wegum, and
geriht þa manðwæran on domum, and him getæceð his wegas.
 24.8. For þinre godnesse, Drihten, þu eart swete, and wynsum,
and eac rihtwis; Ealle Godes wegas syndon mildheortnes, and rihtwisnes,
ælcum þæra þe his æ secað, and his bebodu lufiað.
 24.9. Drihten, for þinum naman beo þu forgifende mina synna,
for þy hi synt swyðe mycele.
 24.10. Hwa hwylc mann swa Drihten ondræt, he him geset þa
æ, and him sylð þæt geþeaht on þone weg, þe heora ægðrum
licað ge Gode ge eac þam men.
 24.11. His sawl hi gerest softe on monegum goodum, and his sæd
on ece yrfeweardnesse gesit eorðan.
 24.12. Drihten is mægen and cræftig ælces þæra þe
hine ondræt, and he him getæcð eallum his willan.
 24.13. Symle lociað mine eagan to Gode; for þam he alysð mine
fet of gryne.
 24.14. Geloca to me, Drihten, and gemiltsa me; for þam ic eom ana
forlæten, yrming.
 24.15. And þa earfoðu minre heortan synd swyðe tobræd, and
gemanigfealdod; gedo for þi, Drihten, þæt þu me gefriðie æt
minre nydþearfe.
 24.16. Geseo mine eaðmetto, and mine earfoða, and forgif ealle
mine scylda.
 24.17. And geseoh eac mine fynd; for þam hi synt swyþe
gemanigfealdode, and geseoh hu unrihtlice hi me hatiað.
 24.18. Geheald mine sawle, and gefriða me, þæt me ne
sceamie, þæs þe ic to þe clypige.
 24.19. þa unsceðfullan, and þa rihtwisan, þa þe
begangað, coman to me, wendon þæt me sceolde cuman sum fultum, and sum
frofor fram þe; for þam ic symle þæs anbidode, and wilnode, and wende
æt þe, Drihten.
 24.20. Gefriða me, Drihten, Israela God, of eallum minum
nearonessum.
 25.1. Dem me, Drihten, for þam ic eom unscyldig wið þas mine
fynd, and ic hopige to Drihtne, and ic ne weorðe for þi geuntrumod.
 25.2. Fanda min, Drihten, and smea mine geþohtas.
 25.3. For þan þin mildheortnes is beforan minum eagum, and ic
symle tilode, mid rihtwisnesse, þe and him to licianne.
 25.4. Ne sæt ic na on þære samnunge idelra manna, and
unnytra; ne ic ineode on þæt geþeaht unrihtwyrcendra.
 25.5. Ac ic hatode þa gesamnunge unrihtwisra; for þam ic
næfre ne teolade sittan on anum willan mid þam arleasum.
 25.6. Ac ic wilnode symle þæt ic aðwoge mine handa betwuh
þam unscæððigum; þæt is þæt ic wære unscyldig betwuh him
þæt ic meahte hweorfan ymb þinne þone halgan alter, Drihten.
 25.7. And þær gehyran þa stemne þines lofes, and þæt
ic mæge cyþan eall þin wundru.
 25.8. Drihten, ic lufode þone wlite þines huses, and þa stowe
þines wuldorfæstan temples.
 25.9. Ac ne forleos mine sawle ongemang þam arleasum, ne min lif
betwuh þam manslagum, þæra handa and þæra weorc syndon fulle
unrihtwisnesse.
 26.1. Drihten is min onlyhtend, and min Hælend; hwæt þearf
ic ondrædan?
 26.2. Drihten is scyldend mines lifes; hwy sceal ic beon afærd?
 26.3. þonne me to geneahlæhton mine fynd, me to derianne,
swylce hi woldon fretan min flæsc; þa þe me swencton, hi wæron sylfe
geuntrumode, and gefeollon.
 26.4. þeah hi nu gyt wyrcen getruman, and scyldridan wið me, ne
byð min heorte nawuht afæred; þeah hi arisan ongean me to feohtanne, to
þam Gode ic hopie, þe me ær gefreode.
 26.5. ....and geseon Godes willan, and þone ongitan, and he me
gefriðie on his þam halgan temple.
 26.6. For þam he me gehydde on his temple, on þam yflan dagum
he me gefriðode, on þam sceade his geteldes and his temples; and he me ahof
uppon heanne stan.
 26.7. And huru nu hæfð min heafod upp ahafen ofer mine fynd;
for þæm ic ymbhweorfe þin þæt halige tempel, Drihten, and þær
offrige, on þinum huse, þa offrunga; sangas ic singe, and secge Gode lof.
 26.8. Gehyr, Drihten, mine stefne, mid þære ic clypige to
þe; gemiltsa me, and gehyr me.
 26.9. To þe cwyð min heorte, Ic sohte þine ansyne; ic sece
gyt symle, Drihten.
 26.10. Ne awend þu þine ansyne fram me, ne þe næfre
yrringa acyr fram þinum þeowe.
 26.11. þu eart min fultumend, Drihten; ne forlæt me, ne ne
forseoh me, Drihten, min Hælend.
 26.12. For þam min fæder and min modor me forleton, ac Drihten
me ne forlet.
 26.13. Gesete me æ, Drihten, on þinum wege, and gerece me on
rihtne pæð, fore minum feondum.
 26.14. And ne syle me to þara modes willan, þe min ehtað; for
ðam arison ongean me lease gewitnessa, and heora leasung wæs gecyrred to
heom sylfum.
