 26.15. Ic gelyfe þæt ic geseo Godes good on libbendra lande.
 26.16. Hopa nu, min mod, to Drihtne, and gebid his willan, and do
esnlice, and gestaþela, and gestranga þine heortan, and geþola Drihtnes
willan.
 27.1. To þe ic hopige, Drihten, min God; ne swuga, ac dem, and
miltsa me; gif þu swa ne dest, þonne beo ic gelicost þam þe afylð on
pytt.
 27.2. Ac gehyr þa stemne mines gebedes; for þam ic nu to þe
clypige, and mine handa upphebbe to þinum þam halgan temple.
 27.3. Ne syle me, ne ne send mid þam synfullan, and mid þam
unrihtwyrcendum, ne forleos me.
 27.4. Ne me ne fordo mid þam þe luflice sprecað to heora
nyhstum, and habbað þeah facn on heora heortan.
 27.5. Ic wat þæt þu sylst him edlean be heora gewyrhtum, and
æfter þam unrihte, þe hi answincað, þu heom gyldest.
 27.6. ðu heom sylst edlean; for þam hy ne ongitað þin
weorc, ne þa ne geseoð.
 27.7. Þu hi towyrpst, and hi eft getimbrast; Gebletsod sy
Drihten, for þam þe he gehyrde þa stemne mines gebedes.
 27.8. Drihten is min fultumend, and min gescyldend; on hine gehyht
min heorte, and he me gefultumað.
 27.9. Drihten is strengo his folces, and gescyldend þære
hælo his gesmyredan.
 27.10. Gehæl, Drihten, þin folc, and gebletsa þin yrfeland,
and gerece þa þe þæron eardiað, and hi upp ahefe on ecnesse.
 28.1. Ge Godes bearn, bringað eow sylfe Gode, and bringað him
eac eowera ramma bearn.
 28.2. And bringað eac Drihtne wuldor and weorðmynd, and
bringað wuldor Drihtnes naman.
 28.3. And gebiddað eow to Gode, on his halgan healle: Godes word
is ofer wætrum, and hy gehæft; he is mægenþrymmes God, and he
þunrað ofer manegum wæterum, and mycelum.
 28.4. Godes word is on mycelum mægene, and mycelu þing deð.
 28.5. þæs Godes word brycþ cedortreowu, and symle se God
brycð þa hean cedertreowu on Libano, þam myclan munte: þa treowa
tacniað ofermodra manna anweald Drihten forbrycð and forbryt þa myclan
cedertreowu, emne swa þa lytlan on wæstmas; þa owæstmas beoð swa
mycle, and swa fægere swa swa þæs deores bearn, þe unicornus hatte.
 28.6. Godes word adwæscð fyres lig; Drihten ahrysode þa
westan eorþan, and astyrede þa westan stowe, þe is gehaten Cades.
 28.7. And he gedyde þæt þa fynd flugan swa heortas, and he
onwreah þa eorðan, þe ær wæs oferþeaht mid feondum; cumon nu for
þi ealle to his temple, and secgon him þæs lof.
 28.8. Drihten us gedyde, þæt we moston buian æfter þam
folce: se Drihten is ure kyning, se sitt on ecnesse ofer us.
 28.9. Drihten sylþ his folce mægen, and gebletsað his folc
on sibbe.
 29.1. Ic fægnige, Drihten, and þe herige; for þam þu me
gefriðadest, and þu ne lete mine fynd min fægnian.
 29.2. Drihten, min God, ic clypode to þe, and þu me
gehældest, and atuge mine sawle of neolnessum, and of helle, and me
gehældest fram þæra geferscipe, þe feollon on pytt.
 29.3. Heriað nu Drihten, ealle his halige, and andettað
þæt gemynd his halignesse.
 29.4. For þam open wracu ys on his yrsunga, and soð lif on
þam þæt man wrece his willan.
 29.5. þeah we wepon on æfen, he gedeð þæt we hlihhað
on morgen.
 29.6. Ic cwæð on minum wlencum, and on minre orsorhnesse, Ne
wyrd þises næfre nan wendincg.
 29.7. For þam þu me sealdest, on ðinum goodan willan, wlite
and mægen; þa awendest þu þinne andwlitan fram me, þa wearð ic
sona gedrefed.
 29.8. þa clypode ic eft to þe, and gebæd me to minum
Drihtne, and cwæð, Drihten, hu nyt is þe min slæge, oþþe min
cwalu, oððe min rotung on byrgenne?
 29.9. Hwæðer þe þæt dust herige, on þære burgene;
oþþe hwæðer hit cyðe þine rihtwisnesse?
 29.10. þa gehyrde Drihten þa word, and gemildsade me; he
wearð me to fultume.
 29.11. Drihten, þu gehwyrfdest minne heaf and mine seofunga me to
gefean; þu totære min hwite hrægl, and þu me bebyrgdst mid gefean;
for þam hit ys cyn þæt min wuldor, and min gylp þe herige, þæt ic
ne wurðe gedrefed.
 29.12. Drihten, min God, on ecnesse ic þe herige.
 30.1. To þe ic hopige, Drihten, ne gesceamað me næfre
þæs; on þinre rihtwisnesse alys me, and gefriða me.
 30.2. Onhyld to me þine earan, and efste þæt þu me
gefriðie.
 30.3. And beo min God, and min gefriðiend, and beo min
friðstow, and gedo me halne.
 30.4. For þam þu eart min trymnes and min gebeorh, and on
þinum naman ic þe healsige, þæt þu beo min ladþeow, and me fede.
 30.5. And alæd me of þysum grynum, þe her gehydde synt
beforan me, for þam þu eart min gescyldend, Drihten, on þine handa ic
befæste mine sawle.
 30.6. þu me ahreddest, Drihten, rihtwisnesse God; þu hatodest
þa þe beeodon idelnesse, and eac þa þe unnyt worhton.
 30.7. Ic þonne symle hopige to Drihtne, and fægnie, and
wynsumige, and blissige on þinre mildheortnesse.
 30.8. For þam þu gesawe mine eadmodnesse, and þu gedydest
hale æt nydþearfe mine sawle, and me ne demdest on minra feonda handa.
 30.9. Ac asettest mine fet on swyðe brad land: gemiltsa me nu,
Drihten, for þam ic swince.
 30.10. Mine eagan wæron gedrefede and afærde, for þinum
yrre; and eac swa ilce, min mod and min maga.
 30.11. For þam full neah on þam sare geteorode and geendode min
lif, and min gear wæron on sicetunga, and on gestæne.
 30.12. And geuntrumod wæs for wædle, and for yrmðum, min
mægen; and min ban wæron gedrefedu, and full neah forod.
 30.13. Ofer ealle mine fynd ic eom geworden to edwite, and minum
neahgeburum swiðost; ic eom worden him to ege, and eallum þam þe me
cunnon.
 30.14. þa þe me gesawon, hi me flugon: ful neah ic afeoll, swa
swa se þe byð dead on his heortan, and on his mode; and ic wæs swylce
forloren fæt, and tobrocen.
 30.15. For þam ic gehyrde manegra manna edwit, þe me ymbutan
budon.
 30.16. And swa hwær swa hi hi gegaderodon ealle togædere, to
þam þæt hy þeahtodon, hu hi mihton geniman mine sawle.
 30.17. And ic þeah, Drihten, to þe hopode, and sæde þæt
þu wære min God: on þinum handum synd þa lenga minra tida.
 30.18. Alys me, and gefriða me of minra feonda handum, and fram
þam þe min ehtað.
 30.19. And onliht þinne andwlitan ofer þinne þeow, and gedo
me halne for þinre mildheortnesse, and gedo þæt me ne gesceamige, for
þam ic cleopode to þe.
 30.20. Ac þeah sceal gescamian þa unrihtwisan, and hi beoð
gelæd to helle; and adumbiað þa facnfullan weoloras, þa þe sprecað
wið þone rihtwisan unriht, on heora ofermettum, and on heora leahtrunga.
 30.21. Eala, Drihten, hu micel and hu manigfeald is seo mycelnes
þinre swetnesse, þe þu hæfst gehyd and gehealden þam þe þe
ondrædað: þa swetnesse þu him ne lætst næfre aspringan, nanum
þæra þe to þe hopað beforan manna bearnum.
 30.22. þu hi gehydst and gehyldst hale and orsorge, ægðer
ge modes ge lichaman, butan ælcere gedrefednesse, þe menn þrowiað.
 30.23. þu hi gescyldst on þinum temple, wið ælcere tungan
leahtrunge.
 30.24. Gebletsod sy Drihten; for þam he swa wuldorlice gecydde
his mildheortnesse me, on þære fæstan byrig.
 30.25. Ic cwæð on minre fyrhto, þæt ic wære aworpen of
þinra eagena ansyne.
 30.26. And þu þa for þi gehyrdest þa stemne minra gebeda,
þa ic to þe cliopode.
 30.27. Lufiað nu for þan Drihten ealle his halgan; for þam
rihtwisnesse God lufað and secð, and forgylt be fullan ælcum þe
ofermetto doð.
 30.28. Ac doð esnlice, and gestrangiað eowere heortan, and
eower mod, ælc þæra þe to Gode hopige.
 31.1. Eadige beoð þa þe him beoð heora unrihtwisnesse
forgifene, and heora synna beoð behelede.
 31.2. Eadig byð se wer, þe him God ne oðwit his scylda, ne on
his mode ne byð facn.
 31.3. For þam þe ic sugode, and hæl mine scylda, eal min
ban, and min mægn forealdode; þa ongan ic clypian ealne dæg.
 31.4. For þam, ægðer ge on dæg ge on niht, wæs swyðe
hefig ofer me þin hand, and þin yrre; ic wæs gehwyrfed on ælce
yrmðe, swylce me wære se hrycg forbrocen.
 31.5. Ic þa gedyde min scylda þe swyþe cuðe, and min unriht
ic na ne helede wið þe.
 31.6. þa cwæð ic on minum mode, þæt ic wolde andettan,
and stælan ongean me sylfne, min scylda, and þa Gode andettan; and þu
me þa forgeafe þæt unriht minra scylda.
 31.7. For þæm gebiddað ealle halige to þe on tilne timan;
for þæm þonne, and for eallum heora goodum dædum, ne genealæcð
him na þæt flod þæra myclena wætera; þæt synt þas
andweardan earfoþa and eac þa weardan.
 31.8. þu eart min gebeorhstow on minum earfoþum, þa me
habbað utan behringed: ac þu þe eart min frefrend, ahrede me æt þam
þe me habbað utan bestanden.
 31.9. þa andswarode God þam witegan, þurh þone halgan
gast, and cwæð, Ic þe sylle andgit, and þe getæce þone weg, þe
þu onsteppan scealt; and ic locie to þe mid minum eagum.
 31.10. Ne beo ge na swylce hors and mulas, on þam nis nan
andgit.
 31.11. Þæra cinban þu scealt mid bridle, and mid caman, to
þe geteon; swa ylce þu scealt þa men, þe heora gelican beoð; for
þam hi elles ne genealæceað þinum willan.
 31.12. Swiþe manigfealde synt synfulra manna swingelan; ac þa
þe to Gode hopiað, beoð ymbhringde mid swyþe manegre mildheortnesse.
 31.13. Blissiað for þæm on Gode, and wynsumiað, ge
rihtwisan; and fægniað, and wuldriað, ealra rihtwillenda heortan.
 32.1. Blissiað, ge rihtwisan, on Godes gifum; rihte hit gerist,
þæt hine ealle rihtwillende emnlice herian.
 32.2. Heriað hine mid hearpum; and on þære tynstrengean
hearpan.
 32.3. Singað him niwne sang, and heriað hine swyþe wel mid
heare stemne.
 32.4. For þæm his word synd swyþe rihte, and ealle his weorc
synt getreowe.
 32.5. He lufað mildheortnesse and rihte domas; mid his
mildheortnesse he gefylð ealle eorðan, mid his worde synt getrymede
heofonas; and þurh þone gast his muðes synt eall heofona mægn.
 32.6. He gegaderode eall sæwætru tosomne, swylce hi wæron
on anum cylle; he gesette þone garsecg on his goldhorde.
 32.7. Ondræde hine eall eorðe; fram him beoð onstyred ealle
gesceafta, and ealle þa þe on eorðan buiað.
 32.8. For þæm he cwæð his willan, þa wæs he
geworden; he bebead his willan, þa wæron ealle gesceafta gesceapene.
 32.9. Se Drihten tostencð þa geþeaht yfelwillendra kynna, and
he forsyhð þa geþohtas þara folca, and eac yfelra ealdormanna geþeaht
he forsyhð.
 32.10. Ac Godes geþeaht wunað on ecnesse, and geþoht his
modes a weorulda weoruld.
 32.11. Eala, eadig byþ þæt kynn, þe swylc God byð heora
God; and eadig byð þæt folc, þe se Drihten gecyst him to
yrfeweardnesse.
 32.12. Drihten locað of heofonum, and gesihð eall manna bearn
of his þam wlitegan temple; he wlit ofer ealle þa þe ealre eorðan
ymbhwyrft buiað.
 32.13. For þam he gesceop heora heortan, ælces synderlice; and
he ongit heora ealra weorc.
 32.14. Ne wyrð nan kyning næfre gehæled þurh his agen
mægen; ne se gigant ne wyrð na gehæled on þære mycelnesse his
mægenes.
 32.15. He byð swiðe dysig, se þe getruwað on his horses
swiftnesse, for þæm hit is swiðe leas tohopa; for þæm nawþer ne
ðam horse, ne þæm rædemen, ne wyrð geborgen of his agnum
cræftum.
 32.16. Symle beoð Godes eagan open ofer þa ðe hine
ondrædað, and ofer þa þe hopiað to his mildheortnesse; for þam
þæt he gefriðie heora sawla fram deaðe, and hi fede on hungres tide.
 32.17. Hopiað nu to Drihtne ure sawla; for þam he ys ure
friðigend, and ure gescyldend, and on hine blissiað ure heortan, and to his
halgan naman we hopiað.
 32.18. Sy Drihten þin mildheortnes ofer us, swa swa we gehyhtað
on þe.
 33.1. Ic bletsige Drihten on ælce tid, symle byð his lof on
minum muðe.
 33.2. On Gode byð geherod min sawl, gehyren þæt þa
manþwæran, and blissien for þy.
 33.3. Micliað Drihten mid me, and upp ahebben we his naman betwuh
us.
 33.4. Ic sohte Drihten, and he me gehyrde, and of eallum minum
earfoðum he me gefriðode.
 33.5. Cumað nu to him, and genealæcað him, and he eow
onliht, and eowerne andwlitan na ne gesceamað.
 33.6. þes þearfa cleopode to Drihtne, and Drihten hine
gehyrde, and of eallum his earfoþum he hine alysde.
 33.7. Onsende he his engel ymbutan þa þe hine ondrædað,
þæt he hi gefriðige, swa he me dyde.
 33.8. Fandiað nu þonne; ongite ge þæt Drihten is swyðe
sefte; eadig byð se wer, þe to him cleopað.
 33.9. Ondrædon hine ealle his halige, for þæm þæm ne
byð nanes goodes wana, þe hine ondrædað.
 33.10. þa welegan wædledon, and eodon biddende, and hi
hingrode; ac þa þe God seceað, ne aspringeð him nan good.
 33.11. Cumað nu, bearn, and gehyrað me; ic eow lære Godes
ege.
 33.12. Se þe libban wylle, and wilnige þæt he geseo goode
dagas, gehyre hwæt ic secge.
 33.13. Forbeode his tungan ælc yfel, and his weolorum, þæt
hi ne sprecon nan facn.
 33.14. Onwende hine fram yfele, and wyrce good; sece sibbe, and
folgie þære.
 33.15. For þæm Godes eagan beoð ofer þa rihtwisan ontynde,
and eac his earan to heora gebedum.
 33.16. Ac Godes andwlita and his yrre byð ofer þa þe yfel
wyrcað, to þæm þæt he forleose heora gemynd ofer eorðan.
 33.17. þa rihtwisan cleopodon, and Drihten hi gehyrde, and of
eallum hiora earfoðum he hi alysde.
 33.18. Swiþe neah is Drihten þam þe beoð gedrefede on heora
heortum, and þa eaðmodan on heora gaste he gehælð.
 33.19. Monigu synt earfoðu þara rihtwisena, and of eallum
þæm hi alysð Drihten.
 33.20. Drihten gehylt eall heora ban, þæt ys eall heora
mægen þæt heora ne wyrð furðon an tobrocen.
 33.21. Ac þæra synfullena deað byð se wyrsta, and þa
þe þone rihtwisan hatiað, þa agyltað.
 33.22. Drihten gefriðað þa sawla his þeowa, and ne
forlæt nænne þæra þe him to hopað.
 34.1. Dem me, Drihten, and þæm þe me swencað; feoht
wið þa þe wið me feohtað.
 34.2. And gefoh wæpn and scyld, and aris, me to fultume.
 34.3. Geteoh þin sweord, and cum ongean hy, and beluc heora wegas
mid þinum sweorde, þara þe min ehtað: cweð to minre sawle, Ne
ondræd þu þe; ic eom þin hælo, and ic þe gehealde.
 34.4. Geleahtrode syn mine fynd, and sceamien heora, þa þe
secað mine sawle to fordonne.
 34.5. Syn hi gecyrde on earsling, and scamien heora, þa þe me
ðenceað yfeles.
 34.6. Syn hi tostencte, swa swa dust beforan winde, and Godes engel
hi geþræste.
 34.7. Syn heora wegas þystre and slidore, and Godes engel heora
ehte.
 34.8. For þam hi, butan gewyrhtum, teldedon gryne, and þa
gehyddon, to þam þæt hi woldan me on gefon; and idle hi wæron, þa
hi me tældon.
 34.9. Gefon hi þa grynu, þe wið hy beheled synt; and eac
þa þe hi wið me beheled hæfdon.
 34.10. þonne blissað min sawl and min mod on Drihtne, and hit
byð gelustfullod on his hælo.
 34.11. Eall min ban þæt is min mægen cwyð, Eala Drihten,
hwa is ðin gelica; for þam þu generest þone earman of þæs
strengran anwealde, and þone wædlan, and þone þearfan, ahredst æt
þæm þe hine swencað.
 34.12. þonne wið me arison lease gewitan, and stældon on me,
þæt ic nawþer ne nyste, ne ne worhte; ac guldon me yfel wið gode, and
woldon me gedon unwæstmbærne, swa swa se þe butan ælcum yrfewearde
byð.
 34.13. Ic, þa þa hi me swa hefige weron, dyde me hwite hrægl
on/, and gebigde min mod to fæstenne, and min gebedo wendon eft to me, on
minne agenne bosm; forþam heora nolde onfon se dema, þe ic him to sende.
 34.14. And ic, þeah þeah hi me swa hefige wæron, hy lufode,
and him tilode to licianne, and to cwemanne, swa swa minum nyhstum, oððe
minum breðer; and hy me gedydon swa unrotne, and swa wependne, swa se byð
þone þe he lufað.
 34.15. Hy wæron bliðe wið me on heora gebærum, and þeah
on heora mode hi blissedon micle swyðor on minum ungelimpe, and hi comon
ongean me, and gegaderodon swyðe manega swingellan ofer me, and ic nyste
hwæt hi me witon.
 34.16. And hy wurdon þeah tostencte, and hy þeah þæs na ne
hreowsedon, ac fandodon eft min, and bysmredon me, mid ælcere bysmrunga, and
gristbitedon/, mid heora toþum, ongean me.
 34.17. And þa cwæð ic, Drihten, hwænne gesyhst þu
þis, oððe hwænne gefriðast þu mine sawle, wið heora yfelum
dædum, oþþe hwænne ahredst mine agnan sawle æt þæm leoum?
 34.18. Gif þu me æfre alyst, ic þe andette on mycelre
gesamnunge, and þe þær herige.
 34.19. For þæm þæt mine fynd ne blissien æfter me;
þa þe winnað mid unrihte ongean me, and me hatiað butan scylde, and
wincettað mid heora eagum betwuh him.
 34.20. þeah hi gesibsumlice hwilum wið me sprecen, hy
þenceað þeah swiðe facenlice.
 34.21. Hy geopenodon ealne heora muð for leahtre, to þæm
þæt hi me bysmredon; and cwædon, Hit is la ful good, þæt æfre
ure eagan moston geseon þæt we wilnodon: nu þu gesyhst, Drihten, hwæt
hy doð, ne geþafa þu hit leng, ne gewit fram me.
 34.22. Aris, Drihten, and beseoh to me, and geseoh hu unscyldig ic
eom wið þa þe min ehtað: Drihten, min God, aris to minum þinge, and
to minre þearfe.
 34.23. Drihten, Drihten, min God, dem me æfter þinre
mildheortnesse, þæt mine fynd ne gefeon mines ungelimpes; ne hy cweþan,
on heora mode, Wel, la wel is urum modum; ne hy ne cweðen, We hine
frætan.
 34.24. Ac sceamien hy heora, and him eac ondrædon, ægðer
endemes, þa þe fægniað mines ungelimpes; beslepen hi on hy bysmor, and
gegyrion hy mid sceame, þa oferspræcan þe me yfel cweðað.
 34.25. Fægnien þa and blissien, þa þe willon me þancian
minre rihtwisnesse, and þa þe symle cweðað: Gemyclad sy Drihten, and
þa þe willon sibbe wið his ðeow.
 34.26. þonne smeað min tunge þine rihtwisnesse, and ealne
dæg þin lof.
 35.1. Se unrihtwisa cwyð on his mode, þæt he wylle syngian;
forþam Godes ege nis beforan his eagum.
 35.2. For þæm he deð swiðe facenlice beforan his ansyne,
ac his unriht and his feoung wurð þeah swiðe open.
 35.3. þa word his muðes beoð unriht and facen; he nyle
ongitan þæt he cunne wel don; unriht he byð smeagende on his cliofan.
 35.4. He stent on ælcum yflum wege, ne hatað he nan yfel.
 35.5. Drihten, þin mildheortnes is on heofonum, and þin
rihtwisnes/ is upp oð þa wolcnu.
 35.6. þin rihtwisnes is swa heah swa þa heofonlican muntas, and
þine domas synt swa deope swa swa æfgrynde, oþþe seo deoposte sæ.
 35.7. Menn and nytenu þu gehælst, Drihten; hu wunderlice þu
gemanigfealdodest þine mildheortnesse, Drihten.
 35.8. Manna bearn soðlice symle hopiað to þæm sceade
þinra fiðera, and hy beoð oferdrencte on þære genihte þines huses,
and on þære æ þines willan þu hy drencst.
 35.9. For þæm mid þe is lifes wylle, and of þinum leohte
we beoð onlihte.
 35.10. Læt forð þine mildheortnesse, þam þe þe witon,
and þine rihtwisnesse, þam þe synt rihtes modes.
 35.11. Ne læt þu me oftredan þa ofermodan under heora fotum,
and þara synfullena handa me na ne styrien.
 35.12. Ac under heora fet, and under heora handa, gefeallen ealle
þa þe unriht wyrcen; and him þæt licað, hy synt aworpene, þæt
hi ne magon standan.
 36.1. Ne wundrie ge þæra yfelwillendra, and þæra
orsorgra, ne him na ne onhyriað; ne eow ne ofþince, þeah eow ne sy swa
swa him, þam þe unriht wyrcað.
 36.2. For þæm swyþe hraþe forseariað swa fileðe, and
hy gefeallað swiðe hrædlice, swa swa wyrta leaf, oþþe blostman.
 36.3. Ac þu hopa to Drihtne, and do good, and buwa eorðan, and
fed þe on hyre welum.
 36.4. And blissa on Drihtne, þonne syleð he þe þæt þu
bidst on þinum mode.
 36.5. Onwreoh Gode þine wegas, and hopa to him; he þe gedeð
fultum.
 36.6. And he gedeð þine rihtwisnesse mannum swa sweotole swa
sunnan, and þinne dom he gedeð swa sweotolne swa sunne byð to middes
dæges.
 36.7. Beo þu Gode underþyd, and halsa hine; and ne onhyre þam
þe byð orsorh on his wege, and wyrcð þeah unriht.
 36.8. Forlæt yrre and hatheortnesse; ne bysna þe be nanum
þæra þe yfel don.
 36.9. For þæm þa þe yfel doð, and þæt ne betað,
hy beoð awyrtwalode of eorþan; ac þa þe to Gode hopiað, and his
fultumes anbidiað, hy gesittað on yrfeweardnesse eorþan.
 36.10. Gebid ane lytle hwile, þonne ne byð se synfulla; þeah
þu þonne sece his stowe, þonne ne findst þu hy.
 36.11. Ac þa manþwæran gesittað eorþan, and fægniað
þære myclan sibbe.
 36.12. Se synfulla sætað þæs rihtwisan, and gristbitað
mid his toþum ongean hine; ac Drihten hine gebysmrað, for þam he gesyhð
hu hraðe his ende cymð.
 36.13. þa synfullan teoð heora sweord, and bendað heora
bogan, to þæm þæt hi mægon besyrian þone earman, and þone
wædlan, and þurhsceotan þa unscæðfullan heortan.
 36.14. Ac heora sweord gað inn on heora heortan, and heora bogan
forberstað.
 36.15. Betere ys þam rihtwisan lytel, þonne þam synfullan
mycel wela.
 36.16. For þam se earm and þæt mægen þæra synfulra
byð forbrocen, ac Drihten gestrangað þa rihtwisan.
 36.17. For þæm he wat þa wegas þæra unsceðfulra, and
heora yrfeweardnes byð on ecnesse.
 36.18. Ne gesceamað hy na on þære ylfan tide; ac on hungres
tide hy beoð gefyllede, þonne þa synfullan forweorðað.
 36.19. þa Godes fynd swiþe hraðe, þæs þe hy beoð
gearode and upp ahefene, beoð gedwæscte, swa swa smec.
 36.20. æfre borgiað þa synfullan, and næfre ne gyldað;
þa rihtwisan syllað, ægþer ge to borge ge to gife.
 36.21. þa þe God bletsiað beoð eorðan yrfeweardas, and
þa þe hine wyrgeað forweorðað.
 36.22. Fram Gode byð gereht se weg þæs rihtwisan, and hine
lyst his wega and his weorca swiðe.
 36.23. And þeah se rihtwisa afealle, ne wyrð he gebrysed, ne
his nan ban tobrocen; for þam God gefehð his hand, and hine upp
arærð.
 36.24. Ic wæs geo geong, and nu ic ealdige, and ne geseah ic
næfre rihtwisne man forlætenne, ne his sæd þæt wære hlafes
wædla.
 36.25. Ac se rihtwisa ælce dæge miltsað, and syleð
oþrum to borge, and his sæd byð on bletsunge on genihte.
 36.26. Gecyr for þæm fram yfele, and do good, þonne wunast
þu on weorulda weorld.
 36.27. For þæm God lufað ryhte domas, and ne forlæt
næfre his halge, ac he gehylt hy on ecnesse.
 36.28. He witnað þa scyldigan, and þæt sæd þæra
unrihtwisra forwyrð.
 36.29. þa rihtwisan gesittað eorðan on yrfeweardnesse, and hy
buiað on hyre a weorulda weoruld.
 36.30. Se muð þæs rihtwisan smeað wisdom, and his tunge
sprycð rihte domas.
 36.31. Seo æ his Godes bið on his heortan, and ne aslit his
fot.
 36.32. Se synfulla hopaþ symle þæs rihtwisan, and secð
hine to fordonne; ac Drihten hine ne forlæt on his handa, to þam þæt
he hine mæge fordon; and Drihten demð hym bæm.
 36.33. Gebid Drihtnes, and heald his bebodu, and he þe upp
ahefð, to þæm þæt þu bust eorðan; and þu gesyhst hwær þa
synfullan forweorðað.
 36.34. Ic geseah þone unrihtwisan swiðe up ahafenne, swa swa
sum cedertreow on Libanus munte.
 36.35. And ic þa þanon for, and eft ðyder com, þonne næs
he; and ic acsode æfter him, and hine sohte, and hine ne funde; ne furþum
þa stowe, þe ic hine ær on geseah, gecnawan ne mihte.
 36.36. Heald for ðy rihtwisnesse, and efnesse; for þæm se
gesibsuma læfð symle yrfeweard æfter him.
 36.37. Ac þa unrihtwisan symle forweorþað, ealle ætsomne,
mid hyra yrfeweardum.
 36.38. Ac seo hæl þæra rihtwisena cymeð symle fram Gode,
and he byð heora gescyldend on geswinces tide.
 36.39. And Drihten him gefultumað, and hy alysð, and hy ahret
æt þam synfullum, and hy gedeð hale; for þæm hy hopiað to him.
 37.1. Drihten, ne þrea þu me, ne ne þrafa, on þinum yrre;
ne on þinre hatheortnesse, ne witna ðu me.
 37.2. For þam þine flana synt afæstnad on me, þæt synt
þa earfoðu þe ic nu þolie and þu gestrangodest þine handa ofer
me.
 37.3. Nis nan hælo on minum flæsce, for þære
andweardnesse þines yrres; ne nan sib, ne nan rest nis minum banum, beforan
þære ansyne minra synna.
 37.4. For þæm min unriht me hlypð nu ofer heafod, and, swa
swa hefig byrðen, hy synt gehefegode ofer me.
 37.5. Mine wunda rotedan and fuledon for minum dysige.
 37.6. Ic eom swiðe earm geworden, and ic eom ful neah gebiged to
ende; ælce dæge ic gange inn and unrot.
 37.7. For þæm eall min lichama is full flæsclicra lusta,
for þam nis nan hælo on minum flæsce.
 37.8. Ac ic eom gesæged, and gehnæged, and swiðe
geeaðmed; and ic grymetige, and stene, swiþe swiðlice, mid ealle mode.
 37.9. Drihten, Drihten, þu wast nu eall hwæs ic wilnie, eall
hit ys beforan ðe, and min granung þe nis na forholen.
 37.10. Min heorte is gedrefed, and min mod on innan me, for
þæm min mægen, and min strengo, and min cræft, me hæfð
forlæten; and þæt leoht, and seo scearpnes minra eagena, þe ic ær
hæfde, nis nu mid me, swa swa ic hy geo hæfde.
 37.11. Mine frynd, and mine magas, and mine neahgeburas, synt nu
gemengde wið mine fynd, and standað nu mid him, ongean me, and synt me nu
toweardes; and þa þe me nyhst wæran, þa ic orsorgost wæs, standað
me nu swiðe feor.
 37.12. And wyrceað woh, þa þe me hefigiað, and mine sawle
seceað, hu hy magon yfel don, sprecað idelnesse, and smeagað facn ælce
dæge.
 37.13. Ic þonne, swa swa deaf, dyde swylce ic hit ne gehyrde; and
swugode, swa swa se dumba, þe næfre his muð ne ontynð.
 37.14. Ic wæs geworden swylce se mann þe nanwuht ne gehyrð,
ne on his muðe næfð nane riht andsware.
 37.15. For þam ic hopode to þe, Drihten, and cwæð to þe,
Gehyr ðis, Drihten, and andswara him.
 37.16. For þæm ic symle bæd, þæt næfre mine fynd ne
gefægen æfter me; þy læs hi mægen sprecan gemetlico word ongean
me, gif hy geseon þæt mine fet slidrien.
 37.17. For þæm ic eom nu to swingellan gearu, and min sar ys
symle beforan me.
 37.18. For þæm ic andette Gode min unriht, and ic þence ymbe
mine synna.
 37.19. Gyt libbað mine fynd, and synt strengran þonne ic, and
synt swiðe gemanigfealdode þa þe me, mid unrihte hatiað.
 37.20. þa þe me gyldað yfel mid goode, hy me lætað; for
þy ic sece riht.
 37.21. Ne forlæt me, Drihten, min God, ne ne gewit fram me; ac
beseoh me to fultume, Drihten God, min Hælend.
 38.6. ....ælces libbendes mannes mægen and anwald is
idelnes.
 38.7. And swa þeah ælc man hæfð Godes anlicnesse on him,
þeah hit idel sy þæt hy mid gedrefde synt.
 38.8. þæt ys þæt hy gaderiað feoh, and nyton hwam hy
hyt gadriað.
 38.9. Hwæt ys þonne min tohopa; hwæs anbidie ic, butan
þin, Drihten; for þam mid þe is eall min æht.
 38.10. Ac of eallum minum unrihtwisnessum gefriða me; þu me
sealdest to bysmrianne þam unrihtwisan.
 38.11. þa geswugode ic, and ne ondyde na minne muð; for
þæm ic ongeat þæt þu hit geðafodest; ac awend nu fram me þine
witnunga, for þam ic eom nu geteorod: for þære strenge þinra handa,
and þinre þreaunga, ic geteorode on þære þrowunga.
 38.12. ælcne man þu þreast for his agenre scylde, and gedest
þæt he aswint on his mode, and wyrð swa tedre swa swa gangewifran nett.
 38.13. For þam byð ælc man gedrefed, and abysgod on idlum
sorgum, and on ymbhogum.
 38.14. Drihten, gehyr min gebed, and mine healsunga; onfoh, mid
þinum earum, minne wop, and mine tearas; ne swuga wið me, ac andswara me
mid þine fultume.
 38.15. For þam ic eom nifara hider on eorþan beforan ðe, and
ælðeodig, swa swa ealle mine fæderas wæran.
 38.16. Forlæt me nu, Drihten, to sumre rothwile on þisse
weorulde, ær ic hire swa ofgewite, þæt ic eft on ne sy.
 39.1. Næs ic on nauht idlum anbide, þeah hit me lang anbid
þuhte, þa ða ic anbidode Godes fultumes; for þam he beseah wið min,
and gehyrde min gebed, and alædde me fram þam pytte ælcra yrmða, and
of þam duste, and of þam drosnum ælces ðeowdomes, and ælcere
hæftnyde.
 39.2. And he asette mine fet on swiðe heanne stan, þæt ys
on swyðe heah setl and on swyðe fæstne anweald and he gerihte mine
stæpas, and sende on minne muð niwne sang þæt is lofsang urum Gode.
 39.3. Manege geseoð hu þu hæfst ymbe us gedon; and for þy
to þe hopiað, and þe ondrædað.
 39.4. Eadig byð se wer, þe his tohopa byð to swylcum Drihtne,
and ne locað næfre to idelnesse, ne to leasungum, ne to dysige.
 39.5. Drihten, min God, þu gemanigfealdodest þine wundru, and
þine geðohtas; þæt ys þin weorc nis nan þæra, þe þe gelic
seo.
 39.6. Ic spræc, and þæt sæde; for ðam hy wæran
gemanigfealdode ofer ælc gerim: noldest þu na ofrunga, and oflata nane, ac
hyrsumnesse þu me bebude for ofrunga.
 39.7. Ne bud þu me na ælmessan to syllan, ne for minum
synnum, þa þa ic hy næfde; ac ic cwæð, Ic eom gearu, ic cume, and
sylle þæt þu ær bebude þæt ys hyrsumness.
 39.8. On forewardre þyssere bec ys awriten be me, and eac on
manegum oþrum, þæt ic sceolde þinne willan wyrcan, and swa ic eac
wylle don: Drihten, min God, ic hæfde geteohhod, and gyt hæbbe, þæt
ic scyle healdan þine æ symle on minre heortan.
 39.9. Ic cyðe þine rihtwisnesse on micelre gesamnunge, and
minum weolorum ic ne forbeode, ac bebeode þæt hy þæt sprecon symle.
 39.10. Drihten, þu wast þæt ic ne ahydde on minum mode
þine rihtwisnesse, ac þine soðfæstnesse, and þine hælo, ic
sæde.
 39.11. Ne ahydde ic na þine mildheortnesse, and þine
rihtwisnesse on myclum gemotum.
 39.12. Ac ne do þu, Drihten, þæt þin mildheortnes sy me
afyrred; for þam þin mildheortnes, and þin soðfæstnes, me symle
underfengon.
 39.13. For þam me ymbhringde manig yfel, þæra nis nan rim;
me gefengan mine agene unrihtwisnessa, and ic hy ne meahte geseon, ne ongytan.
 39.14. Mine fynd wæran gemanigfealdode, þæt heora wæs ma
þonne hæra on minum heafde, and min heorte, and min mod, me forleton; to
þam þæt ic me nyste nænne ræd.
 39.15. Ac licige þe nu, Dryhten, ic þe bidde, þæt þu me
gearige, and ne lata þu to minum fultume.
 39.16. Sceamian hiora, and ondræden him endemes, þa þe
ehtað mine sawle, and hy teohhiað me to afyranne.
 39.17. Syn hy gehwyrfde under bæc, and ondræden him þa þe
me yfeles unnon.
 39.18. Beren hi swiþe raþe heora agene scame, þa þe
cweþað be me, þonne me hwylc ungelimp becymð, Is þæt la well.
 39.19. Blissien þa and fægnien, þa þe þinne willan
seceað; and cweðen, þa þe hopiað to þinre hælo, Gemyclad sy se
Drihten þe swylc deð.
 39.20. Ic eom yrming and þearfa, and þeah Dryhten min gymð.
 39.21. þu, Drihten, eart min friðiend, and min gefultumend, and
min gescyldend; Drihten, min God, ne yld nu þæt þu me arie.
 40.1. Eadig byð se þe ongyt þæs þearfan and þæs
wædlan; and him þonne gefultumað, gif hine to onhagað; gif hine ne
onhagað, þonne ne licað him þeah his earfoðu þone gefriþað
Drihten, on swylcum dæge, swylce him swylc yfel becymð.
 40.2. Drihten hine gehylt, and hine geliffæst, and gedeð hine
gesæligne on eorðan, and ne sylð hine na on his feonda anweald.
 40.3. Drihten him bringð fultum to his bedde, þe he on lið,
and eall his bedd he onwent of untrumnesse to trymðe.
 40.4. Ic cweðe, Drihten, to þe, gemildsa me, and gehæl mine
sawle; for ðon ic gesyngode wið þe.
 40.5. Mine fynd me cwædon yfel, and wilnodon, and spræcon
betwuh him, and cwædon, Hwonne ær he beo dead, oþþe hwænne his
nama aspringe?
 40.6. And þeah hy þæs lyste, þeah hy eodon in to me, and
fandodon min, and seofodon min sar.
 40.7. And þonne hy ut eodon from me, þonne worhton hy heora
gemot, and wæran ealle anspræce, þonne hy me leahtrodon and
læðdon.
 40.8. Ealle mine fynd hy þonne gegaderodon ongean me, and
þohton me yfeles, and spræcon me yfeles, and spræcon unriht wið me,
and cwædon on bysmor.
 40.9. Nis him nan lað, he rest hine eaðe, he mæg arisan,
þeah he slape, and licette untrymnesse: ge furðon, þa spræcon
þæt ylce mid him þe ic betst truwode, and þa þe ær æton and
druncon mid me.
 40.10. þu þonne, Drihten, nu gemiltsa me, and arære me, to
þam þæt ic him mæge forgyldan þæs lean.
 40.11. þonne ongyte ic on þam þæt þu me lufast, gif nan
minra feonda ne fægnað mines ungelimpes.
 40.12. þu me underfenge for minre unsceðfulnesse, and me
gestrangodest beforan þinre ansyne, on ecnesse.
 40.13. Gebletsod sy se Drihten, Israela God, on weorulda weoruld:
sy swa.
 41.1. Swa heort wilnað to wætre, þonne he werig byð
oþþe ofþyrst, swa wilnað min sawl and min mod to þe, Drihten.
 41.2. Mine sawle þyrst and lyst, þæt heo mæge cuman to
Gode; for þam he is se libbenda wylle: eala Dryhten, hwænne gewyrð
þæt, þæt ic cume and ætywe beforan Godes ansyne?
 41.3. Me wæran mine tearas for hlafas, ægþer ge on dæg
ge on niht; þonne ic gehyrde to me cweþan, Hwær is þin God, þe
þu to hopast?
 41.4. Ac þonne gemunde ic þine ærran gyfa, and
gestaðelode on me mine sawle; for þy ic geare wiste þæt ic sceolde
cuman, for Godes mildheortnesse, to þam wundorlican temple, þæt ys Godes
hus, þyder ic sceal cuman mid mycelre wynsumnesse stemne, and mid andetnesse,
swylce symblendra sweg byð, and bliðra.
 41.5. For hwi eart þu þonne unrot, min sawl; and min mod, hwi
gedrefe gyt me?
 41.6. Hopa to Drihtne, for þam ic hine gyt andette; for þam he
ys min Hælend, and min God.
 41.7. Wið me sylfne wæs min sawl and min mod gebolgen and
gedrefed; for þæm ic eom gemyndig þin, Drihten, be Iordane staðe, and
on þam lytlan cnolle, þe Ermon hatte.
 41.8. Seo neolnes cliopað to þære neolnesse, and heo
oncwyð, for þære stemne eorðan wæterædra, þæt ys þin yrre
eall heahwitu and hefig coman to me, and þine yþa me oferfleowon.
 41.9. On dæg bebead God his mildheortnesse cuman to me, me to
gefriþianne wið þyssum yrmðum, and on niht he us bebead þæt we
sceoldon singan his sang.
 41.10. Mid me beoð symle gearo gebedu to þam Gode, þe me
libbendne þanon gelædde; ic cweðe to þam Gode, þu eart min
andfengend.
 41.11. Hwy forgitst þu min, and hwi awyrpst þu me fram þe;
oððe hwy lætst þu me gan þus unrotne, þonne me mysceað mine
fynd?
 41.12. And þonne hy tobrecað eall min ban, and þonne me
hyspað þa þe me swencað; and huru swiðost, þonne hy cweðað,
ælce dæge, Hwær ys þin God?
 41.13. For hwy eart þu unrot, min mod, and min sawl, and hwy
gedrefest þu me?
 41.14. Hopa to Drihtne, for þam ic gyt hine andette; for þam he
is min Hælend, and min God.
 42.1. Dem me, Dryhten, and do sum toscead betwuh me and unrihtwisum
folce, and from facenfullum menn, and unrihtwisum, gefriða me.
 42.2. For þam þu eart min God, and min mægen: forhwy awyrpst
þu me, and hwi lætst þu me gan unrotne, þonne mine fynd me
drecceað?
 42.3. Send þin leoht, and þine soðfæstnesse, þa þe me
geogeara læddon, þæt hy me nu gyt gelædan to þinum halgan munte,
in on þin halge templ.
 42.4. þæt ic þonne gange to þinum altere, and to þam
Gode, þe me bliðne gedyde, on minum geogoðhade.
 42.5. Ic þe andette, Dryhten, mid sange, and mid hearpan; Hwy
eart þu unrot, min sawl, oþþe hwi gedrefest þu me?
 42.6. Hopa to Drihtne, for þam ic hine gyt andette; for þam
þu eart God, min Hælend, and min Dryhten.
 43.1. Drihten, we gehyrdon mid urum earum, and ure fæderas hit
us sædon þa weorc þe þu worhtest on hiora dagum, and on hiora
foregengena dagum.
 43.3. þæt wæs þæt þin hand towearp þa
elðeodegan folc, and plantode, and tydrede ure foregengan; þu swenctest
þa elðeodgan folc, and hy awurpe.
 43.4. Ne geeodon ure foregengan na ðas eorðan mid sweorda
ecgum, ne hy mid þy ne geheoldon, ne heora earmas hy ne geheoldon, ne ne
gehældon.
 43.5. Ac þin swiðre hand, and þin earm, and þæt leoht
þines andwlitan; for þam hy þe þa licodon, and þe licode mid him to
beonne.
 43.6. Hu ne eart þu min cyning and min Drihten, swa ylce swa þu
hiora wære; þu þe bebude hælo cuman to Iacobes cynne?
 43.7. þurh þe we beþurscon ure fynd, and awindwedan, and for
þinum naman we forsawan þa þe stodon ongean us.
 43.8. Ne getruwode ic næfre on minne bogan, ne min sweord me ne
gefriðode, ne ne gehældes.
 43.9. Ac þu us ahreddest æt þam þe ure ehton; and þa
ðe us hatedon, þu gebysmrodest.
 43.10. And we þa heredon God ælce dæge, and we wæron eac
geherede fram oþrum þeodum, for his weorcum; and his naman we andettað a
weoruld.
 43.11. þeah þu, Drihten, us nu adrifen hæbbe fram þe, and
us gebysmrod, and mid us ne fare on fyrd, swa þu geo dydest.
 43.12. Ac þu hæfst nu us gehwyrfde on bæclincg, and us
forsewenran gedone þonne ure fynd; and þa þe us hatiað, hy us
gegripað, and him sylfum gehrespað.
 43.13. þu us geþafodest him to metsianne, swa swa sceap, and
þu us tostenctest geond manega þeoda.
 43.14. þu us bebohtest, and bewrixledest, and nan folc mid us ne
gehwyrfdest.
 43.15. þu us gesettest to edwite, and to bysmre urum neahgeburum,
and to hleahtre, and to forsewennesse eallum þam þe us ymbsittað.
 43.16. þu hæfst us gedon to ealdspræce, þæt oðra
þeoda nyton hwæt hy elles sprecon, buton ure bysmer; and wecggeað heora
heafod ongean us, on heora gesamnuncge.
 43.17. ælce dæge byð min sceamu beforan me, and ongean me;
and mid minum bysmre ic eom bewrogen.
 43.18. For þara stemne þe me hyspað, and tælað, and for
þara ansyne þe min ehtað.
 43.19. Eall þas earfoðu becoman ofer us, and ne forgeate we
þeah na þe, ne þæt woh ne worhton, þæt we þine æ forleten;
ne ure mod ne eode on bæclincg fram þe.
 43.20. And þeah þu geþafodest, þæt ure stæpas wendon
of þinum wege; for þam þu woldest us geeaðmedan, on þære stowe ure
unrotnesse, þær we wæron bewrigene mid deaþes sceade.
 43.21. Gif we ofergeotole wæron Drihtnes naman, ures Godes, and
gif we ure handa upp hofon to oþrum Gode.
 43.22. Hu ne wræce hit þonne God; for þan he wat ealle
dygelnessa ælcere heortan.
 43.23. For þam we beoð ælce dæge for ðe geswencte; hy
teohhiað us him to snædincgsceapum.
 43.24. Aris, Drihten, for hwi slæpst þu; aris, and ne drif us
fram þe oð urne ende.
 43.25. For hwi wendst þu þinne andwlitan fram us, oððe hwy
forgytst þu ure yrmða, and ure geswinc?
 43.26. For þam synt nu full neah to duste gelæd ure sawla, and
ure wamb lið on þære eorðan.
 43.27. Aris, Drihten, and gefultuma us, and alys us for þinum
naman.
 44.1. Min heorte bealcet good word; þæt ys good Godes bearn
þæm cyncge ic befæste anweald ofer eall min weorc.
 44.2. Min tunge ys gelicost þæs writeres feþere þe
hraðost writ, þæt ys Crist, se ys word and tunge God Fæder; þurh
hine synt ealle þincg geworht.
 44.3. He ys fægrostes andwlitan ofer eall manna bearn;
geondgotene synt þine weleras mid Godes gyfe; for þam he gebletsode God on
ecnesse.
 44.4. Gyrd nu þin sweord ofer þin þeoh, þu Mihtiga,
þæt ys gastlicu lar, seo ys on þam godspelle; seo ys scearpre þonne
ænig/ sweord.
 44.5. Geheald nu þinne wlite, and þine fægernesse, and cum
orsorg, and rixsa; For þinre soðfæstnesse, and for þinre ryhtwisnesse:
þe gelæt swyþe wundorlice þin seo swyþre hand, and þin agen
anweald to þæm.
 44.7. þina flana synt swyþe scearpa on þam heortum þinra
feonda; folc gefeallað under ðe, þæt ys þæt hy oþer twega,
oþþe on andetnesse gefeallað, oþþe on helle.
 44.8. þin setl is, Drihten, on weorulda weoruld; swiðe ryht is
seo cynegyrd þines rices, seo gerecð ælcne mann, oþþe to þinum
willan, oððe to wite.
 44.9. þu lufodest rihtwisnesse, and hatodest unryhtwisnesse; for
þam þe gesmyrede Dryhten, þin God, mid þam ele blisse, ofer ealle
oþre menn.
 44.10. Myrre, and gutta, and cassia dropiað of þinum claðum,
and of þinum elpanbænenum husum, on þæm þe gelufiað cynincga
dohtor þa þær wuniað, for þinre lufan, and for þinre weorðunga;
þa wyrtgemang tacniað mistlicu mægen Cristes, and þæt hrægl
tacnað Cristes lichaman, and þa elpanbænenan hus tacniað rihtwisra
manna heortan, þara kynincga dohtor tacniað rihtwisra manna sawla.
 44.11. And þær stent cwen þe on þa swyðran hand, mid
golde getucode, and mid ælcere mislicre fægernesse gegyred, þæt ys
eall Cristnu gesamnung.
 44.12. Gehyr nu, min dohtor; þæt ys seo gesamnuncg Cristnes
folces geseoh, and onhyld þin eare, and forgit, and alæt þin folc,
þæt synd yfelwillende menn and unðeawas and þæt hus, and þone
hired þines leasan fæder; þæt ys deofol.
 44.13. For þam se cyncg wilnað þines wlites, for þam he ys
Drihten, þin God; gebide þe to him, and weorþa hine: and swa ycle doð
eac þa dohtor þære welegan byrig Tyrig, hi hine weorðiað mid gyfum,
þæt synt þa sawla, þe beoð gewelgoda mid goodum geearnuncgum.
 44.14. Gif þu þus dest, þonne weorðiað þe ealle þa
welegastan on ælcum folce, and habbað him þæt to mæstum gylpe,
þæt hy geseon kyninga dohtra inne mid him.
 44.15. Utan beslepte, and gegyrede mid eallum mislicum hrægla
wlitum, and mid gyldnum fnasum, þæt synt mistlice geearnunga fulfremedra
manna; Eala kynincg, hwæt þe beoð broht manega mædenu, and æfter
þam þære seo nyhste, þe we ær ymbe spræcon.
 44.16. Mid blisse and mid fægnuncge hy bioð gelædde in to
þinum temple, þær synt þa sawla þe heora mægðhad gehealdað,
and þa hreowsiendan, and þa þe gewitnode beoð for hiora scyldum;
oþþe heora willum, oððe heora unwillum.
 44.17. For þinum fædrum, þe bioð acennedu bearn, þæt
synt apostolas wið þam heahfædrum and wið witgum and þu hy gesetst
to ealdormannum ofer ealle eorþan.
 44.18. And hy beoð gemyndige þines naman, Dryhten on ælcere
cneoresse/.
 44.19. And þonne, for þy þe andett ælc folc on ecnesse,
and on weorulda weoruld.
 45.1. Dryhten ys ure gebeorh, and ure mægen, and ure fultumend
on earfoðum, þa us swiðe swiðlice oft onbecomon.
 45.2. For þam we us ne ondrædað, þeah eall eorðe sy
gedrefedu, and þeah þa muntas syn aworpene on midde þa sæ.
 45.3. Ure fynd coman swa egeslice to us, þæt us ðuhte, for
þam geþune, þæt sio eorþe eall cwacode, and hy wæron þeah sona
afærde fram Gode, swyþor þonne we; and þa upahafenan kynincgas, swa
þa/ muntas, wæron eac gedrefde, for þæs Godes strenge.
 45.4. þa wæs geblissod seo Godes burh on Hierusalem, for þam
cyme þæs scures þe hy geclæsnode: se Hyhsta gehalgode his templ in on
þære byrig; for þam ne wyrð seo burh næfre onwend, þa hwile þe
God byð unonwendedlic on hire midle.
 45.5. God hyre gehealp swyþe ær on morgen, and gedrefed
wæron þa elðeodgan : folc, and hiora rice wæs gehnæged: se Hyhsta
sende his word, and gehwyrfed wæs ure land and ure folc to beteran; and hi
and heora land to wyrsan.
 45.6. Drihten, mægena God, ys mid us, and ure andfengend is
Iacobes God.
 45.7. Cumað, and gesioð Godes weorc, and his wundru þe he
wyrcð ofer eorðan.
 45.8. He afierð fram us ælc gefeoht ut ofer ure landgemæru,
and forbrycð ura feonda bogan, and eall heora wæpn gebryt, and heora
wæpn gebryt, and heora scyldas forbærnð; þa andswarode God þæs
witgan mode, and cwæð eft þurh þone witgan.
 45.9. Geæmetgiað eow nu, and gesioð, þæt ic eom ana
God, and me nu up ahebbe ofer þa elðeodegan folc, and eac on þysum folce
ic beo nu up ahæfen.
 45.10. Dryhten, mægena God ys mid us, and ure andfengend ys
Iacobes God.
 46.1. Wepað nu and heofað, eall orlegu folc, for þam ure God
eow hæfð ofercumen; and eac ge, Israhela, hebbað upp eowre handa, and
fægniað, and myrgað Gode, mid wynsumre stemne.
 46.2. For þam he ys swyþe heah God, and swyþe andrysnlic, and
swiþe micel Cynincg, ofer ealle oðre godas.
 46.3. He us underþeodde ure folc, and orlega þeoda he alede
under ure fet.
 46.4. He us geceas him to yrfeweardnesse, and Iacobes cynn þæt
he lufode.
 46.5. Drihten astah mid wynsume sange, and mid bymena stemne.
 46.6. Ac singað urum Gode, and heriað hine; singað, singað,
and heriað urne Cyning; singað, and heriað hine.
 46.7. For þam he ys God, and Cynincg ealre eorðan; singað,
and heriað hine wislice.
 46.8. Dryhten rixað ofer eall cynrynu; Drihten sit ofer his ðam
halgan setle.
 46.9. þa ealdormen ealre eorðan becumað to Abrahames Gode,
and beoð him underðydde; for þam he oferswiðde þa strangan kynincgas
ofer eorðan, þa þe wæron up ahæfene swa þas godas.
 47.1. Mycel ys se Drihten, ure God, and swyþe to herianne, on
þære byrig ures Drihtnes, and on his þam halgan munte.
 47.2. He tobrædde blisse ofer ealle ure eorþan; sio mycle burh
þæs myclan kyninges is aset on þa norðhealfe þæs muntes Syon.
 47.3. Se God ys cuð on þære byrig, for þam he hire symle
fultumað.
 47.4. Eala hwæt ge sawon, hu egeslice gegaderode wæron
eorðkyningas, and hu hi togædere comon.
 47.5. And sona swa hi gesawon Godes wundru, hy wæron wundriende,
and wæran gedrefde, and wæran styriende, and onwende for þam ege, and
fyrhto, þe hi gegripon.
 47.6. For þam him com swa hrædlic sar and wracu, swa þam
cennendan wife cymð færlic sar; and hy wæron gebrytte swa hrædlice
swa swa hradu yst windes scip tobrycð, on þam sandum, neah þære byrig
þe Tarsit hatte, seo is on þam lande þe Cilicia hatte.
 47.7. Swa swa we geogeare hyrdon, þæt God dyde be urum
fæderum, swa we geseoð nu þæt he deð be us, on þæs Godes
byrig, þe myclu wundru wyrcð, þæt ys on ures Godes byrig, þe he
gestaþelode on ecnesse.
 47.8. We onfoð, Drihten, þinre mildheortnesse, on middum
þinum temple.
 47.9. Swa swa þin nama is tobræd and gemyclad geond ealle
eorðan, swa ys eac þin lof; þin swiðre hand is full rihtwisnesse.
 47.10. Blissie nu Syon se munt, and fægnie Iudea cyn, for
þinum domum, Drihten.
 47.11. Hweorfað ymb Sion, and gað ofer þone weall Hierusalem,
and ymbutan heriað God, mid ælces cynnes heringe, and lufiað hine, and
secgað his wundru on þam torrum, and on þam wighusum þære byrig; and
fæstniað eower mod on his wundrum, and dælað hire weorðias swiðe
rihte, and secgað swylc wundru eowrum gingrum, þæt hy hy mægen eft
secgan of cynne on cynn.
 47.12. For þam he is ure God on ecnesse, and on weorulda woruld;
and he ræt us and recð, on weorulda weorld.
 48.1. Gehyrað nu þas word, ealle þeoda, and onfoð heora mid
eowrum earum, ealle þa þe eorðan buiað.
 48.2. And ealle þa þe þæron acende synt, and eall manna
bearn, ægðer ge welige ge heane.
 48.3. Min muð wile sprecan wisdom, and seo smeaung minre heortan
foreþancolnesse.
 48.4. Ic onhylde min earan to þam bispellum, þæs ðe me
innan lærð, and ic secge on þys sealme, hwæs ic wylle ascian.
 48.5. And hwæt ic ondræde on þæm yflan dagum; þæt
is unrihtwisnes minra hoa, and ealles mines flæsces, sio me hæfð utan
behrincged.
 48.6. Ongitan nu, þa þe truwiað heora agenum mægene, and
þære mycelnesse hiora speda gylpað and wuldrað.
 48.7. þæt nan broðor oþres sawle nele alysan of helle, ne
ne mæg, þeah he wylle, gif he sylf nanwuht nyle, ne ne deð to goode,
þa hwile þe he her byð; Gylde for þy him sylf, and alyse his sawle,
þa hwyle ðe he her sy; for þam se broðor oþþe nyle, oððe ne
mæg, gif he sylf na ne onginð to tilianne, þæt he þæt weorð
agife to alysnesse his sawle; ac þæt ys wyrse þæt full neah ælc
mann þæs tiolað, fram þæm anginne his lifes, oþ þone ende, hu
he on ecnesse swincan mæge.
 48.8. And næfð nænne forðanc be his deaðe, þonne he
gesyhð þa welegan, and þa weoruldwisan sweltan; se unwisa and se dysega
forweorþað him ætsamne.
 48.9. And læfað fremdum heora æhte; þeah hy gesibbe
hæbben, hy beoð him swyðe fremde, þonne hi nan good æfter him ne
doð; ac heora byrgen byð heora hus on ecnesse.
 48.10. And heora geteld of cynne on cynn; and hi nemnað hiora
land, and hiora tunas, be heora naman.
 48.11. þa hwile þe mon on are, and on anwealde byð, næfð
he full neah nan andgyt nanes goodes, ac onhyreð dysegum neatum; swa hi eac
beoð him swyðe gelice.
 48.12. Ac þes weg, and þeos orsorgnes þyses andweardan lifes
him fet witu on þam toweardan; for þam heo on last tiliað to cwemanne
Gode and mannum, mid wordum, næs mid weorcum; ne furþum gearone willan
nabbað to þam weorce.
 48.13. Mid swylcum monnum byð hell gefylled, swa swa fald mid
sceapum; and se deað hy forswylcð on ecnesse.
 48.14. And sona, on þam ylcan morgene, þa rihtwisan heora
wealdað, and hyra fultum and hyra anweald forealdað on helle; for þæm
hy beoð adrifene of heora wuldre.
 48.15. Ac God þeah alyst mine sawle of helle handa; þeah ic
þyder cume, þonne he me underfehð.
 48.16. Ne wundrige ge, na ne ne andgiað on þone welegan, þeah
he welig seo geworden, and þeah gemanigfealdod sy þæt wuldor his huses.
 48.17. For þam þe he þyder ne læt þæt eall mid him,
þonne he heonan færþ ne hit him æfter þyder ne færeð.
 48.18. For þæm he hæfde his heofonrice her on eorðan,
þa him nanes willan næs forwyrnd her, ne nanes lustes on þysse weorulde;
For ðam he nyste him nænne þanc, ne Gode ne mannum, þæs ðe he
him sealde, syððan he hit hæfde; butan þa ane hwile, þe hit him man
sealde.
 48.19. For þæm he færð þær his foregengan beoð,
þæt is to helle þær he næfre nan leoht ne gesyhð.
 48.20. Ac þas spræce ne ongit na swylc mann, þonne he byð
on welan, and on weorðscipe, and onhyreð þonne dysegum neatum, and byð
him swiðe gelic geworden.
 49.1. Dryhtna Dryhten wæs sprecende, þæt he wolde cuman to
eorðan, swa he eft dyde, and cliopode eorðlice men to geleafan.
 49.2. Fram sunnan upgange, oð hire setlgang, of Sion aras se
wlite his andwlitan.
 49.3. And eft cymð se ylca God swiðe openlice, þæt ys ure
God; and he þonne naht ne swugað.
 49.4. Fyr byrnð for his ansyne, and ymb hine utan strange
stormas.
 49.5. And he cleopað to þæm heofone, hæt hine þæt he
hine fealde swa swa boc; and he bebyt þære eorðan, þæt heo
todæle hyre folc.
 49.6. And gegadrie on þa swyðran hand his halgan, þa þe
heoldon his bebodu, ofer ælcere offrunga.
 49.7. Heofonas bodiað his rihtwisnesse, for þam se God is
demend.
 49.8. And þonne cwyð to him: Gehyrað nu, min folc; ic sprece
to eow, Israelum, and ic eow secge; soðlice, for þam ic eom Drihten, eower
God.
 49.9. Ne þreage ic eow na æfter offrunga; for ðam eowra
offrunga synt symle beforan minre ansyne.
 49.10. Ne onfo ic na of eowrum huse cealfas, ne of eowrum heordum
buccan; For þam min synt ealra wuda wildeor, and ealra duna; ceap, and
nytenu, and oxan.
 49.12. Ic can ealle heofones fugelas, and eall eorþan wlite is
mid me.
 49.13. Gif me hingreð, ne seofige ic þæt na to eow; for
ðam min is eall eorðan ymbhwyrft, and eall hyre innuncg.
 49.14. Wene ge þæt ic ete þæra fearra flæsc, oþþe
þara buccena blod drince?
 49.15. Ac ofriað Gode þa offrunge lofes, and gyldað þam
Hyhstan eower gehat.
 49.16. And cleopiað to me, on þam dagum eowra earfoða;
þonne gefriðie ic eow, and ge weorðiað me.
 49.17. Ac to þam synfullan cwyð God, For hwy bodast þu mine
rihtwisnesse; oððe for hwy onfehst þu on þinne fulan muð mine æ?
 49.18. For þæm þu hatodest symle leornunga, and forwurpe min
word symle under bæc fram þe.
 49.19. Gif þu gesawe þeof, þu urne mid him, næs na ongean
hine; and þu dydest þe to þam wohhæmendum.
 49.20. þin muð wæs symle ful unrihtes, and þin tunge
ontynde facn.
 49.21. þu sæte ongean þinne broþor, and tældest hine;
and worhtest wrohte betwuh þe, and þinre modor suna oðrum.
 49.22. Eall þis yfel þu dydest, and ic swugode and þolode,
swylce ic hit nyste: þu ræswedest swiðe unryhte, þæt ic wære
þin gelica, swylce ic ne meahte þe forgyldan swylces edlean.
 49.23. Ic þe þreage nu, and stæle beforan þe, and þe
cyðe eal þas yflu; Gehyrað nu ðiss, and ongytað ealle þa þe Godes
forgytað, þy læs he eow gegripe; for þam nys nan oþer þe eow
mæge gefriðian of his handa.
 49.24. Seo ofrung lofes me licað swiðost, and me eac swyðost
weorþað, and on þære offrunga is se rihtwisa weg, on þære ic
getæce Godes hælo eallum þam þe swa doð.
 50.1. Miltsa me, Drihten, æfter þinre mycelan mildheortnesse.
 50.2. And æfter þære menigu þinra mildheortnessa, adilega
mine unrihtwisnessa.
 50.3. And aðweah me clænran from minum unrihtwisnessum,
þonne ic ær ðysse scylde wæs, and of þysse scamleasan scylde
geclænsa me.
 50.4. For þam mine unrihtwisnessa ic ongyte, and mina synna
beoð symle beforan me, on minum gemynde.
 50.5. Wið þe ænne ic gesyngode, and ic dyde yfel beforan
ðe; wið þe ænne ic sceal þæt betan; for þæm þu ana eart
rihtwis, and oferswiðest ealle, þonne ðu demst.
 50.6. Nis hit nan wundor, þeah þu sy god, and ic yfel; for
ðam þu wast þæt ic wæs mid unrihtwisnesse onfangen, and min modor
me gebær mid synne.
 50.7. Ic wat þæt þu symle lufast rihtwisnesse, and me
sealdest mænega gyfa ðines wisdomes; þa gyfa synt beheleda and uncuþa
manegum oðrum.
 50.8. Ac bespreng me nu mid þinum haligdome, swa swa mid ysopon,
þæt ic beo geclænsod; and aðweah me, þæt ic sy hwitra þonne
snaw.
 50.9. Syle minre gehyrnesse gefean and blisse; þæt ic gehyre
þæt ic wylle, and eac oðre gehyron be me, þæt þæt ic wilnige;
swa swa hy ær gehyrdon þæt þæt ic nolde; þæt þonne mæge
unrote mod blissian.

PsHead
B8.2.2.
Headings to Psalms 1-50: Bright &amp; Ramsey 1907, 1-122.
<catref target="PIS">


 2.1. Ðæs æfteran sealmes capitul is gecweden <foreign>Psalmus
Dauid</foreign> þæt ys on Englisc Dauides sealm.
 2.2. For þæm he ys sealm gecweden, for þi he seofode on
þæm sealme, and mænde to Drihtne be his feondum, ægðer ge inlendum
ge utlendum, and be eallum his earfoðum; and swa deð ælc þæra, þe
þysne sealm sincgð, be his sylfes feondum, and swa dyde Crist be Iudeum.
 3.1. Ðysne þriddan sealm Dauid sang þa he fleah Absalon his
sunu, and seofode þa yrmðe to Drihtne.
 3.2. Swa deþ ælc þæra manna þe þisne sealm singð,
his sylfes earfoðu, ægðer ge modes ge lichaman, he seofað to Drihtne.
 3.4. Swa dyde Crist, þonne he þysne sealm sang, be Iudeum he
hine sang, and be Iudan Scarioth, þe hine læwde, he seofode to Drihtne.
 4.1. Þe feorða sealm ys gecweden Dauides sealm, and Dauides
sang; for ði ælc þæra sealma þe swa gecweden byð, þæt he sy
ægðer ge Dauides sealm ge Dauides sancg, ælcne ðæra he sancg
besone mid weorode.
 4.3. Ac ða he þysne sealm sancg, þa gealp he and fægnode
Godes fultumes wið his feondum; and swa deð ælc welwillende man, þe
þisne sealm singð, and swa dyde Ezechias, þa he wæs ahred æt his
feondum, and swa dyde Crist, ða he wæs ahred æt Iudeum.
 5.1. Ðe fifta sealm ys gecweden Dauides sealm, þone he sang be
his sylfes frofre, and be herenesse ealra ðæra rihtwisena ðe secað
yrfeweardnesse on heofonrice, mid Crist, se ys ende ealra ðinga.
 5.3. And ælc mann þe þisne sealm singð, he hine singð be
his sylfes frofre; and swa dyde Ezechias, þa he alysed wæs of his
mettrumnesse; and swa dyde Crist, þa he alysed wæs fram Iudeum.
 6.1. Dauid sang þysne syxtan sealm be his mettrumnesse, and be
his earfoðum, and eac be þam ege þæs domes on domes dæge; and swa
deð ælc þæra þe hine singð; and swa dyde Crist, þa he on
eorðan wæs, he hine sang be his earfoðum; and eac Ezechias be his
untrumnesse.
 7.1. Þysne seofoðan sealm Dauid sang, þa he seofode his
ungelimp to Drihtne; þæt wæs þa Absalon his sunu hine adrifen
hæfde of ðam rice, þa hine teonode and wyrgde Chus Geniminis sunu;
þa seofode he þæt to Drihtne, and swa deð ælc mann þe þysne
sealm singð, mænð his earfoðu to Drihtne; and swa dyde Crist, þa he
on eorðan wæs.
 8.1. Þysne eahteoðan sealm sang Dauid, þa he wundrade Godes
wundra, se wylt eallum gesceaftum; and eac he witgode on ðam sealme be
þære wuldorlican acennednesse Cristes.
 9.1. On ðam nigoðan sealme Dauid hine gebæd to Drihtne, and
him þancode, þæt his sunu and eac oðre fynd him ne mihton eall
þæt yfel don, þæt hi him geteohod hæfdon; and on ðæt ylce
gerad, hine singð ælc rihtwis mann be his sylfes feondum.
 9.4. And be þam ylcan, hine sang Crist, þa Iudeas hine woldan
don mare yfel ðonne hig mihton; and swa dyde eac Ezechias, ða his fynd hine
ne meahton ateon swa hy woldon.
 10.1. Ðysne teoþan sealm Dauid sang, þa he wæs adrifen on
þæt westen fram Sawle þam cynge, þa his geferan hine lærdon
þæt he hine þær hydde, swa þes spearuwa; and swa ylce þa
rihtwisan þe hine singað, hi seofiað be heora feondum, ægðer ge
gesewenlicum ge ungesewenlicum; and swa dyde Crist be Iudeum, þa he þysne
sealm sang.
 11.1. Þa David þisne endleftan sealm sang, þa seofode he on
þam sealme, þæt on his dagum sceolde rihtwisnes and wisdom beon swa
swiðe alegen; and swa deð ælc rihtwis mann, þonne he þysne sealm
singð, þonne mænð he to Drihtne þæt unriht þæt on his dagum
bið; and swa dyde Crist, þa he hine sang, þa mænde he to Drihtne Iudea
ungeleaffulnesse.
 12.1. Ða David þysne twelftan sealm sang, þa seofode he to
Drihtne, on þam sealme, be his feondum, ægþer ge gastlicum ge
lichamlicum; and swa deð ælc þæra þe hine singð; and swa dyde
Crist be Iudeum, and be deoflum; and swa dyde Ezechias se cyng be Assiriam,
þa hi hine ymbseten hæfdon, on þære byrig.
 13.1. Ða Dauid þisne þreotteoðan sealm sang, þa seofode
he to Drihtne on þam sealme, þæt æfre on his dagum sceolde gewurðan
swa lytle treowa, and swa lytel wisdom wære on worulde; and swa deð ælc
rihtwis man, þe hine nu singð, he seofað þæt ylce be his tidum; and
swa dyde Crist be Iudeum, and Ezechias be Rapsace, Assiria cyninge.
 14.1. Dauid sang þysne feowerteoðan sealm, þa he adrifen
wæs of his earde, wiscte þæt he moste eft tocuman; and swa dyde Israela
folc, þa hie on hæftnyde gelædde wæron, of Hierusalem to Babilonia.
 14.3. And swa deð ælc rihtwis man, þonne he þysne sealm
singð, wilnað him sumere rothwile on þissere worulde, and ece reste
æfter þisum; and swa dyde Crist, þa he hine sang, seofode his earfoðu
to Drihtne.
 15.1. Þone fifteoðan sealm Dauid sang be his earfoðum,
ægðer ge modes ge lichaman; and eft swa ilce Ezechias hine sang be his
mettrumnesse, wilnode him to Gode sumre frofre; and swa deð ælc rihtwis
mann, þe hine singð, on his earfoðum; and swa dyde Crist, þa he hine
sang.
 16.1. Dauid sang þysne syxteoþan sealm, and hine geornfullice
gebæd on þisum sealme to Drihtne, and hine unscyldigne cyðde wið þa
his fynd, þe his ehton, butan scylde; and swa doð ealle þa rihtwisan,
þe þisne sealm singað, ymb þæt ylce hi hine singað; and swa dyde
Crist be Iudeum.
 17.1. Dauid sang þysne seofonteoþan sealm lytle ær his ende,
ymb swyðe lang þæs þe hine God alysed hæfde, ægðer ge æt
Sawle ge æt eallum his feondum.
 17.3. And swa deð ælc þæra þe hine singð, þancað
Gode his mundbyrde, þonne he hine of hwylcum earfoðum alysed hæfð,
oþþe hine oððe þone þe he hine fore singð, for þæm ylcan
hine sang Crist, þonne he alysed wæs fram Iudea ehtnesse.
 18.1. Ðysne eahtateoðan sealm David sang, Gode to þancunga
his mislicra and manigfealdra gesceafta ðe he gesceop, mannum to ðeowian;
ne for ðy þæt þa men sceoldon him ðeowian; be þæm he
cwæð.
 19.1. Dauid sang þysne nigonteoðan sealm, and sæde on
ðæm sealme hu his folc him fore gebæde on his earfoðum; and eac
Ezechias folc gebæd for hine, þa he wæs beseten mid his feondum on
þære byrig.
 19.3. And swa doð ealle cristene men þe þysne sealm singað,
hy hine singað for heora kyningas; and eac þa apostolas hine sungon be
Criste, þa hine man lædde to rode.
 20.1. Ðysne twentigoðan sealm Dauid sang be him sylfum, and eac
witegode be Ezechie þæm kinge; and ælc folc þe hine singð for heora
kyning and ealra mæst Dauid, witegode on þæm sealme be Criste.
 22.1. Dauid sang þysne twa and twenteogeþan sealm, þa he
witegode be Israela folces freodome; hu hy sceoldon beon alæd of Babilonia
þeowdome and hu hi sceoldon Gode þancian þæra ara þe hi be wege
hæfdon hamweardes; and eac be his agenre gehwyrftnesse of his
wræcsiðe.
 22.4. And ælc þæra ðe hine singð, he þancað Gode
his alysnesse of his earfoðum; and swa dydon þa Apostolas, and eall
þæt cristene folc, Cristes æriste; and eac þanciað cristene men,
on þyson sealme, heora alysnesse of heora scyldum æfter fulluhte.
 23.1. On þissum þreo and twentigoðan sealme, Dauid witegode,
and rehte mid hwylcum geearnungum gehwylc man hine mæg alysan of his
earfoðum; and eac he witgode be Cristes sigefæstnesse, þa þa he on
heofonas astah, æfter his æriste; and eac he witgode be him sylfum, hu
his ealdormenn sceoldon fægnian his cymes of his wræcsiðe.
 24.1. Dauid sang þysne feower and twentigoðan sealm, and hine
þæron gebæd, þa he to þære reste becom, þe he ær wilnode;
and eac he witegode on þam sealme be þæs folces gehwyrfnesse of heora
hæftnyde, þa hi on Babilonia gehæfte wæron; and swa ylce hi ælcum
rihtwisum, þonne he ænige reste hæfð, æfter his earfoðum; and
eac be Criste, æfter his æriste.
 25.1. Dauid sang þisne fif and twentigoðan sealm be his
unscyldignesse/ wið his sunu, and wið his geþeahteras, þe hine onwoh
lærdan.
 25.2. And eac he witgode, on þam sealme, be þære
unscyldignesse Israela folces wið Asirie, þa hi hy læddan on hæftnyd
to Babilonia; and eac swa ylce, ælc rihtwis man þe hine singð, he hine
singð be him sylfum, and be þam þe hine unscyldigne dreccað; and swa
dyde eac Crist be Iudeum.
 27.1. Dauid sang þisne seofon and twentigoþan sealm; on
þæm sealme he wæs cleopiende to Drihtne, wilnode þæt he hine
arette, and gefriðode wiþ eallum earfoðum, ægðer ge modes ge
lichaman; and wið ealle his fynd gescylde, ge wið gesewene ge wið
ungesewene.
 27.4. And eac Ezechias, on þam ylcan sealme, hine gebæd,
þæt hine God alysde, ægðer ge æt his mettrumnesse ge æt his
feondum, swa he þa dyde.
 27.6. And þæs ylcan wilnað ælc þæra hine singð,
oþþe for hine sylfne, oððe for oþerne; and swa ylce dyde Crist, þa
þa he þysne sealm sang.
 28.1. Ðysne eahta and twentigoðan sealm Dauid sang, bebeodende
þam folce þæt hi gelæston heora gehat, and heora ælmessan sealdon
Gode, for swa myclum gifum swa he him geaf.
 28.3. And he witegode eac þæt ylce be Ezechie, þe lange
æfter him wæs, þæt he sceolde þæt ylce don, þonne he alysed
wære æt Asirium, and eac æt his mettrumnesse.
 28.5. And eac swa þæt ilce he witegode be eallum þam þe
æfter him gebrocode wæron, and eft arette, þæt hi eac þæs Gode
þancodon, æfter heora bysne; and eac he witegode be Criste, þæt he
sceolde beon alysed æt Iudeum: he cwæð.
 29.1. Dauid sang þysne nigan and twentigoþan sealm þam Gode,
þe hine alysde æt his feondum, and æt eallum earfoðum.
 29.2. And þæt ylce he witgode be Ezechie, þæt he sceolde
þæt ylce don þonne he alysed wære æt Assirium, and æt his
metrumnesse.
 29.4. And þæt ylce he witegode be ælcum rihtwison men, þe
þysne sealm singð, oþþe for hine sylfne, oþþe for oðerne, Gode to
þancunge þære blisse, þe he þonne hæfð.
 29.6. And eac he witegode on þam sealme be Criste, hu he sceolde
alysed beon, ægðer ge fram Iudeum ge of ðy deaðe.
 30.1. Dauid sang þysne þrittigoðan sealm, gebiddende to
Drihtne for his hamcyme of þam wræce, and of þam earfoðan, þe he
þa on wæs.
 30.2. And eac he witgode be þære wræce, þe æfter him
wurðan sceolde þæm folce; þæt wæs þa hi to Babilonia
gelædde wæron.
 30.4. He witgode, þæt hi sceoldon gebiddan on þa ylcan wisan
þe he dyde, and hyra ungelimp þær seofian swa he dyde.
 30.5. And eac he witegode be ælcum rihtwisan menn, þe sealmas
singð, awþer oþþe for hine sylfne, oððe for oðerne mann, þara
þe geswenced byð, awðer oþþe on mode, oþþe on lichaman.
 30.8. And he witegode eac be Criste, þæt he hine sceolde swa
gebiddan wið þam earfoðum, þe Iudeas him dydon.
 31.1. Dauid sang þisne an and þrittigoðan sealm wundriende
þære unaseccgendlican gesælignesse þæra manna, þe him God
forgifð ealle heora scylda, and him ælc geswinc aferþ, swa swa he him
oft dyde.
 31.3. And he witgode eac be Ezechie, hu he sceolde wundrian
þære myclan mildheortnesse, þe he him oft forgeaf, ægðer ge on his
hælo ge on his alysnesse æt his feondum.
 31.5. And swa þæt ylce he witgode be ælcum godum men, þe
him God swa ymb dyde; and he ætwat eac him sylfum, þæt he ne hreowsode
his synna, ær he hæfde witnunga; and he witgode eac be Criste, þæt
he swa ylce wolde herian swylce menn.
 32.1. Dauid sang þisne twa and þrittigoþan sealm, herigende
Drihten, and him þanciende, þæt he hine swa wundorlice of eallum his
earfoþum gefriðode, and hine swa weorðlice gesette ofer his rice.
 32.3. And eac he lærde, on þam sealme, ealle menn, þæt hi
sceoldon Gode þancian, ealra þæra gooda þe he him dyde.
 32.5. And he witgode eac be Ezechie, þæt he sceolde þæt
ylce don, þonne he alysed wære of his earfoþum, and be ælcum
þæra þe þysne sealm singð.
 32.7. And eac be Criste he witgode, þæt he sceolde, æfter
his æriste, ealle men þæt ylce læran.
 33.1. Dauid sang þysne þreo and þrittigoðan sealm,
gehatende Drihtne þæt he hine symle wolde bletsian, for þæm gifum
þe he him geaf; and he wilnode on þæm sealme, þæt him God sende his
godcundne engel on his fultum.
 33.4. And he lærde eac, on þæm sealme, ælcne man þe
æfter him wære, þæt he þæt ylce dyde.
 33.5. And he witgode eac, on þæm sealme, be Ezechie þam
kincge, þæt he sceolde þæt ylce don æfter þam sige, þe he
hæfde wið Assirium; and þæt ylce he witgode be Criste, þæt he
þæt ylce don wolde, and eac oðre læran.
 34.1. Dauid sang þysne feower and þrittigoþan sealm,
siofigende to Drihtne his yrmða; tealde his ungelimp, and hu he hine gebæd
to Gode, þæt he him gearode.
 34.3. And eac he witegode, on þam ilcan sealme, þæt ylce be
ælcum rihtwison menn, þe þysne sealm sunge, oððe for hine sylfne
oþþe for oþerne mann, þæt he sceolde þæs ylcan wilnian.
 34.5. Eac he witgode be Criste, þæt he wolde þæt ylce
don, þonne he come ma witgiende, þonne wyrgende oððe wilniende.
 35.1. Dauid sang þisne fif and þrittigoðan sealm, þa he
wæs aflymed fram Sawle, on þa ylcan tiid þe he genam his ceac, and his
spere, on his getelde, on niht, to tacne þæt he inne mid him slæpendum
wæs; and swa deð ælc þæra þe þysne sealm singð, for his
earfoþum; and swa dyde Crist, þa he hine sang, for þam earfoðum þe
Iudas him dyde.
 36.1. Dauid sang þysne syx and þritigoðan sealm, on þæm
he lærde ealle geleaffulle þæt hy ne onhyredon þam yfelwillendum,
þeah him þuhte þæt hi gesælige ond orsorge wæron; for þam hyra
orsorgnes swiðe hraðe aspringð; and ælc þæra ðe gyt þysne
sealm singð, be þam ylcan he hine singð; and eac Crist þæt ylce
lærde and witgode, þonne he þysne sealm sang.
 37.1. Dauid sang þysne seofon and þrittigoðan sealm,
andettende Drihtne his scylde, and seofigende his ungelimp, þæt he ær
mid his scyldum geearnode.
 37.3. And he eac healsode Drihten, on ðæm sealme, þæt he
hine on swylcum earfeðum ne lete his lif geendian.
 37.4. And he witegode eac be Ezechie, þam kyncge, þæt he
sceolde þæt ylce don, on his earfoðum.
 37.5. And eac be ælcum þæra þe þysne sealm sunge,
oþþe for hine sylfne, oððe for oðerne man, he witgode þæt he
sceolde þæt ilce mænan, and eac þæt ylce gemetan; and eac be
Criste he witegode, þæt he wolde þæt ylce don.
 38.1. Dauid sang þysne eahta and þrittigoþan sealm,
seofigende to Drihtne, mid hu manegum unrotnessum he wæs ofðrycced under
Sawle.
 38.2. On þæm sealme he lærde and tælde ealle men, þe
worulde welan gaderiað mid unrihte, and nytan hwam hi hine læfað.
 38.4. And eac he witgode þæt ælc þæra þæt ylce
don sceolde, þe þysne sealm æfter him sunge.
 38.5. And eac he witgode be Criste, þæt he wolde seofian swa
ylce his nearonesse, þe he hæfde under Iudeum.
 38.7. And eac, on æfteweardum þæm sealme, he wilnode ealra
swiðost, þæt him God sealde sume frofre, and sume rothwile on þyssum
andweardum life, ær his ende.
 39.1. Dauid sang þysne nigan and þritigoþan sealm, gylpende
on þam sealme, þæt he nauht idel nære, þa he anbidode Godes
fultumes; forþam he on þæm ærran sealme ahsode God, Hwæt his anbid
wære; oððe hwæs he anbidode?
 39.4. And eac he witgode be þam gehæftan folce on Babylonia,
þæt hy sceoldon þone ylcan sealm singan, and þæt ylce seofian, and
eft fægnian, þonne hy on genere wæron, and þysne sealm singan, swa he
dyde.
 39.6. And swa ylce gebyreð ælcum cristnum men, þas twegen
sealmas to singanne; þone ærran, on his earfoðum, and þone æftran,
syþþan he genered byð.
 39.8. And þæt ylce he witgode be Criste, þæt he wolde, be
þam ylcan, þas sealmas singan, ægðer ge be þam earfoðum, þe hine
Iudeas dydon, ge eft be his alysnesse.
 40.1. Dauid sang þysne feowertigoðan sealm be his earfoðum,
and eft be þam fultume þe he hæfde fram Gode.
 40.2. And he sæde eac on þam sealme, hu he hæfde afandod
ægðer ge his frynd ge his fynd, on his earfoðum, and on his ungelimpe;
and eac he witgode be Ezechie cincge, þe æfter him beon sceolde, þæt
him sceolde þæt ylce beon.
 40.5. And eac be ælcum Cristnum men he witgode þæt ylce,
þara þe ærest on earfoðum byð, and eft on eðnesse; and eac be
Criste he witgode, on þæm sealme, and be Iudeum, hu hy hine swencton, and
hu hine God eft arette.
 41.1. Dauid sang þysne an and feowertigoþan sealm, þa he
wilnode to hys eðle to cumanne, of his wræcsiðe; and þæt ilce he
witgode be Israela folce, gehæftum on Babilonia, þæt hy sceoldon
þæt ylce don.
 41.3. And eac he witgode be ælcum cristnum men, þara þe
geswenced wære, oþþe on mode oððe on lichaman, and þonne wilnode
ægðer ge þyses lifes frofre ge þæs toweardan.
 41.6. And eac be Criste and be Iudeum he witgode, hu he wilnode
þæt he wurde gedæled wið hy, and wið heora yfelnesse.
 42.1. Dauid sang þysne tu and feowertigoþan sealm, and healsode
God on þyssum sealme, þæt he demde betwuh him and his feondum, þe nane
æ Godes ne heoldon, and he eac witgode be þam gehæftan folce on
Babylonia, þæt hy sceoldon þæt ylce don.
 42.4. And be ælcum cristnum menn, þe þysne sealm singð, he
witgode, þæt hy hine sceoldan be þam ylcan singan; and eac Crist be
Iudeum.
 43.1. Dauid sang þysne þreo and feowertigoðan sealm
seofigende his earfoþa, and myngode þæra gyfa, þe he his fædrum and
his foregengum sealde, and hiora eaforum gehet; and eac seofode þæt him
þuhte þæt hy Gode, on ðam tidum, swa hrædlice ne gehyrde, swa he
his foregengan dyde.
 43.4. And eac he witgode on þam sealme be Mathathia, and be his
sunum, þa we Machabeas hatað, þæt hy sceoldon þæt ylce seofian,
on hiora earfoðum, under Antiochus, þam kynge.
 43.7. And eac he witgode be ælcum cristnum men, þe to Gode
hopað, þæt he sceolde þæt ylce don; and eac be Criste, þæt he
wolde þæt ylce don be Iudeum.
 44.1. Dauid witgode on þissum feower and feowertigoþan sealme,
þa he wæs oferdrenct mid þy halgan gaste; and on eallum þam sealme he
spræc ymb Fæder, and ymb Sunu, and ymb þa halgan gesamnuncga cristenra
manna, geond ealle eorðan.
 44.4. Sona on þam forman ferse, se Fæder spræc, þurh
Dauid, be Cristes acennesse, and cwæð.
 45.1. Dauid sang þysne fif and feowertigoþan sealm, þanciende
Gode þæt he hine oft alysde of manegum earfoðum.
 45.2. And eac he witgode þæt þæt ylce sceoldon don þa
men, þa þe twa scira beoð, þæt ys Iude and Beniamin þæt hy
sceoldon þam Gode þancian, þe hy gefriðode fram þære
ymbsetennesse, and fram þære herunge þara twega kynincga, Sacces,
Rumeles suna, and Rasses, Syria cyncges.
 45.6. Næs þæt na gedon for þæs cynincges geearnuncga
Achats, ac for Godes mildheortnesse, and for his yldrena gewyrhtum hit
gewearð, þæt þa twegen kyningas wæron adrifene fram Assyria cynge.
 45.8. And eac þæt ylce he witgode be ælcum rihtwisum menn,
þe ærest geswenced byð, and eft gearod; and eac be Criste, and be
Iudeum, he witgode þæt ylce.
 46.1. Dauid sang þysne syx and feowertigoþan sealm, and
lærde on þam sealme ealle þeoda, þæt hy heredon þone God mid him,
mid ælcum þæra cræftum, þe man God mid herian mihte; þone God
þe hine swa arlice gefriðode on eallum his earfoðum, and ealle his fynd
gebrytte.
 46.4. And eac he witgode be Machabeum, þæt hy sceoldon
þæt ylce don, þa hy alysde wæron æt elðeodegum folcum.
 46.6. And eac he witgode be ælcum ryhtwisum geswenctum, and eft
alysdum; and eac be Criste, and be Iudeum.
 47.1. Dauid sang þysne seofon and feowertigoþan sealm,
mycliende þone wundorlican sige Godes, þe he þa and oftor ær dyde; hu
hrædlice he oferswiðde swa ofermode kyningas.
 47.3. And eac he lærde ælcne man þe geswære and
ofercumen, and eft gefriðod byð þæt he swa ylce Gode þancode, and
his anweald herede.
 47.5. And þæt ylce he witgode be Criste, þæt he þæt
ylce sceolde cweðan to his Fæder, æfter ðære æriste.
 48.1. Dauid sang þysne eahta and feowertigoðan sealm, on þam
he lærde ealle men, ge on his dagum ge æfter his dagum, þæt hy hy
upp ne ahofen for heora welum, and þæt hy ongeaton, þæt hi ne mihton
þa welan mid him lædan heonon of weorulde.
 48.4. And eac he lærde þæt þa ðearfan hy ne
forðohton, ne ne wenden þæt God heora ne rohte; and eac he witgode
þæt ealle rihtwise menn sceoldon þæt ylce læran; and eac þæt
Crist wolde þæt ylce læran, þonne he come.
 49.1. Dauid sang þysne nigen and feowertigoðan sealm be
ægþrum/ tocyme Cristes: on þam sealme he cydde hu egeslice Crist
þreatode Iudeas, and ealle heora gelican þe þæt ylce doð þæt hy
dydon; forþam hy sealdon ælmessan, and ofredon Gode heora nytenu, næs
hy sylfe.
 50.1. Dauid sang þysne fiftigoðan sealm, hreowsiende for ðam
ærendum, þe Nathan, se witga, him sæde; þæt wæs, þæt he
hæfde gesyngod wið Ureus, þone Cyðþiscan, þa he hine beswac for
his wifes þingum, þære nama wæs Bersabe.
 50.4. And eac he witgode, on þam sealme, be Israela folce; hu hy
sceoldon hreowsian hyra hæftnyd on Babilonia, and eac be Sancte Paule þam
Apostle, and be ælcum rihtwisum men he witgode; hu hy sceoldon syngian, and
eft hreowsian: he cwæð.

Mt (WSCp)
<bibl>Matthew (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 140): Skeat 1871-87, 24-244.</bibl>



 1. Æfter Matheus gerecednysse.
 1.1. Her is on cneorisseboc Hælendes Cristes, Dauides suna
Abrahames suna.
 1.2. Soðlice Abraham gestrynde Isaac; Isaac gestrynde Iacob;
Iacob gestrynde Iudiam &amp; his gebroðra.
 1.3. Iudas gestrynde Phares &amp; Zaram of þam wife þe wæs
genemned Thamar; Phares gestrynde Esrom; Esrom gestrynde Aram.
 1.4. Aram gestrynde Aminadab; Aminadab gestrynde Naason; Naason
gestrynde Salmon.
 1.5. Salmon gestrynde Booz of þam wife Raab; Booz gestrynde Obeth
of þam wife Ruth; Obeth gestrynde Iesse.
 1.6. Iesse gestrynde þone cyning Dauid; Dauid cyning gestrynde
Salomon of þam wife þe wæs Urias wif.
 1.7. Salomon gestrynde Roboam; Roboas gestrynde Abiam; Abia
gestrynde Asa.
 1.8. Asa gestrynde Iosaphath; Iosaphath gestrynde Ioram; Ioras
gestrynde Oziam.
 1.9. Ozias gestrynde Ioatham; Ioatham gestrynde Achaz; Achaz
gestrynde Ezechiam.
 1.10. Ezechias gestrynde Mannasen; Mannases gestrynde Amon; Amon
gestrynde Iosiam.
 1.11. Iosias gestrynde Iechoniam &amp; his gebroþru on Babilonis
geleorednysse.
 1.12. And æfter Babilonys geleorednysse Iechonias gestrynde
Salathiel Salathiel gestrynde Zorobabel.
 1.13. Zorobabel gestrynde Abiud; Abiud gestrynde Eliachim; Eliachim
gestrynde Azor.
 1.14. Azor gestrynde Sadoc; Sadoc gestrynde Achim; Achim gestrynde
Eliud.
 1.15. Eliud gestrynde Eleazar; Eleazar gestrynde Mathan; Mathan
gestrynde Iacob.
 1.16. Iacob gestrynde Ioseph, Marian wer, of þære wæs
acenned se Hælend þe is genemned Crist.
 1.17. Eornostlice ealle cneoressa fram Abrahame oð Dauid synd
feowertyne cneoressa, &amp; fram Dauide oð Babilonis geleorednysse feowertyne
cneoressa, &amp; fram Babilonis geleorednesse oð Crist feowertyne cneoressa.
 1.18. Soðlice þus wæs Cristes cneores; ða þæs
Hælendes modor Maria wæs Iosepe beweddod, ær hi tosomne becomun heo
wæs gemet on innoðe hæbbende of þam halegan gaste.
 1.19. Soðlice Iosep hyre wer ða he wæs rihtwis &amp; nolde
hi gewidmærsian, he wolde hi dihlice forlætan.
 1.20. Him þa soðlice ðas þing ðencendum Drihtnes engel on
swefnum ætywde &amp; him to cwæð, Iosep, Dauides sunu, nelle þu
ondrædan Marian þine gemæccean to onfonne; þæt on hire acenned ys
hyt ys of þam halgan gaste.
 1.21. Witodlice heo cenð sunu &amp; þu nemst hys naman
Hælend.
 1.21. He soðlice hys folc hal gedeð fram hyra synnum.
 1.22. Soþlice eal þys wæs geworden þæt gefylled wære
þæt fram Drihtne gecweden wæs þurh þone witegan.
 1.23. Soðlice seo fæmne hæfð on innoðe &amp; heo cenð
sunu &amp; hi nemnað his naman Emanuhel, þæt ys gereht on ure geþeode,
God mid us.
 1.24. Ða aras Iosep of swefene &amp; dyde swa Drihtnes engel him
bebead, &amp; he onfeng his gemæccean.
 1.25. &amp; he ne grette hi; Heo cende hyre frumcennedan sunu &amp;
nemde hys naman Hælend.
 2.1. Eornustlice þa se Hælend acenned wæs on Iudeiscre
Bethleem on þæs cyninges dagum Herodes; þa comon þa tungolwitegan fram
eastdæle to Hierusalem.
 2.2. &amp; cwædon, hwær ys se Iudea cyning þe acenned ys;
Soðlice we gesawon hys steorran on eastdæle &amp; we comon us him to
geeadmedenne.
 2.3. Ða Herodes þæt gehyrde ða wearð he gedrefed &amp;
eal Hierosolimwaru mid him.
 2.4. &amp; þa gegaderode Herodes ealle ealdras þæra sacerda
&amp; folces writeras &amp; axode hwær Crist acenned wære.
 2.5. Ða sædon hi him, on Iudeiscere Bethlem.
 2.5. Witodlice þus ys awriten þurh þone witegan.
 2.6. And þu Bethleem Iudealand, witodlice ne eart þu læst on
Iuda ealdrum.
 2.7. Of ðe forðgæð se heretoga se þe recð min folc
Israhel.
 2.7. Herodes þa clypode on sunderspræce ða tungelwitegan
&amp; befran hi georne hwænne se steorra him æteowde.
 2.8. And he asende hi to Bethlem &amp; ðus cwæð, Farað
&amp; axiað geornlice be þam cilde &amp; þonne ge hyt gemetað cyþað
eft me þæt ic cume &amp; me to him gebidde.
 2.9. Ða hi þæt gebod gehyrdon þa ferdon hi, &amp;
soþlice se steorra þe hi on eastdæle gesawon him beforan ferde oð he
stod ofer þær þæt cild wæs.
 2.10. Soþlice þa ða tungelwitegan þone steorran gesawon
fægenodon swyðe myclum gefean.
 2.11. &amp; gangende into þam huse hi gemetton þæt cild mid
Marian hys meder &amp; hi aðenedon hi &amp; hi to him gebædon; And hi
untyndon hyra goldhordas &amp; him lac brohton þæt wæs gold &amp;
recels &amp; myrre.
 2.12. And hi afengon andsware on swefnum þæt hi eft to Herode
ne hwyrfdo ac hi on oðerne weg on hyra rice ferdon.
 2.13. Þa hi þa ferdon þa ætywde Drihtnes engel Iosepe on
swefnum &amp; þus cwæð, aris &amp; nim þæt cild &amp; his modor
&amp; fleoh on Egypta land &amp; beo þær oð þæt ic ðe secge;
Toweard ys þæt Herodes secð þæt cild to forspillenne.
 2.14. He aras þa &amp; nam þæt cild &amp; his modor on niht
&amp; ferde on Egyptum.
 2.15. &amp; wæs þær oð Herodes forðsið, þæt
wære gefylled, þæt ðe fram Drihtne gecweden wæs þurh ðone
witegan, of Egyptum ic minne sunu geclypode.
 2.16. Ða wæs Herodes swyðe gebolgen forþam þe he
bepæht wæs fram þam tungelwitegum; &amp; he asende þa &amp; ofsloh
ealle þa cild þe on Bethleem wæron &amp; on eallum hire gemærum fram
twywintrum cilde &amp; binnan þam æfter þære tide þe he geaxode
fram ðam tungelwitegum.
 2.17. Ða wæs gefylled þæt gecweden wæs þurh
Hieremiam þone witegan.
 2.18. Stefn wæs on hehnysse gehyred, wop &amp; mycel þotorung;
Rachel weop hyre bearn &amp; heo nolde beon gefrefred forþam þe hi
næron.
 2.19. Soðlice þa Herodes wæs forðfaren witodlice on swefne
Drihtnes engel ætywde Iosepe on Egyptum.
 2.20. &amp; þus cwæð, Aris &amp; nim þæt cild &amp; his
modor &amp; far on Israhelaland.
 2.21. Nu synd forðfarene þe ðæs cildes sawle sohton.
 2.21. He aras ða &amp; onfeng þæt cild &amp; his modor &amp;
com on israhelaland.
 2.22. Ða he gehyrde þæt Archelaus rixode on Iudeaþeode for
ðæne Herodem he ondred þyder to farende, &amp; on swefnum gemynegod he
ferde on Galileisce dælas.
 2.23. &amp; he com þa &amp; eardode on þære ceastre ðe is
genemned Nazareth þæt wære gefylled þæt gecweden wæs þurh
ðone witegan, for þam ðe he Nazarenisc byð genemned.
 3.1. On þam dagum com Iohannes se Fulluhtere; &amp; bodude on
þam westene Iudee.
 3.2. &amp; cwæð, Doþ dædbote; Soðlice genealæceð
heofona rice.
 3.3. Ðis ys se be þam þe gecweden ys þurh Esaiam ðone
witegan, Clypiendes stefn wæs on westene, gegearwiað Drihtnes weg, doþ
his siðas rihte.
 3.4. Se Iohannes witodlice hæfde reaf of olfenda hærum &amp;
fellenne gyrdel embe hys lendenu &amp; hys mete wæs gærstapan &amp;
wuduhunig.
 3.5. Ða ferde to him Hierosolimwaru &amp; eal Iudeaðeod &amp;
eal þæt rice wiðgeondan Iordanen.
 3.6. &amp; hi wæron gefullode on Iordane fram him &amp; hi
andettan hyra synna.
 3.7. Soðlice þa he geseh manega þæra sunderhalgena &amp;
þæra rihtwisendra to his fulluhte cumende, he cwæð to him, La
næddrena cyn, hwa geswutelode eow to fleonne fram þan toweardan yrre?
 3.8. Eornostlice doþ medemne weastm þære dædbote.
 3.9. &amp; ne cweþað betwux eow, we habbað Abraham us to
fæder; Soþlice ic secge eow þæt God ys swa mihtig þæt he mæg
of þysum stanum aweccean Abrahames bearn.
 3.10. Eallunga ys seo æx to ðæra treowa wurtrumum asett;
Eornustlice ælc treow þe godne wæstm ne bringð byð forcorfen &amp;
on fyr aworpen.
 3.11. Witodlice ic eow fullige on wætere to dædbote; Se þe
æfter me towerd ys he ys strengra þonne ic, ðæs gescy neom ic wyrðe
to berenne; He eow fullað on halgum gaste &amp; on fyre.
 3.12. Ðæs fann ys on his handa &amp; he afeormað his
þyrscelflore &amp; he gegaderað hys hwæte on his bern; þa ceafu he
forbærnð on unadwæscendlicum fyre.
 3.13. Þa com se Hælend fram Galilea to Iordane to Iohanne
þæt he hine fullode.
 3.14. Iohannes þa soðlice forbead him &amp; cwæð, Ic sceal
fram þe beon gefullod, &amp; cymst ðu to me?
 3.15. Ða andswarode se Hælend him &amp; cwæð, Læt nu,
þus unc gedafnað ealle rihtwisnesse gefyllan; þa forlet he hine.
 3.16. Soþlice þa se Hælend gefullod wæs, hrædlice he
astah of ðam wætere &amp; him wurdon þærrihte heofenas ontynede &amp;
he geseah godes gast niþerstigende swa swa culfran &amp; wunigende ofer
hine.
 3.17. And soðlice þa com stefn of heofenum &amp; þus
cwæð, Her is min se gecorena sunu on þam me gelicode.
 4.1. Ða wæs se Hælend gelæd fram gaste on westen
þæt he wære fram deofle costud.
 4.2. &amp; þa þa he fæste feowurtig daga &amp; feowurtig
nihta þa ongan hyne syððan hingrian.
 4.3. And þa genealæhte se Costnind &amp; cwæð, Gyf þu
Godes sunu sy, cweð þæt þas stanas to hlafe gewurðon.
 4.4. Ða andswarode se Hælend, Hit ys awriten, ne leofað se
man be hlafe anum ac be ælcon worde þe of Godes muðe gæð.
 4.5. Þa gebrohte se Deofol hine on þa halgan ceastre &amp;
asette hine ofer þæs temples heahnesse.
 4.6. &amp; cwæð to him, gyf þu Godes sunu eart, asend þe
þonne nyðer; Soþlice hit ys awriten þæt he his englum bebead be ðe
þæt hig þe on hyra handum beron þe læs þe ðin fot æt stane
ætsporne.
 4.7. Ða cwæð se Hælend eft to him, Hit ys awriten, ne
costna þu Drihten þinne God.
 4.8. Eft se Deofol hine genam &amp; lædde hine on swiðe heahne
munt &amp; æteowde him ealle middaneardes ricu &amp; hyra wuldor.
 4.9. &amp; cwæþ to him, Ealle þas ic sylle þe gyf þu
feallende to me geeadmetst.
 4.10. Ða cwæð se Hælend to him, gang þu sceocca
onbæc; Soþlice hit ys awriten, to Drihtne þinum Gode þu ðe
geeaðmetsð &amp; him anum þeowast.
 4.11. Ða forlet se Deofol hine &amp; englas genealæhton &amp;
him þenodon.
 4.12. Soðlice þa se Hælend gehyrde þæt Iohannes
belæwed wæs, þa ferde he to Galileam.
