 1.65. Ða wearð ege geworden ofer ealle hyra nehcheburas, &amp;
ofer ealle Iudea muntland wæron þas word gewidmærsode.
 1.66. &amp; ealle þa ðe hit gehyrdon on heora heortan settun
&amp; cwædon; Wenstu hwæt byð þes cnapa; Witodlice drihtenes hand
wæs mid him.
 1.67. And Zacharias his fæder wæs mid halegum gaste afylled,
&amp; he witegode &amp; cwæþ; Gebletsud si Drihten Israhela God, forþam
þe he geneosode, &amp; his folces alysednesse dyde; &amp; he us hæle horn
arærde on Dauides huse hys cnihtes.
 1.70. Swa he spræc þurh hys halegra witegena muð, þa he of
worldes frymðe spræcon, &amp; he alysde us of urum feondum, &amp; of ealra
þara handa þe us hatedon, Mildheortnesse to wyrcænne mid urum
fæderum, &amp; gemunan his halegan cyþnesse.
 1.73. Hyne us to syllenne þone að, þe he urum fæder
Abrahame swor, þæt we butan ege of ure feonda handa alysede him þeowian,
On halignesse beforan him eallum urum dagum.
 1.76. And þu cnapa byst þæs hehstan witega genemned, þu
gæst beforan Drihtnes ansyne his wegas gearwian, To syllenne his folce hys
hæle gewit on hyra synna forgyfnesse.
 1.78. Þurh innoþas ures Godes mildheortnesse on þam he us
geneosode of eastdæle upspringende.
 1.79. Onlihtan þam þe on ðystrum &amp; on deaþes sceade
sittað, ure fet to gereccenne on sybbe weg.
 1.80. Soþlice se cnapa weox, &amp; wæs on gaste gestrangod,
&amp; wæs on westenum oþ þone dæg hys ætiwednessum on ISRAHEL.
 2.1. Soþlice on þam dagum wæs geworden gebod fram þam
casere Augusto þæt eall ymbehwyrft wære tomearcod.
 2.2. Þeos tomearcodnes wæs æryst geworden fram þam deman
syrige Cirino, &amp; ealle hig eodon, &amp; syndrie ferdon on hyra ceastre.
 2.4. Ða ferde Iosep fram Galilea of þære ceastre Nazareth,
on Iudeisce ceastre Dauides seo is genemned Bethleem, forþam þe he wæs
of Dauides huse, &amp; hirede þæt he ferde mid Marian þe him beweddod
wæs, &amp; wæs geeacnod.
 2.6. Soþlice wæs geworden þa hi þar wæron, hire dagas
wæron gefyllede þæt heo cende, &amp; heo cende hyre frumcennedan sunu,
&amp; hine mid cildclaþum bewand, &amp; hine on binne alede, forþam þe
hig næfdon rum on cumena huse.
 2.8. &amp; hyrdas wæron on þam ylcan rice waciende, &amp;
nihtwæccan healdende ofer heora heorda.
 2.9. Þa stod Drihtnes engel wiþ hig &amp; Godes beorhtnes him
ymbescean, &amp; hi him mycelum ege adredon.
 2.10. &amp; se engel him to cwæð; Nelle ge eow adrædan;
Soþlice nu ic eow bodie mycelne gefean, se bið eallum folce; forþam
todæg eow ys hælend acenned, se is Drihten Crist on Dauides ceastre.
 2.12. And þis tacen eow byð; Ge gemetað an cild hreglum
bewunden, &amp; on binne aled.
 2.13. And þa wæs færinga geworden mid þam engle mycelnes
heofonlices werydes God heriendra &amp; þus cweþendra; Gode sy wuldor on
heahnesse &amp; on eorðan sybb mannum Godes willan.
 2.15. &amp; hit wæs geworden þa ða englas to heofene ferdon,
þa hyrdas him betwynan spræcon &amp; cwædon; Utun faran to Bethleem,
&amp; geseon þæt word þe geworden is, þæt Drihten us ætywde.
 2.16. &amp; hig efstende comon, &amp; gemetton Marian &amp; Iosep
&amp; þæt cild on binne aled.
 2.17. Þa hi þæt gesawon þa oncneowon hig be þam worde
þe him gesæd wæs be þam cilde.
 2.18. &amp; ealle þa ðe gehyrdon wundredon be þam þe him
þa hyrdas sædon.
 2.19. Maria geheold ealle þas word on hyre heortan smeagende.
 2.20. Ða gewendon ham þa hyrdas God wuldriende &amp; heriende
on eallum þam ðe hi gehyrdon &amp; gesawon, swa to him gecweden wæs.
 2.21. Æfter þam þe ehta dagas gefyllede wæron þæt
ðæt cild emsnyden wære, his nama wæs Hælend; Se wæs fram engle
genemned, ær he on innoðe geeacnod wære.
 2.22. &amp; æfter þam þe hyre clænsunge dagas gefyllede
wæron æfter Moyses æ, hi læddon hyne on Hierusalem þæt hi hine
gode gesettun swa swa on drihtnes æ awriten is, þæt ælc wæpned
gecyndlim ontynende byð Drihtne halig genemned.
 2.24. And þæt hig offrunge sealdon æfter þam þe
drihtnes æ gecweden is twa turtlan, oððe twegen culfran briddas.
 2.25. &amp; þa wæs an man on Hierusalem þæs nama wæs
Simeon &amp; þes man wæs rihtwis &amp; oþ Israhela frofor geanbidiende,
&amp; hali gast him on wæs.
 2.26. &amp; he andsware fram þam halegan gaste onfeng, þæt
he deað ne gesawe, buton he ær Drihten Crist gesawe.
 2.27. And on gaste he on þæt tempel com, &amp; þa his magas
læddon þone hælend, þæt hig for him æfter þære æ
gewunan dydon, he onfeng hine mid his handum, &amp; God bletsode &amp;
cwæð; Drihten, nu þu lætst þinne þeow æfter þinum worde on
sibbe; Forðam mine eagan gesawon þine hæle, ða þu geearwodest
beforan ansyne eallra folca.
 2.32. Leoht to þeoda awrigenesse &amp; to þines folces wuldre
ISRAHEL.
 2.33. Ða wæs his fæder &amp; his modor wundriende be þam
þe be him gesæde wæron.
 2.34. And þa bletsude hig Simeon &amp; cwæþ to Marian his
meder; Loca nu þes is on hryre, &amp; on æryst asett manega on Israhel,
&amp; on tacen þam ðe wiðcweden byð.
 2.35. And his swurd þine sawle þurhfærð, þæt
geþohtas syn awrigene of manegum heortum.
 2.36. And Anna wæs witegystre Fanueles dohtor of Asseres
mægðe þeos wunude manigne dæg, &amp; heo leofode mid hyre were seofan
ger of hyre fæmnhade.
 2.37. &amp; heo wæs wudewe oð feower &amp; hundeahtatig
geara.
 2.37. Seo of þam temple ne gewat, dæges &amp; nihtes
þeowigende on fæstenum &amp; on halsungum, And þeos ðære tide
becumende drihtne andette &amp; be him spræc eallum þam þe geanbidedon
Hierusalem alysednesse.
 2.39. &amp; þa hi ealle þing gefyldon æfter drihtnes æ hi
gehwurfon on Galileam on heora ceastre Nazareth.
 2.40. Soðlice þæt cild weox &amp; wæs gestrangod wisdomes
full, &amp; Godes gyfu wæs on him.
 2.41. &amp; his magas ferdon ælce gere to Hierusalem on
easterdæges freolstide.
 2.42. &amp; þa he wæs twelf wintre hy foron to Hierusalem to
þan easterlican freolse æfter hyra gewunan.
 2.43. And gefylledum dagum þa hig agengehwurfon, belaf se
Hælend on Hierusalem, &amp; his magas þæt nyston; wendon þæt he on
heora gefere wære.
 2.44. Þa comon hig anes dæges fær, &amp; hine sohton betux
his magas &amp; his cuðan.
 2.45. Ða hig hyne ne fundon hig gewendun to Hierusalem hyne
secende.
 2.46. Ða æfter þrim dagum hig fundon hine on þam temple
sittende on middan þam lareowum, hlystende &amp; hi ahsiende.
 2.47. Þa wundrodon hig ealle þe gehyrdon be his gleawscipe,
&amp; hys andswarum.
 2.48. Ða cwæþ his modor to him; Sunu hwi dydest þu unc
ðus; þin fæder &amp; ic sarigende þe sohton.
 2.49. Ða cwæð he to him, hwæt is þæt gyt me sohton;
Nyste gyt þæt me gebyrað to beonne on þam ðingum ðe mines fæder
synt.
 2.50. Ða ne ongeton hig þæt word þe he to him spræc.
 2.51. Ða ferde he mid him &amp; com to Nazareth, &amp; wæs him
underþeod.
 2.51. And his modor geheold ealle þas word on hyre heortan
smeagende.
 2.52. And se hælend þeah on wisdome &amp; on ylde &amp; mid
gyfe, mid Gode &amp; mid mannum.
 3.1. Soðlice þam fifteoðan geare þæs caseres anwealdes
Tiberii, begymendum þam Pontiscan Pilate Iudeaþeode, feorðan dæles
rica Galilee Herode; Filippo his breþer feorðan dæles rica Iturie, &amp;
þæs rices traconitidis &amp; Lisania Abiline feorþan dæles rica,
under ðara sacerda ealdrum Anna &amp; Caifa.
 3.2. Godes word wæs geworden ofer Zacharias sunu on westene
&amp; he com into eall Iordanes ricæ bodiende dædbote fulluht, &amp;
synna forgyfenesse, swa hit awriten ys on Isaias bec þæs witegan;
Clypiende stefen on westene, gegearwiað drihtnes weg, doð his siðas
rihte.
 3.5. Ælc denu bið gefylled, &amp; ælc munt &amp; beorh
byð genyðerud, &amp; þwuru beoð on gerihte, &amp; ungerydu on smeðe
wegas, &amp; ælce flæsc gesihð Godes hæle.
 3.7. Soþlice he cwæð to þam menegum þe ferdon þæt
hi wæron gefullode fram him, eala næddrena cynn hwa ætywde eow
þæt ge fleon fram þam towerdan yrre?
 3.8. Doð geornlice dædbote wæstmas &amp; ne ongynne ge
cweðan.
 3.8. We habbað us to fæder Abraham; Ic secge eow, þæt god
is swa mihtig þæt he mæg of þysum stanum Abrahames bearn aweccan.
 3.9. Nu is seo æx asett to ðæs treowes wyrtruman; witodlice
ælc treow þe ne bryncð godne wæstm bið forcorfen &amp; on fyr
aworpen.
 3.10. Þa ahsodon hyne þa menegu &amp; cwædon, hwæt do
we?
 3.11. Ða cwæð he to him: se þe hæfð twa tunecan sylle
þam þe næfð, &amp; þam gelice do se þe mettas hæfþ.
 3.12. Ða comon þa manfullan þæt hig aþwegene wæron,
&amp; cwædon to him, lareow hwæt do we?
 3.13. Þa cwæð he, ne do ge naht mare þonne þæt eow
geset is.
 3.14. Ða ahsodon hine þa cempan &amp; cwædon, &amp; hwæt
do we?
 3.14. Ða sæde he him, ne sleage nanne; ne tale ne doð, &amp;
beoð eðhylde on eowrum andlyfenum.
 3.15. Soðlice þam folce wenendum &amp; eallum on hyra heortan
þencendum be Iohanne hwæþer he Crist wære.
 3.16. Ða andswarude Iohannes him eallum secgende; Witodlice ic
eow on wætere fullige; Soþlice cymð strengra þonne ic, þæs ic ne
eom wyrþe þæt ic hys sceoþwancg uncnytte; He eow fullað on halgum
gaste &amp; on fyre.
 3.17. &amp; his fann ys on his handa, &amp; he feormað his bernes
flore, &amp; gaderað hys hwæte into his berne; þæt ceaf he
forbærnþ on unacwencedlicum fyre.
 3.18. Manega oðre þing bodigende he þæt folc lærde.
 3.19. Herodes se feorðan dæles rica, þa he wæs fram him
geðread, be ðære Herodiadiscan hys broðor wife, &amp; be eallum yfelum
þe Herodes dyde.
 3.20. &amp; ofer eall þæt geicte þæt he beclysde Iohannem
on cwearterne.
 3.21. Soðlice wæs geworden þa eall þæt folc wæs
gefullod, &amp; þam hælende gefulledum &amp; gebiddendum, heofon wæs
geopenud &amp; se halega gast astah lichamlicre ansyne on hyne swa an culfre,
&amp; stefen wæs of heofone geworden &amp; þus cwæð; ðu eart min
gecorena sunu, on þe me gelicode.
 3.23. &amp; se hælend wæs on ylde swylce þritig wintre,
þæt menn wendon þæt he wære Iosepes sunu; Se wæs heliges sunu;
se wæs nazareth, swa of cneorysse on cneorysse oð adam, se wæs godes
sunu, oð fif &amp; hundseofantig cneoryssa.
 4.1. Soðlice se Hælend wæs full halgum gaste &amp; ferde
fram Iordane, &amp; he wæs fram haligum gaste gelæd on sumum westene
feowertig daga, &amp; wæs fram deofle costod, &amp; he on þam dagum nan
þing ne æt; and þam dagum gefylledum hine hingrede.
 4.3. Ða cwæð se deofol him to, gif þu sy Godes sunu sege
þisum stane þæt he to hlafe gewurðe.
 4.4. Ða andswarude him se Hælend, Hit is awriten þæt se
man ne leofaþ be hlafe anum, ac of ælcum Godes worde.
 4.5. And þa lædde se deofol hyne, &amp; ætywde him ealle
ricu eorðan ymbehwyrftes, on anre byrhmhwile &amp; to him cwæð, Ealne
þisne anweald ic ðe sylle, &amp; hyra wuldor, forþam þe hi me synt
gesealde, &amp; ic hi sylle þam ðe ic wylle.
 4.7. Witodlice ealle hig beoð þine gif þu geeaðmetst
beforan me.
 4.8. Þa andswarode him se hælend, Hit is awriten, Drihten
þinne God ðu geeadmetst, &amp; him anum þeowast.
 4.9. Ða lædde he hyne on Hierusalem &amp; gesette hine ofer
þæs temples hricg, &amp; him to cwæð, Gyf þu sy Godes sunu asend
þe heonun nyþer.
 4.10. Soðlice hyt is awriten, ðæt he hys englum be þe
bebyt þæt hig þe gehealdon, &amp; þæt hig þe mid handum nimon,
þelæs þu ðinne fot æt stane ætspeorne.
 4.12. Ða cwæð se hælend him andswariende, Hyt is
gecweden, ne costa þu Drihten þinne god.
 4.13. &amp; ealre þære costunge gefylledre, se deofol him sume
hwile fram gewat.
 4.14. Þa ferde se hælend on gastes mægene on Galileam,
&amp; his hlisa be him ferde on eall þæt rice, &amp; he lærde be hyra
gesamnungum, &amp; wæs fram eallum gemærsod.
 4.16. Ða com he to Nazareth, þar he afed wæs, &amp; he eode
on restedæge on þa gesamnunge æfter his gewunan &amp; he aras þæt
he rædde.
 4.17. &amp; him wæs geseald Isaias boc þæs witegan &amp;
sona swa he þa boc unfeold þa funde he þar awriten, drihtnes gast is ofer
me, forþam ðe he smyrede me, he sende me þearfum bodian, &amp;
gehæftum alysednesse, &amp; blindum gesihþe, forbrocene gehælan &amp;
bodian Drihtnes andfenge ger, &amp; edleanes dæg.
 4.20. And þa he þa boc befeold he hig þam ðene agef &amp;
sæt, &amp; ealra heora eagan on þære gesamnunge wæron on hyne
behealdende.
 4.21. Ða ongan he him to cweðan, Soþlice todæg þis
gewrit is on eowrum earum gefylled.
 4.22. &amp; hig ealle wæron þæs gecnæwe, &amp; wundredon
be þam wordum þe of his muþe eode, &amp; þus cwædun, Nys þes
Iosepes sunu.
 4.23. Ða cwæþ he, witodlice ge secgað me þas gelicnesse,
eala læce, gehæl ðe sylfne; Do her on þinum earde, swa fela wundra
swa we gehyrdon gedone on cafarnaum.
 4.24. Ða cwæð he soðlice, ic eow secge þæt nan witega
nis andfenge on his eþele.
 4.25. Soþlice ic eow secge manega wudewan wæron on Helias
dagum on Hisrahel, ða þa seo heofon wæs belocen þreo ger &amp; syx
monþas; þa wæs geworden mycel hunger on ealle eorðan &amp; to þara
nanum næs Helias asend, buton to anre wudewan on Sarepta Sidonie.
 4.27. And manega licþroweras wæron on Israhel, under Heliseo
þam witegan, &amp; hyra nan næs aclænsud buton naaman se Sirisca.
 4.28. Ða wurdon hig ealle on þære gesamnunge mid yrre
gefylled, þas þing gehyrende.
 4.29. &amp; hig arison &amp; scufon hine of ðære ceastre,
&amp; læddon hine ofer ðæs muntes cnæpp, ofer þone hyra buruh
getimbrud wæs, þæt hi hyne nyðer bescufon, þa ferde he þurh hyra
midlen.
 4.31. And he ferde to Cafarnaum on Galileisce ceastre, &amp; hi
þar on restedagum lærde &amp; hig wundredon be his lare, forþam his
spæc on anwealde wæs.
 4.33. And on hyra gesamnunge wæs sum man unclæne deofol
hæbbende, &amp; he hrymde micelre stefne &amp; cwæþ, Læt la
Nadzarenisca Hælend, hwæt is us &amp; þe, com þu us to forspillanne;
ic wat þæt ðu eart Godes halega.
 4.35. And þa cidde him se Hælend &amp; cwæþ, adumba &amp;
ga him of, &amp; þa he utadraf hine on heora midlene, he him framgewat, &amp;
him naht ne derude.
 4.36. Ða wurdon hig ealle forhte &amp; spræcon him betwynan
&amp; cwædon, hwæt ys þæt word þæt he on mihte &amp; on
mægene unclænum gastum bebyt &amp; hig utgaþ?
 4.37. Ða wæs his hlisa gewidmærsod on ælcere stowe
þæs rices.
 4.38. Soþlice he aras of heora gesamnunge &amp; ferde on Simones
hus.
 4.38. Ða wæs Simones sweger geswenced on mycelum feferum,
&amp; hig hyne for hyre bædon.
 4.39. &amp; he standende ofer hig þam fefore bebead &amp; he hig
forlet &amp; heo sona aras and him þenode.
 4.40. Soðlice þa sunne asah ealle þe untrume wæron on
mislicum adlum hig læddon him to &amp; he syndrygum hys hand onsettende hig
gehælde.
 4.41. Ða ferdon þa deoflu of manegum hrymende &amp; cweðende,
Soðes þu eart Godes sunu, &amp; he ne geþafude þæt hig æni þing
spræcon forþam þe wiston þæt he Crist wæs.
 4.42. Ða gewordenum dæge se Hælend utgangende ferde on
weste stowe, &amp; þa meniu hine sohtun, &amp; hi comon to him, &amp;
behæfdon hine, þæt he him fram ne gewite.
 4.43. Þa sæde he him, soðlice me gedafænað oðrum
ceastrum Godes rice bodian, forþam to þam ic eom asend.
 4.44. &amp; he wæs bodigende on Galilea gesamnungum.
 5.1. Soþlice wæs geworden þa ða menegu him to comon
þæt hig Godes word gehyrdon, he stod wið þone mere Genesareth.
 5.2. &amp; he geseah twa scipu standende wið þæne mere.
 5.2. Ða fisceras eodun &amp; wohson heora nett.
 5.3. He þa astigende on an scyp, þæt wæs Simones bæd
hyne þæt he hit lythwon fram lande tuge, &amp; on þam scipe sittende he
lærde þa menegu.
 5.4. Ða he sprecan geswac he cwæþ to Simone, Teoh hit on
dypan &amp; lætað eowre nett on þone fiscwer.
 5.5. Þa cwæþ Simon him andswariende, Eala bebeodend ealle
niht swincende we naht ne gefengon; Soðlice on þinum worde ic min nett
utlæte.
 5.6. &amp; þa hi þæt dydon hig betugon mycele menigeo fixa,
&amp; hyra net wæs tobrocen.
 5.7. &amp; hig bicnodon hyra geferan, þe on oðrum scipe
wæron, þæt hi comun &amp; him fylston; ða comon hig &amp; gefyldon
butu þa scipu, swa þæt hi neh wæron besencte.
 5.8. Þa Petrus þæt geseah he feoll to þæs Hælendes
cneowum &amp; cwæð, Drihten, gewit fram me forþam ic eom synfull mann.
 5.9. &amp; he wundrude &amp; ealle þa ðe mid him wæron on
þam were þara fixa þe hi gefengon.
 5.10. Gelice Iacobum &amp; Iohannem Zebedeis suna, þa wæron
Simones geferan; ða cwæþ se Hælend to Simone, ne ondræd þu þe;
Heonon forð þu byst men gefonde.
 5.11. &amp; hig tugon hyra scypo to lande, &amp; forleton hig &amp;
folgodon þam Hælende.
 5.12. Ða he wæs on anre ceastre þa wæs þar an hreofla
&amp; þa he geseah þæne hælend þa astrehte he hine &amp; bæd
&amp; þus cwæð, Drihten, gyf þu wylt þu miht me geclænsian.
 5.13. And he æthran hine his handa aþenede &amp; cwæð, Ic
wylle, si þu geclænsud; And sona se hreofla him fram ferde.
 5.14. &amp; he bebead him þæt he hit nanum men ne sæde, ac
ga ætyw þe þam sacerde, &amp; bring for þinre clænsunga swa Moyses
bebead him on gewitnesse.
 5.15. Witodlice þæs þe ma seo spræc be him ferde &amp;
mycele menegeo comun þæt hi gehyrdon &amp; wurdon gehælede fram hyra
untrumnessum.
 5.16. He þa ferde on westen &amp; hyne gebæd.
 5.17. Ða wæs anum dæge geworden þæt he sæt &amp;
hig lærde &amp; þa wæron þa Farisei sittende &amp; þære
ælareowwæs, þa comon of ælcon castele Galileæ &amp; Iudeæ
&amp; Hierusalem, &amp; drihtnes mægen wæs hig to gehælene.
 5.18. And þa bæron men on anum bedde anne man se wæs lama.
 5.19. &amp; hig ne mihton hine inbringan &amp; alecgan beforan him,
for þære menigo þe mid þam Hælende wæs; þa astigon hig uppan
þæne hrof &amp; þurh þa watelas hine mid þam bedde asende beforan
þæne Hælend.
 5.20. Ða he geseah hyra geleafan he cwæð, La mann þe synd
þine synna forgyfene.
 5.21. Þa agunnon þencan þa boceras &amp; Farisei &amp;
cwædon, hwæt is þes þe her sprycþ woffunga; Hwa mæg synna
forgyfan buton god ana?
 5.22. Ða se hælend gecneow hyra geþancas he andswariende
cwæþ to him, hwæt þence ge on eowrum heortum, hwæðer is eðre
to cweþenne þe synd þine synna forgyfene, hwæþer þe cweþan aris
&amp; ga, þæt ge witon þæt mannes sunu on eorðan anweald hæfð
synna to forgyfanne; And he sæde þam laman, þe ic secge aris, nim þin
bed &amp; ga on þin hus.
 5.25. &amp; he sona beforan him aras, &amp; nam þæt he on
læg &amp; to his huse ferde &amp; God wuldrode.
 5.26. &amp; hig ealle wundredon &amp; God mærsodon &amp;
wæron mid ege gefyllede, &amp; cwædon, soðes we todæg wundru
gesawon.
 5.27. Þa æfter þam he uteode &amp; geseah Publicanum, he
wæs oþrum naman Leui gehaten æt ceapsceamule sittende, &amp; he
cwæþ to him, filig me.
 5.28. &amp; he him þa filigde &amp; ealle hys þing forlet.
 5.29. &amp; Leui dyde him mycelne gebeorscype on his huse, &amp;
þar wæs mycel menegeo manfulra &amp; oðerra þe mid him sæton.
 5.30. Þa murcnodon þa Farisei &amp; þa boceras &amp;
cwædon to hys leorningcnihtum, hwi ete ge &amp; drincað mid manfullum
&amp; synfullum?
 5.31. Ða andswarude se Hælend &amp; cwæþ to him, Ne
beþurfon læces þa ðe hale synd, ac þa ðe unhælþe habbaþ.
 5.32. Ne com ic rihtwise clypian, ac synfulle on dædbote.
 5.33. Ða cwædon hig to him, hwi fæstað Iohannes
leorningcnihtas gelomlice &amp; halsunga doð, &amp; eallswa Farisea, &amp;
þine etað &amp; drincað.
 5.34. Þa cwæð he, cwystuþu magon þæs brydguman bearn
fæstan swa lange swa se brydguma myd him ys.
 5.35. Soþlice þa dagas cumaþ þonne se brydguma him byð
afyrred, þonne fæstað hig on þam dagum.
 5.36. Þa sæde he him an bigspell: Ne asend nan man scyp of
niwum reafe on eald reaf, elles þæt niwe slit, &amp; se niwa scyp ne hylp
þam ealdan.
 5.37. Ne nan man ne sent niwe win on ealde bytta, elles þæt
niwe win brycð þa bytta &amp; þæt win byð agoten, &amp; þa bytta
forwurðað.
 5.38. Ac niwe win is to sendenne on niwe bytta, þonne beoð þa
bytta gehealdene.
 5.39. And ne drincð nan man eald win &amp; wylle sona þæt
niwe, he cwyþ, þæt ealde is betere.
 6.1. Soþlice wæs geworden on þam æfteran restedæge,
æryst þa he ferde þurh þa æceras hys leorningcnihtas þa ear
pluccedon &amp; mid hyra handum gnidon &amp; æton.
 6.2. Ða cwædon sume of þan sundorhalgan, hwi do ge þæt
eow alyfed nis on restedagon?
 6.3. Þa andswarode him se Hælend, ne rædde ge þæt,
hwæt Dauid dyde þa hine hingrede, &amp; þa ðe mid him wæron, hu he
eode into Godes huse, &amp; nam þa offrunghlafas &amp; hig æt, &amp; þam
sealde þe mid him wærun, þa nærun alyfede to etanne buton sacerdon
anum.
 6.5. And he sæde him þæt Drihten is mannes sunu, eac swylce
restedæges.
 6.6. Soðlice on oðrum restedæge wæs geworden þæt he
on gesamnunge eode &amp; lærde, &amp; þar wæs sum man &amp; his
swyðre hand wæs forscruncen.
 6.7. Ða gymdon þa boceras &amp; Farisei hwæþer he on
restedæge hælde, þæt hi hyne gewregdon.
 6.8. Soþlice he wiste hyra geþancas, &amp; he sæde þam men
þe ða forscruncenan hand hæfde, aris &amp; stand her amiddan; þa aras
he &amp; stod.
 6.9. Ða cwæþ se hælend to him, Ic ahsige eow alyfþ on
restedagum wel don, oððe yfele, sawle hale gedon, hwæþer ðe
forspillan?
 6.10. And him eallum gesceawodum mid yrre he sæde þam men,
Aþene þine hand, &amp; he Aþenode &amp; his hand wæs geedniwod.
 6.11. Þa wurdon hig mid unwisdome gefyllede &amp; spæcon betux
him hwæt hig þam Hælende dydon.
 6.12. Soþlice on þam dagum he ferde on anne munt hine gebiddan,
&amp; wæs þar waciende on Godes gebede.
 6.13. And þa ða dæg wæs he clypode hys leorningcnihtas
&amp; geceas twelf of him, &amp; þa he nemde apostolas.
 6.14. Simonem þæne he nemde Petrus &amp; his broðor Andreas,
Iacobum &amp; Iohannem, Filippum &amp; Bartholomeum, &amp; Thomam, &amp;
Matheum, &amp; Iacobum, Alfei, &amp; Simonem, se is genemned Zelotes, Iudam,
Iacobi, &amp; Iudam Scarioð se wæs læwa.
 6.17. And mid him farendum he stod on feldlice stowe, &amp; mycel
wered his leorningcnihta, &amp; mycel menegeo fram ealra Iudea &amp; fram
Ierusalem, &amp; ofer muþan &amp; sægemæro Tiri &amp; Sidonis, ða
coman þæt hi hyne gehyrdon, &amp; wæron of hyra adlum gehælede.
 6.18. &amp; þa ðe wæron of unclænum gastum gedrehte
wærun gehælede.
 6.19. And eal seo menigeo sohte hine to æthrinenne, forþam
þe mægen of him eode &amp; he ealle gehælde.
 6.20. Ða cwæþ se hælend beseonde to his leorningcnihtum,
Eadige synd ge þearfan on gaste forþam þe Godes rice is eower.
 6.21. Eadige synd ge ðe hingriað nu, forþam þe ge beoð
gefyllede.
 6.21. Eadige synt ge ðe nu wepað, forþam ge hlihaþ.
 6.22. Eadige beo ge, þone eow men hatiað &amp; ehtað, &amp;
onhiscaþ, &amp; awurpað eowerne naman swa swa yfel for mannes suna.
 6.23. Geblissiað &amp; gefagniað on þam dagum, nu eower med
is mycel on heofenum; Soðlice æfter þissum þingum hyra fæderas
dydon þam witegum.
 6.24. Þeahhwæðere wa eow witegum, forþam þe ge eowerne
frofor habbað.
 6.25. Wa eow þe gefyllede synt, forþam þe ge hingriað; Wa
eow þe nu hlihað, forþam þe ge heofað &amp; wepað.
 6.26. Wa eow þonne eow ealle men bletsiað, æfter þissum
þingum hyra fæderas dydon þam witegum.
 6.27. Ac ic eow sege forþam þe ge gehyraþ, lufiað eowre
fynd doþ þam tala þe eow hatedon.
 6.28. Bletsiað þa ðe eow wiriað, gebiddaþ for þa þe
eow onhisceað.
 6.29. And þam þe slihþ on þin gewenge wend oðer agen,
&amp; þam þe ðin reaf nymþ, ne forbeod him no þine tunecan.
 6.30. Syle ælcum þe ðe bidde, &amp; se ðe nimþ þa
ðing þe ðine synt ne mynega þu hyra.
 6.31. And swa ge wyllaþ þæt eow men don, doþ him gelice.
 6.32. &amp; hwylc þanc is eow gif ge lufiað þa þe eow
lufiað; Soðlice synfulle lufiað þa þe hi lufiað?
 6.33. And gyf ge wel doð, þam ðe eow wel doð; hwylc þanc
is eow; Witodlice þæt doð synfulle.
 6.34. &amp; gyf ge lænaþ þam þe ge eft æt onfoð,
hwylc þanc is eow?
 6.34. Soþlice synfulle synfullum lænað, þæt hi gelice
onfon.
 6.35. Þeahhwæðere lufiað eowre fynd &amp; him wel doð,
&amp; læne syllað nan þing þanun eft gehihtende, &amp; eower med byþ
mycel/ on heofone, &amp; ge beoþ þæs hehstan bearn, forþam þe he is
god ofer unþancfulle &amp; ofer yfele.
 6.36. Heornostlice beoþ mildheorte swa eower fæder is
mildheort.
 6.37. Nelle ge deman, &amp; ge ne beoð demede.
 6.37. Nelle ge genyðerian, &amp; ge ne beoð genyþerude;
Forgyfaþ, &amp; eow byð forgyfen.
 6.38. Syllað &amp; eow byþ geseald god gemet &amp; full,
geheapod &amp; oferflowende hig syllaþ on eowerne bearm; þam sylfan gemete
þe ge metað, eow byð gemeten.
 6.39. Ða sæde he him sum bigspell, Segst þu, mæg se
blinda þæne blindan lædan; Hu ne feallaþ hig begen on þæne
pytt?
 6.40. Nis se leorningcniht ofer þone lareow; ælc byð
fulfremed, gif he is swylce hys lareow.
 6.41. Hwi gesihst þu þa egle on þines broþor eagan, &amp;
ne gesihst þæne beam on þinum eagan?
 6.42. And hu miht þu segan þinum breþer, broþor læt
þæt ic ateo þa egle of þinum eage, &amp; þu sylf ne gesyhst
þæne beam on þinum agenum eagan; Eala licetere, teoh ærest þone
beam of þinum eage, &amp; þonne þu gesihst þæt ðu ateo þa egle
of þines broðor eage.
 6.43. Nys god treow þe yfelne wæstm deð, ne nis yfel treow
godne wæstm donde.
 6.44. Ælc treow is be his wæstme oncnawen.
 6.44. Ne hig of þornum ficæppla ne gaderiaþ, ne winberian on
gorste ne nimað.
 6.45. God man of godum goldhorde hys heortan god forðbringð,
&amp; yfel man of yfelum goldhorde yfel forðbringþ; Soðlice se muð
spycð swa seo heorte þencð.
 6.46. Hwi clypege ge me, Drihten, Drihten, &amp; ne doð þæt
ic eow secge?
 6.47. Ælc þara þe to me cymþ &amp; mine spræca gehyrð
&amp; þa deþ, ic him ætywe hwam he gelic is.
 6.48. He ys gelic timbriendum men his hus se dealf deopne &amp; hys
grundweall ofer þæne stan asette; Soðlice gewordenum flode hit fleow
into þam huse, &amp; hyt ne mihte þæt hus astirian, hit wæs ofer
þæne stan getrymed.
 6.49. Se ðe gehyrð &amp; ne deþ, he is gelic þam
timbriendan men his hus ofer þa eorþan butan grundwealle, &amp; þæt
flod infleow &amp; hrædlice hyt afeoll &amp; wearð mycel hryre þæs
huses.
 7.1. Soþlice ða he ealle his word gyfylde on þæs folces
hlyste; He eode into cafarnaum.
 7.2. Þa wæs sumes hundredmannes þeowa untrum, se wæs
sweltendlic, se wæs him dyre.
 7.3. And þa he gehyrde be þam Hælende he sende to him Iudea
ealdras &amp; bæd þæt he come, &amp; hys þeow gehælde.
 7.4. Þa hi to þam Hælende comun, hi bædon hyne geornlice
&amp; þus cwædon, He is wyrðe þæt ðu him tilige, witodlice he
lufað ure þeode, &amp; he us ure samnunge getimbrode.
 7.6. Þa ferde se Hælend mid him, &amp; þa he wæs unfeor
þam huse se hundredmann sende hys frynd to him &amp; cwæþ, Drihten nelle
þu beon gedreht; ne eom ic wyrðe þæt ðu ga under mine þecene,
forþam ic ne tealde me sylfne þæt ic to ðe come, Ac cweð þin word
&amp; min cniht byð gehæled.
 7.8. Ic ne eom an man under anwealde gesett; cempan under me
hæbbende.
 7.8. &amp; ic secge þissum, ga, &amp; he gæð, &amp; ic secge
þissum, cum, þonne cymð he, &amp; ic secge minum þeowe, do þis, &amp;
he deð.
 7.9. Ða wundrude se Hælend þam gehyredum, &amp; cwæþ to
þære menigeo bewend, Soþlice ic secge eow ne funde ic on Israhel swa
mycelne geleafan.
 7.10. &amp; þa ða ham comon ðe asende wæron hig gemetton
halne þone þe ær untrum wæs.
 7.11. Þa wæs syððan geworden he ferde on þa ceastre þe
is genemned Naim &amp; mid him ferdun hys leorningcnihtas &amp; mycel menego.
 7.12. Þa he genealæhte þære ceastre gate þa wæs
þar an dead man geboren anre wudewan sunu þe nanne oðerne næfde, &amp;
seo wudewe wæs þar, &amp; mycel menegu þære burhware mid hyre.
 7.13. Þa se Hælend hig geseah þa wæs he mid
mildheortnesse ofer hig gefylled, &amp; cwæþ to hyre, ne wep þu na.
 7.14. Ða genealæhte he &amp; þa cyste æthran, þa
ætstodon þa þe hyne bæron; þa cwæþ se Hælend, eala geonga,
þe ic secge aris.
 7.15. Ða aras se þe dead wæs, &amp; ongan sprecan, þa agef
he hine hys meder.
 7.16. Þa ofereode ege hig ealle, &amp; hig God mærsodon &amp;
cwædon, þæt mære witega on us aras, &amp; þæt God hys folc
geneosude.
 7.17. Ða ferde þeos spæc be him on ealle Iudea, &amp; embe
eall þæt rice.
 7.18. Ða cyddun Iohannes leorningcnihtas him be eallum þysum
þingum.
 7.19. Þa clypode Iohannes twegen of his leorningcnihtum, &amp;
sende to þam Hælende, &amp; þus cwæþ; Eart þu þe to cumene
eart, hwæðer þe we oþres scylon onbydan.
 7.20. Ða hig to him comun þus hig cwædon, Iohannes se
fulluhtere us sende to þe &amp; þus cwæð; Eart þu ðe to cumenne
eart þe we sculon oðres onbidan.
 7.21. Soðlice on þære tide he gehælde manega of adlum, ge
of witum &amp; of yfelum gastum, &amp; manegum blindum he gesihþe forgeaf.
 7.22. Ða cwæþ se Hælend; Faraþ &amp; cyþað Iohannes
þa ðing þe ge gesawon &amp; gehyrdon; þæt blinde geseoð &amp;
healte gaþ, hreoflan synt gehælede, deafe gehyrað, deade arisaþ,
þearfan bodiað, &amp; eadig ys swa hwylc swa ne byð on me geuntrywsud.
 7.24. And þa þa Iohannes ærynddracan ferdon.
 7.24. Þa cwæð se Hælend to þam folce be Iohanne, Hwi
ferde ge on westene geseon þæt hreod þe byð mid winde astyred, Ac hwi
ferde ge to seonne þone man mid hnescum reafum gescryddne, þa ðe synt on
deorwurþum reafe &amp; on estum.
 7.26. Ac hwi ferde ge þæne witegan geseon, witodlice ic eow
secge he is mara þonne witega.
 7.27. Ðes is be þam þe awriten is, nu ic asende minne engel
beforan þine ansyne, se gegearwað þinne weg beforan þe.
 7.28. Soþlice ic eow secge, nis betwux wifa bearnum nan mærra
witega þonne Iohannes se fulluhtere, se þe is læssa on Godes rice, se is
his mara.
 7.29. &amp; eall folc þis gehyrende sundorhalgan God heredon
&amp; gefullede on Iohannes fulluhte.
 7.30. Soþlice þa sundorhalgan &amp; þa ægleawan forhogodon
þæs Hælendes geþeaht on him sylfon, na fram þam Hælende
gefullode.
 7.31. Hwam telle ic gelice þisse cneorisse men, &amp; hwam synt
hi gelice.
 7.32. Hi synt gelice cildum on stræte sittendum &amp; specendum
betwux him &amp; cweðendum; We sungon eow be hearpan, &amp; ge ne saltudun,
we heofdun &amp; ge ne weopun.
 7.33. Soþlice Iohannes com se fulluhtere hlaf ne ætende, ne
win drincende, &amp; ge cweðað, deofolseocnysse he hæfð.
 7.34. Mannes sunu com, etende &amp; drincende, &amp; ge cweþað
þes man is swelgend &amp; win dringcende, manfullra and synfulra freond; And
wisdom is gerihtwisud on eallum his bearnum.
 7.36. Þa bæd hine sum of þam sundorhalgum þæt he mid
him æte, ða eode he into þæs Fariseiscan huse &amp; gesæt.
 7.37. And þa þæt wif þe wæs on þære ceastre
synfull, þa heo oncneow þæt he sæt on þæs Fariseus huse, heo
brohte hyre sealfbox, &amp; stod wiðæftan his fet, &amp; ongan mid hyre
tearum hys fet þwean, &amp; drigde mid hyre heafdes fexe, &amp; cyste hys fet
&amp; mid sealfe smyrede.
 7.39. Ða se sundorhalga þe hyne ingelaðode þæt geseah,
he cwæþ on hys geþance, Gyf þe man witega wære, witodlice he wiste
hwæt &amp; hwylc þis wif wære þe his æthrinþ þæt heo synful
is.
 7.40. Ða cwæð se hælend him andswariende, Symon ic
hæbbe þe to secgenne sum ðing; þa cwæð he, lareow, sege
þænne.
 7.41. Twegen gafolgyldon wæron sumum lænende, an sceolde fif
hund penega &amp; oðer fiftig; ða hig næfdon hwanon hi hyt aguldon, he
hit him bam forgef; Hwæþer lufode hyne swyðor?
 7.43. Þa andswarode Simon, ic wene, se ðe he mare forgef; ða
cwæð he rihte, þu demdest.
 7.44. Þa bewende he hyne to þam wife, &amp; sæde Simone,
Gesyhst þu þis wif; Ic eode into þinum huse ne sealdest þu me wætan
to minum fotum; ðeos mid hyre tearum mine fet þwoh, &amp; mid hyre loccum
drigde.
 7.45. Coss þu me ne sealdest, þeos syððan ic ineode, ne
geswac þæt heo mine fet ne cyste.
 7.46. Min heafod þu mid ele ne smyredest, þeos smyrede mid
sealfe mine fet.
 7.47. Forþam ic secge þe, hyre synt manega sinna forgyfene,
forþam heo me swyðe lufode; Læsse lufað þam ðe læsse forgyfen
ys.
 7.48. Þa cwæþ he to hyre, þe synt þine synna
forgyfenne.
 7.49. Ða begunnon þa ðe þar sæton betwux him cweðan,
Hwæt is þes þe manna synna forgyfð.
 7.50. Ða cwæþ he to þam wife, þin geleafa þe dyde
hale; ga nu on sybbe.
 8.1. Syððan wæs geworden þæt he ferde þurh þa
ceastre &amp; þæt castel Godes rice prediciende &amp; bodiende, &amp; hi
twelfe mid hym.
 8.2. And sume wif þe wæron gehælede of awyrgdum gastum
&amp; untrumnessum, seo Magdalenisce Maria of þære seofan deoflu uteodon,
&amp; Iohanna Chuzan wif Herodes gerefan, &amp; Susanna &amp; manega oðre
þe him of hyra spedum þenedon.
 8.4. Soþlice þa mycel menegeo com &amp; of þam ceastrum to
him efstun, he sæde him an bigspel.
 8.5. Sum man his sæd seow, þa he þæt seow sum feoll wið
þæne weg &amp; wearð fortreden, &amp; heofones fugulas hyt fræton.
 8.6. And sum feoll ofer þæne stan &amp; hit forscranc forþam
þe hit wætan næfde.
 8.7. &amp; sum feoll on þa þornas, &amp; þa þornas hyt
forþrysmodon.
 8.8. And sum feoll on gode eorðan, &amp; worhte hundfealde
wæstm/.
 8.8. Þa clypode he &amp; cwæð, Gehyre se ðe earan
hæbbe.
 8.9. Ða ahsodon hine hys leorningcnihtas hwæt þæt bigspel
wære.
 8.10. Þa cwæð he, eow is geseald þæt ge witun Godes
rices geryne &amp; oðrum on bigspellum, þæt hi geseonde ne geseon, &amp;
gehyrende ne ongyton.
 8.11. Soðlice þis is þæt bigspell, þæt sæd ys
godes word; þa ðe synt wið þæne weg, þæt synt þa þe
gehyrað.
 8.12. Syððan se deofol cymþ, &amp; ætbryt þæt word of
hyra heortan þæt hig þurh þone geleafan hale ne gewurðað.
 8.13. Ða ðe synt ofer þæne stan þa þæt word mid
gefean onfoð, &amp; þa nabbað wyrtruman forþam þe hi hwilum
gelyfað, &amp; awaciaþ on þære costnunge timan.
 8.14. Ðæt sæd þe feoll on þa ðornas þæt synt
þa ðe gehyraþ, &amp; of carum &amp; of welum &amp; of lustum þiss lifes
synt forþrysmede, &amp; nanne wæstm ne bringað.
 8.15. Þæt feoll on ða godan eorðan, þæt synt þa
ðe on godre &amp; on selestre heortan gehyrende þæt word healdað &amp;
wæstm on geþylde bringað.
 8.16. Ne oferwrihð nan man mid fæte his onælede
leohtfæt, oððe under bedd asett, ac ofer candelstæf asett, þæt
ða ingangendan leoht geseon.
 8.17. Soðlice nis nan ðing digle þæt ne sy geswutelod, ne
behydd, þæt ne sy cuþ, &amp; open.
 8.18. Warniað hu ge gehyran, þam byð geseald ðe hæfð,
&amp; swa hwylc swa næfð þæt he wene þæt he hæbbe, him byð
afyrred.
 8.19. His modor &amp; his gebroðru him to comun &amp; hi ne
mihton hine for þære menegu geneosian.
 8.20. Þa wæs him gecyðed, þin modor &amp; þine
gebroðru standað her ute, wyllað þe geseon.
 8.21. Þa cwæð he to him, min modor and mine gebroðru synt
þa ðe gehyrað &amp; doð Godes word.
 8.22. Soðlice anum dæge wæs geworden þa he on scyp eode
&amp; his leorningcnihtas; þa cwæþ he to him, Utun seglian ofer þisne
mere, &amp; hig seglydan þa.
 8.23. Þa hig reowun, þa slep he; ða com windi yst &amp; hig
forhtodon.
 8.24. Þa genealæhton hig him to &amp; cwædon, Hlaford, we
forwurðað; ða aras he &amp; ðreade þæne wind &amp; þæs
wæteres hreohnesse; ða geswac se wind &amp; wearð mycel smyltnes.
 8.25. Ða cwæþ se Hælend, hwar is eower geleafa.
 8.25. Þa adredon hig &amp; wundredon &amp; betwux him cwædon,
Wenst þu hwæt is þes, þæt he bebyt ge windum ge sæ, &amp; hig
him hyrsumiað.
 8.26. Þa reowon hig to Gerasenorum rice, þæt is foran ongen
Galileam; þa he to lande com, him agen arn sum man, se hæfde
deofolseocnesse lange tide, &amp; næs mid nanon reafe gescrydd, &amp; ne
mihte on huse gewunian ac on byrgenum.
 8.28. Þa he geseah þæne Hælend he astrehte hyne toforan
him, &amp; cwæþ mycelre stefne hrymende, Hwæt is me and þe, la
Hælend þæs hehstan Godes sunu, Ic halsige þe þæt ðu ne
ðreage me.
 8.29. Þa bead he þam unclænan gaste þæt he of ðam men
ferde.
 8.29. Soþlice lange tide he hyne gegrap, &amp; he wæs mid
racenteagum gebunden &amp; mid fotcopsum gehealden, &amp; toborstenum bendum he
wæs fram deofle on westen gelædd.
 8.30. Ða ahsode se Hælend hine, hwæt is þin nama?
 8.30. Þa cwæð he, <foreign>Legio</foreign>, þæt is on ure geþeode
eored, forþam þe manega deoflu on hyne eodun.
 8.31. Þa bædon hig hine þæt he him ne bude þæt hi on
grund ne bescuton.
 8.32. And þar wæs mycel heord swyna on þam munte
læsiendra.
 8.32. Þa bædon hy þæt he lyfde him on þa gan; þa
lyfde he him.
 8.33. Þa eodon hig of þam men on þa swyn, þa ferde seo
heord myculum ræse on ðæne mere &amp; wearð þar adruncen.
 8.34. Þa ða hyrdas þæt gesawon þa flugon hig &amp;
cyddon on þa ceastre &amp; on tunum.
 8.35. Þa eodon hig ut þæt hig gesawon þæt ðar
geworden wæs.
 8.35. Þa comon hig to þam Hælende, þa fundon hig ðæne
man þe deofol of eode gescryddne &amp; halum mode æt his fotum, &amp; hig
adredon him.
 8.36. Ða cyddon him þa ðe gesawon hu he wæs hal geworden
of ðam eorede.
 8.37. Þa bæd hine eall menego þæs rices Gerasenorum
þæt he fram him gewite, forþam hig mycelum ege gehæfte wærun; ða
wende he on scype agen.
 8.38. Þa bæd hyne se man ðe se deofol of eode þæt he
mid him wunede.
 8.38. Þa forlet se Hælend hyne &amp; cwæð to him, wend to
þinum huse &amp; cyð hu mycel þe God gedon hæfð.
 8.39. Ða ferde he into eall þa ceastre, &amp; cyðde hu mycel
se Hælend him gedon hæfde.
 8.40. Soðlice wæs geworden þa se Hælend agencom; seo
menegeo hine onfeng; ealle hig gebidon his.
 8.41. And þa com an man þæs nama wæs Iairus, se wæs
þære gesamnunge ealdor; ða feoll he to þæs Hælendes fotun &amp;
bæd hyne þæt he ferde to hys huse, forþam he hæfde ane dohtor,
nean twelf wintre &amp; seo forðferde; þa gebyrede hyt þa he ferde of
ðam menegum he wæs ofþrungen.
 8.43. Ða wæs sum wif on blodryne twelf ger.
 8.43. Seo fordælde on læcas eall þæt heo ahte, &amp; ne
mihte þeah of ænegum beon gehælyd.
 8.44. Ða genealæhte heo wiðæftan &amp; æthran hys
reafes fnæd, ða ætstod sona þæs blodes ryne.
 8.45. Þa cwæð se Hælend, hwæt is se ðe me
æthran?
 8.45. Ða hig ealle ætsocon, þa cwæð Petrus &amp; þa
ðe mid him wæron, Eala Hlaford, þas menegeo þe ðringað &amp;
geswencað, &amp; þu segst hwa hwa æthran me.
 8.46. Þa cwæþ he sum me æthran, ic wiste þæt
mægen of me eode.
 8.47. Ða þæt wif geseah þæt hit him næs dyrne, heo
com forht &amp; astrehte hig to his fotum &amp; geswutulude beforan eallum
folce for hwylcum þinge heo hit æthran, &amp; hu heo wearð sona hal.
 8.48. Þa cwæð he to hyre, Dohtor þin geleafa þe hale
gedyde; Ga nu on sybbe.
 8.49. Him þa gyt specendum, þa com sum man to þære
gesamnunge ealdre &amp; cwæð to him, ne drece þu hyne.
 8.50. Þa se Hælend þæt word gehyrde he andswarude
þæs mædenes fæder, Ne ondræd þu ðe; Gelyf wotodlice, &amp;
heo bið hal.
 8.51. And þa ðe he to þam huse com, ne let he nanne mid him
ingan buton Petrum &amp; Iohannem &amp; Iacobum, &amp; þæs mædenes
fæder &amp; hyre modor.
 8.52. Þa weopon hig ealle &amp; heofodon hi.
 8.52. Ða cwæþ he, ne wepe ge; Soþlice nis þis mæden
dead, ac heo slæpð.
 8.53. Ða tældon hig hyne &amp; wiston þæt heo dead
wæs.
 8.54. Ða nam he hyre hand &amp; cwæð, Mæden, þe ic
secge aris.
 8.55. Þa gehwearf hyre gast agen &amp; heo sona aras, &amp; he
het hyre syllan etan.
 8.56. Ða wundredon hyre magas þa bead he þam þæt hi hit
nanum men ne sædon þæt þar geden wæs.
 9.1. Þa clypode he togædere his twelf apostolas, &amp; sealde
him mihte, &amp; anweald ofer ealle deofolseocnessa, &amp; þæt adla hi
gehældon.
 9.2. &amp; he sende hig to bodianne Godes rice, &amp; untrume
gehælan.
 9.3. Ða cwæþ he to him, ne nyme ge nan þing on wege, ne
gyrde, ne codd, ne hlaf, ne feoh, ne ge ne ge nabbon twa tunecan.
 9.4. &amp; on swa hwylc hus swa ge ingað wuniað þar oð ge
utgan, &amp; swa hwylce swa eow ne onfoð, þonne ge of þære ceastre
gað asceacað eower fota dust ofer hig on witnesse.
 9.6. Ða ferdon hig þurh þa burhga bodiende &amp; æghwar
Hælende.
 9.7. Þa gehyrde Herodes se feorðan dæles rica ealle þa
ðing þe be him wærun gewordene; ða twynude him forþam þe sume
sædon þæt Iohannes of deaðe aras, sume sædon þæt Helias
ætywde; sume sædon eald witega aras.
 9.9. Ða cwæþ Herodes, Iohannem ic beheafdude, hwæt is
þes; Be þam ic þilc gehyre; ða smeade he þæt he hine gesawe.
 9.10. Þa cyddun him ða apostolas swa hwæt swa hig dydon.
 9.10. Ða nam he hig &amp; ferde onsundron on weste stowe seo is
Bethsaida.
 9.11. Ða ða menego þæt wiston þa filidon hig him, þa
onfeng he hig &amp; spæc to him be Godes rice, &amp; þa he gehælde ðe
lacnunga beþorftun.
 9.12. Þa gewat se dæg forð, &amp; hig twelfe him
genealæhton &amp; sædon him, Læt þas menego þæt hig farun on
þas castelu &amp; on þas tunas þe her abutan synt &amp; him mete findon,
forþam þe we synt her on westere stowe.
 9.13. Ða cwæð he to him, sylle ge him etan.
 9.13. Ða cwædon hig we nabbað buton fif hlafas &amp; twegen
fixas, buton we gan &amp; us mete bicgon &amp; eallum þissum werede.
 9.14. Þar wæron neah fif þusenda wera.
 9.14. Ða cwæþ he to his leorningcnihtun, Doþ þæt hig
sitton þurh gebeorscypas fiftegum.
 9.15. &amp; hig swa dydon &amp; hi ealle sæton.
 9.16. Ða nam he þa fif hlafas &amp; þa twegen fixas, &amp; on
þone heofon beseah &amp; bletsude hig &amp; bræc, &amp; dælde his
leorningcnihtum, þæt hig asetton hig beforan þam menegum.
 9.17. Þa æton hig ealle &amp; wurdon gefyllede, &amp; man nam
þa gebrotu þe þar belifon twelf cypan fulle.
 9.18. Ða wæs geworden þa se Hælend wæs ana hine
gebiddende, hys leorningcnihtas wæron mid him; þa ahsode he hig, hwæt
secgð þis folc þæt ic sy?
 9.19. Ða andswarudon hig &amp; cwædon, Iohannes baptistam,
sume Heliam, sume þæt sum witega of ðam ealdum aras.
 9.20. Ða sæde he him, hwæt secge ge þæt ic sy?
 9.20. Þa andswarude Petrus, ðu eart Crist godes sunu.
 9.21. Ða þreade he hig &amp; bead þæt hig hit nanum men ne
sædon, forþam þe hit gebyreð þæt mannes sunu fela þinga
þolige, &amp; beo aworpen fram ealdrum &amp; ealdormannum &amp; fram bocerum,
&amp; beon ofslegen, þriddan dæge arisan.
 9.23. Þa cwæð he to eallum, Gyf hwa wyle æfter me cuman,
ætsace hine sylfne &amp; nime his cwylminge &amp; me folgige.
 9.24. Se þe wyle hys sawle hale gedon, se hig forspilþ.
 9.24. Witodlice se ðe his sawle for me forspilð he hi
gehæleð.
 9.25. Hwæt fremað ænegum men þeah he ealne middaneard on
æht begite, &amp; hyne sylfne forspille; And his forwyrd wyrce, Se ðe me
&amp; mine spæca forsyhþ, þæne mannes sunu forsyhþ, þonne he
cymð on his mægenþrymme &amp; hys fæder &amp; halegra engla.
 9.27. Ic secge eow soðlice, her synd sume standende þa deade ne
wurðaþ, ær hig Godes rice geseon.
 9.28. Ða wæs geworden æfter þam wordum nean eahta dagas
þæt he nam Petrum &amp; Iohannem &amp; Iacobum, &amp; eode on anne munt,
þæt he hyne gebæde.
 9.29. Þa he hine gebæd þa wæs hys ansyn oþres hiwes,
&amp; his reaf hwit scinende.
 9.30. Þa spæcon twegen weras wið hyne Moyses &amp; Helias
gesewene on mægenþrymme, &amp; sædon his gewitendnesse þe he to
gefyllende wæs on Hierusalem.
 9.32. Petrus &amp; þa þe mid him wæron wurdon mid slæpe
gehefegude; And þa hi onwæcnedun hi gesawun his mægenþrym, &amp;
twegen weras þe mid him stodun.
 9.33. And hi him fram eodun, Petrus cwæð to him; Eala
bebeodend, god is þæt we her beon &amp; uton wyrcan þreo eardungstowa,
ane þe &amp; ane Moyse &amp; ane Hælie, &amp; he nyste hwæt he
cwæð.
 9.34. Ða he þis spæc, ða wearð genip &amp; ofersceadude
hig, &amp; hi ondredon him gangende on þæt genip.
 9.35. Ða com stefen of þam genipe and cwæð, þes ys min
leofa sunu; gehyrað hyne.
 9.36. Ða seo stefn wæs gehyred þa wæs se Hælend gemett
ana, &amp; hi suwodun &amp; ne sædun nanum men on þam dagum nan þing
þæs ðe hi gesawun.
 9.37. Oðrum dæge him of þam munte farendum him agen arn
mycel menego.
 9.38. Þa clypode an wer of þære menego &amp; cwæð,
Lareow, ic halsie þe, geseoh minne sunu forþam he is min anlica sunu, &amp;
nu se unclæna gast hine æthrinð, &amp; he færlice hrymð &amp;
fornimð hyne &amp; fæmð, &amp; hyne tyrð &amp; slit.
 9.40. &amp; ic bæd þine leorningcnihtas þæt hig hine
utadrifon &amp; hig ne mihton.
 9.41. Þa cwæð se Hælend him to andsware, Eala
ungeleafulle &amp; þwure cneores, swa lange swa ic beo mid eow, &amp; eow
þolie; Læd hider þinne sunu.
 9.42. And þa he hyne lædde him to, se deofol hine fornam &amp;
fordyde.
 9.42. Ða nydde se Hælend þone unclænan gast ut, &amp;
gehælde þæne cnapan &amp; agef hine his fæder.
 9.43. Þa wundredon hig ealle be Godes mærðe, &amp; eallum
wundriendum be þam þingum þe gewurdun; He cwæð to his
leorningcnihtum, Asettað þas spæca on eowrum heortum, hit ys towerd
þæt mannes sunu si geseald on manna handa.
 9.45. Ða þohton hig þis word &amp; hit wæs bewrigen
beforan him þæt hi hit ne ongeton, &amp; hi ne dorston hine be þam worde
ahsian.
 9.46. Soðlice þæt geþanc eode on hig, hwylc hyra yldest
wære.
 9.47. Ða se Hælend geseh hyra heortan geþancas, he gesette
þæne cnapan wiþ hine &amp; cwæþ to him, Se ðe þysne cnapan on
minum naman onfehð, se me onfehð; And se þe me onfehð he onfehð
þæne þe me sende; Witudlice se ðe is læst betwex eow ealle, se is
mara.
 9.49. Ða andswarode Iohannes, bebeodend, we gesawon sumne on
þinum naman deofolseocnessa utdrifende &amp; we hine forbudon, forþam he
mid us ne fylygð.
 9.50. Ða cwæð he, ne forbeode ge.
 9.50. Se ðe nis ongen eow se is for eow.
 9.51. Soðlice wæs geworden þa his andfenga dagas wæron
gefyllede; he getrymede hys ansyne þæt he ferde to Hierusalem.
 9.52. Ða sende he bodan beforan his ansyne, þa eodon hig on
þa ceastre Samaritanorum þæt hi him gegearwodon.
 9.53. &amp; hig ne onfengon hine forþam þe he wolde faran to
Hierusalem.
 9.54. Ða his leorningcnihtas þæt gesawon, Iacobus &amp;
Iohannes, þa cwædon hig, Drihten, wyltu we secgað þæt fyr cume of
heofone &amp; fornime hig.
 9.55. And hine bewende he hig þreade, &amp; hig ferdon on oþer
castel.
 9.57. Ða hi ferdon on wege, sum him to cwæð, Ic fylige þe
swa hwyder swa þu færst.
 9.58. Ða cwæþ se Hælend, foxas habbað holu &amp;
heofones fuglas nestþ; Soðlice mannes sunu næfþ hwar he hys heafod
ahylde.
 9.59. Ða cwæþ he to oðrum filig me.
 9.59. Ða cwæþ he, drihten, alyf me æryst bebyrigean minne
fæder.
 9.60. Ða cwæþ se Hælend, læt þa dead byrigan hyra
deadan.
 9.60. Ga ðu &amp; boda Godes rice.
 9.61. Ða cwæð oðer, ic fylige þe drihten, ac læt me
æryst hit cyþan þam ðe æt ham synt.
 9.62. Ða cwæþ se Hælend him to, nan mann þe hys hand
asett on hys sulh, &amp; onbæc besyhð nys andfenge Godes rice.
 10.1. Æfter þam se hælend gemearcude oðre twa &amp;
hundseofantig and sende hig twam beforan his ansyne on ælce ceastre &amp;
stowe þe he to cumenne wæs, &amp; cwæð to him, her is mycel rip &amp;
feawa wyrhtan.
 10.2. Biddað þæs ripes hlaford þæt he sende wyrhtan to
his ripe.
 10.3. Farað nu, nu ic eow sende swa swa lamb betwux wulfas.
 10.4. Ne bere ge sacc, ne codd, ne gescy, ne nanne man be wege ne
gretað.
 10.5. On swa hwylc hus swa ge ingað, cweðaþ æryst, sib si
þisse hiwræddenne.
 10.6. And gyf þar beoð sybbe bearn, reste þar eower sib; Gif
hit elles sy, heo sy to eow gecyrred.
 10.7. Wunigaþ on þam ylcan huse, &amp; etað &amp; drincað
þa þing þe hig habbað; Soðlice se wyrhta is his mede wyrðe; Ne fare
ge fram huse to huse, ac on swa hwylce ceastre swa ge ingað &amp; hig eow
onfoð, etað þæt eow toforan aset ys, &amp; gehælað þa untruman
þe on þam huse synt, &amp; secgað him, Godes rice to eow genealæcð.
 10.10. On swa hwylce ceastre swa ge ingað, &amp; hig ne onfoð
eow gaþ on hyra stræta &amp; cweðaþ, þæt dust þæt of eowre
ceastre on urum fotum clifode, we drigeaþ on eow; witað þeah þæt
Godes rice genealæcð.
 10.12. Ic eow secge þæt sodomwaron on þam dæge bið
forgyfenlicre þonne þære ceastre.
 10.13. Wa þe Corozam, wa þe Bethsaida, forþam gif on Tyro
&amp; on Sidone gewordene wæron þa menegu þe on eow gedone synt, gefyrn
hig on hæran &amp; on axan hreowsunge dydon.
 10.14. Ðeahhwæþere Tiro &amp; Sydone on þam dæge byð
forgyfenlicre þonne eow.
 10.15. And þu Cafarnaum oð heofon upahafen, þu byst oþ
helle gesenced.
 10.16. Me gehyrð se ðe eow gehyrð, &amp; me oferhogaþ se
ðe eow oferhogað; Se þe me oferhogað, he oferhogað þæne þe me
sende.
 10.17. Ða gecyrdon þa twa &amp; hundseofantig mid gefean &amp;
cwædon, Drihten deofolseocnessa us synt on þinum naman underþeodde.
 10.18. Ða sæde he him, ic geseah Satanan swa swa ligræsc of
heofone feallende, &amp; nu ic sealde eow anweald to tredenne ofer næddran
&amp; snacan &amp; ofer ælc feondes mægen, &amp; nan þing eow ne
derað.
 10.20. Þeahhwæðere ne blissige ge on þam þe eow synt
gastas underþeodde; Geblissiað þæt eower naman synt on heofonum
awritene.
 10.21. On þære tide he on halgum gaste geblissode &amp;
cwæð, Ic andete þe fæder, drihten heofones &amp; eorðan, forþam
þe ðu þas ðing wisum &amp; gleawum behyddest, &amp; lytlingum awruge,
forþam hit beforan þe swa gelicode.
 10.22. Ealle þing me synt fram minum fæder gesealde, &amp; nan
man nat hwylc is se sunu buton se fæder, ne hwylc si ðe fæder buton se
sunu, &amp; se ðe se sunu hit awreon wyle.
 10.23. Þa cwæþ he to his leorningcnihtum bewend, Eadige synt
þa eagan þe geseoð þa ðing þe ge geseoð.
 10.24. Soðlice ic eow secge þæt manega witegan &amp;
cyningas woldon geseon þæt ge geseoþ &amp; hig hit ne gesawon, &amp;
woldon gehyran þæt ge gehyraþ, &amp; hig hit ne gehyrdon.
 10.25. Ða aras sum æglæw man, &amp; fandode his &amp;
cwæð, Lareow, hwæt do ic þæt ic ece lif hæbbe?
 10.26. Ða cwæþ he to him, hwæt is gewriten on þære
æ; Hu rætst þu?
 10.27. Ða andswarude he, lufa drihten þinne God of ealre
þinre heortan, &amp; of ealre þinre sawle, &amp; of eallum þinum mihtum
&amp; eallum þinum mægene, &amp; þinne nehstan swa ðe sylfne.
 10.28. Þa cwæð he, rihte þu andswarodest.
 10.28. Do þæt, þonne leofast þu.
 10.29. Ða cwæþ he to þam Hælende, &amp; wolde hine
sylfne gerihtwisian, And hwylc is min nehsta?
 10.30. Ða cwæþ se Hælend hine upbeseonde, Sum man ferde
fram Hierusalem to Hiericho &amp; becom on þa sceaðan, þa hine bereafodon
&amp; tintregodon hine, &amp; forleton hine samcucene.
 10.31. Þa gebyrode hit þæt sum sacerd ferde on þam ylcan
wege &amp; þa he þæt geseah he hine forbeh, &amp; eallswa se diacon,
þa he wæs wið þa stowe &amp; þæt geseah he hyne eac forbeah.
 10.33. Ða ferde sum Samaritanisc man wið hine.
 10.33. Þa he hine geseah þa wearð he mid mildheortnesse ofer
hine astyred.
 10.34. Þa genealæhte he &amp; wrað his wunda &amp; onaget
ele &amp; win, &amp; hine on hys nyten sette &amp; gelædde on his
læcehus, &amp; hine lacnude &amp; brohte oðrum dæge twegen penegas
&amp; sealde þam læce &amp; þus cwæð, Begym hys, &amp; swa hwæt
swa þu mare togedest, þonne ic cume ic hit forgylde þe.
 10.36. Hwylc þara þreora þyncð þe þæt sy þæs
mæg, þe on ða sceaðan befeoll.
 10.37. Ða cwæð he, Se ðe him mildheortnesse on dyde.
 10.37. Ða cwæþ se hælend, ga &amp; do eall swa.
 10.38. Soðlice hit wæs geworden þa hig ferdon, se Hælend
eode on sum castel &amp; sum wif on naman Martha onfeng hyne on hyre hus.
 10.39. &amp; þære swustur wæs Maria, seo eac sæt wið
þæs hælendes fet &amp; his word gehyrde.
 10.40. Soþlice Martha geornlice him þenode.
 10.40. Þa stod heo &amp; cwæþ, Drihten, nis þe nan caru
þæt min swustur let me ænlipie þenian; Sege hyre þæt heo fylste
me.
 10.41. Ða cwæþ se Hælend, Martha Martha, geornfull þu
eart &amp; embe fela þinga gedrefed.
 10.42. Gewislice an þing is niedbehefe.
 10.42. Maria geces þæne selestan dæl, se hyre ne byð
afyrred.
 11.1. Soðlice wæs geworden þa he wæs on sumere stowe hine
gebiddende, þa þa he geswac, him to cwæð an his leorningcnihta,
Drihten, lær us, us gebiddan, swa Iohannes his leorningcnihtas lærde.
 11.2. Ða cwæþ he to him, cweðað þus, þonne ge eow
gebiddað, Ure fæder þu ðe on heofone eart, si þin nama gehalgod,
tocume þin rice, gewurðe ðin willa on heofone &amp; on eorþan.
 11.3. Syle us todæg urne dæghwamlican hlaf, &amp; forgyf us
ure gyltas, swa we forgyfað ælcum þara þe wið us agyltað; &amp; ne
læd þu us on costunge, ac alys us fram yfele.
 11.5. Ða cwæþ he to him, Hwylc eower hæfð sumne freond,
&amp; gæþ to midre nihte to him, &amp; cwyð to him, La freond, læn me
þry hlafas, forþam min freond com of wege to me, &amp; ic næbbe hwæt
ic him toforan lecge.
 11.7. And he þonne him þus andswarige, ne beo þu me gram nu
min duru is belocen, &amp; mine cnihtas synt on reste mid me, ne mæg ic
arisan nu &amp; syllan þe.
 11.8. Gyf he þonne þurhwunað cnucigiende, ic eow secge gyf he
ne/ arist &amp; him sylð þonne forþam þe he his freond ys,
þeahhwæþere for hys onhrope he arist &amp; sylð him his neode.
 11.9. And ic eow secge, biddað, &amp; eow byð seald, secað,
&amp; ge findað; cnuciað, &amp; eow byð untyned.
 11.10. Ælc þara þe bitt onfehð, &amp; se ðe secð he
fint, &amp; cnuciendum byð untyned.
 11.11. Hwylc eower bitt his fæder hlafes, segst þu sylð he
him stan, oððe gif he byt fisces sylð he him næddran for fisce,
oððe gyf he bit æg, segst þu ræcð he him <foreign>scorpionem</foreign>, þæt
is an wyrmcynn.
 11.13. Witodlice gyf he þonne þe synt yfele cunnun syllan gode
sylene eowrum bearnum swa mycele ma eower fæder of heofone sylð godne gast
þam þe hyne biddað.
 11.14. Ða wæs se Hælend utadrifende sume deofolseocnysse,
&amp; seo wæs dumb; And þa he utdraf þa deofolseocnesse þa spræc se
dumba, &amp; þa menego wundredon.
 11.15. Sume cwædon on Belzebub deofla ealdre he utadrifð þa
deofolseocnessa.
 11.16. And sume his fandodon &amp; gyrndon of heofone tacnys of
him.
 11.17. Ða he geseah hyra geðancas he cwæð, ælc rice on
hyt sylf todæled byð, toworpen &amp; þæt hus ofer þæt hus
fealð.
 11.18. Gyf Satanas is todæled on hine sylfne, hu stent his
rice?
 11.18. Forþamþe ge secgað þæt ic on Belzebub
deofolseocnessa utadrife.
 11.19. Gif ic on Belzebub deofla utdrife, on hwam utadrifað eower
bearn, forþam hig beoð eowere deman.
 11.20. Gewislice, gif ic on Godes fingre deofla utadrife, eallunga
Godes rice on eow becymð.
 11.21. Ðonne se stranga gewæpnud his cafertun gehealt, þonne
beoð on sibbe þa ðing þe he ah.
 11.22. Gyf þonne strengra ofer hine cymð, &amp; hine
oferwinð, ealle his wæpnu þe he on truwude he him afyrð, &amp;
todælþ his herereaf.
 11.23. Se þe nis mid me se is ongen me; and se þe ne gaderað
mid me, se hit tostret.
 11.24. Ðonne se unclæna gast gæð of þam men, he
gæð þurh unwæterie stowa reste secende &amp; nane ne gemet þonne
cwyð he, Ic gewende eft to minum huse þe ic of eode.
 11.25. &amp; þænne he cymð, he hit gemet æmtig mid besmum
afeormod.
 11.26. Þonne gæð he &amp; nimð seofan oðre gastas wyrsan
þonne he &amp; ingað, &amp; þar eardiað, þonne synt þæs mannes
endas wyrsan þam ærrum.
 11.27. Soðlice wæs geworden þa he ðis sæde, sum wif him
to cwæþ, Eadig is se innoð þe þe bær, &amp; þa breost þe ðu
suce.
 11.28. Ða cwæð he, eadige synt þa ðe Godes word
gehyrað &amp; þæt gehealdaþ.
 11.29. Ða hyra manega togædere comon he cwæþ to him,
ðeos cneorys is manfull cneorys, heo secð tacen, &amp; hyre ne bið nan
geseald buton Ionan tacen.
 11.30. Swa swa Iona wæs tacen Niniuetum, swa bið mannes sunu
tacen þisse cneorisse.
 11.31. Suðdæles cwen arist on dome mid þisse cneorysse
mannum &amp; genyðerað hig, forþam þe heo com of eorðan endum to
gehyranne Salomones wisdom, and efne þes is mara þonne Salomon.
 11.32. Niniuetisce men arisaþ on dome mid þisse cneorysse &amp;
genyðeriað hig, forþam þe hig dædbote dydon æt Ionam bodunge,
&amp; þes is mara þonne Iona.
 11.33. Ne onælþ nan man his leohtfæt &amp; sett on diglum,
ne under bydene ac ofer candelstæf, þæt ða þe ingað leoht
geseon.
 11.34. Ðin eage is þines lichaman leohtfæt.
 11.34. Gif þin eage bið hluttor ðonne bið eall þin
lichama beorht; Gif hit byð deorc, eall þin lichama byð þystre.
 11.35. Warna þæt þæt leoht þe ðe on is ne syn
þystru.
 11.36. Gyf þin lichama eall bið beorht and næfþ nanne
dæl þystra, þonne byð he eall beorht, &amp; þe onlyht swa þæt
leohtfæt þæs ligræsces.
 11.37. Þa bæd hine sum Fariseisc man þæt he æte mid
him &amp; he ineode &amp; sæt.
 11.38. Ða ongan se Fariseisca on him smeagan &amp; cweðan hwi
he geþwogen nære ær his gereorde.
 11.39. Ða cwæð Drihten to him, nu ge Farisei þæt ute is
calices &amp; disces geclænsiað þæt eow innan is þæt is full
reaflace &amp; unrihtwisnesse.
 11.40. La dysegan, hu ne worhte þæt þæt inne is, se ðe
worhte þæt ute is, þeahhwæþere þæt to lafe is syllað
ælmessan þonne beoð eow ealle þing clæne.
 11.42. Ac wa eow Fariseum ge þe teoþiað mintan &amp; rudan,
&amp; ælce wyrte &amp; ge forbugað dom &amp; Godes lufe; þas þing eow
gebyrede to donne, &amp; þa þing ne forlætan.
 11.43. Wa eow Fariseum ge þe lufiað þa forman heahsetl on
gesamnungum &amp; gretinga on stræte.
 11.44. Wa eow forþam þe ge synt swylce þa byrgena þe man
innan ne sceawað; And þa men nyton þe him onufan gað.
 11.45. Ða andswarode him sum ægleaw, lareow, teonan þu
wyrhcst us mid þisse sage.
 11.46. Þa cwæþ he, Wa eow ægleawum, forþam þe ge
symað men mid þam byrþenum þe hig aberan ne magon, &amp; ge ne
ahrinað þa seamas mid eowrum anum fingre.
 11.47. Wa eow ge þe timbriað witegena byrgena, eower fæderas
hig ofslogon, eallunga ge cyðað &amp; ge þafiað eower fædera
weorcum, forþam hig ofslogon hig, &amp; ge timbriað hira byrgena.
 11.49. Forþam cwæð Godes wisdom, ic sende to him witegan
&amp; apostolas, &amp; hig ofsleað hig, &amp; ehtað þæt ealra witegena
blod sy gesoht, þe wæs agoten of middangeardes fruman, fram þisse
cneorysse, fram Abeles blode oð Zachariam blod, se forwearð betux þam
altare &amp; þam temple; Ic eow secge, swa bið gesoht fram þisse
cneorysse.
 11.52. Wa eow ægleawum forþam þe ge ætbrudun þæs
ingehydes cæge, ge in ne eodun &amp; ge forbudon þa þe ineodun.
 11.53. Ða he him þis to cwæð, þa ongunnun ða Farisei
&amp; þa ægleawan hefilice him agen standan &amp; his muð dyttan &amp;
embe hine syrwan, secende sum þing of his muðe þæt hig hine wregdun.
 12.1. Mycelum weredum him embe standendum þæt hig hine
trædun, ða cwæð he to his leorningcnihtum, warniað wið Farisea
lare þæt is licetung, Soðlice nis nan þing oferheled, þe ne beo
unheled; ne behydd þæt ne sy witen.
 12.3. Forþam þe þæt ge secgað on þystrum beoð on
leohte sæde &amp; þæt ge on earum spræcun on beddcofum bið on
hrofum bodud.
 12.4. Ic secge eow, minum freondum, ne beo ge bregyde fram þam
þe þone lichaman ofsleað, &amp; nabbað syþþan hwæt hig ma don.
 12.5. Ic eow ætywe hwæne ge ondredon, adrædað þone
þe anweald hæfð, seððan he ofslyhð on helle asendan, þus ic eow
secge adrædað þone.
 12.6. Ne becypað hig fif spearwan to helflinge, &amp; an nis of
þam ofergyten beforan Gode, ac ealle eowres heafdes loccas synt getealde.
 12.7. Ne adræde ge eow ge synt beteran manegum spearwum.
 12.8. Soðlice ic eow secge swa hwylc swa me andet beforan mannum,
þone mannes sunu andet beforan Godes englum.
 12.9. Se þe me wiðsæcð beforan mannum, se byð wiðsacen
beforan Godes englum, &amp; ælc þe segð ænig word agen mannes sunu
þam bið forgyfene; ðam þe wiðersacað ongen haligne gast, ne bið
þam forgyfen.
 12.11. Þonne hig lædað eow on gesamnunga &amp; to
dugeðeealdrum &amp; to anwealdum, ne beo ge embeþencynde, hu oððe
hwæt ge specon oððe andswarian.
 12.12. Halig gast eow lærð on þære tide þa þing þe
eow specan gebyrað.
 12.13. Ða cwæð sum of þam menegum, Lareow, sege minum
breðer þæt he dæle uncer æhta wið me.
 12.14. Ða cwæð he, la man, hwa sette me deman, oððe
dælend ofer inc?
 12.15. Þa cwæð he, gymað &amp; warniað wið ælce
gytsunge, forþam þe nys nanes mannes lif on gytsunge of þam þe he ah.
 12.16. Ða sæde he him sum bigspel.
 12.16. Sumes weliges mannes æcer brohte forð gode wæstmas.
 12.17. Þa ðohte he on him sylfum &amp; cwæð, Hwæt do ic
forþam ic næbbe hwyder ic mine wæstmas gadrige?
 12.18. Ða cwæþ he, þus ic do.
 12.18. Ic towurpe mine bernu &amp; ic wyrce maran, &amp; ic
gaderige þyder eall þæt me gewexen ys &amp; mine god, &amp; ic secge
minre sawle, eala sawel þu hæfst mycele god.
 12.19. Asette to manegum gearum, gerest þe, et &amp; drinc &amp;
gewista.
 12.20. Ða cwæð God to him, La dysega, on þisse nihte hig
feccað þine sawle fram þe, hwæs beoð þa ðing þe ðu
gegearwudest?
 12.21. Swa is se ðe him sylfum strynð, &amp; nis welig mid
gode.
 12.22. Þa cwæð he to his leorningcnihtum, forþam ic eow
secge ne beo ge ymbehydige eowre sawle hwæt ge etan, ne eowrum lichaman
hwæt ge scrydun.
 12.23. Seo sawul ys ma þonne se lichama, &amp; se lichama ma
þonne þæt reaf.
 12.24. Besceawiað þa hrefnas þæt hig ne sawað, ne ne
ripað.
 12.24. Nabbað hig heddern ne bern, ac God hig fett, þæt þe
ma ge synt hyra selran.
 12.25. Hwylc eower mæg þencende ican ane elne to his
anlicnesse?
 12.26. Gyf ge þæt læsse ne magon, hwy synt ge be oðrum
þingum ymbehydige?
 12.27. Sceawiaþ þa lilian hu hi wexað, hi ne swincað ne ne
spinnað; Soðlice ic eow secge þæt Salomon on eallum hys wuldre næs
gescrydd swa þissa an.
 12.28. Gyf God scrytt þæt hig, ðe ys todæg on æcere
&amp; tomorgen forscrincð, swa mycele ma God scryt eow gehwædes geleafan.
 12.29. And nelle ge secean hwæt ge eton oððe drincon, &amp;
ne beo ge upahafene.
 12.30. Ealle þas þing þeoda seceað Eower fæder wat
þæt ge þises beþurfon.
 12.31. Þeahhwæþere seceað Godes rice &amp; ealle þas
þing eow beoþ geihte.
 12.32. Ne ondræd þu þe, la lytle heord, forþam eowrum
fæder gelicode eow rice syllan.
 12.33. Syllaþ þæt ge agon &amp; syllað ælmessan,
wyrcað seodas þa ðe ne forealdigeað ungeteorudne goldhord on heofenum;
þyder ðeof ne genealæcð, ne ne moððe ne gewemð.
 12.34. Ðar eower goldhord is, þar byð eower heorte.
 12.35. Sin eower lendenu begyrde &amp; leohtfatu byrnende, &amp;
beo gelice þam mannum þe hyra hlafordes abidað hwænne he sy fram
gyftum gecyrred, þæt hig him sona ontynon þonne he cymð &amp;
cnucað.
 12.37. Eadige synt þa þeowas þe se hlaford wæccende gemet
þonne he cymð; Soðlice ic eow secge þæt he begyrt hine &amp; deð
þæt hig sittað &amp; gangende him þenað.
 12.38. And gif he cymð on þære æfteran wæccan,
oððe on þære þriddan &amp; þus gemet, eadige synt þa þeowas.
 12.39. Witað þæt gif se hiredes ealdor wiste hwænne se
þeof cuman wolde, witodlice he wacude &amp; ne geþafude þæt man his
hus underdulfe.
 12.40. And beo ge wære forþam þe mannes sunu cymð
þære tide þe ge ne wenað.
 12.41. Þa cwæþ Petrus, Drihten, segst þu þis bigspell to
us hwæþer þe to eallum?
 12.42. Ða cwæþ Drihten, hwa wenst þu þæt sy getrywe
&amp; gleaw dihtnere, þæne se hlaford geset ofer hys hired þæt he him
hwætes gemet on timan sylle.
 12.43. Eadig is se þeow þe his hlaford gemet þus donde
þonne he cymð.
 12.44. Soðlice ic secge eow þæt he gesett hine ofer eall
þæt he ah.
 12.45. Gyf þonne se þeow cwyð on hys heortan, min hlaford
uferaþ hys cyme, &amp; agynð beatan þa cnihtas &amp; þa þinena, &amp;
etan &amp; drincan &amp; beon oferdruncen, þonne cymþ þæs þeowan
hlaford on þam dæge þe he ne wenð, &amp; þære tide þe he nat,
&amp; todælþ hine &amp; sett his dæl mid þam ungetreowum.
 12.47. Soþlice þæne þeow þe his hlafordes willan wiste
&amp; ne dyde æfter his hlafordes willan, he biþ witnad manegum witum.
 12.48. Ðone þeow þe his willan nyste &amp; þeah dyde he bit
witnad feawum witum; ælcum þe mycel geseald is, him man mycel tosecð,
&amp; æt þam þe hig micel befæstun hig mycel biddað.
 12.49. Fyr ic sende on eorþan &amp; hwæt wylle ic buton
þæt hit bærne.
 12.50. Ic hæbbe on fulluhte beon gefullod &amp; wenege, hu beo
ic geþread oð hyt sy gefyllyd.
 12.51. Forþam þe ic com sybbe on eorþan sendan, ne secge ic
eow ac todal.
 12.52. Heononforð beoð fife on anum huse todælede, þry on
twegen, &amp; twegen on þry, beoð todælede, Fæder on sunu &amp; sunu
on his fæder, modor on dohtor &amp; dohtor on hyre modor, Swegr on hyre
snore, &amp; snoru on hyre swegere.
 12.54. &amp; he cwæþ to þam folce, þonne ge geseoð þa
lyfte cumende on westdæle, sona ge cweðað storm cymð &amp; hit swa
byð.
 12.55. And þonne ge geseoð suðan blawan ge secgaþ þæt
is towerd &amp; hit byð.
 12.56. La liceteras cunnege afandian heofones ansyne &amp;
eorþan, humeta na afandige ge þas tide.
 12.57. Hwi ne deme ge of eowsylfum þæt riht is?
 12.58. Ðonne þu gæst on wege mid þinum wiðerwinnan to
hwylcum ealdre, do þæt ðu beo fram him alysed, þelæs he þe sylle
þam deman, &amp; se dema þam bydele, &amp; se bydel þe sende on
cwertern.
 12.59. Ic secge þe ne gæst þu þanone ær þu agylde
þone ytemystan feorðling.
 13.1. Þar wæron sume on þære tide of Galileum him
cyþende þara blod Pilatus mengde mid hyra offrungum.
 13.2. Þa cwæð he him andswarigende, wenege wæron þa
Galileiscan synfulle toforan eallum Galileiscum, forþam þe hig swylc
þoledon?
 13.3. Ne secge ic na; ac ealle ge gelice forwurðaþ, buton ge
dædbote don.
 13.4. Swa þa ehtatyne ofer þa feoll se stypel on Siloa &amp;
hig ofsloh; Wenege þæt hig wæron scyldige ofer ealle menn þe on
Hierusalem wunedon.
 13.5. Ne secge ic, ac swa ge forwurðaþ, buton ge dædbote
don.
 13.6. Ða sæde he him þis bigspel.
 13.6. Sum man hæfde an fictreow geplantod on his wingearde; þa
com he &amp; sohte his wæstmas on him þa ne funde he nanne.
 13.7. Þa cwæþ he to þam hyrde nu synt þreo ger
syðþan ic com wæstm secende on þissum fictreowe, &amp; ic ne funde;
Forceorf hine; hwi ofþricð he þæt land?
 13.8. Ða cwæð he hlaford, læt hine gyt þis gear, oð
ic hine bedelfe &amp; ic hine bewurpe mid meoxe, &amp; witodlice he wæstmas
bringð.
 13.9. Gif hit elles hwæt byð ceorf hine syððan.
 13.10. Ða wæs he restedagum on hyra gesamnunge lærende.
 13.11. Þa wæs þar sum wif seo hæfde untrumnesse gast
ehtatyne gear, &amp; heo wæs abogen; ne heo eallunga ne mihte upbeseon.
 13.12. Þa se Hælend hig geseah, he clypode hig to him &amp;
sæde hyre, Wif, þu eart forlæten of þinre untrumnesse, &amp; his hand
hyre on sette.
 13.13. Þa wæs heo sona up aræred, &amp; heo God wuldrode.
 13.14. Ða gebealh se duguðeealdor hine forþam þe se
hælend on restedæge hælde &amp; sæde þam menegum; Syx dagas synt
on þam gebyrað þæt man wyrce, cumaþ on þam &amp; beoð
gehælede, &amp; na on restedæge.
 13.15. Ða andswarude se Hælend &amp; cwæð, La licteras,ne
untigð eower ælc on restedæge his oxan oððe assan fram þære
binne &amp; læt to wætere.
 13.16. Þas Abrahames dohtor þe Satanas geband nu eahtatyne
gear, ne gebyrede hyre beon unbunden of þissum bende on restedæge?
 13.17. Þa he þis sæde, þa sceamode ealle his
wiðerwinnan.
 13.17. &amp; eall folc geblissode on eallum þam ðe
wuldorfullice fram him gewurdon.
 13.18. Soðlice he cwæþ, hwam is Godes rice gelic, &amp; hwam
wene ic þæt hit beo gelic?
 13.19. Hit ys gelic senepes corne þæt se man onfenc &amp; seow
on his wyrtun &amp; hit weox &amp; wearð mycel treow, &amp; heofenes fuhlas
restun on his bogum.
 13.20. And eft he cwæð, hwam wene ic þæt Godes rice si
gelic?
 13.21. Hit is gelic þam beorman þe þæt wif onfengc &amp;
behydde on þam melewe þreo gemetu, oð hit wearð eall ahafen.
 13.22. Ða ferde he þurh ceastra &amp; castelu to Hierusalem
&amp; þar lærde.
 13.23. Ða cwæð sum man to him, Drihten, feawa synt þe synt
gehælede.
 13.23. Þa cwæþ he to him, efstað þæt ge gangen þurh
þæt nearwe get forþam ic secge eow manega secað þæt hig ingan
&amp; hi ne magon.
 13.25. Ðonne se hiredes ealdor ingæð &amp; his duru beclyst
ge standaþ þær ute &amp; þa duru cnuciað &amp; cweðaþ, Drihten
atyn us; þonne cwyð he to eow, Ne can ic eow, nat ic hwanon ge synt.
 13.26. Ðonne ongynne ge cweþan we æton &amp; druncon beforan
þe, &amp; on urum strætum þu lærdest.
 13.27. Þonne segð he eow, ne cann ic hwanon ge synt gewitað
fram me ealle unrihtwyrhtan, þar bið wop &amp; toþa grystlung.
 13.28. Ðænne ge geseoþ Abraham &amp; Isaac &amp; Iacob &amp;
ealle witegan on Godes rice, &amp; ge beoð utadrifene &amp; hig cumað fram
eastdæle &amp; westdæle &amp; norþdæle &amp; sittað on Godes rice,
&amp; efne synt ytemeste þa ðe beoð fyrmyste, &amp; synt fyrmyste þa
ðe beoð ytemeste.
 13.31. On þam dæge him genealæhton sume Farisei &amp; him
sædon, Far &amp; ga heonon forþam þe Herodes þe wyle ofslean.
 13.32. And þa cwæð he to him, gað &amp; secgað þam
foxe, deofolseocnessa ic utadrife, &amp; ic hæla gefremme todæg &amp;
tomorhgen &amp; þriddan dæge ic beo fornumen.
 13.33. Ðeahhwæðere me gebyreþ todæg &amp; tomorhgen,
&amp; þy æfteran dæge gan, forþam þe ne gebyreð þæt se
witega forwurðe butan Hierusalem.
 13.34. Eala Hierusalem Hierusalem, þu ðe þa witegan ofslyhst
&amp; hænst, þa ðe to þe asende synt, hu oft ic wolde þine bearn
gegaderian swa se fugel deð his nest under his fiðerum &amp; þu noldest.
 13.35. Nu bið eower hus eow forlæten; Soðlice ic eow secge
þæt ge me ne geseoð ærþam þe cume se þonne ge cweðað,
gebletsod sy se ðe com on drihtnes naman.
 14.1. Þa wæs geworden þa he eode on sumes Farisea ealdres
hus on restedæge þæt he hlaf æte, &amp; hig begymdon hine.
 14.2. Ða wæs þar sum wæterseoc man beforan him.
 14.3. Ða cwæþ se Hælend to þam ægleawum &amp;
Fariseum, Ys hit alyfed þæt man on restedagum hæle?
 14.4. Ða suwudon hig, þa nam he hine &amp; gehælde &amp;
forlet hyne.
 14.5. Þa cwæð he to him andswariende, hwylces eowres assa
oððe oxa befealþ on anne pytt &amp; ne tihþ he hyne hrædlice up on
restedæge?
 14.6. Ða ne mihton hig agen þis him geandwyrdan.
 14.7. Ða sæde he sum bigspel be þam ingelaðudan, gymende
hu hig þa fyrmestan setl gecuron &amp; þus cwæð, ðonne þu byst to
gyftum gelaþod ne site þu on þam fyrmestan setle, þelæs wenunga sum
wurðfulra sig yngelaðod fram hym.
 14.9. &amp; þonne cume se þe ðe ingelaþode &amp; secge
ðe rym þysum men setl, &amp; þu ðænne mid sceame nyme þæt
ytemeste setl.
 14.10. Ac þonne þu geclypod byst, ga &amp; site on þam
ytemestan setle, þæt se ðe þe ingelaðude þænne he cymð
cweþe to þe, la freond, site ufur, þonne byð þe wurðmynt beforan
midsittendum.
 14.11. Forþam ælc þe hine upahefð, bið genyðerud,
&amp; se ðe hine nyðerað se bið upahafen.
 14.12. Ða cwæð he to þam þe hine inlaðode, þonne
þu dest wiste oððe feorme ne clypa þu þine frynd ne þine
gebroðru, ne ðine cuðan ne þine welegan nehheburas, þelæs hi ðe
agen laðiun, &amp; þu hæbbe edlean.
 14.13. Ac þænne þu gebeorscype do, clypa þearfan &amp;
wanhale &amp; healte &amp; blinde.
 14.14. Þonne bist þu eadig, forþam ðe hi nabbað hwanun
hig hit þe forgyldon; Soðlice hit byð þe forgolden on rihtwisra
æriste.
 14.15. Ða þis gehyrde sum of þam sittendum, þa cwæð
he, eadig is se ðe hlaf ytt on Godes rice.
 14.16. Ða sæde he him, sum man worhte mycele feorme &amp;
manega gelaðode.
 14.17. Þa sende he his þeowan to þære feorme timan
þæt he sæde þam gelaðedum þæt hig comun forþam þe ealle
þing gearwe wæron.
 14.18. Þa ongunnon hig ealle hig beladian.
 14.18. Se forma him sæde, ic bohte ænne tun, ic hæbbe
neode þæt ic fare &amp; hine geseo; Ic bidde þe þæt ðu me
beladige.
 14.19. Ða cwæþ se oþer, ic bohte an getyme oxena; Nu wille
ic faran &amp; fandian hyra; Nu bidde ic þe belada me.
 14.20. Ða cwæð sum, ic lædde wif ham, forþam ic ne
mæg cuman.
 14.21. Þa cyrde se þeowa &amp; cydde his hlaforde þæt.
 14.21. Ða cwæð se hlaford mid yrre to þam þeowan, Ga
hraþe on þa stræta &amp; on wic þisse ceastre &amp; þearfan &amp;
wanhale &amp; blinde &amp; healte læd hider in.
 14.22. Ða cwæð se þeowa, hlaford, hit ys gedon swa þu
bude, &amp; nu gyt her is æmtig stow.
 14.23. Þa cwæð se hlaford þa gyt to þam þeowan, Ga
geond þas wegas &amp; hegas,&amp; nyd hig þæt hig gan in, þæt min
hus si gefylled.
 14.24. Soðlice ic eow secge þæt nan þara manna þe
geclypode synt ne onbyrigeað minre feorme.
 14.25. Soðlice mid him ferde mycel menego.
 14.25. Þa cwæð he to him bewend, Gyf hwa to me cymð &amp;
ne hatað his fæder &amp; moder &amp; wif &amp; bearn &amp; broþru &amp;
swustra, &amp; þænne gyt his sawle ne mæg he beon min leorningcniht.
 14.27. &amp; se þe ne byrð hys cwylminge &amp; cymð æfter
me, ne mæg he beon min leorningcniht.
 14.28. Hwylc eower wyle timbrian anne stypel, hu ne sytt he
ærest &amp; teleð þa andfengas þe him behefe synt, hwæðer he
hæbbe hine to fullfremmenne, þelæs syððan he þæne grundweall
legð &amp; ne mæg hine fullfremman; Ealle þe hit geseoð agynnað hine
tælan &amp; cweðan, Hwæt þes man agan timbrian &amp; ne mihte hit
geendian.
 14.31. Oððe gyf hwylc cynincg wyle faran &amp; feohtan agen
oðerne cyning hu ne sit he ær &amp; þencð hwæðer he mæge mid
tyn þusendum cuman agen þone þe him agen cymð mid twentigum
þusendum.
 14.32. &amp; gif he þonne wið hine gefeohtan ne mæg, he sent
æryndracan &amp; bitt sibbe.
 14.33. Witodlice swa is ælc of eow þe ne wiðsæcð eallum
þingum þe he ah, ne mæg he beon min leorningcniht.
 14.34. God ys sealt gif hit awyrð on þam þe hit gesylt bið;
nis hyt nyt ne on eorþan ne on myxene, ac hyt bið utaworpen; Gehyre se þe
earan hæbbe to gehyrenne.
 15.1. Soðlice him genealæhtun manfulle &amp; synfulle þæt
hig his word gehyrdon.
 15.2. Ða murcnedon þa Farisei &amp; þa boceras &amp;
cwædon, ðes onfehð synfulle &amp; mid him ytt.
 15.3. Þa cwæþ he þis bigspel to þam.
 15.4. Hwylc man is of eow þe hæfð hund sceapa, &amp; gif he
forlyst an of þam, hu ne forlæt he þonne nigon &amp; hundnigontig on
þam westene, &amp; gæð to þam þe forwearð oð he hit fint?
 15.5. &amp; þonne he hit fint he hitt set on his exla
geblissiende, &amp; þonne he ham cymð he tosomne clypað hys frynd &amp;
his nehheburas, &amp; cwyð, Blissiað mid me forþam ic funde min scep þe
forwearð.
 15.7. Ic secge eow þæt swa byð on heofone blis be anum
synfullum þe dædbote deð, ma þonne ofer nigon &amp; nigontigum
rihtwisra þe dædbote ne beðurfon.
 15.8. Oððe hwilc wif hæfð tyn scyllingas, gif heo forlyst
anne scylling, hu ne onælð heo hyre leohtfæt, &amp; awent hyre hus
&amp; secð geornlice oð heo hine fint?
 15.9. &amp; þonne heo hine fint heo clypað hyre frynd &amp;
nehhebyryna &amp; cwyð, blyssiað mid me forþam ic funde minne scylling
þe ic forleas.
 15.10. Ic secge eow swa bið blis beforan Godes englum be anum
synfullum þe dædbote deð.
 15.11. He cwæð, soðlice sum man hæfde twegen suna.
 15.12. Þa cwæð se yldra to his fæder, Fæder, syle me
minne dæl minre æhte þe me to gebyreþ; þa dælde he him his
æhte.
 15.13. Ða æfter feawa dagum ealle his þing gegaderude se
gingra sunu, &amp; ferde wræclice on feorlen rice, &amp; forspilde þar his
æhta lybbende on his gælsan.
 15.14. Ða he hig hæfde ealle amyrrede þa wearð mycel
hunger on þam rice &amp; he wearð wædla.
 15.15. Þa ferde he &amp; folgude anum burhsittendan men þæs
rices, ða sende he hine to his tune þæt he heolde his swyn.
 15.16. Ða gewilnode he his wambe gefyllan of þam biencoddun
þe ða swyn æton, &amp; him man ne sealde.
 15.17. Þa beþohte he hine &amp; cwæð, Eala, hu fela
yrðlinga on mines fæder huse hlaf genohne habbað &amp; ic her on hungre
forwurðe.
 15.18. Ic arise, &amp; ic fare to minum fæder, &amp; ic secge
him, Eala fæder, ic syngode on heofenas &amp; beforan þe.
 15.19. Nu ic neom wyrðe þæt ic beo þin sunu nemned; do me
swa anne of þinum yrðlingum.
 15.20. &amp; he aras þa &amp; com to his fæder, &amp; þa gyt
þa he wæs feorr his fæder he hyne geseah &amp; wearð mid
mildheortnesse astyrod &amp; agen hine arn &amp; hine beclypte &amp; cyste
hine.
 15.21. Ða cwæð his sunu, Fæder, ic syngude on heofon,
&amp; beforan ðe; Nu ic ne eom wyrþe þæt ic þin sunu beo genemned.
 15.22. Ða cwæþ se fæder to his þeowum, Bringað raðe
þæne selestan gegyrelan &amp; scrydað hyne &amp; syllað him hring on
his hand, &amp; gescy to his fotum.
 15.23. &amp; bringað an fætt styric &amp; ofsleað &amp; utun
etan &amp; gewistfullian, forþam þes min sunu wæs dead &amp; he
geedcucude; He forwearð &amp; he is gemet; ða ongunnon hig gewistlæcan.
 15.25. Soðlice hys yldra sunu wæs on æcere &amp; he com,
&amp; þa he þam huse genealæhte he gehyrde þæne sweg &amp; þæt
weryd.
 15.26. Þa clypode he anne þeow &amp; axode hine hwæt
þæt wære.
 15.27. Ða cwæð he, þin broðor com, &amp; þin fæder
ofsloh an fæt celf forþam þe he hyne halne onfeng.
 15.28. Ða bealh he hine &amp; nolde ingan, þa eode his fæder
ut &amp; ongan hine biddan.
 15.29. Ða cwæþ he his fæder andswarigende, Efne swa fela
geara ic þe þeowude &amp; ic næfre þin bebod ne forgymde, &amp; ne
sealdest þu me næfre an ticcen þæt ic mid minum freondum
gewistfullude.
 15.30. Ac syððan þes þin sunu com, þe hys spede mid
myltystrum amyrde, þu ofsloge him fætt celf.
 15.31. Ða cwæþ he, sunu, þu eart symle mid me, &amp; ealle
mine þing synt þine.
 15.32. Þe gebyrede gewistfullian &amp; geblissian forþam þes
þin broðor wæs dead &amp; he geedcucede he forwearð &amp; he is
gemet.
 16.1. Ða cwæð he to his leorningcnihtum, Sum welig man
wæs hæfde sumne gerefan se wearð wið hine forwreged swylce he his god
forspilde.
 16.2. Þa clypode he hine &amp; sæde him, Hwi gehyre ic þis
be þe?
 16.2. Agyf þine scire, ne miht þu lencg tunscire bewitan.
 16.3. Ða cwæþ se gerefa on his geþance, Hwæt do ic
forþam þe min hlaford mine gerefscire fram me nymð; Ne mæg ic delfan,
me sceamað þæt ic wædlige.
 16.4. Ic wat hwæt ic do þæt hig me on hyra hus onfon
þonne ic bescired beo fram tunscire.
 16.5. Ða þa gafolgyldan gegaderude wæron þa sæde he
þam forman, hu mycel scealt þu minum hlaforde?
 16.6. Ða sæde he, hund sestra eles.
 16.6. Þa sæde he him, nim þine feðere &amp; site hraðe
&amp; writ fiftig.
 16.7. Ða sæde he oðrum, hu mycel scealt þu; þa cwæþ
he, hund mittena hwætes; ða cwæð he, nim þine stafas &amp; writ
hundeahtatig.
 16.8. Ða herede se hlaford þære unrihtwisnesse tungerefan,
forþam þe he gleawlice dyde, forþam ðe ðisse worulde bearn, synd
gleawran þises leohtes bearnum on þisse cneoresse.
 16.9. &amp; ic secge eow, wyrcað eow frynd of þisse
woruldewelan unrihtwisnesse þæt hig onfon eow on ece eardungstowe þonne
ge geteoriað.
 16.10. Se þe ys on lytlum getrywe, se ys on maran getrywe &amp;
se þe ys on lytlum unrihtwis se ys eac on maran unrihtwis.
 16.11. Gif ge on unrihtwisum weoruldwelan næron getrywe hwa
betæhð eow þæt eower ys.
 16.12. And gyf ge on fremedum næron getrywe hwa sylþ eow
þæt eower ys.
 16.13. Ne mæg nan þeow twam hlafordum þeowian, oððe he
anne hatað &amp; oðerne lufað, oððe he anum folgað &amp; oðerne
forhogað; And ge ne magon Gode þeowian &amp; woruldwelan.
 16.14. Ðas ðing ealle þa Farisei gehyrdon þa ðe gifre
wæron, &amp; hig hine tældon.
 16.15. Þa cwæð he to him, ge synt þe eow sylfe beforan
mannum gerihtwisiaþ; Soðlice God can eowre heortan forþam þe beforan
Gode ys ascuniendlic þæt mannum heah ys.
 16.16. Seo æ &amp; witegan oð Iohannem, &amp; of him is bodud
Godes rice, &amp; ealle on þæt strangnysse wyrcað.
 16.17. Eaðre is þæt heofen &amp; eorðe gewiton þonne an
stæf of þære æ fealle.
 16.18. Ælc man þe his wif forlæt &amp; oþer nimð se
unrihthæmð, &amp; se ðe þæt forlætene wif nimð se
unrihthæmð.
 16.19. Sum welig man wæs, &amp; he wæs gescrydd mid purpuran
&amp; mid twine, &amp; dæghwamlice riclice gewistfullude.
 16.20. And sum wædla wæs on naman Lazarus, se læg on his
dura swyðe forwundon, &amp; wilnode þæt he hine of his crumum gefylde
þe of his beode feollun, &amp; him nan man ne sealde, ac hundas comon &amp;
his wunda liccodon.
 16.22. Ða wæs geworden þæt se wædla forðferde &amp;
hine englas bæron on Habrahames greadan; þa wearð se welega dead &amp;
wæs on helle bebyrged.
 16.23. Ða ahof he his eagan upp þa he on þam tintregum
wæs, &amp; geseah feorran Abraham &amp; Lazarum on his greadan.
 16.24. Ða hrymde he &amp; cwæð, eala fæder Abraham,
gemilsa me, &amp; send lazarum þæt he dyppe his fingres lið on
wætere, &amp; mine tungan gehæle, forþam þe ic eom on þis lige
cwylmed.
 16.25. Ða cwæð Abraham, eala sunu, geþenc þæt þu
God onfenge on þinum life, &amp; gelice Lazarus onfeng yfel; Nu ys þes
gefrefryd &amp; þu eart cwylmed.
 16.26. And on eallum þissum betwux us &amp; eow is mycel dwolma
getrymed, þa ðe willað heonon to eow faran ne magon, ne þanun faran
hidere.
 16.27. Ða cwæð he, fæder, ic bidde þe þæt ðu
sende hine to mines fæder huse.
 16.28. Ic hæbbe fif gebroþru þæt he cyðe him þæt
hig ne cumon on þissa tintrega stowe.
 16.29. Þa sæde Abraham him, hig habbað Moysen &amp; witegan;
hig hlyston him.
 16.30. Ða cwæð he, nese fæder Abraham, ac hig doð
dædbote gif hwylc of deaðe to him færð.
 16.31. Ða cwæð he, gif hig ne gehyraþ Moysen &amp; þa
witegan, ne hig ne gelyfað þeah hwylc of deaðe arise.
 17.1. Ða cwæð he to his leorningcnihtum, unmihtlic is
þæt gedrefednyssa ne cuman, wa þam þe hig þurh cumað.
 17.2. Nyttre him wære þæt an cweornstan sy gecnytt abutan
his swuran &amp; si on sæ beworpen ðonne he gedrefe anne of þissum
lytlingum.
 17.3. Warniað eow.
 17.3. Gyf þin broðor syngað, cid him.
 17.4. And gif he on dæg seofan siþun syngað, &amp; seofan
siþun to þe on dæg gecyrred byð &amp; cwyð, Hit me ofþincð,
forgyf hit him.
 17.5. Ða cwæðon his apostolas, drihten, geic urne geleafan.
 17.6. Ða cwæþ drihten, gif ge hæfdon geleafan swa senepes
corn, ge sædun þissun treowe sy ðu awyrtwalud &amp; aplantud on sæ,
&amp; hit hyrsumode eow.
 17.7. Hwylc eower hæfþ eregendne þeow, oððe scep
læsgendne þam of þam æcere gehworfenum, he him sona segð ga &amp;
site.
 17.8. &amp; ne segþ him gearw þæt ic ete &amp; gyrt þe
&amp; þena me þa hwile þe ic ete &amp; drince, &amp; syððan þu ytst
&amp; drincst.
 17.9. Wenst þu hæfð se þeowa ænigne þanc, forþam
ðe he dyde þæt him beboden wæs; ne wene ic.
 17.10. Swa ys eow þonne ge doð eall þæt eow beboden ys,
cweþað, unnytte þeowas we synt, we dydon þæt we don sceolon.
 17.11. Ða he ferde to Hierusalem, he eode þurh midde Samarian
&amp; Galileam, &amp; þa he eode on sum castel him agen urnon tyn hreofe
weras.
 17.12. Þa stodon hig feorran &amp; hyra stefna upahofon &amp;
cwædon, Hælend, bebeodend gemiltsa us.
 17.14. Ða he hig geseah þa cwæþ he, Gað &amp;
